Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nisha78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location is great, the hotel room was clean and nice, the staff are friendly and helpful, the spa is wonderful and the view from the restaurant at night is to die for. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: noelekelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in April 2012 and had a great experience. The reception and dining room staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel was spotless and the breakfasts were the best we have had in a continental hotel in a long time. Also, this was served until 10:30 on weekdays and 11:00 at weekends allowing us to have a welcome lie-in. The impressive restaurant/ dinig room is on the top floor which gives panaroramic views of the city in all directions. Choice was impressive from a buffet style set-up. with full English breakfast, fruit, cold meats, cereals, fruit juices etc. The hotel's location was also a strong point. Just three stops on the train from the airport into Sants station, out through the maix exit and the hotel was about fifty metres across the square. At 23 storeys high, it would be hard to miss. Using the three day travel pass we were able to travel from the metro station in Sants staton to all of the main attractions and the Barcelona Tour Bus also had a stop at the side of the station. Slight disappointment was the lack of wi-fi access although an ethernet cable connection was available in the room. However, as I only had an iPad with me, this was of no use.

Reviews.Title: “Torre in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - fabulous views from upper floors and restaurant. Easy to get around being just opposite the station. Lovely spa. Excellent customer service. Really nice spacious rooms with very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Missus2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right next to the train station on a direct route from the airport, and took about 20 minutes to reach. It was a perfect location for transport links, with the airport train, the metro and the tourist bus all easily accessible. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the restaurant, with an excellent view over Barcelona, provided a great setting for a romantic dinner. Both this dinner and the breakfast were expensive, but were of a very high standard, with the choice at breakfast far surpassing most places we've stayed for a city break. I think it's probably more of a business hotel, so there are more deals for the weekends, and we had upgraded to an executive room for a very small fee. The room was great, and the bathroom outstanding. Would definitely recommend and stay here again if we were to return to Barcelona. However, if you want to stay right in the centre of things without having to get the metro etc., then it might not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: ShafALondon
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, just three stops on the train from the Airport (Terminal 2 to Sants Station). The Hotel is right opposite the station. There are a number of other Metro Stations located close to the Hotel which are very convenient for the city centre (La Rambla) or for a day trip to Montserrat (from Espanya station), also the Magic Fountain is 10 minute walk. The Hotel Staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was reasonably sized, clean and had all the amenities (we paid a bit extra to get a room higher up for the view). The view from the Restaurant is amazing. There was quite a good selection for the buffet breakfast. There is also a small gym. All in all an excellent Hotel, would definitely head back to HTC next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Johan_Norlund
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only based on the good reviews I had read, and it turned out that everyone was right. Location-wise Torre Catalunya is just a tiny bit off, but still offers walking distance to many attractions (for example The Magic Fountain of Montjuic). The hotel was quiet and very clean and modern. I got a corner room (fourth floor, I think) and was very happy with how the big windows let in a lot of light. There are thick curtains though, so you don't have to worry about light when sleeping. The only negative thing I can think of is that the in-room CD player didn't work. I told the friendly staff about this, and they promised to get it fixed, but didn't. Not a big thing. Breakfast was wonderful, in the penthouse restaurant that offers a truly amazing view of Barcelona. Be sure to go up there! Next time I visit Barcelona I would definitely consider staying here again. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great mini-break in a hotel which met all our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: noeltourist
Reviews.Content: Three cheers for the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya! Location, room, service and food were perfect for our needs - a "young" middle aged couple on a weekend break! We would recommend without hesitation this hotel to any similar couple considering a break in Barcelona. Look for room on the higher floors as the view is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: peter r Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible to all of Barcelona via bus, train, metro. Hotel staff are excellent. Rooms were large and clean with great views of Barcelona. The restaurant on the 23rd floor has panoramic views over the whole of Barcelona - has to be seen to be believed.

Reviews.Title: “very nice choice”
Reviews.Author: itsak69
Reviews.Content: Nice place with access to central train-metro station. Large rooms with marble bath and perfect view of the city. It is better to select a room in high roof (>14). Polite and friendly reception people. It is 15 min from the downtown by metro. Taxi all the day in the entrance of the hotel. Expensive breakfast, but it is not needed (a lot of choices for breakfast very close to the hotel). A supermarket is in the same building with the hotel, while there are many cafe restaurants and fast food 50 meters from the hotel. No free Interent (10 euro/24h)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: dashers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel, we found it to be an ideal hotel for exploring Barcelona.The staff were very helpful,if you can afford to upgrade to a floor higher than 13 do it you will not be disapointed.The views both day and night are fantastic.We only booked rooms but on arrival were offered breakfast for 12 euros instead of 16 euros.The breakfast was okay but could have offered more choice, but it beats leaving the hotel in the morning looking for breakfast else where.If you do decide to search for somewhere else for breakfast stay clear of the place across from the hotel called PANS it was yuk.There is a supermarket under the hotel which is great to buy drinks etc for your room.We boarded a train when we got off the plane, when you buy a train ticket buy the T10 its so much cheaper and costs 18 euros for 10 journeys so you can use it on the under ground metro in the city as well as the trains.Once you enter the metro station you can hop on and off the different lines as long as you dont exit the turnstile.Pick up a few maps of the metro system they come in very handy.You are constently warned about pick pockets just be very careful.Ladies use a over the shoulder bag worn in front of you,and gents wallets in your front pockets. Be very aware when crossing the junctions the cars seem to come at you from all directions.The ramblers is buzzing but be very aware of drink prices the foods ok but then they sting you with high prices if you sit on the main strip outside.Its a great city with great people so soak up a fab atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Central, relaxing and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: EdizTR
Reviews.Content: I spend a day in Barcelona and in Gran Torre. It was at the centre of the metro station and the city. My room was at 16th floor with an amazing Barcelona view. If you want to stay for 2-3 days and have a limited budget, I will definitely propose you to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, I would not stay as a tourist”
Reviews.Author: MirelaD
Reviews.Content: Spent a night in this hotel in a business trip. The best part is the breakfast on top floor. Clean rooms and bathrooms, comfortable. A welcome drink was included in our package. The location is excellent, close to Placa d'Espanya. It is definitely a good hotel for business, but for a holiday I would choose something more cosy.

Reviews.Title: “it's not pretty but.......”
Reviews.Author: Phillicj
Reviews.Content: It's not pretty but it's location is great,the staff were very friendly with excellent English,vital given my pathetic Spanish,the rooms were large,clean and with views.My only criticism was that the Internet was difficult to connect to....and as they say if that's all I have to moan about its pretty good really.....breakfast was too expensive for me even to try and there are many fantastic cafes near by so I would suggest they reduce their prices but as for the hotel i'd stay there again .....

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, awesome stay.”
Reviews.Author: Carl M
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, I was in room 1419 on the 14th floor. It's worth paying the little extra for have an executive room as there on a higher floor with superb views of the city. The hotel is just across the road from the underground metro system with takes you to the city centre in 10 minutes. The metro is the best way to get around in Barcelona, cheap, quick and easy. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, they couldnt do enough for us. Great stay, and I will defiantly be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Will the real Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya please stand up!”
Reviews.Author: scoti99
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a city break in Barcelona where I was staying at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya. I initially booked with this hotel due to the numerous reviews saying how great it was. I am now left feelling confused as to which hotel the reviews were talking about? Standing adjacent to the Barcelona Sants station, The Gran Hotel Torre is a 20 minute train trip from the Airport and this, along with the panoramic views of Barcelona from the top floor restaurant, are really the only good points for this hotel. Regarding the restaurant, I do not advise eating there as it is very expensive and the food is terrible. included in the price of any bill is a 50 % markup for enjoying the view. I would also not advise opting for any breakfast options as what is provided is very basic; the coffee was truly awful and the "fresh" orange juice probably was...a week before. A better and cheaper option for an evening meal is the Las Arenas stadium just a short walk from the hotel, where you can enjoy a cheap meal in any of the restaurants which circle the roof of the arena. This is also a great location for viewing the magic fountains. For breakfast I would opt for the Mauri cafe only a short metro ride from the hotel: www.pasteleriasmauri.com I stayed on the 12th floor and while the hotel, for the most part, was clean and the rooms tidy there were none of the extras you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The audio / visual system was decades old (not a flat screen or ipod player in sight). I would also expect a wifi service in a modern hotel but I was not informed of any such service upon arrival. All the fittings and fixtures were really worn and the marble flooring was very stained / mouldy in parts. My lasting impression of this hotel is that it is very tired and is in desperate need of an overhaul. The staff, in their favour, were very pleasant and courteous, but no measure of charm could hide the lack of investment in this hotel. I think the good reviews of this hotel in no way truly reflect its current state, services or surroundings. The plaza in front of the hotel is part building site / skater park and the noise emanating from the station / traffic is unwelcome for a relaxing break. I suppose if your purpose is to go to Barcelona for a business trip (a quick in and out job on the cheap) then this place would be ok for one night. Other than that stay clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: froufrouBkk
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything we were looking for: close to the airport train, close to the green line metro (very convenient for touring Barcelona), supermarket downstairs, spa and massage facilities, great modern room, outstanding view (ask for a room on the top floors), excellent restaurant on the top floor, and above all, outstanding staff who went out of their way to be helpful. It's not in a happening area, but definitely a convenient location. We loved it and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Three stays in two weeks”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth S
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. First and foremost, kudos to the staff. All were friendly, knowledgeable, efficient, kind and spoke good English. When there was a question regarding the extra charge for a third person in my room, they charged me the lower of the Expedia price on my paperwork versus their standard rate:) They really could not have been agreeable and accommodating. I would like to give special recognition to one of the bellmen, Tomas Sevilla. He is a true gem! He is the PERFECT example of an employee who will go above and beyond for the comfort of the guest. For example, I asked him where I could buy "bubble wrap" to protect a bottle in my luggage for the trip back to the US. He offered to bring some to me from his home...which he did. And, he would not accept any payment for the wrap. He was so plesant, kind, and helpful and always had a smile on his face! I would also like to commend Luis of the reception desk staff who helped me tremendously and without hesitation when I had an issue with my room on my final stay at the hotel. Now on to the hotel itself. I stayed there with family (two rooms) three times over the course of two-plus weeks between trips around Spain and to Rome. I am SO glad I chose this hotel. Not only was it a nice hotel to start out in, it was especially nice to come back to each time we returned from traveling. It was BY FAR the best hotel we stayed in during our two week trip. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are large by European standards, especially the bathrooms. All rooms have refrigerators and safes at no charge as well as flat screen TVs. The beds are large, though a bit hard (I found this to be the case throughout Spain and in Rome as well) and you will not want for sufficient pillows. Slippers and bathrobes are provided for extra comfort. The location, while not in the center of town, is extremely convenient with both a Metro stop (Sants Estacion) and the main train station (Sants) within a few minutes walk. Both the Metro and trains are easy to navigate and make traveling within and away from Barcelona a piece of cake! There is a supermarket adjacent to the hotel and a little bakery where one can pick up a quick breakfast treat before heading out for the day. Nearby there is a great little semi "hole in the wall" restaurant - wish I could recall the name - that has free wi-fi. (The hotel only gives 30 minutes each day free; but you can check email for free in their business center which is a really nice service). The restaurant is a couple of doors down from the small supermarket located up the street from Sants Metro station. The staff will know where this small supermarket is. The paella is awesome, as are the mussels...and everything else...and the servings are HUGE! We did not eat at the hotel or have drinks so I cannot say anything about that service. I guess the only non-positive thing I would say is that it costs to use the very small pool and gym (6 Euro I seem to recall). But, that's probably a small price to pay for such a great hotel. I could go on and on about this hotel but the bottom line is that I would stay there again and again and HIGHLY recommend it to anyone traveling to the wonderful city of Barcelona. Oh, you can store your luggage at the hotel and not worry about it at all if you travel away from Barcelona and don't want to take everything with you!

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise hotel”
Reviews.Author: artoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel strikes a good compromise between price, convenience wrt transport, being close to the main tourist sights and being away from hordes of tourists. The room is more or less what you would expect of a midrange business hotel in Barcelona (bearing in mind that Barcelona hotels are much more expensive than many other parts of Spain), though the maintenance and condition of repair is only average for this class. Staff were helpful and competent. Being so close to the Sants station is great for airport connections, and the L3 and L5 lines get you to many tourist sights reasonably quickly (e.g. 20-25 minutes door-to-door to las Ramblas). Also very close to the number of tourist sights in Montjuic and the food/entertainment in the up-and-coming area of Poble Sec, and the adjacent Parc de l'Espanya Industrial is an interesting green annex to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: andai
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week holiday in Spain with my wife. Barcelona is our final destination and we're glad that we choose GHTC (Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya) as our base for 3 days. The location as what have been mentioned is perfect. Strategically located at the outskirt of central Barcelona with Metro station (Sants Estacio) is just 5 minutes away. From there you can reach all the must see places (Sagrada Familia, Casa Mila, Casa Batllo, Gothic Quarter, and even Nou Camp). Not only that, the RENFE train to the airport is also on 5 minutes away. We have 3 big and 3 small luggage and we not even break a sweat in getting there. There's also an hipermarket (ESCLAT) downstairs which you can get almost everything (last minute shopping!), but it is closed on Sunday. The staff is very professional and friendly as well. They even help us book the Flamenco show (El Tabalo De Carmen - highly recommended!) with no problem at all. Our room is just perfect for our needs. King size bed with tons of pillows, mini fridge with full of stuff (even though we didn'nt use them) and the bathroom is HUGE! I definitely recommend it for those who look for a good base to experience the very best of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CityT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the weekend and thought it was a great location to base oneself in Barcelona. Its right outside the main station Sants Estactio and there are two metro stops Sants across from the hotel and the other Tarragona a few hundred meters down the road. Its also a five to ten minute walk to Plaza Espayna. Its only a few metro stops away from the centre. There is also a supermarket round the corner and a bigger one in the shopping centre at Plaza Espayna if you need to stock on some drinks or snacks. There is a restaurant on the top floor of the hotel which I didn't get to eat in as I was there for only one night. I did have breakfast there and it has a pretty cool view of Barcelona. The room itself was on the 14th floor which was great, it was clean and very comfortable, loved the power shower in the bathroom and was overall very happy with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great town Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: 187849Gsquare
Reviews.Content: I spent a great business trip in Barcelona. It is not the first time and this town never stops to positively surprise me. Clean, secure, easy to travel with public transportation. Good job Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: indigogrl
Reviews.Content: Located right next to Barcelona Sants, the central train station, this hotel is very handy for getting around Barcelona and more. A bus tour stand is on the other side of the station, there are plenty of entrances to the metro around and it’s walking distance to many of the sights. The rooms were spacious and clean and the bathroom was huge! The views from the higher floors were amazing but unfortunately this came at a premium – we booked a standard room and asked to be on a higher floor. When we arrived we were given a room on the third floor, when we asked to be moved to a higher floor we were told there was an extra charge, which wasn’t transparent in the booking process. Some reviews mention the noise outside the hotel; we could hear skateboarders, traffic, building work etc on the 20th floor so I should imagine it’d be quite disturbing on the lower floors. The only other complaint was the charge to use the pool area, 6 euros each for the day (not even a 24 hour period). For a hotel of this standard I’d expect to be able to use the facilities free of charge. The hotel suggests you can use the roof top pool at the neighbouring hotel but the rooftop was derelict and the pool was full of seagulls. That said, it’s a good hotel with friendly and helpful staff. We will definitely be back in Barcelona and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: wendyboston
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite on the 20th floor with views in 2 directions. Perfect location near the station and only 20 mins from airport. Check out the restaurants on top of the shopping centre within the old bullring which is 5 mins walk. Another great view.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, V. Rude Restaurant Host”
Reviews.Author: kalypso_rose
Reviews.Content: The quality of the hotel and its rooms (I stayed in a basic) is four star. My room was was lovely, with wooden accents, a wonderful view, and the bathroom was spacious and had a window! I am especially a fan of wooden/tiled, as opposed to carpeted, floors. It is close to a main train station and shopping mall, but a tad out of the way in terms of being close to major attractions and fine dining. Because of this I had made reservations on a Sunday night at the restaurant with the panoramic view. The host-manager welcomed me coldly, and proceeded to sit my friend and I in the middle of the room. We were the only ones isolated like this. There were perhaps 3 other dining couples who were all seated at the windows to enjoy the view. When I asked if I could also sit near the window, he said, no, and walked away, without explanation. Well, I didn't need one really to stay. We simply left and took a cab to go to Barrio Gótico. I did leave a complaint at the front desk, and to their credit, a manager apologized and explained that the tables by the windows had all been reserved. I do not doubt that this was the reason provided to her, but based on the few diners I saw in the restaurant, it was very hard to believe. In any event, in spite of Mr. Snooty, the rest of the staff, especially the Concierge and Front Desk personnel were very friendly. I do recommend this hotel, and would stay there again. Hopefully, I will be able to dine in the restaurant upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “Graet Location Great view”
Reviews.Author: Thair_1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week, arrived early morning at 7 am and guess what, my room was ready waiting for me at 15th floor with a very nice view day and night, great gesture and reception help, they offered my very reasonable breakfast and WiFi rate for my stay. Location is very good walking distance to main train and metro station and to Spain Square, big supermarket 1 block away and its open until 10 pm Breakfast was full of options at the 27th floor with a very good view. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Zlani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and were very impressed by the great location, which is right outside Sants station, where you can get trains and metros to just about anywhere in Spain and Barcelona. Rooms are spotlessly clean and quiet and a good size for the money you pay. Staff were also helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't want to be in the centre of Barcelona and away from the hustle and bustle but with easy access to all the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel .............A SAD BUT”
Reviews.Author: Keviebhoy
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed here from Sat4th feb to Monday 6th feb on a football trip with my father and was very impressed with the room we got for the price we paid.The hotel is located right outside Sants station giving easy access to the rest of the city and 10 mins walk to camp nou,it's is spotlessly clean and very helpful staff on reception,however this has been slightly soured by someone helping themselves to a pair of leather boots from my supposedly secure room on Sunday at some point,now entry to the room is by key card only so it could only be a hotel employee as we were the 10th floor,I am still waiting on the hotel management to get back to me and apologise even,the boots were inexpensive but that is totally beside the point,would I stay again I really don't know as the hotel was perfect in every other way.

Reviews.Title: “my "home" in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: simonabroad
Reviews.Content: been travelling on business to Barcelona for the past 10 years and st of the times I stayed at the Torre Catalunya. The primary reason to stay there is the location almost right next to our offices. Rooms are kept modern and cosy. In such a building it is pretty obvious that the higher floor your room is, the better view to the city you have. Restaurant on top floor is excellent for a good start in the morning - view is just amazing. Had dinner there once - it was OK, but simply overpriced. seems like they charge for the nightly view...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Bluesilverstar
Reviews.Content: Splendid location: 15 mins from airport by train, not in touristy Barcelona but minutes away from everything as the Sants Station is next door and that puts you at the centre of a very efficient transport network. Rooms are very clean, beds are comfy. I stayed in the suite and that offers amazing views of Barcelona, both by day and by night. Nice restaurants nearby. Simply ask Staff who are brilliant and welcoming. Only had a drink in the top floor restaurant and a coffee at the ground floor bar. Service was excellent. Very hard to fault this hotel. It's no-nonsense and yet very warm. I would strongly recommend. It certainly is different from the big hotel chains...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Monica W
Reviews.Content: We visited this place in June 2010, meant to write a review ealier, but delayed until today. We have travelled one month in Paris, Italy and Spain. By far, this is the best and most comfortable stay in our journey. The location is excellent, we took hight speed train from paris to Barcelona, and then took a local train to Sants station, the hotel is just two minutes walk from the station. We arrived quite earlier and the check-in is not ready. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, when we asked if there is any place we can go. We were advised turn right and walk on the main street, just about 10- 15 minutes walk, we arrived at the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya,( is a museum of Catalan visual art). It's the most pleasant and magnificent place, you can climb up the stair to the top of the building, you have a overview of the whole Barcelona. One thing need to be careful, is some gypsi kids trying to steal from you. Actually, On the way back, the police is running after two kids passing us. It's rather funny. About the room, Its a standard room for two, We stayed on the tenth floor, the room is huge and have a really nice bed. The bathroom and toliet is seperated as well. I am really enjoy watching the Spanish TV too. It is very clean. The air conditioning worked well. There is a convenience store nearby and there is chemist in the train station (2 mins walk). We had lunch at a caffe on the main road on the right side of the hotel. There is a seafood resturant about 5-8 mins walk. Hotel staff told us that. Its a lovely place. I really enjoyed their fish. It's about 20-30 mins walk to their main shopping centre. (Sorry I forget the name, ask the hotel staff ) there are two metro station next to the hotel. Which is very convenient if you want to go to the city or other sightseeing place. Anyway, We really enjoyed our stay there. I would definitely go back if I ever visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: numanx
Reviews.Content: Excellent panoramic views over Barcelona from the suite room and from the restaurant on top. Hotel is situated next to Sants train station and close to several metro stations. Rooms are comfortable, big and staff is professional. The food in their restaurant Visual was mediocre and little overpriced but the breakfast is excellent, combined with the stunning views over Barcelona there. As welcome gift, we tasted a delicious chocolate cake which i can recommend. On the minusside : internet was paying after five minutes, not a big cost but we had this free in other hotels, so hope they will do that soon too. In all i give a 9/10 and we will surely consider in staying in this hotel again when we come to Barcelona next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have stayed at in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: JerryPage
Reviews.Content: We have visited Barcelona a number of times and always come back to this hotel. It is literally 3 minutes walk from Santes station which is linked direct to the airport..very handy after a journey flight from England. Once in Barcelona there is so much choice of what to do that will have been covered in other reviews. Try 'Barcelona John' in google..a regular newsletter comes out. You will be spoilt for places to eat and this can be quite bemusing on your first night so try Top Table, a site we have used to book restaurants in advance of our visits to Barcelona and gives some fantastic value and excellent restaurants. trip Advisor, of course is excellent too. Back to the hotel. we always ask at reception for a high up room and end up on the 21st floor with stunning views..sometimes with a free upgrade! The rooms are huge, comfortable with gorgeous bathrooms. Breakfast is wonderful with cava and almost any breakfast food served in true spanish style. The staff have always been very attentive and will help guide you with whatever you ask. One warning, my wife had an attempted bag snatch as we boarded the train back to the airport so be vigilant as there is a lot of opportunistic crime in Las Ramblas as well. No need to really worry though as we have always felt very safe in this city apart from the one incident. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Spicey12
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews I booked this hotel and was not disappointed at all. Arrived at Sants Estacios train station after 25 minute journey from airport having purchased a Barcelona card (a must for getting about). Walked 200 yards to hotel and met by cheerful staff who were extremely helpful. We were given a room on the 22nd floor which had the most amazing views across the northern side of Barcelona. I could clearly see Camp Nou (10 min walk away). The room was huge with a massive king bed. The bathroom was fantastic with 2 sinks, bath with shower attachment and a shower cubicle in marble to die for. We had intended to use the Visual restaurant on the 23rd floor but changed our minds as we had a brilliant view from our room and the fact the menu was limited. Whilst the hotel is sky scrapper don't let this put you off it's in a fantastic location just far enough away from the hub of the city noise. The train station and underground are on your door step with access to all areas of the city. We walked into the city each day until our poor feet could take no more. We used then used the underground and buses. There are so many restaurants and bars to choose from which can be a bit daunting. The reception staff will help find exactly what your looking for and they don't disappoint. We were recommended a superb Tapas bar and Spanish restaurant which were outstanding for value and quality. I can not fault this hotel in any way. We will return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Declan O
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a number of different hotels in Barcelona over the last few years, and this is the only hotel we return to regularly. It's location is excellent, offering easy links to the airport (rail) and central Barcelona (metro), as well as buses to other parts of Barcelona. Rooms are comfortable, with fantastic views from the higher floors. Breakfast (buffet) is as good as we've had anywhere. The suites are also fantastic if you're staying for more than a day or two and want some living space. There's a small spa with swimming pool on site, but to be honest it's not worth the extra cost. Also, based on our last visit, avoid the hotel restaurant (Visual). It used to offer a fantastic tasting menu, but after a change of chef (I think) things have gone very downhill. The tasting menu is now themed around Barcelona landmarks... quite honestly, anyone who doesn't laugh their socks off at "Tibidabo" or "Sagrada Familia" has a heart of stone (though neither is actually worth eating sadly).

Reviews.Title: “I woud definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ally P
Reviews.Content: You know........ there are times when you book and then look at reviews and think oh hell what have I done. When I looked further into this hotel I thought just that, but lucky for us it just happened to be fantastic. So many wonderful little special touches and extraordinarily comfortable bed and space. It was great to be away from the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas and the view from the restaurant over to the museum and amazing fountain was superb. Thank you all at Torre Catalunya for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yiska3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, right next to the train station. Also near the City Bus Tour if that is an interest of yours. The service was great. My luggage did not arrive with me at the airport & the staff called for me to check the status & delivered my luggage to my room for me. The view was amazing from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rollinhand
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Barcelona for the first time, you could do worse than choose this hotel as a base. Took the train from the airport to Sants Estacio (23 mins and 3 euros - but I would suggest you get a T10 ticket - great value) and the hotel is 200m from the front of the station on the right, Reception staff couldnt do enough to help and i heard them speak at least 4 langauges - impressive! Room was spacious and more than ample and I agree with other reviewers about the bathrooms - they are the best I have come across (the shower is divine!) and I have stayed in lots of hotels around the world. The metro line is 200m away and you can get anywhere in the city from here - just travel and enjoy. The staff were very helpful in providing directions to Camp Nou (a must visit if you enjoy your football) and were pleasant throughout. Didnt see anything to worry about from a crime aspect but then I am a city person and am used to city life. I did see some obvious tourists who did little to protect themselves and there were amny types around who would take advantage. Just use your common sense and assume you stand out as a non local and you will be fine. Would highly recommend this hotel to all and will use it again when I visit the city again

Reviews.Title: “Would be very happy to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ChirpyTheWanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a super choice for us. Being next to the railway station made it very convenient for us, as we were travelling in and out of Barcelona by train (Sants station has exits on two sides – if you don’t see the hotel clearly on your right as you leave one exit, then try the other!). The metro station at Sants station connects directly with most of the major tourist sights. We stayed twice on our Spanish holiday – once in a loft room (19th floor) and then, as a rare treat, in a suite (17th floor). Both rooms were very spacious and offered great views over the city. In fact, the suite provided views across 3 directions. The king beds were incredibly comfortable and the rooms spacious, clean and well appointed, including good air-con. Staff were consistently very helpful and multi-lingual. Check-in and check-out was swift on each occasion. We didn’t use the leisure facilities (€6 extra per person). Breakfasts offered a wide range of hot and cold, savoury and sweet options, all good quality. Being on the top (i.e. 23rd) floor, views from the restaurant were stunning. While not essential to our rating of the hotel and room, it is worth noting that the one underwhelming feature for us concerned eating in the area at night. There is not much choice on offer. Staff recommended one restaurant in the area for traditional Spanish food (Casa Martelo). While it appears to have some good reviews on TripAdvisor, we found it to be pretty average and easily overshadowed by other restaurants we were to try later on our holiday. We also ate in the hotel’s Visual restaurant on our last night, as part of an inclusive package we booked with the suite. We were pretty frustrated about miscommunication between hotel bookings and the restaurant (why does this happen in so many places?). We arrived, were given one set of menus, then had to ask our waitress what we could eat as part of our package, faced a bit of a wait while discussions took place with the head waiter, then had our menus summarily whisked from us: we were instead to eat from the chef’s Tasting Menu, which bizarrely was not even mentioned to us when we first arrived in the restaurant. To be fair, the waiting staff then took care to explain each course of the tasting menu to us. All courses were designed to represent some feature of Barcelona and looked impressive. The food also tasted generally good, with some courses being absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service & super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely top-notch. My family and I stayed in barcelona for two nights before boarding a cruise ship. We decided to spend a little extra and get a good hotel where we'll feel comfortable and also pretty close to everything. We stayed at this hotel and were treated very well, everyone was super friendly and helpful. We didn't run into any problems of any kind. To be honest, we weren't there unless we were coming back into the hotel to shower and sleep. But the location of the hotel was perfect since we had the metro station right there and even a little kiosk that sells you a pass for the tourist hop-on, hop-off buses. The view of the 23rd floor is phenomenal. We had breakfast included into our stay and only cost just a bit more than the usual price. We had the breakfast overlooking the view of the 23rd floor (vision floor) for those two days. Honestly no complains here. We had a great stay at this hotel and would consider it again next time I come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel made for a brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: frank_the_tank21
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Barcelona for his 30th Birthday and spent ages choosing hotels. Went with this one, half way between las ramblas and the Nou Camp. Hotel was absolutely brilliant and very accomodating. I had organised beforehand cava and a birthday cake to be delivered to the room for my boyfriend's birthday. And they did and he loved it. They also gave us free access to the spa which we enjoyed after a long day walking around the city. Breakfast was absolutely to die for. Views of Barcelona from the restaurant (top floor) and everything you could want for breakfast on offer! Room was clean and spacious. This hotel was also right outside the main train station which was perfect as we hopped on a train straight from the airport and arrived pretty much outside our hotel. Metro is just over the road and tickets were cheap. Nothing like the expense of the tube in London! The perfect hotel for our 3 night/4 day break! Would recommend to anyone! A very stylish place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: RLJenkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel in one of the executive rooms located on the 14th floor. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and found this hotel to be in a great location. It's right outside the train station front entrance. We were really glad to see it after we got off the train from the airport (only about 3 stops away). There was a wheelchair ramp at the front of the building that made it much easier to get our luggage to the door where a young man from the hotel met us with a cart for our luggage. The subway is also located in the train station. There are restaurants on all sides of the hotel and in the train station so finding a place to eat was easy. There is also a grocery store called something like Hypomarcat located directly beneath the hotel and you access it outside on either side of the hotel building. When you first enter the store you find yourself in a department store of sorts with clothes, children's toys, etc. and you have to walk to the back of the store and take an escalator down to the large grocery market where we bought cokes, snacks and items for breakfast. As stated in other reviews,, the room was spacious and had an excellent view. The bathroom was quite large and had separate rooms for the toilet (with bidet) and shower. It had a large bathtube and vanity area with marble. It was all in marble and quite large and very nice as for as bathrooms go. The bed was large but hard with nice pillows. The room was very clean and had a flat screen television and disc player. The stereo was a large boom box. It had nice looking bookshelves as well. The lighting did not have a soft glow like in the picture but was satisfactory. Coffee was available in the room. Also, there was a small refrigerator where we kept cokes after some rearranging of the various items contained within for sale. Each floor has its own ice machine which is supposed to dispense ice automatically when the ice bucket is placed in the front opening. However the ice buckets provided in the rooms are too short to be detected by the sensor. You must place your hand above and behind the bucket to cause the ice to come out. We had some problems with this until we figured out the sensor could not detect the ice bucket. If you want to do the hop-on/hop-off bus tour of the city you can walk through the train station and get to it easily. The tickets are purchased on the bus itself, even though a sign on the ticket office where the bus stops says they can be purchased inside the train station. We found the hotel staff to be very courteous and helpful. They all spoke fluent English and were quite easily understood. We had no problems checking in or out of the hotel We were in Barcelona to take a cruise. Taxis are located outside the hotel's front door and it cost 17 Euros to get to our ship at the port. From what we could tell, it would have been quite a walk from the nearest hotel to the ship. Overall, our experience with this hotel was very good. Next year we are planning on taking another cruise out of Barcelona and plan on staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just one short night, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTex
Reviews.Content: Pluses: right next door to the Sants station, making travel easy. Room was very spacious, clean, and well decorated. We used points to stay one free night. Negatives: stairs into the hotel??? not fun with luggage. Check in and check out: long lines and ridiculously time-consuming. Would like free wifi in rooms....

Reviews.Title: “great location - hotel nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed this hotel, very clean and well cared for. in a great location for my office and central point near bus station, tourist areas, etc. couple specifics - found the beds to be unusually close to the ground, the shower in my room was fantastic - a room unto itself. the check in staff is courteous and friendly, the bar staff in the lobby was awesome. all in all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend for a city break”
Reviews.Author: apple501
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed out stay at the hotel. The room was very spacious and light. The bathroom facilities were spotless with separate walk-in shower room and toilet. The bedding was spotless. The staff were very friendly, welcoming and informative. the breakfast served at the top floor of the hotel in the Visual restaurant had amazing views of Barcelona. The breakfast offered a very good variety of cooked and continental choices. the location was ideal. We traveled around with ease and access to the metro and train stations were across the road. Definitely value for money and would recommend the location. The beds were also comfortable.Ask for a higher floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service/Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kas531
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya exceeded all our expectations! My husband and I spent 4 fabulous nights in a suite on the 18th floor with views of the harbour. The bed was really comfy and we were not disturbed by any street noise so the higher up your room is the better. Ana offered as an upgrade at a very reasonable rate and as it was my husbands birthday and our wedding anniversary it was definitely the room to stay in. We were shown all the available rooms by a concierge and given the choice. Our cases were then brought to us with our key cards. Having gone to explore Las Ramblas on our return there was a complimentary bottle of cava and some gorgeous pieces of tiramasu - what a lovely surprise. Breakfast is on the top floor of the hotel and whilst eating you have the splendid views of Barcelona to admire. Everything from arrival to departure was superb and especially Ana Carcelero who was available on reception throughout our stay. She is a great asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for our honeymoon and would go back!”
Reviews.Author: ami1129
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for our honeymoon back in July. We had a suite and it was just as it is pictured on the hotel website. It was actually even bigger and better than that as it had a seperate living room area with a second bathroom that I didnt expect. We had windows to the front and left of our bed that gave us amazing views of the city! We could see everything and that is how we often decided what to do and where to go for the day. The service we received from reception, housekeeping, waitstaff, and bartenders was above and beyond. We arrived earlier than we were allowed to check in, but they gladly held our bags, provided us with a map, suggested things to do, and gave us vouchers for free drinks. Our room was always immaculate and we received extras (such as champagne and a special welcome basket) because it was our honeymoon. We would definite return, but unfortunately this was probably a once in a lifetime trip for us and that is why we chose to go there as part of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cdnpolo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Bran Torre Catalunya. The breakfast buffet was set up over looking all of Barcelona and the views are worth the price. The rooms are absolutely stunning and first class. The location next to the train station is also very convenient. The hotel isn't too far from anything including Olympic sites, beaches, La Rambla, Camp Nou, etc. We had a wonderful stay and if we are ever lucky enough to go to Barcelona again, we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reidb123
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate for 2 nights on September 29 & 30th, 2011. Rooms were very nicely decorated and large. Bathrooms were huge. We were upgraded(?) to a higher floor, corner room which was wonderful. Close to metro and train station (right in front of hotel), which you'll need since it's location is not premium for city center wannabes like me... Dined at Visual which was nice. The view was wonderful, although the food quality could have been a little better considering the price, but the decor is beautiful. Staff was always very nice and very helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: flysohigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while on vacation in Barcelona in last August. Was a great hotel, very clean and a good location close to a train station. Even made the walk to Las Ramblas from here. Cab rides to the centre were also quite inexpensive. Only downside was paying for wifi since I didn't book directly thru the hotel. Service was good with the exception of a few staff. I would definitely book here again. Wonderful city and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Torre Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: goonerjon2
Reviews.Content: This was a great a hotel that my wife and I stayed in in Oct 2011......its rated as 4 stars and I have to agree, on arrival the staff where very helpful and gave us lots of city info and we requested a quiet room which we received (although I think we had slightly different definitions of quiet as we were given a corner room that was quiet from within the hotel but meant that we had a road facing room which wasn't so quiet). It is a very central hotel that is close to the Metro line and has a supermarket just around the corner if you're looking for cheaper food / drinks. The breakfast is served on the top floor and so has a great view and so is expensive. We chose to go across the road to Pans & Company where you can get a coffee and a croissant for €2!! its approx 10 mins by Metro to Las Ramblas, 20 mins from the beaches and Sagrada Familia so is a great location. Hotel facilities where excellent, we had a large room with a large walk in shower + bath......staff very helpful and all in all well worth the money, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare train journey”
Reviews.Author: rimshot
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days at Gran Torre Catalunya after a nightmare journey from terminal 1 Barcelona Airport by taking the train to Barcelona Sants station which is about a 100yds from the hotel. I had never seen so many people fighting to get on the train and on a platform which was at bursting point. After finally getting on the train we then had to endure buskers making an unholy racket and trying to sell cds. My wife rides trains all the time and said it was the most horrendous journey of her life. Needless to say we returned to the airport by taxi which was far quicker and was worth all of the 25 euros. Now the hotel, we had an executive room on the 12th floor which was very spacious. We had a shock the first night when in the early hours i needed to use the toilet and didn't realise there was a pane of frosted glass between the bathroom and bedroom and when the light was on lit up the bedroom like daylight which woke my wife. From then on had to go to the loo using my mobile phone light. Another small quirk was there were no spare pillows so rolled up a spare blanket as a bolster, the television was an old type cathode ray tube set with rubbish channels for english speakers, i'm not interested in business news on holiday, that's why i came on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria10017
Reviews.Content: I booked Gran Torre Catalunya based on the great reviews from Tripadvisor. I booked through their website and as advertised, got free wifi internet for my iPad and iPhone the whole stay. The staff had been great. We arrived late from Paris and our room was ready. Check-in was so easy, the front desk assistance was very pleasant and assisting. To book tickets for our visit to Sagrada Familia I had to use the Business Centre where we were told we had 15 minutes free but when the computer I was using froze they let me use another one and let me print the tickets for no fee at all. The whole time the Business Centre staff member provided tips of where to go and what to order. It was like coming home to long lost relatives who want you to enjoy their city! It was fantastic. The rooms are very big (well, of course in comparison to Paris, which is unfair!) and we were given a room on the 21st floor with great views of the Camp Nou and the city and in the afternoons, dramatic sunset views. We reported that two lamps were not working when we arrived and went out for dinner. When we returned both were lit up - working! The rooms were cleaned everyday and the bathroom was always tidied up. I always appreciate it when hotels provide free bottled water for guests and Gran Hotel Torre gives you 3 bottles instead of just 2! Need ice? There is a dispenser just along the corridor available 24/7. We stayed 4 nights and it was sort of sad to leave - like leaving home. The beds were comfortable and we had restful sleep all throughout. Sometimes there would be noise coming from the corridor but that is not the fault of the hotel but guests who have had too much wine. And when we checked out it was also a breeze - like they understand you have to be on your way.... The hotel provides welcome drinks to all guests though I cannot rate it since we had no time to do that. There is a restaurant at the penthouse that boasts great views but with the abundance of great places to eat in Barcelona we opted out of overspending on westernized-style (read: cute and overpriced!) and enjoyed the many other restaurants in the area. Same with breakfast - we suggest you go out and enjoy what the city has to offer. There are plenty of restaurants close by that offer coffee, omelets, croissants for less than 10 euros. The Barcelona Sants station is right next door so if you are arriving by AVE or regional trains into Barcelona then it is your best bet for your stay. Local buses and the subway lines (Tarragona Station, we found to be more convenient then Sants Station) are within walking distance. If arriving from the airport and you have tons of luggage - or just lazy like us, take a cab and it would cost no more than 25 euros counting the tip and one euro cost per luggage piece. Arrive in style and enjoy! Overall, would recommend to friends and the universe and yes, if not that obvious - would come back - to Barcelona and Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: turabiannights
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before boarding a cruise, and were very happy with the location and quality of the hotel. The Torre Catalunya is just across from the main train station in Barcelona, which also hosts a stop for the Green and Blue Metro lines. It was easy to hop onto the Metro to get to the Ramblas or to Sagrada Familia. The hotel is very clean and modern, with good linens and beautiful bathrooms. Plentiful electrical outlets for all your gizmos and gadgets -- no coffee maker/tea kettle that we could discover in our third floor room. Generally quiet, though you may hear some street noise or fountain noise on the lower floors. Two reasons this wasn't a five star experience for us: there aren't a lot of eating options nearby, so we had to go into town for dinner, and the internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TATSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best service of any hotel that I have stayed in. The rooms are beautiful. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “NICE POSITION”
Reviews.Author: MilanMarco
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel, it's very well connected with the city and, most of all, from the station (which is really below the hotel) you can easily reach the line for the airport...i know very well the city and it was the first time i was so far away from the sea but it's just matter of spending some time in the subway...the room was very nice (an executive one), the room service very quick...of course the price is balanced to all these services.......but you pay the best...only bad thing .. in the night there is no entertainment around, you have to move toward Barceloneta or the Ramblas but on the other side you can sleep very well.......ps: amazing view from the 13rd floor.......

Reviews.Title: “Like home”
Reviews.Author: Jose R
Reviews.Content: In these last months, this hotel has been my second house. There is always a smile on everyone's face followed by your name when you arrive. Little but fully functional gym, a good spa and excellent rooms (specially when it comes to the bathroom). The room service is quick and good. I have no doubt about which hotel I will choose next time I come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel location is very good and great view”
Reviews.Author: Emelecuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good and great view, but the reception people are useless, I arrived from London at 3:00 pm and had to go to a meeting with a client right away, my two companions were given their room right away but mine was not ready until 4, I was not offered anything in return, only to leave my suitcase with them and I actually needed to shower and change clothes. When leaving I almost missed my flight because the same people at the desk would not let me leave because my room was booked and paid with the card from my assistant who was in another room (we had different flights times). They treated me like a thief and told me I could not leave until the blond girl my assistant would come down to confirm the payment and I had to beg them to phone and confirm my assistant's room. Well the most unpleasant of all was that when I spoke in Spanish to them they were rude (I am native Spanish speaker), but in English they really respected me.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: alilopez69
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Barcelona. My husband and I found this the perfect hotel to stay at while touring around the city. The rooms are beautiful and the air conditioning is welcome after spending the day touring around. It is a 15 minute train ride from the airport and the hotel is right across from the station. It is a 7 minute metro ride to La Rambla and there are lots of things to do and see within walking distance. The metro is cheap and very user friendly. We would definitely stay here again. The staff were very helpful. We were on the 18th floor and the views were stunning. A great experience staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Uz27
Reviews.Content: So far - the best hotel of all that I saw! Great service Fantastic view from the window (our room was on the 19th floor) Location is not the center but a taxi from the hotel to the city center is only 6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carina H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this nice stylish hotel in april 2010. We upgraded to a junior suite when we checked in, (for a reasonable price). So we got a fantastic accommodation with a stunning view. The location is not charming but close to public transportation. Hotel was perfect in terms of service and staff and the room was spotlessly clean. Mornings were beautiful with breakfast on 23rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TFan1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya in early September, 2011. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was very convenient with excellent access to Sants Estacion and buses, just a short walk away. Booking on the hotel website is gives you access to free internet and late checkout. We had breakfast included and it was a great decision. The breakfast had a great selection and a nice view from the top level of the hotel. We had an internet problem with our room but the staff was very attentive to the issue and moved us to a nicer room. I believe that this hotel takes great pride in their service and reputation. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend with my Wife”
Reviews.Author: gakkawakka
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. easy to get to from the airport. very easy to get into the centre of things. ie. Las Ramblas. Metro works likes Paris and is really cheap. Breakfast is brilliant - all you can eat and the food choice is excellent and all of a very high standard. Rooms are beautiful and have a drink in the upstairs lounge at night, the Views are spectacular. Service second to none. Overall highly recommended. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get-away to Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya!”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizen1986
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely go back to this hotel! We had an early flight to Barcelona from Madrid, so we did not expect that our room would be ready at 10am when we arrived. But it was, and it literally saved my day! The hotelstaff spoke very well english, and they where so helpfull when it came to tell us about attractions and must-see sightsing areas. We had a great first day in Barcelona because of them! Next morning, after a good night sleep we went up on the top floor for breakfast. GREAT view. The staff up here was great, could absolutely smile a bit more, but the breakfast was very nice, so we didn't mind too much.. The hotel was situated just next door to the station Sants. It made it so easy to go back and forth to the airport, but also to get around in the city. We bought a Metro pass and it was great. A good way to get around. The area around felt very safe and quiet. The staff informed us that we could use the top- floor pool at the hotel next door because they had an agreement. Also, our hotel had a SPA and gym department, but unfortunately we did not have time to chech this out. However, the pool next door looked very relaxing and nice. I will definitely go back to this hotel when I return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and sleek hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMTMRome
Reviews.Content: The reception staff at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya must be among the friendliest and most helpful I have ever come accross in the hunders of hotels I have stayed in. Arriving late one evening after a delayed flight I felt immediately welcomed and happy to be in the hotel. The same was true when I asked for anything adn when I checked out. Lovely people! The room was perfectly good. Reasonable size, comfortable bed, modern decor a lttle worn at the edges, but not enough to complain about, good bathroom, big TC, nice view from the window. A highlight of the hotel is their Restaurant Visual on the 23rd floor which has a spectacular 360 degree view of Barcelona. Breakfast was an impressive buffet which was well worth the add on to the room price. The location is great for public transport, several good restaurants nearby, walking distance to Plaza España and other important locations, but a little removed from teh main tourist center. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: lrfbaf
Reviews.Content: We took a med cruise from Barcelona. The two nights prior to cruise we stayed at another hotel because of location being close to La Ramblas and it was ok. After the cruise, we stayed at Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya because it was close to the Renfe train. The train was down for repair so that part of the plan was not what expected but the Torre is a great value and with the metro, no need to be close to La Ramblas. You can get the the tourist spots in a few minutes. If were doing all again, would save $50US per night and stay at the Torre before and after cruise. We had a very clean nice room. My wife was impressed with the bath, one of the largest we have ever had. All staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel right at the train station”
Reviews.Author: TheSpear
Reviews.Content: This may or may not be a great location for you. It's good if you're doing some train trips around the area (which I'd recommend). It's only a 5 minute train ride from the main plaza (non stop) and that's included if you get one of the metro cards or the Barcelona card. Had to pay for internet which wasn't great though the price was not unreasonable. They indicated it might have been included if you book directly with them (rather than through a major travel site). However, the wired internet went out on at least 2 floors while we were there and was out for more than 3 days - while everyone was very apologetic and helpful with workarounds, they weren't very quick at resolving the problem. There's a nice view restaurant up on the top through meals are rather pricey there. They did offer us a deal at check-in on their breakfast that made it more reasonable if you were going to eat there everyday. The deluxe rooms were nice and spacious - understand that the standard rooms are a fair bit smaller. There is a very good shower. Beds were comfortable. The business center has several computers and a printer though you may be charged for user there too. There was no pool but they indicated you might be able to use the one at their sister hotel next door. The employees there all seemed eager to help and most spoke at least some English. All in all, it was a good place for us.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice without any doubt”
Reviews.Author: Familia_Sampaio
Reviews.Content: We were 3 nights in this hotel in August/2011, where we booked 2 rooms for our family . We had a very agreeable reception at the hotel. The staff is very nice, polite and gave us some tips where to go. The rooms are comfortable, clean, with good space for a couple and an extra bed. The breakfast were also very delicious , with several options to many different tastes and as this is on the 23rd floor you can have a spectacular vision of Barcelona. It is not so close to the beach or downtow and close to it there is not so much to see. The hotel is just some meters from subway station/train. You can also use the taxi service as this is not so expensive. A Fare from the hotel to the Barceloneta beach costs around 11Euros. Barcelona is a very nice city, modern, clean with several options to eat, see, enjoy. We regret that we had spent only 3 nights. When we comeback we will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer915
Reviews.Content: Not worth it. Only good thing is ease of getting to and from the airport. Otherwise a rediculous place to stay. Almost everyting is 8 metro stops away by two trains at Jaume I. Extra fees for EVERYTHING. Free WiFI? Don't believe it.--- only for the first 15 minutes, "but you can go check your email in the business center for free" 5 minute limit on a slow connection. After 5 minutes they start charging. Never again. Next time I'll stay in the Gothic Quarter from which everything interesting radiates. Then can walk to all. Metro is interesting for people watching and 'living like a loca' but on the whole is hot and sweaty so gets old after a few days of 20 minutes out, 20 minutes back 20 minutes out 20 minutes back.

Reviews.Title: “Great links to airport & city without being super noisy”
Reviews.Author: hooliam
Reviews.Content: Stayed July for 5 nights. Really easy access to airport via overland train & into city on underground as right next to Sants station. Can even walk to the sights if feeling energetic! Staff were really helpful & friendly, food in restaurant upstairs excellent & even had a decent veggie option, unheard of in lots of places. Buffet breakfasts had a great selection- fresh watermelon, homemade muffins, loads of cheeses & meat as you'd expect in Barcelona & also your American style cooked stuff. Room was spacious & clean. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: KITTYCOL
Reviews.Content: I just love the city of Barcelona in Spain. The arquitecture is beautiful and the food is great. The Torre Catalunya Hotel has very nice and large rooms. It has a mini bar, dvd player and all of the amenities. It is a block from the central train station which would make it an easy access if you plan to go to other cities by train while in Spain.. I prefer a hotel more near the heart of downtown. From this hotel one has to take the metro to go anywhere and it is usually a long ride with train changes.. They offer a very nice breakfast buffet but it runs out of their assortment and they did not have any more to add. I find this hard to believe since they ask that one make reservations for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Tom N
Reviews.Content: We booked through expedia a late deal for a 4 night getaway. The hotel is located right next to the train station 3 stops from the airport, approximately 6 euros for both of us. On arrival the reception staff were brilliant and although we were booked into a standard room my wife asked if they had any superior rooms available they quickly looked at their reservations and said that they had rooms available. We asked if we could see both to compare a very polite porter took us to both rooms, the standard was fine but the superior rooms were fantastic with panoramic windows up 20 floors with views of the whole city. We decided to upgrade for the extra 12.50 euros per night. The room service is excellent and the bar and resturant (top floor) are very good places to relax. The hotel is located in the middle of Barcelona some distance away from the main shops and sea front, however this is not a disadvantage as the tube provides easy access to the city. I would recommend buying a T10 ticket for the tube as it allows you to share a ticket and get 10 journeys. The open top bus provides an excellent service to see all the major attractions and you can hop on and off we bought a two day ticket 33 euros and did the blue route one day and the red on the other. Breakfast is expensive and I would suggest using the cafe next door 20 metres where you can get a good meal for 4 euros. Barcelona is a fantastic city and the hotel with it's views enhanced our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Good location,next to the Sants train Station and opposite the metro station(Sants Estansion) . There is also a bus station very close to the hotel where you can return back from the centre (Catalunya Plaza) after midnight,when the metro is closed. The hotel is away from the hustle of the centre-we really recommend not to stay in the centre because there is too much noise,too many people,it's not so clean,too many prostitutes at night...- but it's just 10 minutes by metro. The hotel room is large and spacious,although there are different sizes of rooms-we booked triple so were given a big size room. The bathroom was the best, it had 2 sinks and there was seperate toilet room and seperate shower room with glass doors. Very convinient for families. The view from the room was breathtaking- it's better if you book the room directly from the hotel's website and sign free to become member for the expo club as you will get many benefits(also they might upgrade the room free) and ask for a room on the higher floors for better views. Our room was on the 11th floor. We didn't try the hotel's breakfast as it was expensive but around the area there are many cheap options for breakfast. Also beside the hotel the is a hypermarket with a bakery. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you want to eat good food around Barcelona or have a drink in a nice bar you can ask them and they will recommended you the best-everything we tried was great. The last night they recommended a restaurant just few minutes near the hotel and the food was so delicious, we had the best sangria ever tried in Barcelona. We really enjoyed our stay there and we recommend it to everybody

Reviews.Title: “" A great hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Mawkesy
Reviews.Content: Although our stay at this hotel was short we thoroughly enjoyed it. Very close to Barcelona Sants and the staff were friendly and helpful. Did not eat there but did find a lovely restaurant a street away at back of hotel. It was easy to get to the town centre by the metro and you can pick up the hop on hop off bus at the station.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but ...”
Reviews.Author: dandelionsf
Reviews.Content: Location is great - right next to the Train/bus station, which makes it easy to get around and easy to find. However, in retrospect I would have preferred to be closer to the "action." The room was fine, bar was nice, and the staff was pleasant. Free Wi-Fi, but only in the lobby. One more thing ... before this trip I had never had a bug bite so I don't know much about them, but I did get some kind of bite on my ankle during my 4 night stay there. Just sayin' ...

Reviews.Title: “The whole package”
Reviews.Author: christine h
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 22 staying here before our cruise departed. The age range varied from 5-85 and i am 28F...everyone loved the hotel! the staff was extremely friendly, location was great (with a metro across the street to get you anywhere in the city.) We prefer to stay a little outside of the city center because its calmer and quieter...and just as easy to ride in. The breakfast here was phenomenal, and i would highly recommend getting up early to experience it. the views up in the breakfast room may be some of the best in Barcelona, it was breathtaking. We are americans and are used to nice large rooms, with upgraded amenities. This hotel had it and was well-priced vs the smaller european boutique hotels, where you can barely fit your luggage in the room. The beds were a little on the hard side, so they were not very plush, but the rest of the place made up for it. They had converters if you needed and internet in the rooms. free Wifi was only available in the lobby though and i was told that it will be in the rooms within the next year. The bathrooms had a nice large bathtub, which i love and was spacious, clean and modern. I would upgrade to a higher floor or suite (the price isn't much more but the room and views are worth it) We will be staying here if we ever come back to this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and well-priced”
Reviews.Author: MsMoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for 5 nights. The before check-service was brilliant. We emailed in advance to request a room on a lowish floor. They acknowledged the email straight away and, when we arrived, we did not have to remind them. We had a lovely room on the third floor with a private balcony. The room and the bathroom were the real selling points as they were absolutely HUGE! The bathroom had double sinks, as well as a separate toilet room, separate shower room and very large bath. The room was very comfy with powerful aircon and a very comfortable bed. It also had a free safe. The location is good just across the road from Barcelona Sants station, which is very well-connected) and also next to a supermarket). They did offer spar facilities and access to the gym, neither of which I wound up using as it was extra. The reason I wouldn't give this a five star is that there was no wi-fi, the patio door on to the balcony had a crack in the corner, the TV wasn't wide-screen and the ice machines seem to be working (although the receptionists did point me in the direction of the bar who were able to give me ice) .There were also no tea or coffee-making facilities, which seemed a bit strange. Fairly small things, but they stood out as the rest of the hotel was lovely. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Torre Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: bshaw18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a week in Spain which covered Madrid and Valencia as well as Barcelona. Of the three places (and four hotels) we visited, this unfortunately was the worst. The room was not as nice as advertised and we had to call the service folks twice for problems. First was the moldy smell in the shower which made it difficult to be comfortable. But more than that, was the smell of the pillows. We called down both days as it was so bad we could not sleep with them. In the staff's defense, they did their best to correct it quickly, but it still made our stay a bit more uncomfortable as compared to the other places. I would also comment that the area around the hotel is not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly convenient, great value!”
Reviews.Author: its_about_glamour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya in August 2011. We landed late Friday evening, so the convenience of a direct 20 minute journey to Sants Estacio (Barcelona's main train station across from the hotel) was very much appreciated. We had a Standard room on the sixth floor; we asked for a room on a higher floor, but the hotel was booked out, so the highest room possible (without paying for an upgrade) was the sixth. The room was facing the train station and traffic noise throughout the night was clearly audible; luckily I am a heavy sleeper, so it didn't bother me, but would most likely affect a lighter sleeper. Main positives: - Conveniently located across from main train station with quick access around the city and to the airport - Good size room - Great bathroom - Friendly, helpful service at the front desk - Able to print out flight confirmations at no cost - Overall great value Main negatives - Noise of outside traffic clearly audible in room - One cupboard door falling apart We did not eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant but went for alternatives such as outdoor cafes (including a really lovely cafe on Placa Catalunya before out bike tour of the city). Overall, great value given the convenience and quality of the rooms. I would stay here again but next time try to organise a room on a higher floor in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but something missing”
Reviews.Author: Mattsay
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights here and while the hotel is modern and clean, and my room had magnificent views to Montjuic and the sea, I was a little disappointed. I paid a lot for the Superior room but there was no free internet "except on the ground and top floors" I was told. then, when my phone was stolen late at night and I returned to the hotel to call the UK to block the phone, none of the hotel's phones would call abroad! I had to use a public phone in the street...Location is handy for transport connections. One other thing - strange they have no flatscreen TVs and poor selection of foreign channels. Not a massive issue, but again I'd expect better from an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryan m
Reviews.Content: The staff were really pleasant and very helpful. The hotel was not crowded at all and ideal for families. Clean and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinShane
Reviews.Content: It's almost perfect, almost. It's a business class hotel, but offered at a great price (I picked up a night there for 89 Euro in the summer). Can't beat that! Pro's 1- A stone's throw from the main train station and the metro. 2- Free Internet (when you book on their website). It's fast too.
