And they have a business center where they let you print your boarding passes and hotel vouchers free. 3- Nice little work out gym (it's small - but suffices). 4- Nice size rooms, with a great bathroom. 5- Nice views of the city from your room. 6- Super friendly front desk staff. So... why isn't it perfect? Con's: 1- The bed. Ugh. It's def a very uncomfortable bed. Firm and bumpy. Not a good combo. Why oh why? If they upgraded the bed - they'd have gotten 5 stars. But clearly the bed is one of the most important things! C'mon Gran Hotel Torre - upgrade the beds and move up the rating ladder.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Katherine6659
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on trip advisor recommendations. Service was great. After taking a red eye from the states appreciated the hotel getting us a room as soon as we arrived at noon. Very nice room with a great bathroom. They also offered a breakfast buffet I would recommend. Food was great with an excellent selection. Breakfast is served on the 16 floor....great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good service, awful food”
Reviews.Author: chanyuklan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before the apartment we booked becomes available. We booked a superior room. A few days before our arrival the hotel sent us an email asking if we have any special request. I asked them to give us a room on an upper floor if possible. It ended up that they gave us a room on the top floor - Floor 22! The view was magnificent! We also appreciate the helpfulness of their staff, and the spaciousness of the room. We went to the Vision Restaurant for breakfast. Alright we knew the review for food there had been bad, but we still went there because of the view, which was good, but the food - you are right - was awful! Never tasted fried eggs so poorly done! To sum up, everything that needs cooking were bad. Only those uncooked items (bread, cereals, fruit, etc) were okay. The one mark was deducted due to food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevo31
Reviews.Content: Perfect for access to all the tourist attractions, very close to metro station. Hotel was clean, tidy and quiet. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful. As we were having a family holiday, the adjoining rooms were perfect with the link doors which made us feel as if we had a large suite of rooms. Views from the top floor restaurant were superb and breakfasts were plentiful. All in all we would be happy to stay there again and recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, did not enjoy the location”
Reviews.Author: GBstravels
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and service at the reception of the hotel. The hotel is easy to get to from the Airport, and has excellent access to the city (train and city explorer buses pull up outside), however would recommend staying closer to the city if you want to enjoy the Barcelona atmosphere. It was hard to find a decent restaurant for breakfast or dinner nearby and it wasn't especially nice walking back to the hotel at night around the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, just a but disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: s&p_on_hols
Reviews.Content: Having booked an Exec Room here I was just expecting a bit more than we got. The room was pretty small and nothing special and it was the fact things like free wi-fi and use of the spa were not included, these were all extra charges (and actually the wi-fi was only available in certain parts of the hotel anyway). On the plus side the views if you get one of the upper floors are stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, more to come”
Reviews.Author: MsSoffi
Reviews.Content: What can I say - this time I had a room on the 18th floor with a 180° view of Montjuic and the sea. I LOVED it! Even for those with a fear of heights, Torre Catalunya offers great value for money - big, comfy beds, enormous bathrooms, everything very clean, extremely friendly staff - I can only recommend it. What's more, it's right next to Sants Station, where the train from Barcelona Airport stops, so you can get there with an absolute minimum of cost and discomfort. You are going to love it too! :)

Reviews.Title: “impressive stay”
Reviews.Author: thereisonlyoneofme
Reviews.Content: My partner and me stayed at the Torre Catalunya on 4th August, 1 night, to celebrate my 30th bday. I found the hotel through lastminute.com but booked directly on the hotel's website as they offer added benefits if you book directly. They prize for a junior suite was very attractive and offered great views over Barcelona. We arrived quite early and the room wasn't ready. They stored our bags and provided us with details on what to do in Barcelona. Ana who checked us in was ever so lovely and helful. When we came back, our bags were already placed in our room and they upgraded us to their best suite on the 18th floor! We had fabulous views over Mont Juic, Sagrada familia and the rest of Barcelona. The upgrade was a very nice surprise and we very much enjoyed our stay. The bed was very comfy, linen very crisp, bathroom had a good power shower, a/c in good working order, the living room of the suite had a ipod player and there was a separate toilet for visitors, unfortunately we dind't have any to show off our suite to. Just after we arrived in the suite, they delivered a bday cake as well, I couldn't be made to feel more special. We didn't have breakfast, we walked to a local bakery instead for some fresh bread and tea/coffee. The location of the hotel is excellent, near Sants station. You can walk to the fountains and Mont Juic in 20 minutes. The red tourist bus line only 5 minute walk and 20 min walk to the point where you can board the blue line tourist bus. I would definately go back to this hotel or reccommend it. The staff was very friendly, hotel looks good, location near Sants station is very convenient. Thanks Torre Catalunya staff for making my stay so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: Bramblewood1
Reviews.Content: After missing our last train home from Barcelona we had to stay an extra night in Barcelona and as this was the first hotel that met our eye when leaving the Barca Sants train station we headed for this one. Great Hotel, large and well equipped rooms and comfortable beds. Had breakfast in the top floor restaurant which had amazing 360o views of the city and buffet breakfast was very enjoyable. would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NewToIowa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We loved the location: a grocery store in the basement of the same building, Metro station just across the street, rail station next door (but all trains go underground, so no noise what so ever). Room was large and nice... But these are not even the best thing about this hotel-it was the service. We had a late arrival at 2am and contacted the hotel through email a day before, they replied our email promptly and we checked in like breeze. On our last day in Barcelona, we needed to catch a 6pm train, but decide to check out in the morning, leave the luggage with front desk and go on for some more sight seeing. But soon after we checked out, my husband felt seriously sick and needed to lay down, so we went back to the hotel and asked them if we could take our room back so my husband can rest a bit. The front desk was so helpful, even though our room was not available any more, they still manage to find us another room, when I asked how much it would cost, they told us since it was because of illness, they won't charge us anything. Finally after an entire afternoon's rest, my husband felt a lot better and were ready to get back onto the road. This is the true hospitality we could ever ask when traveling away from home. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Customer is number 1!”
Reviews.Author: wveronica
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel for 9 days in superior room. I put my preference in high floor and smoking room, and they met my satisfaction. So, if you'd like to book a hotel room, put your preference!!! The bedroom is huge huge huge! and the bathroom is amazing. Moreover, the location of this hotel is easily to reach by metro, and there are some shops near by the train station which make you easily to get some daily needs. The room service is FAST and the quality of the food is excellent. HOwever, what i regret from this hotel was only the housekeeping because they cleaned the room only the bed, bath and bit of the floor which is can shown how it is not clean. Yet, overall stay, i would like to recommend this hotel because of its service, location and price is fair!! And i definitely come back to this hotel when i return to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fine location!”
Reviews.Author: cbourdon
Reviews.Content: After finding this hotel and reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to book for the second week of our trip to Spain. We stayed in Madrid the first week and took the TGV to get to Barcelona. Getting out of the train station, we did not have to look far for our hotel since it was located at the station! It was very convenient to take the metro or bus since public transportation is almost a must if you want to see everything in Barcelona. The hotel from outside was not what I expected, but the customer service and great room compensated. As part of expo hotels, and as being a member, you can request anything you want. I had a nice suite for a great price and ask to have Jazz music and a bottle of Champagne upon arrival. Everything was perfect! the surprise was a succes! I would recommend this hotel to anyone not shy of taking public transportation (or a taxi) and doesn't mind not being exactly centralized.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gav99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and the hotel made the holiday! We had upgraded to a superior room, although I did not see the other rooms, I think the extra money was worth it. We were on the 19th floor with amazing views across the city and the room itself was quiet, excellent air conditioning, spotlessly clean and spacious. The location of the hotel wasn't fantastic as we like to walk everywhere however the metro is literally across the square from the hotel so getting about the city was fine. We did walk to the seafront/Ramblas area once but it took about 45 mins to an hour and it was so hot we decided we'd just use the metro from then on. It is easy though to walk to Monjuic. As for eating out, there weren't many restaurants around at all and we didn't fancy the expense of the hotel restaurant. Right next to the hotel though is the train station with plenty of cafes, mcdonalds and fast food type places and also, at the foot of the hotel is a huge supermarket. The staff at the hotel were amazing. I had almost been off this hotel by a trip advisor reviewer stating that the staff did not like the British. I can say that that is not true from our experience. Every member of staff we came across did their utmost to help us with anything or to just greet us with a smile. We arrived too early for check in so we were given access to the spa to change and refresh. By the time we got back to the hotel after a wander the staff remembered us, gave us our keys immediately and said our luggage was already in the room. I could not fault the staff in any way. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed every return to this hotel after rambling around Barcelona in the hot sun. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money, we loved it & will definately come back!!”
Reviews.Author: AreejDaoud
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Gran Torre for 6 nights. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone, its spectacular! I wasn’t expecting what I found…if you like 5 star hotels & a 5 star service, then definitely book in this hotel! It’s like a 5 star hotel but with a 4 star price...what more can anyone ask for!! It was worth every penny, it had a mini-bar, water heater with complementary tea & coffee, a hair dryer, ironing board! Everything…I loved the hotel; it completed the whole feel of being on a vacation. We booked an executive room and had such a breathtaking view, we were on the 17th floor and the view was overlooking the Expo pool terrace and the whole of Montjuic & the MNAC, and on one side you could see the horizon of the sea…I loved the large floor to ceiling windows, the bed is too comfortable to get out of, and the bathroom is super huge, with his & hers sinks and a huge bathtub with water pressure that makes you want to stay in the shower. The only bad thing was that its front entrance water fountain kinda had a bad smell sometimes, but I don't think that's a major point. The location is perfect, I wouldn’t have asked for a better location. You have the main station ‘Estacio’ to your left, this is like 3mins walk and it has the Renfe train that comes directly from the airport. Also 5mins walk to your left there’s a very nice park (Joan Miro) with a beautiful lake, very nice to have breakfast at in the mornings. And there’s a supermarket and bakery located in the same building as the hotel. Also right in front of the hotel there’s PAN which is like a Spanish sub-way type thing. Also it’s walking distance from Placa Espanya and Montjuic where Poble Espanyol & the Magic fountain are located, and another 10mins to get to the Estadi Olympico. Its location is right in the center, close to everything – you go to Placa Espanya to get to barcelonatta beach and the other beaches nearby. And if you take the metro station right across the street you can easily get to La Ramblas or anywhere else in 15mins maximum. It’s also a plus that you can access the Expo pool for free if you don’t feel like going to the beach. The reception are very friendly, they are ready to help you with anything you may need. Patricia helped us a lot with directions, bike rentals…honestly she had an answer for everything we asked. Go to this hotel without a second thought...best hotel ever! And one last thing, the stop for the turistic bus is right across the street so thats also helpful! Also a tip for travellers, make sure you spend a good time at the Museu Picasso area, its beautiful if you like artsy atmospheres,narrow alleys, small pastry shops & pizzerias and cafes, my favourite area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stunning views, stinky pond!”
Reviews.Author: Ecowoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business in Barcelona...very convenient to the train station and metro, walking distance to some great sites (Olympic Stadium, museum and park) plus the newly renovated bull arena now shopping mall. The rooms were pretty contemporary in their decor...those with the corner rooms get a bit more space. The lounge and restaurant on the top floor has stunning views, and the food is outstanding. It's great to just come up for a glass of wine at the end of a long day...there is a grocery store attached to the basement area of the hotel, where you can pick up some breakfast foods, or nibbles (and very cheap wines!) If that's your interest. So, about that stinky pond...weird, but the pool/fountains at the front of the building often smelled like sewage...perhaps they were using "grey water" in the fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and so convenient”
Reviews.Author: brushstick
Reviews.Content: The first thing anybody notices about this hotel is its proximity to the main train station. Straight across the square in fact - meaning transport to.from the airport is easy, as is getting about this beautiful city, as you are never more than a few stops away from all the sights. It's also only a short walk to the busy placa espanya and to the magic dancing fountain. Check what night they are on though. There are also plenty of places to eat off the streets around here. The Hotel itself was great and an easy place to relax. The rooms we stopped in were both double and were a good size with al the amenities one would expect. The hotel has a small gym and swimming pool. We had breakfast at the hotel on our last day at a negotiated price to fill ourselves up for the flight back. There are plenty of options, though for other days we ate breakfast at one of the many cafes around the hotel. We also ate an evening meal in the panoramic restaurant on the top floor. The views were ok looking over the city but we didn't think the high cost of the meals were worth the view!! There were many little nice touches and all the staff in the hotel that we encountered were friendly and helpful and if in Barcelona again wouldn't hesitate in staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: timdoody
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value. We got a room on the 22nd floor with a beautiful view over the city for a very reasonable price. its located next to the main train station and there are two subway stops very close by. The facilities are excellent and the staff very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Request the Corner Room!”
Reviews.Author: lawstudent13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of May after reading great reviews on this website. We found the hotel to be extremely convenient and nice. We took the train from the airport. Depending on what terminal your flight is on...you may need to take a courtesy airport shuttle to the other terminal where you can get on the train. We bought a ten trip card pass (which more than one person can use) for about 8 euros...pretty cheap!! There are other options...I can't remember the name of it...but there's also some shuttle...you pay per person. We thought this would be a better way to get to know the city and, of course, it's MUCH cheaper! After you buy the pass from either the automated machine, which is very easy to use plus there's an employee that stands by to assist you, or the teller, you insert the card into the machine and the gate opens and you just walk to the other side. Make sure you ask for a map! For a map of the metro (which is different), you just get it at one of the metro stations. We bought one card w/ten trips (which can be used for BOTH train and metro) and my fiance would put the card into the machine, I would go through, and he would just insert it again and go through it himself. The train is pretty nice...we're from the Miami and the trains here aren't nearly as nice. They are air-conditioned w/plenty of seats and racks to put your luggage. To get to this hotel, you get off at Placa de Sants (I think it's referred to as Sants for short). There's a screen that tells you the next stop and you will also hear announces about the stops. Once at the Sants station, just go out through the doors and you will see a tall building to the right...that's the hotel! Check-in was quick and easy. We were given a corner room (#818)..which was amazing! We had two different views of the city. We didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel...you really have to make a reservation for that and they were simply booked. The hotel staff was very helpful. I talked to the staff/security often during our staff...asked for restaurant recommendations and information about certain attractions. There's also a small convenient store around the corner from the hotel and an ATM, too. We forgot to pack a converter and we just couldn't find a store that sold them...so we finally asked the hotel staff to point us to a store. Instead, the lady gave us a converter free of charge! We had to sign something just saying we took it and we have to return it when we check-out, but it beats looking for one when we needed one ASAP. About our room, I can't remember what the name of the layout is...but it was basically a queen bed...LOTS of closet/storage space. The bathroom was roomy...double sink...there's a tub and a shower. We ate at two restaurants close to the hotel...one hotel staff recommended Restaurante Zaravtz. We went very late and thought it might be closed, but there were about 3-4 parties there...not bad. It's about a block from the hotel..on the corner of Elisi and Rector Triado. We had steak and duck...the food was amazing and reasonably priced! We also ate at Tapa Tapa...it's right next to the mall at the Espanya metro station. You could walk there...we did! We also loved this place...food was pretty good. You might also want to go inside the mall...even if you're not too crazy about shopping...go all the way to the top and see the view of the city from there! Remember, take the metro/train. It's cheap. We found it to be safe...we didn't have any close calls and we also didn't witness any suspicious activity. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: roy_prn
Reviews.Content: We got in to Barcelona at 10pm after a 4 hour train ride from (partying in) Pamplona and were very happy our hotel was 1 block away from Barcelona Sants Train Station which is also serviced by Metro line 3 (2 stops to Plaza Espanya, 5-6 stops to La Ramblas) and Line 5 (Sagrada Familia, Diagonal). I was in Barcelona in 2002 and can say Las Ramblas has changed, it is overcrowded, dirty, foul smelling and sketchy at night. I'm glad we did not book there. The Hotel itself is high quality. We booked a double room and asked for a 3rd bed and had lot's of room to move. The hotel is clean, safe and large (without being overwhelming or unwelcoming). There is always a taxi outside (we used it once to go out at night to a driver recommended club). Great location, great value, American Standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great for metro/ airport transportation. Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: broadfi2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I knew we wanted to close access for the RENFE trains to continue our vacation to other parts of Spain. I highly recommend this to anyone who wishes to stay close to a major subway/ train station to the rest of Spain/ Europe. The staff was super friendly and we even checked in very early in the morning after our flight got in at 7:45am. The staff was helpful with maps and directions. Very fluent in english and was funny to see the staff switch from language to language dependant on the peopl checking in. BIG HINT- book through their website as if you do then we get WIFI access 24/4. If not then you only get it for 15mins a day. Although WIFI is only in the lobby and the Visions resturant. The room was very clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “If you have the funds, splurge on the suite”
Reviews.Author: MagnumSauna
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at the Torre Catalunya. Took an upgraded room with a nice view. I would reccomend the suite though, as it offers even greater views. Great location if you have to catch an early train as it is right across the Barcelona Sants station. Cleanliness and service 100 percent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: LauderdaleBill
Reviews.Content: This is a nice modern hotel in a good area. The check- in was very quick and efficient. The person checking us in, was well trained, well spoken in English and extremely helpful. Our room was a corner unit on the 15th floor with great views and clean. There are plenty of restaurants nearby....and a mall down the street. Overall a good place to stay...although housekeeping could do a better job....leaving crumbs behind and mold in the shower...but this shouldn't stop you from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: nonafoo
Reviews.Content: Everybody knows that the location of the hotel is very important and this is where Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya scores. 1 minute's walk from trains and metro is a big plus. Also the rooms are spacious with ample space for suitcases and clothes. Staff are friendly and provide the guests with information on the city and recommendations on where to go and what to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mh_iulia
Reviews.Content: Hi, This hotel was our second choice for a stay in Barcelona. Our first pick was a little dissapointing so we decided to change the hotel and chose Torre Catalunya. I liked the room. It has a good size. We stayed in a standard room, I think. These are located on the 2nd floor. The more expensive the room the higher in the tower you climb. :) The room was clean. I liked the bathroom. It had a good size and it was equiped with everything you needed. The bed had a matress a little hard for my taste and also, since our room was on the 2nd floor we heard the outside noise. The hotel is closed to the central station so there is a big traffic in the area. But this is also a good "feature" since you are close to the metro and busses. The hotel staff is very nice. They offered us cocktails on our arrival. I had 2 things that I didn't liked: our room was smaller than other similar rooms for the same price. For ex: our room didn't had a terrace and the bathroom was smaller than another similar room and had only one sink. And the second thing: they don't have "things" to stop the room door from closing with a lot of noise. I can't explain better, sorry. Every morning , we woked up because other guests at this hotel repeately "smash" their doors. All in one it is a very good choice if you decide to stay in Barcelona. :) :(

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: johnl10963
Reviews.Content: easy to get to and from, and central enough , standard of room and service top class , we had returned from an unremarkable Royal Carribean cruise with average food and accomadation,to stay in an Executive room . The cruise did not bear the comparison well, bathroom the size of a 5 a side court and a dinner at the resteraunt visual a really top class end to our vacation, we wo'nt be looking elsewhere in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: DBap30
Reviews.Content: We only stayed her for one night so can't review everything but the staff were very friendly and helpful, both at reception and the bar. We stayed here to be near the train station and you are able to see it from the bar. The rooms are very clean and well worth the 4 star rating with large bathroom, walk in shower, large windows overlooking the city and plenty of extras in the rooms. Will be back for a longer stay next time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money. A Bette business than tourist hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TraversingTrini
Reviews.Content: Great, helpful staff, excellent amenities, good quality food and affordable room service. Very close to Sants estacio metro and train station with othe metro connections. Actually not in the catalunya area though but about 15 mins awa via metro.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsYouAll
Reviews.Content: My room was the size of a small apartment with a bathtub and a separate shower - it was a corner room. Hotel is across the street from the train station and metro so that was very convenient. I would definitely stay there again. Staff was very professional / helpful. Flat screen TV including CNBC for business people. Since the hotel is very large ask for a high floor to get away from cars picking up people at the train station.

Reviews.Title: “A room high above the roofs of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RubenHelsinki
Reviews.Content: The personnel at the front desk spoke a splendid English and was very friendly. We had a plentiful breakfast on the 23rd floor restaurant. Next to the restaurant there is a bar were I suggest you enjoy a drink in the evening. Our suite was on the 19th floor occupying a corner of the floor with panoramic views facing the Sants railway station, La Sagrada Famiglia among others. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom luxurous. A cable net connection was included in the price but it was not very fast. A very enjoyable stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay close to airport train”
Reviews.Author: MapRad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 night at the Hotel Torre Catalunya following our cruise. We chose this hotel primarily because of its close proximity to the Sants railway station for our early morning train back to Barcelona airport. We were so pleased that walking time (with luggage) from the reception of the hotel to the platform for the RENFE train to the airport was less than 5 minutes. The hotel staff were very friendly, spoke excellent English, check in and out was very efficient and quick. Hotel rooms were lovely, spacious and modern - although my husband would make comment that the TV was the older large CRT rather than the newer flatscreens that you find in most modern 4* hotels, however, in my opinion TV technology is not an issue when on holiday. The bathroom is large and decorated with beautiful marble; 2 sinks, bathtub and shower, toilet and bidet. However, there was a bit of grime/rust build up around the shower screen grouting which I feel could have been cleaned up a little better. The only other small negative that I found with our room was that our kingsize bed mattress was a little on the hard side (I like a firm bed but felt that this mattress was on the rock side of firm). Although with that being said, we both slept well and were not bothered by any outside or traffic noise given that the location is in a busy area at the main railway station with high volumes of traffic. However, the best and main aspect of this hotel is its view.....wow!! Our room was on the 14th floor and we had such a wonderful view over the city of Barcelona. As has been mentioned in previous reviews, the hotel is not within walking distance to La Rambla nor is it in the heart of the city, but given it's location and height, the hotel has a prime view overlooking these areas, which is very special. We did not eat in the Visual restaurant on the 23rd floor but we visited it to see the dinner menu (menu was wonderful but not what we were after that evening - wanted something with more of an authentic Spanish feel for our last night), but the view alone from the restaurant was amazing and definitely worth a look. In the hotel's Business Centre we were able to use the internet for 5 minutes to check in for our flights and print out our boarding passes, all for free. Really valuable service which was very worthwhile (saved us over an hour at the airport). There is cable internet access in bedrooms and WIFI in reception areas. We used the WIFI in the reception/lounge area on our phone, but only the first 15 minutes was free which we didn't know, until the connection kicked us off after 15 minutes. Not too much of a problem, but if we had known we wouldn't have wasted valuable minutes web browsing. The Sants metro (underground) stop/station is directly across the street from the hotel where you can travel very easily, quickly and cheaply to any part of Barcelona city - I strongly recommend purchasing the T10 ticket if you plan on using the metro a number of times during your stay. The hotel is a 10 minute walk away from Plaça d'Espanya, which is a lively, bustling area at night, especially weekends, with such a wonderful atmosphere. Here you will find Las Arenas (very large impressive shopping complex, just newly opened, with lots of highstreet and designer shops, cinema, restaurants and a stunning roof top view, built on the site of the old bullring). Plaça d'Espanya also hosts the Venetian Towers which lead to a beautiful walk up to the Font màgica de Montjuïc - this was without doubt our favourite area and memories of Barcelona. The magic water fountain is a must-see at night - although the area can become exceptionally busy, it is lovely to walk a little further on up to the amazing Palau Nacional, which is fabulously lit up and offers a less crowded viewing of Font màgica de Montjuïc, and a truly remarkable (and romantic!) night view over the Barcelona skyline - what a fantastic experience! All this within walking distance of the hotel - you couldn't ask for better! Word of warning for any travel in Barcelona - beware of very clever pick pockets!! On the train from the airport to Barcelona at the very start of our holiday, my purse was pick pocketed from my handbag (which was actually in my hand luggage case which i was sitting on!) by a young couple (in their 30's) very smartly dressed, definitely not the scruffy Artful Dodger characters that I was initially looking out for. Thanks to a previous tip review I had read on TripAdvisor, I was alert and on the look out for pickpockets, so I noticed that the man had a coat hung over his arm, while the woman was being distracting with her over-affection towards him. Thankfully I caught on to what had happened and I shouted to my husband (standing on the opposite side of the carriage) that my purse had been stolen - the guy dropped my purse and moved into another train carriage to find the next poor victim. Keep sharp when travelling on crowded trains!

Reviews.Title: “So so location, great staff and room”
Reviews.Author: KokaneeGold
Reviews.Content: Located right by Sants Station (which the RENFE and AVE arrives/departs), location is convenient if you're using these trains. If not, you might find the location a bit off from the excitement. (But the metro also runs in Sants Station and that'll take you anywhere in no time.) Hotel staffs are friendly and courteous, but I have the impression that the cleaning lady wasn't as dedicated. Book thru hotel's website and you'll have free internet access and a welcome cocktail!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: stinky1982
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, lovely room massive bed and amazing bathroom! Close to the train station and metro stations. A lovely close walk to the dancing fountains. Good central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: gkg28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before heading home to Australia. It was very convenient, right next to Sants station. The room was clean and spacious, although a little run down. We also found the hallway noise to be quite loud and we were woken a few times during the night by people returning to their rooms and the doors slamming. However, out stay was pleasant enough and we paid a little more for a higher floor and had fabulous views over Mont Jiuc to Barceloneta. Overall we'd consider it again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: Windmills4ever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a quick business trip to Barcelona. Had one of the executive rooms which was very spacious with a great bathroom: bath, separate shower wet room, separate loo. Very comfortable bed. Only complaint would be shortage of coat hangers for a longer stay. Restaurant was good for breakfast with amazing panoramic views over the city. Used the spa which was small but good, gym also was fine although could do with more machines. What was really exceptional was the service. The staff really worked hard to help and make the stay comfortable. I accidentally left my passport in my room and they got in touch to let me know very quickly: so helpful. Will definitely stay there again. Not walking distance to the tourist stuff but taxis are cheapish.

Reviews.Title: “For a 4 star rated hotel, it should offer more...”
Reviews.Author: lovebirds9187
Reviews.Content: Well, we booked this hotel based on the reviews we read here on tripadvisor. The location of hotel is perfect. You have Barcelona Sants (main train, metro station) just 2 minutes away from the hotel. Walking down to the plaza Espanya takes only 7-9 minutes. The staffs working at the hotel (both at the reception, bar and restaurant) are friendly. The room we got (in the third floor) was spacious. Two twin beds were joined to give an impression that it was one king-sized bed. So it was really uncomfortable because of the uneven space in between. The room was not soundproof. We could clearly hear the buses and taxis out on the street. They had no bathrobes, toothbrushes in the toiletries. And even though we were two staying in the room, they had only one of each included toiletries (like shampoo, shower gel etc.). The restaurant, Visual, had very few courses to choose from. Such a disappointment. The view from the restaurant is great though. All in all, i would say that this is a overrated hotel. I do not think i got the value for the price i paid.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and More”
Reviews.Author: thoddy18
Reviews.Content: Read lots of reviews due to first ever visit to Barcelona. Took my wife for our 10 year wedding anniversary and didn't want it ruined. Got to Barcelona late, caught the Train straight into the City, 19 mins later standing outside the Sants Barca (main train station) and hotel just on our left, perfect. Made to feel very welcome, first impression of the room on the 11th floor was excellent. Went downstairs and ate in the bar, lovely meal and not too exspensive, and customer service was wonderful. Next day caught the 'hop on hop off' buses from just behind the train station, really handy. Had a wonderful day, City is beautiful, and has everything. People very nice. Hotel had left a bottle of Cava in our room for our anniversary, lovely touch. Was raining really heavy outside that night, so took advantage of room service, which again was excellent, and watched the city go by from our room. Found a lovely resturant just down the road next night thanks to the concierge. Overall, loved the hotel, loved the city and loved our stay. Will definatley be going back, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a romantic weekend with the wife”
Reviews.Author: drenetar
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel, five star service all round. Staff very helpful throughout, large spacious rooms, seperate wet room, toilet and bath. enjoyable stay and would deffo stay there again. The only dissapointment was I joined the expo club but did'nt get any of the benefits promissed

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: nlopedebarrios
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Barcelona, and we chose this hotel because of its great reviews online. We were not dissapointed, in fact, exceeded our expectations by far. In a nutshell: very nice employees, serviceable and kind, great location, probably one of the best in the city, and great hotel overall (rooms, restaurant, spa, etc). The building is in great condition, like new. Check-in was fast. It was almost midnight and our room was ready. Unfortunately they didn't had a crib ready as we requested but solved it right away, within 5 minutes. The room was amazing, with a great view of the city, very big and comfortable. The bathroom was super big, with shower and bathtub separated, all the amenities, just great. King sized bed, 32 inch LCD TV, wall-sized window facing the street. You can't ask for more. Very nice spa and pool, and a restaurant on the 23rd floor, with a panoramic view. Located just in front of Barcelona-Sants station, where train, metro and buses depart and arrive. Nearly a 10 minutes walk to Plaza Catalunya, a landmark of Barcelona. Breakfast was expensive. I recommend taking it outside. Overall, a great 4 star hotel for the money (100 euros per night, without breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a pre/post cruise stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Provencelover84
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel after a cruise and before travelling on to France by train. We chose it because it is very close to the Sants train station (you walk across the placa infront of the station and you are there, less than 3 minutes) and has great connections to public transport (Renfe Train and Metro Line in the train station, hopon-hopoff bus in front of the station). It is a bit outside the crowded touristy areas, but if you want to, you can get there quickly. It is really conveniently located for visiting. The room was huge (I think they upgraded us) and even had a tea maker. The bathroom was sparkling, not a speck of dust to be found in the room (or anywhere else in the hotel). One side of the room was floor to ceiling glass, great views. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant, but the evening views must be terrific. We had breakfast there, and what a super breakfast it was. They had lots of local specailities plus the traditional breakfast items. The spa is kind of smallish, but an experience, especially the showers (try them out, you will either be yelling or laughing). What did I not like: Nothing, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'd love to be back”
Reviews.Author: totallypanjabi
Reviews.Content: Excellent Stay!! Stayed here for one night and loved our room and the service! We even got a complimentary bottle of Cava for our anniversary which was a great touch. I am giving it one star short since we had to wait for our room till 1PM (after getting there at 10:30am) which is nothing against the hotel - check in was at 2PM and they got us in at 1...but since we were really tired after a looong journey from the west coast....would have lkoved getting in at 12...right after our llunch!! If I could....I'd give it 4.5. We also got a great deal - $300 for the suite, internet, dinner for 2 at the panoramic restaurant (with Cava and wine pairings), and breakfast all included Overall - great hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelweb
Reviews.Content: An ultra-modern hotel just steps from a main train station, this hotel was a great find. Rooms were clean and modern and the business center and spa were great! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Fridge in room, daily newspapers, free internet in business center, great restaurant overlooking the city. A wonderful experience. We actually had a problem with our room the first night and the staff could not have been nicer handling the problem

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: yashi2612
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights while on a short visit to Barcelona. Had a gorgeous executive double room on the 14th floor, without getting ripped off. Staff were very friendly and the hotel itself was very tidy, clean and quiet. They had a brilliant top floor restaurant with an astonishing view over the city. Simply magnificent. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs, good location”
Reviews.Author: ChristianK
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I had the strangest experience for quite some time in this hotel. The service was either great or unbelievable bad- Adv: Rooms are OK and with a standard design interior, I did stay in a junior suite on the 18 floor with great views over the city. Breakfast was very good and cheap at €11. Location is next to Sants Train Station with great public transport connection, taxis and rental cars. Next to the hotel you can find as well bicycles to rent and tour the city. Hotels offeres some great deals, often much cheaper than in the rest of BCN. Disadv: Service has some serious downs and I had some very funny experiences during my stay. My room was not always very clean without being too much of an issue. It is not inside the inner City center but close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value to Services Ratio”
Reviews.Author: CStefanou
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a standard room, which was spacious, with excellent & huge bathroom (2 washbasins, 1 bath, 1 shower, toilet separate & bidet) Very helpful reception people Breakfast: excellent, great variety, fresh products. Be careful ( at closing time they pack pretty quick, so you should hurry to full your plate) NOT FREE WIFI AS PROMOTED (only 15 minutes are granted per room). but they have cable for ethernet connection

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel located near central station”
Reviews.Author: DazzAus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for using the city's train network - it's only a few hundred metres awayfrom the central station - Sants. The hotel is good quality in terms of accomodation and service. If you are in Barcelona for only a few dyas and want to be in the centre of the tourist area this is not the right hotel as you need to get metro to the maion tourist area. We enjoyed the hotel and its service. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious. Barcelona is an amazing, modern, historical city. Public transport is as good as anywhere in the owrld I have travelled. The history and culture is interesting and the 1929 buildings from the expo and then olympic games are wonderfully kept. Make sure you go to the bullfight arena.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: gone_tripping
Reviews.Content: The staff was superb, in spite of one glitch. Surprisingly they got us tickets to El Tablao de Carmen flamenco show when there were none available on the website. Only problem was the reception clerk told us it would cost 17.50 Euros each and in the end the club demended 35. The room was fantastic, having been given an upgrade as an Expo Club member. Breakfast was beyond great, worth every penny of the 12 Euros. Even the location was fine, with good transportation available. Room could have been cleaned better. Will definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “it wasn't our first time, and definitely not the last time.....”
Reviews.Author: taldot
Reviews.Content: the service is exellent, staff very freindly and helpful. the room is very big and clean, big comfortable bed and restromms. great veiw!!! breakfast and dinner are good and well served. the location is a little far from the city center, need to take taxi

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona view!”
Reviews.Author: katerina_bralos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 2010 at the 20th floor of this amazing hotel. The room was very big, very clean, had a bathtab and a separate shower, very nice view. The first impression i must admit was not the best one, as the hotel is in a very busy square of a main train station (Sants Estacio), looks a bit old and when i entered the room it looked pretty old fashioned for my standards (i always stay at new or recently renovated hotels). But everything was so well preserved and clean, that i felt very comfortable like home! The breakfast was amazing...you drink your coffee and see all Barcelona from the 23rd floor! The croissants were better than those i had in the hotel i stayed in Paris, there were eggs, potatoes, cheese, chorizos and traditional ham, spanish omeletes, freshly baked bread, fruit, cheesecake, yogurt...excellent! We issued a T-10 card that gives you 10 routes by metro. The metro and train station are next to the hotel! The centre was 4 metro stops away, i found it very convenient. Also, the Montjuic sites (the magic fountain, the National Gallery museum, the spanish village, etc) were 10-15 minutes walk. There was also a nice cinema-mall next to the Miro park where you could do some shopping. From the airport if you want to take the train, you must first take the airport inner-bus that takes you from terminal 1 to terminal 2 (maybe the other way around, can't remember for sure) where the train station is. It is very convenient, because the airport is only 18 minutes from the Sants Estacio where the hotel is! Overall, i enjoyed my stay at this hotel and i would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASWY
Reviews.Content: My wife & I managed to book into the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for a one night stay over. Thankfully, the Executive Room at Torre Catalunya put a nice finishing touch to a 4 week holiday trip. The lady receptionist greeted us warmly (as expected but not always delivered at some hotels) and patiently explained through the facilities available at the hotel. She even enquired whether we would require a late check-out. Hotel is right next to a metro and there is a consistent availability of taxis outside the hotel which makes travelling on public transport easy. The hotel is along part of the open-top city discover route and this makes it convenient to hop onto said bus for a tour of Barcelona. There were numerous eating outlets surrounding the hotel and for those seeking quick easy meals, there is no lack. The Visual restaurant on the top floor of the hotel serves Catalan cuisine with a gorgeous vista overlooking the city. Food - value for money, given the view on a glorious clear spring evening. The room was well presented and the copious amount of space allocated to the bathroom/shower and vanity was a huge welcoming change. As I did not booked the room via the hotel's website (through tripadvisor), no free wi fi service was offered. This was a pity, given that the hotel had come up with the goods except for this one small matter (free wi fi is certainly a draw card and essential element of any hotel's standard facility offerings). Any travellers who avail to the Executive Room would not be disappointed and the appointments within the room and hotel are very commendable and there is a touch of style to the hotel. Comfy feel and would gladly stay in any hotel with similar qualities provided at Torre Catalunya. Great job to the team at Torre Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - But Too Far From The Centre”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: Firstly - I must say this is a lovely hotel. We were dropped off in a taxi and initially I had a few disappointments, from the concrete and road surroundings - and the distance from the main hub of Barcelona which is what I really wanted. We were right next to Sants Metro and a corner away from the bus tour which was brilliant but apart from these location plus' I really craved the madness of the city - for those wanting the same this isn't the hotel for you. However on the positive side - check in was quick, the rooms were lovely - I loved the walk in shower and I loved that when I took a shower the mirror would heat up leaving some of it steam-free (I wonder if this is a Spanish thing as I also had this in Madrid?) its a great feature and the bath was lovely aswell. The breakfast was great! Its served up on the 23rd floor so you get fantastic views over Barcelona while you eat breakfast. Breakfast itself was also lovely and had the full spread: pastries, cereal, hot cooked food, cheeses, meats, fruit etc. - there is no-where nearby to the hotel for breakfast so I would recommend taking the breakfast option here. For culture I recommend that everyone goes to the Sagrada Familia and if you have time to the Casa Batllo - both built by Antoni Gaudi I'd done some very brief research on him before I went out and I really enjoyed visiting these places. I also saw the Parc Guell which was good but I highly recommend the first 2 more. The bus tour is well worth doing and of course the La Ramblas. I hope this review has help you somewhat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Miamirambler
Reviews.Content: We moved here after another accomodation proved disappointing and loved our stay. The staff was excellent from the porter who came running out to the cab to take our bags to the front desk staff who provided tips and maps to help us navigate the city. Although it's far from La Rambla action, the Metro is just across the street as is the train station and we found it very convenient for getting to other attractions around the city. The room and bathroom were very large and updated and we had a lovely view of the mountains from the picture windows. Another plus: the business center is open to 11 a.m. and the first 15 minutes of Internet are free. There was a supermarket and ATM just down the street. We shopped at the market for beakfast and sometimes lunch, stashed the food in the mini-fridge and sat at the small table and chairs in the room and breakfasted as we watched the city come alive. Poble Nou, a neighborhood reminescent of Buenos Aires, is just a short ways from the hotel. Plenty of restaurants where you can get a good lunch of the day for under 10 euos. I got a great seafood paella, salad, dessert, bread and drink for nine euros at a sunny outside table for just nine euros.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroghly enjoyable 4 day stay”
Reviews.Author: RussA123
Reviews.Content: While not centrally located for tourists, it is at the hub of the transportation systems of the ciity. The staff and facilities where exceptional. Everyone from the time we entered the hotel till we left was friendly and helpful. We stayed on an upper floor. The of Barcelona was magnificent, The room was spotless and spacious. The "Eclectic" in-house cafe/bar was usually quite, with a friendly staff. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “convenient location and great view”
Reviews.Author: mangelnsm
Reviews.Content: We loved that it was so close to both the metro (which is cheap and convenient) and the train station (for day trips). Our room was lovely and had aspectacular view of the city. The restaurant on the top floor had a gorgeous 360 degree view, but the food was mediocre and pricey. Also, if you need help with directions or restaurant recommendations, see the front desk and not the "concierge", who seemed clueless. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay , or have eyes in the back of your head”
Reviews.Author: Bananaman16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the above hotel , on checking in I left my bags behind me , only about 2meters . When I went to retrieve my computer case , it was gone . To cut a long story short , it had been stolen . The police were called and seen the person steal it on CCTV , under the nose off the security and bell boy and reception . I went to the police station reported it and asked the hotel for compensation , which after 3 months they refused point blank , as they said the reception area was a public place , and was not covered by their insurance . So to all travellers , if you are staying hear be very aware , that if your luggage is stolen your on your own !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but it's far from the center”
Reviews.Author: il_cecco
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in this hotel! the accomodation is very nice and clean and the breakfast is at the top of the tower and the view is amazing. The position is good if you need to take a train or the subway, but it's quite far from the center (you must take a taxi or subway). very good both for business and holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great staff in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RamblingVinnie
Reviews.Content: We were only in Barcelona one night and this hotel suited us perfectly. The price was super reasonable but the staff made it stand out in my mind. The gentleman that checked us in (Pablo) spoke French and English and was very helpful. He wrote his name on the check in card with the room key in case we had any questions, which I thought was a nice touch. We got a welcoming cocktail from the hotel bar which is also a great touch and really appreciated after being herded on and off an easyjet. The rooms are nice, very modern, and clean with beautiful big marble bathrooms. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. The internet worked okay. The other advantage for this hotel is the location being directly across the Sants Barcelona station. It’s a great location for catching the metro, trains and the Tourist Buses. The last time I was in Barcelona we took the train right from Sants to Paris so it was really handy. It’s about a 10-15 minute walk to Ave. Diagonal and there’s a nice park behind the hotel. We checked out in the morning and the hotel kept our bags for the day while we went sightseeing and again the staff were great when we came back to collect them. You could stay closer to the center of the city for 3 or 4 times the price but I’d rather save my money for the food and wine of Spain. Again the price, staff and location made this hotel a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, friendly, convenient location, great value”
Reviews.Author: BelfastPonn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and from start to finish we loved our stay here. The rooms were lovely, clean and with a nice view overlooking city. There were lovely bonuses like dressing gown and slippers, bath and separate enclosed power-shower. The hotel staff were very friendly and efficient. As I joined the Expo Club (free on-line) before our visit, as recommended by another reviewer we got a choice of drink and snacks for our room on arrival (in our case a small bottle of Cava, generous fruit and/or nut bowl). As it was my sister's birthday they also brought her a delicious cake, which was quite special. These little extras added to our stay. We didn't have the hotel breakfast as it's so close to some cafes nearby (supermarket and train station) and the metro (across the road) which is 3 stops from the end of Las Ramblas. The spa area is gorgeous, lovely pool, sauna and steam room (we didn't get treatments). The view from the restaurant is lovely and the interior modern and smart but my only fault with the hotel is that the restaurant food wasn't great. We had the tester menu at €45 each and really it was overpriced as the quality was average but besides this I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would easily stay there agin if I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Room was overpriced for its size, bed comfort and condition of furniture.”
Reviews.Author: dormparentsfl
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was excellent with prompt responses, either at the desk or by phone, to our questions and needs. The restaurant on the top floor had wonderful views but the food we ordered came out cold and the replacement food wasn't much better. However, the breakfast was excellent. The café on the entry floor was very good with an interesting variety of dishes for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: cruisingaussies
Reviews.Content: Initially we were a little concerned at staying so close to the station, but the area is really quite nice and not at all seedy as it is in so many other cities around the station. As we were catching a train the next day, the location was really good. We were impressed that our room was ready when we arrived at 1030 am and we were given a late check-out until 2pm the next day. The staff were wonderful, extremely helpful and friendly, the best we've experienced in hotels all round the world. The rooms were spacious and like the rest of the hotel, spotlessly clean. The restaurant on the top floor has the most amazing views, prices looked reasonable and we would certainly consider eating there during our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms, has an expensive restaurant with poor quality food”
Reviews.Author: Kookookoochoo
Reviews.Content: We choose it as it is right next to the train station and easy to get to the city centre. The suite has a very large bedroom and sitting room, great city views. However, the room is not properly cleaned and we think it was never vacuumed for the 4 days we we there. Though we have a coffee machine in the suite, we have to get the coffee bags from the cafe/bar as daily top up supply wasn't sufficiently provided despite of our gentle reminding. The worst is the restaurant located on the top floor - Vision, I think. I had pan fried fish on fried rice noodle and shitake mushrooms, the fish was tasteless (I wonder if the pan fried fish a good match with fried noodle), the noodle is very very salty, and no mushrooms can been found. We were told that the mushrooms are "infused" in the dish (invisible), and the soy sauce was the reason that the noodle is salty. Isn't that the quantity of soy sauce controls the balance? A very disappointing dinner, very expensive too! Avoid this restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid four star”
Reviews.Author: millieg2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. The hotel is located across the street from the Santa Estacio (central train station) and the bus stop for the double-decker tour buses, which was extremely convenient. Aside from that, there really is nothing to do or see in the immediate area around the hotel, which was confirmed by the front desk when asked. Overall, the front desk was helpful – providing directions and answers to any question I had. They also make reservations at restaurants for you. The inside of the hotel is pretty updated but the outside looked really rundown. I was given a room on the 4th floor and had asked for something higher but was told I’d have to pay the difference. The room itself was a comfortable size. The bed was firm and surprisingly comfortable. The bathroom was a fairly good size but there was no door on the shower and the fan wasn’t working so it was extremely hot in the room. I asked the front desk to have someone look at it and they said they would but nothing was actually done. Overall, a solid four star.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfortable hotel with good city views from higher floors”
Reviews.Author: lawrence_97
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well fitted, with modern furnishings, and are of a good size. Be sure to ask for a high floor as the views of Barcelona are spectacular. The location right next to the Santa Estacio (central train station) is very handy as all parts of the city can be reached by metro from there. Breakfast was good, but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Well Impressed with this Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendyaDublin
Reviews.Content: As a Travel Agent, I have stayed in many hotels over the years and am therefore hard to please. This hotel was for 1 night post cruise and was such a pleasant surprise. Having arrived in Barcelona at 8am, we thought we would have to leave our bags and sightsee for the day. The staff at check in were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble and they allowed us to check in on arrival and upgraded our room. A really large room by City standards, double bathroom, and coffee making facilities, fab robes and slippers. Great location next to Tarragona metro and only 4 stops from Las Ramblas( approx 10 mins). We enjoyed a lovely bottle of wine on the terrace in the afternoon for the unbelievable price of 16 euro, sitting in a suntrap. Staff in Ecklectic Bar were so pleasant. The piece de resistance was dinner at the Visual restaurant, breathtaking views, great service and sumptuous food and wine. NOT TO BE MISSED... Try the Fois for starters and the mouthwatering beef. Wine was again a mere 19 euro per bottle, and a nice touch was amuse bouche prior to dinner and a sample of deserts at the end. All for 80 euro. Breakfast the next day was just as good, a truly Cataln buffet with all the meats and cheeses, freshly squeezed juices and hot fare also. We could hardly move and it set us up for the day. The view by day was spectacular. Great recommendation from reception staff on the fantastic shopping centre in the old bull ring ( 5 mins walk away) which saved us going into the centre for last minute shopping. No rush to check out either. It takes a lot to impress me and many city centre hotels provide indifferent service. Well done to all the Torre Gran. We will be back and I will certainly send my cllents

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, modern, comfortable, well connected for getting around Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaKitten
Reviews.Content: Really enjoye my stay. Room was spacious and clean. Very comfortable. The staff were lovely. The view from the bar and restaurant on the 23rd floor is wonderful. The hotel is well positioned across the road from the rail and tube network (but main sights are not within easy walking distance of the hotel). The only downside is that Wifi is only available in the bar and restaurant, not the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special.. Typical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahme
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is very close to the train station (about a 100m walk), this, in my mind, is about the only reason anyone would stay at this location. The hotel location is not really convenient for anything else (it is about a 15-minute walk to Camp Nou stadium) Clealiness: Rooms were clean and fairly recent (rooms still don t have flat TV screens, so it probaably has been a few years since the last renovation). Service: Service is avarage. Upon check-in, I was given the keys to aa room that didn't match my reservation - they gave me a king bed when I booked a twin bed on the hotel website.. No real excuse for this kind of mistake.. Anyway, the error was quickly corrected... There is no wi-fi in the rooms (one must connect using the ethernet cable), thiss is pretty shocking... Rooms services stops at 1AM, and from 11PM, there is only a limited menu of mainly cold dishes (not even a club sandwich)... Our order (or toast and ham) took over 40-minutes to arrive... The fitness room is pretty old and the machines are rather worn... I wasn;t really happy with that... Room/Comfiness: The beds are very standard (only one pillow per bed)... Rooom temperature was fine and easy to control... Rooms have a nice panoramic vue of the city (even though the location means you're not looking over much...)

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe modern accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Swarton
Reviews.Content: We splurged on a suite, in a package with dinner, wine, and breakfast, which seemed like a good value. The suite was large, modern, and luxurious, with great views. The restaurant featured a tasting menu with a wide variety of delicious and artfully presented food. Breakfast was an extensive buffet. Very good service and panoramic views of the city from the restaurant. Just across the street from the Sants train station. Although our suite was large and well equipped, there was very little usable closet or other storage space. If we had been staying more than one night, it would have ben hard to unpack.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sanggano
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. It is just across the Sants station in a less busy and quieter part of the city. The hotel staff were nice and agreed to a 2 pm check out on the date of our departure. The concierge was very accommodating and helpful. The hotel charges for internet access but gave us 15 minutes free access each day at the lobby. We could not afford the 20 Euro breakfast though. We went out a bit past midnight for a drink but could only find 2 bars that were open.

Reviews.Title: “superior rooms are marvellous - big, great views and with a kettle”
Reviews.Author: HVJ
Reviews.Content: This is not a cheap hotel but it does provide value for money. It was well worth the extra for a superior room on a higher floor - not only did I get marvellous views (which I was expecting) but I also got a kettle tray with tea, coffee etc which was a marvellous extra in a Spanish hotel. No complaints at all - tried the Visual restaurant on the 23rd floor - the short end of the hotel has wonderful views directly towards the Sagrada Familia and the restaurant was well placed to take advantage of this. The food was also very good - savoury dishes a bot more than dessert. Would definitely stay here again if I was in Barcelona - quiet, close to the station for fast and cheap travel to airport and close to metro. Also on open-top tour bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JESSI3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the Sants station, where you can take the metro or the railway, very convenient! The staff were friendly and the room was spacious and clean. Great choice for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahs_Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights near the end of April 2011 with my partner. The hotel is located right outside the train station which is ideal after a good few hours traveling! We booked our hotel through hotels.com and were slightly worried that the best rooms may be saved for those booking direct with the hotel. So we were very pleasantly surprised to find that we had been given a room on the 18th floor which had incredible 180 views out towards Mount Tibidabo. We had booked an executive room and were more than happy with the size and the amenities provided. All expected toiletries were provided and the hair dryer was brilliant. There was plenty of storage space and the bathroom was lovely, with a separate cubicle for the toilet and another for the shower. The service from the staff was fantastic. We had to call down and ask for milk for the complimentary teas and coffees in the room as we had run out and they were up within 5 minutes to deliver it. We also managed to lock our safe and forgot the code we used. The security guard was up straight away to sort it out for us. The staff never hung around expecting a tip, which was really nice not to feel hassled. During our stay, it was St George's day, which in Barcelona is similar to Valentine’s Day. The streets are covered with stalls selling roses and books. On our return to the room that evening, the staff had scattered rose petals from the door to the bed, where there was a heart shape made with petals and a paper scroll which had the story of St George’s day. It was a lovely touch. The hotel also provided us with a free bottle of champagne during our stay, as we got engaged while there. This was a lovely gesture and not at all expected. We paid just over £110 per night for our room, without breakfast, and found it to be really good value for money. As mentioned above, there is free tea and coffee in the room, which a lot of hotels in Barcelona do not seem to offer, and the safe was also free. The food prices in the Eclectik bar were reasonable and we ate there on our arrival and on departure for ease. The room service menu and prices are the same as that of the Eclectik bar. We did not eat in the Visual restaurant but if the food in the bar is anything to go by, I'm sure it would be fantastic. There is a supermarket under the hotel which we used to buy breakfast, water, bottles of wine etc. for our room. This was obviously a cheaper option to drinking and eating out constantly. We had wine each night in our room at the little table and chairs in the room and just enjoyed the fantastic view. The hotel is located a few stops on the metro away from the main centre, La Rambla, but we did not find this to be a problem. If anything, it worked out to be a benefit. The room was very quiet, apart from a few sirens but they did not prevent us from sleeping. I’ve previously stayed in the centre of Barcelona and the noise was terrible. There are thick curtains provided which ensure the room is dark for sleeping. We slept right through the nights without being woken by anything so have no complaints in the sleep quality department! The metro is available opposite the hotel or from the train station. We bought a T10 card at the airport and just shared it and would buy another from the metro station when it ran out. The metro is fantastic, with trains running around every 3 minutes. The card cost us just under 8 euros each and is a very economical way to travel the city. Overall, we had a fantastic stay at the hotel and definitely plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, Nice Room, Nice staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: huishan_ong
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel for our honeymoon after reading the reviews from tripadvisor. Tripadvisor was great and we were very satisfied! They have very friendly and helpful staff, very good view from the hotel room and a very good location as it is very near to Sants station. Our room was huge and the bathroom as well. They were very nice to gave us a complimentary champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. We really appreciate what they did for us and we would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends. If we were to return to Barcelona, it will be our first choice hotel! (A little con to this was the free wifi is only available at selected places such as restaurant and lobby)

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel. AVOID IN AUGUST”
Reviews.Author: bertstare
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights last summer and although the hotel is very modern and nice it was a nightmare with a music festival being held next door in a park. They claimed that there was a notice on their website but I found nothing. The music is LOUD and goes until late hours especially on the last night (went till 5am) they kept offering me different rooms but literally every room of the building regardless of where in the building was noisy as hell. Stay far away from this area during the concert week unless you plan on staying out until late as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KS95
Reviews.Content: It's right outside the Sants Estacio (main railway station). This station has a train that takes you to the airport. It's also walking distance to Catalan Art museum and MontJuic where they have the olympic stadium. It's not close to the Gaudi places or Las Ramblas but there's a metro stop right outside the hotel so you can take a metro to all of the other places in Barcelona. The hotel is quite nice and fancy. The rooms are average. The TV is old school and the reception is quite poor. I'd like to think that the hotel of this class should have flat screens and satellite reception. They give wi-fi free only for 15 mins and if you wanna use their computer in the business center, its only free for 5 mins. Breakfast is quite expensive so I'd skip it. Rooms are decent size (quite big by euro standards). Bathroom is nice and big. The customer service is excellent. We arrived in our room with a big bottle of complimentary champagne waiting for us since they knew we were coming for our honeymoon which was nice of them. Over all, a pretty good hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Colum_7
Reviews.Content: You get off the train from the airport and the last stop, Sants station (also known as Barcs Sants), and walk out the front door of the station and this towering hotel is right in front of you. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful, advising us on good places to eat locally and in the city centre. It is too far to walk comfortably to the Ramblas but the Metro runs two lines from Sants Station (a ticket for ten journeys costs just 7.50 euros) and there is a short line of taxis outside the hotel. The room, at the standard rate and therefore on one of the first six floors, was comfortable and clean. There is a bright atmosphere throughout the hotel and a nice bar. A buffet breakfast on the very top floor has just about anything you might wish to eat. For 145 euros on average per night (including breakfast and taxes) for the two of us this seemed like good value for Barcelona. Staying in or around the Ramblas can be noisy and expensive. A nearby restaurant, the Martello, is good for food but a little more pricey than you might expect.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SusanRanui
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise to find after arriving at Barcelona Sants train station on the AVE from Madrid that the hotel was a few metres away. This was also useful for the train to the airport and for the subway. The hotel staff were helpful and pleasant and the rooms modern, spacious, clean and quiet. We particularly liked the beautiful bathroom with double basins, bath and separate shower. The breakfasts were possibly the best I've ever had. And they are served at the top of the hotel which has breathtaking views across the entire city. The lounge in the lobby was elegant and served good food. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jubru
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels that <I have ever stopped in. A delight - from the first momemt of checking in with Montse -, of seeing the room - etc. etc- The area was very good and near all amenities, will certainly stop here again. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “If I return to Barcelona, I will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ZevAha
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite on the 20th floor. It gave us a wonderful view of the city. Breakfast was great - eat as much as you like. Location is fine since a short journey on the tube takes you to the city centre. However, whilst travel from the airport by train is cheap (3 euros per person), a fair bit of walking is involved, especially if you fly in to terminal one. Taxi costs 28 euros with luggage. The tour bus two day ticket means literally that, not 48 hours. So buy your ticket in the morning. There are two companies operating the tours, one has more buses and more stops, but covers a much smaller area. The prices are similar for both companies and both have stops near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing place !”
Reviews.Author: lacuadra
Reviews.Content: I chose the Torre Catalonya for it was located close to Barcelona Sants ( main train station). But I was surprise that the neighborhood was beautiful, close to everything and most of the sites were a few subway stations away. Even a supermarket next door. And the subway is half-block away too and the subway will take you to the sites in minutes. The hotel is big but service was excellent. The breakfast had plenty of choices and the price was right. I would not hesitate to stay again, in fact this will be my hotel next time I travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a modern, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ebilinie
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel and while the proximity to the Sants station is a definite plus, it also is a bit louder and busier than other hotels. Some of the locals had a great time in the square at the Sants station the night we stayed which made sleeping difficult. Booking on the web is the way to go with great discounts. Warning - the free wi-fi is only available in the lobby. Also, found the TVs in the room to be old and not in great condition - but that was a minor point. As others have mentioned, you are removed from some of the major tourist attractions , but with Metro stops nearby they are easily accessible. It was also difficult to find good restaurants nearby - those on the main cross street were all identical with their menus and the quality of the food was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Make Travel Easy”
Reviews.Author: jfwhitejr
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. Not only are the views from the rooms stunning, but it is right next to the train station and at the intersection of two subway lines. The staff seemed to be fluent in English, and very helpful. What amazed me the most was the size of the rooms. I have grown to expect very small rooms in Europe. The room and the bath (with a separate shower and tub) was way over what I expected. Over all, it is a great choice for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right by Sants station”
Reviews.Author: pattersonmj
Reviews.Content: This modern 23-storey tower is just across a large open area outside Barcelona Sants station. The reception staff spoke good English and were most helpful. I was allocated an enormous corner room on the 10th floor with amazing views across the city, including a distant view of the towers of the Sagrada Familia. With double glazing on the two exterior walls and good air conditioning, the traffic noise outside was barely noticeable. The bathroom was superb - bath, twin wash basins, separate lavatory and what amounted to a separate wet room with shower. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept well.
