I had dinner at a local restaurant rather than in the hotel but enjoyed an excellent breakfast with a full range of hot and cold dishes in the hotel's 23rd floor "Vision" restaurant with its breathtaking panoramic views of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cfredp
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice room, no noise from adjoining rooms... beside Estacio Sants for train to and from Airport. Metro across the street easy to get anywhere. Beds were super comfortable. Not close to downtown city center, which for me being away from Las Ramblas etc... is a good thing. Not a big fan of prostitutes, pimps, street thieves adn jackals as part of my holiday fare :) They have a great walk in shower in the bathroom, but unfortunately in my room the water drains to slowly so ended up having to use shower in bath.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: zac_kn45
Reviews.Content: We had a short break in Barcelona recently and stayed the Torre Catalunya. Location-wise it is a bit away from the tourist hotspots but that's why we went for it. A train from Barcelona Airport will stop at the Sants station which is a few metres from the hotels, so getting here was pretty easy. There is also a metro by the station, so it is pretty easy getting around. We booked a superior room and were rewarded with great views of the Montjuic and the Palau Nacional. This is a great view during the evenings when they switch on the lights around the Palau Nacional and the Magic Fountain (but then again you would want to be AT the Magic Fountain when they start the fun!) The room had plenty of space and a huge king bed, although I could notice more than a few worn out corners and scratches on the furnitures. The breakfast is pretty pricey at 16 Euros, but there is a fairly good selection of items. We got free wifi since we booked on the hotel's website itself otherwise you will be charged, apparently. The staff were very freindly and helpful. I had a few requests before I went there and they made sure everything was addressed correctly. The only (slight) issue was the size of the pillows. We requested a smaller set but were given the same set again. But, I wouldn't let this overshadow an overall positive experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sharron0129
Reviews.Content: Very convient if traveling via train you can walk across the street to the hotel,Front desk staff extreamly helpful,nice views clean LARGE rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Room, service, views, breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: smell_the_earth
Reviews.Content: The service at the reception and the restaurant is UNREMARKABLE! We stayed at a corner room, so we had 2 large windows with views at the city. The bathroom was spacious and clean. It has phantastic views at the top floor, where the restaurant is located (and where breakfast is served). The only negative point is that it is not in the heart of the city centre, but it is outside the train & metro station (Sant Estacio).

Reviews.Title: “trip advisor does it again!”
Reviews.Author: essbeeLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our first time in barcelona and picked this hotel because of its great reviews. We weren't disappointed! Firstly, the location is great-it is literally across the square from the main train staion, Sants. We landed at the airport, caught the train into sants and were in the hotel within half an hour! The check in staff, in fact all the staff at this hotel are really helpful and friendly. We had a room on the 10th floor which was really nice. One small thing that was a bit of a pain was the toiletries. On the first day we opened up the small bar of soap to use to wash our hands after going to the loo. The next day after returning from our day out the soap had vanished and they hadn't replaced it or any of the other tioletries. we phoned reception and they immediately brought some to our room so they were very quick to respond. To be sure, i would say take your own stuff. There was also a bit of dust and fluff at the bottom of the wardrobe but honestly that was all i could find wrong with the room. We didn't eat breakfast at this hotel as we had read the reviews from others but there are plenty of places within 100 metres where you can get breakfast. We used the cafe in the station. One place i must mention for food and drink in the evening is Casa Martelo. A really stylish bar serving great tapas and food and also a huge selection of bottled beers. It is within 3 minutes walk in Calle Numancia which is a main road off of the square in front of the hotel, in fact we could see it from our room! (room 1006). Another place we ate in was just around the block called Zarautz.. It is a tapas bar and quite authentic. We read a review saying that the staff were very friendly and helpful but when we went there we found the staff very unapproachable, not rude but just a bit standoffish. They serve great tapas most of which priced at €1.50 and they are all along the bar. Each one has a cocktail stick in it so you take a plate, help yourself to what you want and leave the coktail stick on your plate. They calculate what you have eaten by the number of sticks left! All in all a great hotel and i will stay here again on my next trip to barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “First class service all the way ...”
Reviews.Author: lolimoli
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend 12th march here ... Suprise treat for my husbands 50th bday , Very efficient and friendly English speaking staff .......Complimentary bottle of champagne & cake in room on arrival ... Superior room 19th floor with stunning views ...(HUGE BED) well worth the upgrade ..... Excellent location .... 15mins walk to olympic stadium wer we saw Kylie in concert .... its just across the road from main train station & Underground . 10mins from Las Ramblas ..... Cant say enough about this Hotel ,, Would deffo go back there & will be reccomending it to our friends ... :@))))

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with panoramic views”
Reviews.Author: daveDerbyUk
Reviews.Content: went for our silver wedding and was given an upgade to a junior suite .we had ordered champagne and strawberries to be there when we arrived ,and they were beautiful being dipped in chocolate which was a nice surprise.the staff were very nice and the views from our room and the breakfast room on the top floor were brilliant .the hotel could not have been better being near the train station and metro .

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient room, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: jacob050
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from the internet, without friend's recommendation. Three walking minutes from the station that brought me from the airport. Then I was guided by the friendly staff at the reception (not sticky, just efficient). And then I saw the large room, large bed and superb bathroom. After the cleanness of the bedding I didn't ask for anything more. The entrance to the Metro station is seen from the room's window, so close. The breakfast is rich and anybody can choose his favorites. Great view from the window. Definitely my pick up for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: golfinggrannie
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Location is great short walking distance to train station where train from airport comes into. Tourist office in station good for purchasing bus, tour etc tickets. "Hop on hop off" bus stop very close. Staff were extremely helpful, room was spotless and large with great view. Daily breakfast option (fee) was a good deal. Very plentiful buffet with excellent choices. We stayed here for 3 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Dress up if you want good service at the reception...”
Reviews.Author: gonzaloperes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, not bad, not superb. Not in the tourist area, no attractions nearby, but right outside the train station. My complain is that I did noticed some "difference" in the way I was treated in comparison with other clients who were dressed up: While we were waiting to be attended at the reception, there were 3 guys in suits, nothing fancy, regular salesman suits and ties. They were obviously in some sort of business trip. The issues is that while we were waiting, behind this 3 guys, the receptionist took a long good time to explain them all about the city, the transport and the multiple services that the hotel offered. But when they left and me and my girlfriend got in to the desk, then the guy was in a hurry to move the line because another couple had just arrived behind us... All that politeness and service displayed with the previous group faded away. I do not know the inner mechanics behind this behavior, but me and my girlfriend were wearing jeans and regular shirts. Now, of course I do not know the specifics of the issue, but that is what I experienced and that was the one difference I noticed. So, as I said the hotel is ok, but I could not avoid noticing that detail. So I will not return to it. And I advise you not to do it either unless you arrive with your best garments.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, good size room and loving the bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Lillyvalley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend of mine. As 2 females we wanted somewhere relaxing, comfortable and at a good price. Having read on trip advisors and read the good reviews, I decided to book this hotel. I absolutely loved this hotel. It's right by the Sants Barcelona station (where there is also a tourist information centre inside the station), so easy to get to from the airport, and the metro station is only 50 meters to travel a round Barcelona. A bonus point, is that there is a supermarket directly underneath the hotel too. When we arrived at the hotel, we managed to check in straight away and our rooms were lovely. We were on the 5th floor, and the rooms were clean and spacious. Bathroom is one fo the best I've seen. There's a bath with a shower mixer, toilet, bidet, and a seperate walk in shower, plus 2 sinks and mirror! The staffs were always willing to help, we ordered room services for tea and we also asked the receptionist to help us get some info on tours/ attractions and places to eat, which they managed to bring to our rooms. Our beds and rooms were also cleaned daily. We also used the indoor swimming pool and sauna's too for an extra 6 euros. All in all we had a wonderful stay here, and I would definately come back here again! Hopefully with my son and husband very soon. Well done Torre Catalunya! once of the best place I've stayed at....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but very dissapointed with the Visual resrtaurant”
Reviews.Author: Londoncitygirl_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great all round and service was very good. The hotel staff were there to advise you about good restaurants and places to see etc. The spa was great too, the steam room and sauna was great to relax - and the opening hours are til 10pm which gave us enough time too. The location of the hotel was a little further out than i would have preferred. But the metro station was on your doorstep so was easy to get around barcelona. We were dissapointed with the restaurant in the hotel. The view from the top was great and the wine was very nice however the food for a 5 star restaurant was dissapointing. We were advised they would cater for vegetarians but when we asked there was not much choice and furthermore there not much effort in trying to accomodate which was unfortunate for a 5 star restaurant. The food overall wasnt very good, and the mains were served cold. The dessert was amazing and on the house as they had not provided the best service, but on another trip to barcelona i would not go again. Very VERY overpriced for an OK meal... Apart from that - it was a great holiday..!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SkipperStockport
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2-7th January 2011 having found it via trip adviser. Best to take train from airport to Sants station; hotel is 5 minutes walk away. The hotel is modern and over 20 floors high. We had a 15th floor room with a really7 good view. Had to pay a 12 euro surplus for the upgraded higher room. Hotel facilities really good. Did not eat in hotel as it is dear and little cafes and restaurants nearby much better value. Staff very helpful all with good English. We had a fridge which did not work but they replaced it. On balance we thought the hotel well situated, the rooms excellent and the price very reasonable. Room service food rubbish though and overpriced. I'd thoroughly recommend this high quality hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Large Spacious room & Bath!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TotallyMe
Reviews.Content: When we returned from our cruise, we wanted to stay in a different hotel. My son chose this hotel. Very good choice. Good location, close to the tour bus stops & train station. Our room was huge compared to the hotel that we stayed in prior to our cruise departure. Which was the Hotel 1898. I was the one who chosed the first hotel. Our room at the 1898, was much smaller & the price was double what we paid at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya. The staff at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya was great also. We only stayed one night in both hotels, but I liked the 2nd hotel better.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with TripAdvisor.com, Great Value, Good location, American Oriented”
Reviews.Author: irvineman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after reading tripadvisor other reviews, well... you can't go wrong with TripAdvisor, location is just across the street from the train station, great train connections, easy to figure colored maps, Hop-On Hop-Off is across the street, clean rooms with best Lobby/concierge service, they did everything then can to make you happy, I mean it.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean and value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: microsoft186338
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as a venue for our sons wedding in Barcelona. About 50 of us stayed in the hotel between the 8th and 13th December 2010. We had all arrived from London. The staff at the hotel were fantastic. The hotel was clean, rooms adequately fitted and the hotel was very central. The full English breakfast served on the 23rd floor was something you all need to experience. The ambiance was good. I will certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High ratings for value genuinely earned”
Reviews.Author: slavetomonkey
Reviews.Content: We booked through their website last minute (day before) for 71 euros plus taxes, got free internet, welcome drinks of choice and even surprise anniversary champagne bottle in our room. That along with well trained, attentive and friendly service, a monster size standard room, floor to ceiling windows----impossible to beat or find in BCN. Top floor bar/restaurant has authentic menu, fantastic view. Negatives are dull,drab area (tho safe and across the street from main train station as well as 2 metro lines), lack of noise deadening door (can hear people opening and closing their doors, foot traffic--tiled not carpet floors throughout). Clock radio would be useful, otherwise well equipped room. If you want to be right in the tourist ghetto, you'll pay more and get lots less, tho stepping out into atmosphere is alluring. Killer, killer value and quality....this hotel earns its keep.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ialtman
Reviews.Content: simply excelent value.excelent in every way. very nice,good location,metro at the hotel,great restaurant for breakfast on the 23ed floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris012
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. We stayed on the 21th floor. Clean room, friendly stuff. Only 500m from main train/metro station with connection to all Barcelona and Spain. We paid 110 eur per night Free wi-fi for online booking. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: BorkenArrow
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights and it is convenient from a transportation point of view. Right next to the train station with a direct link to the airport, and a short taxi ride as well. It is a modern highrise with large rooms with efficient amenities. But it is far away from the sights and sounds that make Barcelona. That said, being next to the main transportation hub, it is accessible by several metro stations, which makes it just a subway ride away from the city centre and the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: prairie-fox
Reviews.Content: Great location with underground, busses and all right there across the street, yet no sound of it in the hotel. Wonderful outstanding hot/cold breakfast. Staff is out of this world for helping you find places to eat and what to see. They will tell you the easiest way to get there and how to use the system around town. Location is great to make it to all the parts people would want to see. Some are even withen walking distance. They provided a great room, water to drink each day (take along on outtings) and checked on us when we arrived to make sure everything was OK in the room. This is one place I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: travellingLeNaLena
Reviews.Content: Gran torre is near the train and metro stations. Thus it is a convenient hotel to stay at, although this is about 15min from the main shopping area. The top floor has great views of the city and breakfast there is worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Attentive and Friendly Staff."”
Reviews.Author: MAL1635
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location - steps from the train to the airport, or Metro to all of Barcelona, and only a short walk to the museums and Font Magica of Montjuic. The supermarket downstairs in an added bonus. Room was comfortable and comparable to US hotels in terms of size, amentities, etc. Breakfast buffet was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Experience”
Reviews.Author: bmyg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great ! I booked it through the phone a month ago and the reservation was done in a couple of minutes. I was going with my wife on our second anniversary so i informed the hotel, and i have to say that it was a great stay. The hotel location is not near to the Rambla, however, it takes you around 10 mins by the metro to be there. There is a metro/train station just 50 meters from the hotel. I subscribed to the Expo club and it was a good choice. They upgraded my room to a suite on the 21st floor, i just couldn't hold my breath with the view ! you can see the whole city just from the windows which surround the suite. Rooms were very clean, food was excellect, plentyful and with many varieties. The service was really outstanding, on our first day, we went out and about and came back to find a bottle of wine as a gesture from the hotel with a nice card wishing us a happy anniversary! My wife was really impressed. It will definitely be our first choice when we come to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice! Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ginawashere
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this hotel. I chose it because of the reviews on this site. I was nervous because I choose the hotel. We are New Yorkers. From the moment we walked in, the staff was helpful and friendly. The bellman happily helped us with our bags and was very happy to answer all of our questions. The hotel is everything we hoped for. The location is great. The train station is directly across from the hotel. There are many little cafes within blocks, supermarkets, cheap stores for souvineirs and clothes, and atms within footsteps. The cafes serve the best sole you've ever eaten, and if you want a good, cheap, and quick dinner, try Boston Pizza which is like three blocks away. That pizza is better than New York pizza!! We were upgraded to the corner suite with the view of the entire Barcelona. My boyfriend and I are very please with this hotel and I have no complaints!! We stayed for almost a week. Tip, if you take a cab from the airport, make sure you pay with euros. The drivers do not accept cash, and the driver charged us $60. for a 30 Euro ride because he had to change the cash for Euros at the bank. Cash is trash, pay with euros or a credit card everywhere else. Also make sure you have adapters for the electric outlets to use american appliances. If you forget them, the little chinese stores within two block sell them for .90 euros.

Reviews.Title: “You can stop the search right here!”
Reviews.Author: Roachepat
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel without hesitation! Check in was a breeze, the staff both helpful and professional. The room met, and in fact exceeded ,our expectations. It was one of the roomiest European rooms we have ever had, and was beautifully appointed. Great views too as we were on the 16th floor. We opted to have the breakfast and it was well worth it, it included a wide variety of scrumptious food. All of the above put us in a positive frame of mind, but the best was yet to come. After we checked out we realised that we had left a brand new pair of boots behind. We were cruising and so upon our return to Barcelona we contacted the hotel to discover that they had the boots safe and sound. When we went to collect the boots they also allowed us to leave our luggage in their storage room, free of charge and all part of their superior service. You won't regret choosing this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel but removed from the action”
Reviews.Author: 72worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Big rooms for Europe. Not too loud despite being on a major road. Friendly staff. Location is a mixed bag. Right across from the Sants train station (easy to find) but a few miles away from the heart of the action. Means a metro ride to go anywhere. For this reason alone, next time I'll stay closer to the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing good service, big rooms, superb breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: wolfent
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the service and quality of the rooms, especially considering the price. The views from some rooms are wonderful. Location means you need to take a taxi or metro to most tourist locations, but everything else is so good I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but a bit further from the center of town than I had thought”
Reviews.Author: mlevy32
Reviews.Content: I just completed a stay here. I liked the hotel a lot. Great service and very nice, modern rooms... it is most certainly a 4-star hotel. I had never been to Barcelona when I made my reservation and made my booking based on location close to the train station, which I thought would be at the center of town. Turns out, the hotel is about a 7 euro cab ride from the main tourist area (prob a 30 minute walk through relatively unimpressive but safe areas) and within walking distance of the beaches. The good thing about the distance is that it's probably a bit quieter and, given the size (25 stories or so) of the hotel, there is breathtaking views of the whole city from the restaurant on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, convenience, courtesy, space and view for the money,”
Reviews.Author: smarter123
Reviews.Content: Just came back last week after a 3 night stay at this wonderful hotel. Great location close to the station which is perfect for those who want practicality, convenience and comfort. Probably one of the most convenient and fast options to get to the comfort of a hotel after arriving at the airport - simply take the train from the airport, walk out 50 meters across a nice safe open plaza and there it is towering over you. No threat of pickpockets or being conspicuous as a tourist dragging a suitcase when there are hundreds other doing the same around you :-). Having registered for the free eClub hotel reward system, I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to an executive suite with a great view on two sides - a corner room on one of the higher rooms are absolutely fabulous. A bottle of Cava and choice of snacks followed right after. The complimentary wired internet due to this upgrade (no wifi in the room) was very welcome after I had been paying through my nose for the same privilege at other expensive hotels during my trip. The view from the room was so great that one night I slept with the huge window on both sides completely open with a full moon outside. Since this was a small pit stop for two days after a long business trip, I appreciated the opportunity to relax in the hotel, but the convenience of having the train, subway and the tourist bus stops all a short walk away. While I had bought a 10 strip subway card (also used on the train) I ended up utilizing the get-on, get-off tourist bus (29Euros) for 2 days mostly. The tourist bus also ended up being a good choice for the time I wanted to get up to the Olympic stadium which is not served by a subway stop. There was also a cafeteria and a large super-market right beside the hotel. Bought some very good wine and variety of ham and cheese samplers for one of the evenings I didn't wan to venture out. There are of course multiple choices for coffee and food in the train station right next door if you don't feel like spending the big bucks at the top floor restaurant or taking advantage of the coffee and tea material in the room. For those of you savvy enough to travel only with the essential money and identification through the tourist sights of Barcelona, there is a safe in the room to keep the rest of the valuables. Yes, I did come across the dreaded pickpockets and thieves of Barcelona when the girl standing in front of me in one line was deprived of her wallet. I tried to prevent it, but then that is another story... Overall, excellent stay at the hotel. It had that the uniqueness that made the 3 night pit stop during an otherwise hectic business trip worth remembering for me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cristeinjohn
Reviews.Content: very central location, impressive rooms, and good multilinguist staff

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect, it exceed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Anonimo40
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a romantic trip and I am happy to say that everything was just perfect. Big and comfortable room with great views of the city, we had a bottle of cava and a cake that came with a nice card (none of that was ordered!) and the most surprising, we were invited to the Visual restaurant for a romantic dinner. The service was excellent, really kind; the hotel is 5 minutes walking to a metro station and then 10 minutes trip to Las Ramblas. The only thing I did not like is that we stayed only one night!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view from the top of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jitka2010
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay, attentive personal, good and clean room, very good variable breakfast. Amazing view all around the city out of the hotel restaurant. THe hotel is very close to the center. So definitelly an recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, courteous staff, first-class restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: MileBender
Reviews.Content: The room was immaculate and well equipped. The staff spoke English and were very professional. The food and service in the restaurant on the 23rd floor were excellent and the views of the city were unbeatable. There is easy access to the attractions of the City, yet the hotel's location is just far enough away from these venues to provide a quiet retreat. Great value. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & CONVENIENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Denten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Oct. 16th & 17th and returned for one night on the 31st. When arriving in Barcelona we purchase a T10 ticket at the airport and took the train to the Sants Station. This ticket is around 8 euros. The train station is across the street from the hotel. Very convenient for trains,metro, buses & hop off & hop on buses. This tour is well worth it. Barcelona is such a beautiful city. The hotel was very good to excellent. I usually make my reservation at a hotel from the comments from trip advisor reviews. The staff were wonderful and the room was large. We were 3 adults in one room which is difficult to find in Barcelona. You should join the Expo Club before you stay here because as a member you get a free welcome drink plus other amenities. You can find it on their web site plus it's free. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything catered for.”
Reviews.Author: lb203
Reviews.Content: The room were very good, the bathroom was amazing with the largest shower i have ever seen. It had some lovely touchs and thought of most things. The food was very good, good quailty breakfast and if you book a amazing dinner with stunning views of the whole city. the bar down stairs is very good for a casual drink and has friendly staff which give good service. the location could not be better for the train from the airport, and if you are going to use the metro. Even a taxi to the town was cheap and reasonable. It is also nice that there is a small supermarket next door so you can get some snacks or drinks. The park next door is also lovely to sit in and just enjoy your time away. I would definatly recommend it to anyone especially couples a lovely city and amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westport75
Reviews.Content: Everything was 1st Class.The rooms and ensuite were among the finest that I have stayed at .The choice at breakfast ! well it had everything you could think of. The location is a little out of the city centre, but a 7 euro taxi ride soon took care of that.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Helpfultraveller25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located near the terminal train, bus and metro station, making it extremely convenient. The rooms were large and the bathroom was absolutely massive with his and hers vanities. The price was great, but they internet was expensive. I would recommend this hotel for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at Great Location near Barcelona Sant Station”
Reviews.Author: rsawh78298
Reviews.Content: We wanted to live closer to station because of our late arrival from Madrid. This hotel is 5 minute walk from the Barcelona Sant Station. Front staff was excellent and spoke good English. Room were excellent and the breakfast on 23rd floor was good and provided an excellent view of city. Also, the Barcelona Hop-on tour bus starts from the Sant station so it was added convenience for sightseeing. Luggage room at the hotel was handy for us to pick our luggage and catch afternoon train to Sevilla. We will definitely stay here for our return trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: ydlt
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the last week of August 2010. From the beginning, the staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel is located across the street from the Metro and Train Station. This was very helpful in getting around the city. During our stay, the locals were celebrating their Saints Celebration, and the hotel staff was very nice in explaining the celebration and extending our invitation to join them. When we go back to Barcelona, we will definitely stay there again. Another plus, is that we went to watch FC Barcelona play and the stadium was only 3 stops away from the Metro. The staff did a great job in answering all our questions!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Scot1421
Reviews.Content: Staff are helpful and friendly. Rooms are are great although there was a lack of tv channels for us! Had a view of the Nou Camp! Hotel is in a great location near Metro and bus stops. Restaurant was nice, but lacked a choice of dishes in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for trip with the lads”
Reviews.Author: Roscoe11
Reviews.Content: Travelled with 3 golf buddies so generally look for cost effective 4 star as we spend very little time in the room. Hotel is in good location we had no major complaints. Minor problem with Parking charge as we tried to leave but it wasn't a disaster and didn't spoil the stay. Just make sure you pay for parking at Reception and not in the Car Park itself.

Reviews.Title: “Proved to be ideal”
Reviews.Author: Guest58
Reviews.Content: This was the start of a city breaks odyssey to see if these breaks suited me as i'm recently single. I've an interest in photography so it seemed a good choice from that point of view. The hotel suited my needs perfectly. The metro in Barcelona is superb and cheap too with a T-10 ticket providing 10 trips(metro or bus) for less than 10 Euros. The hotel is next to Sants estacio station which is ideal for the airport and the city. Couldn't be better, honestly. There isn't the noise that the hotels based right in the middle of the city experience. You can be on Las Ramblas from your door of your room within 15 minutes via the metro, i'd say. The city boils over with things to do. You can't go wrong. Just buy yourself a Lonely Planets travel guide and you can't go wrong. My room on the tenth floor was modern, spacious and stylish with a king size bed. Various treats were provided to an Expo member(see their site) which gave a 'wanted' feeling. The restaurant on the 23rd floor has wonderful views and i found that the food was excellent and good value considering its quality. Breakfast in the same restaurant was also well presented, hot and provided a great energy provider for my days' exploits. The staff were friendly and helpful especially Valentina in reception, Catherine, Gerald Cuthbert and Subrina in the restaurant and Pedra and Rita in the Lounge bar. I felt relaxed here as well as cared for. What more could you want. Four nights wasn't enough and i shall be returning for sure. And to this hotel for sure. Thank you Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you like big business style hotels with zero charm”
Reviews.Author: Seanito
Reviews.Content: The only reason we selected this hotel is because it was a little closer to the airport than our hotel in the L'Eixample district. But in hindsight we would have much rather stayed at Hotel Constanza again. This hotel was just your typical Hyatt style hotel--over priced, nothing distinct or charming about it. The front desk staff was helpful upon checking in--they advised us to take the nearby metro line into the city. They convinced us to upgrade to a slightly better room, but it was difficult to see what we were getting for the extra $30 other than moving up a few floors maybe. The platform bed was comfortable but they had cheap pillows that reminded me of hospital pillows or the ones you throw away on the plane. The room was a little dirty upon checking in. The one bright spot was the room service--good food from the rooftop restaurant. We were very much looking forward to using the pool but they closed over an hour early (on a Saturday night??). Finally the front desk staff the next morning was not as chipper. They were angy at me for trying to take a cart to my room to remove my own bags. However they made no attempts upon checking in to help us with our bags to the room. Tisk, tisk...once again, go for the boutique hotels in the Gothic or L'Eixample areas. You will have a much nicer stay and won't be in a mall like setting.

Reviews.Title: “It's a very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: anon345
Reviews.Content: I know it says that it's a 4 star hotel, including on the building, but I would call it only a 3 star hotel at best. The hotel and rooms aren't in top shape. There was a lot of rust around the metal in the glass partition of the shower and the garbage canister in the bathroom. The shower head had a lot of calcium build up. The rooms are not immaculately clean. The beds were pretty uncomfortable and harshly bleached. There were times we woke up with rashes from the strength of the bleach they used on the sheets. The staff, on the most part, were nice and helpful. They all spoke English. We did encounter two desk clerks who were rude. After paying so much for such a mediocre hotel, I just can't believe that I had to pay another 10EU a 24/hr period for internet which wasn't even wireless. Even though they say they have wireless in the lobby, I was never able to connect. I really liked the location of the hotel. It's not in a touristy area of the city and it is steps from the long distance train and metro. I also liked how there was a supermarket right underneath the hotel. The prices were very reasonable and we got drinks, fruits and snacks from there. Do not go for the hotel's overpriced breakfast. There are a lot of cafes in this neighborhood where you can get coffee and food for a lot less, let alone the supermarket. Barcelona's a beautiful, amazing and wonderful city. We had a great time there. I'm sure there are better hotels too that possibly give free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mairtin_G
Reviews.Content: The first plus about this hotel is its location. When we arrived at the airport we purchased T10 travel passes. These passes cost €7.90 each and allow you to take 10 trips on the Train/Metro. We caught the train to the central station, as you exit the train station the hotel is no more than a 150 metres away. We had a quick and professional check in. We asked for a room on one of the higher floors, and got one on the 15th. Room was clean and tidy and had air conditioning at no extra cost. Our room was next door to the housekeeping room which was a little noisy in the mornings but not enough to complain or ask to be moved to another room. The hotel restaurant, which is located on the 23rd floor, is well worth a visit. To start, there is a very relaxed atmosphere and a great view on this level. The food was great and the staff were very attentive. Overall a great experience. There are two metro lines running from the central station which makes getting around the city

Reviews.Title: “Superior rooms are worth the extra - high floor recommended for wonderful city views!”
Reviews.Author: snrevis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya. The hotel does look a little dated from the exterior but the views from the high floors is amazing and it is ideally placed for the Barca Sants train station and the metro system which is clean, quick and efficient. We paid extra for a superior room at the hotel and requested a high-floor, corner room which provided wonderful dual aspect views over the city from our 21st floor (room 2119). We found the room to be clean, spacious, with a lovely bathroom and walk-in shower/wet room and bath. There is a supermarket adjacent to the hotel which we used to buy sensibly priced wine which we chilled in the mini-bar and enjoyed late evening whilst admiriing the superb views. There is an open-top tourist bus stop close to the hotel which was useful to get a feel for the sights of the city. Can' t really complain about the hotel other than the bar prices, but the staff were very helpful, spoke excellent english and were efficient. Yes, the location is a little off-centre, but with the metro station within easy reach you're really only ten minutes away from La Ramblas and the Gothic areas. We would definately stay here again, but would again go for the superior room option and request a high-floor, corner room. TIP - strongly suggest when arriving at the airport that you purchase a T10 train ticket, which we provides10 trips on the trains and metro for about 8 euros - we used this to get too and from the airport, and SItges, and all around the metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Decent upper mid price hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: EAC73
Reviews.Content: The Torre Catalunya is located in one of Barcelona's less appealing rather bare concrete 'hard squares' near the Saints Estacio mainline station. The hotel itself is rather nice. Staff are friendly and speak good English and the hotel restaurant / and breakfast area are located on the 23rd floor offering stunning views of the city night or day. The rooms are large with superior rooms larger still and offering a separate shower wet room and bathroom audio from the tv. The beds are huge and comfortable. Breakfast was very good with a large choice of foods. The Visual restaurant in the evening was rather over priced for the standard of food on offer.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: trogging
Reviews.Content: Service excellent and fantastic views from the restaurant on the top floor. Its the little things that make a difference - it was my birthday during the stay and they even greeted me with a "happy birthday" on coming into breakfast; I also discovered a special tray laid out in my room in the evening with a birthday greeting card, and a real dark chocolate mouse with birthday candle set out ready with a little box of matches etc - a lovely touch!

Reviews.Title: “Really pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: firstimert0rquay
Reviews.Content: Staff were fantastic, hotel very clean, views from the restaurant superb. Right next to Sants train station so v convenient and bus stop for bus turistic right behind the station. Easy walking to Mont Juic. All in all I would definitely choose this hotel again. Book it and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and stunning views of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cigale
Reviews.Content: Great service, stunning views, ask for the side overlooking the station as the other looks down onto the roof of a hotel. Beautiful stone bathrooms and walk-in Italian showers, with radio reception. Very good double glazing means very little disturbance at night and blackout blinds for a change! A must is a trip to the top floor restaurant for a quiet afternoon coffee en amoureux, or a dinner overlooking the city and its lights at night. The hotel is equipped with lovely pool but if you have children this is banned, however, you can get free entry into the neighbouring hotel and its rooftop pool lido style, wonderful. Hotel is next to the station so metro trips are the cheapest way to get to the port and the Gaudi parc and other central squares. Supervised car parking a little pricy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location with metro and rail terminal next door!”
Reviews.Author: Chasyj
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed and a bottle of Cava was in our room as a gesture for my wife's birthday. Room was very clean, comfortable and (on the 15th floor) had a great view. we didn't use the restaurant for breakfast but booked an evening meal for my wife's birthday. Starters and sweets to die for.....but the main courses were disappointing. I had to send my duck back (very sinuey) and had the chicken instead. Staff were very helpful though. Note: if you book through Expedia you won't get free WiFi. And....be extremely careful with your belongings - I had my wallet removed from a buttoned pocket very cleverly on the metro!! 2 hours in the Police station!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: charlesodonnell
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through trip advisor traveler comments. This has to be the most convenient location in town. Across the street from the train Station, the subway and the jump-on jumpff tour bus. Ten minutes by taxi to anywhere in the city. One of the tallest buildings in Barcelona ( 14 stories ), its roof top restaraunt provided unparalleled views of the city, great food, and service. The hotels was very modern, clean, quiet and adjacent to a beautiful park. Forget the hotels near the Port or Las Ramblas, they are overpriced and many pickpockets. Don't miss the huge modern mall about 3/4 mile up the avenue or the shopping down the avenue towards Las Ramblas. If you are thinking of a lengthy stay, this would be the place to stay. Great concierge and the rooms were simple but modern. If I ever go back, this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you want clean, quiet, modern”
Reviews.Author: 35805Susan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the suite. Huge 2 rooms, 2 bathrooms. Across from Barcelona's major train station and a 10-15 minute walk to Plaza Espana and the Magic Fountain which is great at night. Very clean, comfortable huge rooms with double sink, bathtub and gigantic shower. The staff were so helpful, giving us directions, watching our bags until our room was ready, calling a cab. GREAT!! Easy to jump on the metro to La Sagrada Familia and everywhere else in Barcelona and other towns in Spain and the Hop on the on and off bus. We looked at hotels at La Rambla and am so glad we opted not to stay there. It was so crowded and dirty...we walked through one night and got out. Taxis were about 12-15 euros to La Rambla. Barcelona is beautiful. Just be on guard for pick pockets. Only wish we had a week there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, surprisingly quiet and great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BridinBear
Reviews.Content: My friend Niamh and I stayed here in March (I selected on basis of TripAdvisor positive reviews) and got a great deal on the room price. The hotel seems to be designed for business travellers, although we were there for leisure. The breakfast was on the top floor restaurant which commanded stunning views of the whole city. There were gym facilities which looked lovely although we did not avail of them. Room was really well decorated and bathroom was huge - perfectly for two girls sharing as there were two sinks, came in really handy when doing up the face in the morning. Breakfast had a great selection of everything. Right beside train station so very easy to get to from airport - and then, really easy to get into central Barcelona. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: linz10
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from hotel torre catalunya having stayed four nights with my girl friends for my hen weekend. We all had a great time staying at this hotel and we were suprised how nice it was when we arrived for the money we payed. The hotel is very clean and the staff very helpfull,good sized rooms and lovely bathrooms with a huge walk-in shower. The Visual restaurant has spectaclar views of the city and the food and service is excellent. We used the hotel spa on the Sunday morning and was disapointed with the charge of 6 euros to use it, the pool is very small so don't expect to be able to do lengths. The only unpeasant thing about this hotel is the smell outside the entrance of rotten drains but obviously there is not much time spent in this area, just hold your breth when entering and exiting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent- would stay again in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: becks028
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived at the hotel we felt like VIP guests. We where checked in speedily and given a complementary upgrade. The hotel had also prepared a welcome pack with information that we may find useful during our stay. Our suite was stunning, it was on the 22nd floor and the view was breathtaking. The lift was very quick. The rooms where spotless and well appointed. The spa was an excellent amenity and also spotless. The use of the sister hotel's roof-top pool (Literally on the same block) was a godsend as the weather was very hot. Throughout our stay the reception staff where so helpful and answered all of our queries and where very friendly, as where all the staff in the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel. The only grumble I have is that the cost of the Spa was not included in the room price. It's only 6 euro's per person per day but we felt it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JGF75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here following a cruise out of Barcelona, less than 20 Euro taxi fare from the port. The hotel is located right beside the Sants station (subway and train, so easy access to Ramblas, airport etc)...basically a few minutes away from all the action but far enough away that you can get some peace and quiet too. Another nice feature was the grocery store located right under the hotel. The rooms were more spacious that most others that I have stayed at in Europe, spacious bathrooms with dual sinks, bidet, shower and tub. Among the room features were a tv, cd player, blackout curtains, in-room safe, bathrobes and slippers. The best part about the hotel however were the concierges. Khalid was especially nice, pointing out all the local points of interest, recommending beaches, restaurants and even provided directions and tips for getting around the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ECPERIENCE TO SAY THE LEAST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smilyandhappyalways
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived, the hotel hostess was super nice into explaining everything... the room that i had was on the 10th floor with an amazing view over the city over looking at the Barcelona Sants, which is the train station to Figueres if you are interested in seeing Salvador Dali's museum 22 euros roundtrip and the entrance to the museum is 11 euros (1.5hrs away from Barcelona), and also to the airport (20minutes away) which by the way only cost 3 euros to terminal T1 and T2... then take a shuttle to wherever your destination is... quick and easy... The hotel is very well located,pretty much walking distance to everything... I love walking so it was not a problem for me... also they have a restaurant on the top 24th floor with also an amazing view both in the AM and in the PM... The Spa is located at the basement and cost 6 euros... manicure and pedicure and different massages would be extra... The gym is free... The internet is free for 30 minutes/person. Again the staff is amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! on the other side of the hotel is a Restaurant named Roma that has the most amazing pizza, try the barbecue pizza... I fell safe at all times, and never had to worry about anything... For the soccer lovers, the Camp Nou is actually just 20 minutes walking from the hotel... but I had booked a touring bus, which literally took less than 5minutes... and again comes right across the street from the hotel... I cannot wait to go back.... I did not even want to leave... Two thumbs up for this hotel.. highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....beware pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: richardWooreCheshire
Reviews.Content: easy to locate and 3 euro ticket from airport to Sants Station and as you eixt, you cant miss it.Took advantage of reduction in breakfast charges and 12 euros for continental was very good value.Staff very friendly and helpful.Tour bus picks up at rear of Sants and metro provides good link to main areas...........however beware.At Licea station (las Ramblas district) I went to get on the metro behind my partner.A male got in front of me and barred my way.I tried to get passed him then when he wouldnt move,realised something was amiss and that my wallet had gone from my rear pocket.i challenged four spanish youths and demanded it back.It was returned but as i got back on the metro and opened it, I had lost about 60 euros.Thankfully they had left my credit cards.I observed several other victims during our three night stay and most were in the Las Ramblas area,Soured the trip somewhat but would recommend Gaudi cathedral and his former residence,the views from Montjuic,good restaurants running alongside the harbour and Barelona Cathedral.Did the one day hop on and off bus which at 22 euros was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views of the city”
Reviews.Author: TravelDarling
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides incredible views of the city from its restaurant and rooms (those on the top floors) by day and by night also. Spacious, very clean room, very helpful and friendly staff. Metro station (L1 line - with stops in the most popular spots in the city) and train station about a 3-minute walk away The only downside is the breakfast, which is just a tad too expensive for what it offers

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Catheine810
Reviews.Content: You would love to come back to your room after a long day of sightseeing in Barcelona. The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished, bathrooms are very nice. The view from the hotel is great. And best of all very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackholedweller
Reviews.Content: i had 4 wonderful days in this hotel. this is the perfect hotel for anyone who wants to enjoy barcelona and at the same time be comfortable with the stay. i advise everyone to join the ExpoClub, it entitles you many privileges of the hotel such as free breakfast on room(if your board is on BnB basis, room service is free), late check out, express check out, discounts.. and they'll give you the best room location which on my case they didn't just gave me the best... but a FREE UPGRADE! I booked a standard room and upon knowing that i am an expo member, they gave me an executive room with a stunning view of the Montjuic Palace and the magic fountain.. the hotel's location is peaceful and very strategic, less than 10mins. to the ramblas, walking distance to the montjuic, and 20mins. to the airport via regional trains, there is a supermarket near the hotel and there is everything you'll need such as restaurants, bars and everything on the SANTS station on the front of the hotel. breakfast is not bad but i guess you should try searching bed and breakfast deals coz' i don't think paying 18E is not worth it.. but on the other hand i'll pay even 100E for the view on their visual restaurant!!!! you should absolutely see it! it's like having the whole barcelona on your feet. THe hotel has a SPa too, though it's worth only 6E, i didn't like it. Cable internet connection is available on rooms but book on their website so you could have it free otherwise you'll have to pay somewhat like 10E a day. All the personnel, from the receptionists, room service, housekeepers to waiters and waitress are extremely helpful, polite and always ready to help and to serve.. the room is kept clean during my stay and they clearly indicate to leave the towels on the bathtub if you want them changed and ask the housekeeper if you want new linens otherwise they'll do it every other day, even so, they pass twice a day to clean the room and other personnel pass twice, first to leave you chocolates during mid day and candies in the afternoon, i felt like being pampered during my stay. lastly on my last night, being an expo member, i was surprised to see a chocolate cake with strawberry and orange syrup and a bottle of beer on my room when i arrived after a whole day out. nothing could be better than like what i have just experience staying with them. ABSOLUTELY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sugden
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Barcelona. My partner had stayed in this hotel before. From the minute i stepped out of the taxi i was impressed. The check in was swift and none of the usual " your room is not ready until 2 etc" Our room was on the 15th floor. The view from all the windows [ corner room] was simply stunning. Even the toilet had a view! The biggest walk in shower i have ever seen. There was everything you needed in the room. I was very happy and comfortable. The one problem was the noise from a festival. This went on until the small hours but to be fair the hotel did warn us. Location was great. The metro was 2 mintutes walk and the tourist bus was the same. i would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, super service and easy access to the metro.”
Reviews.Author: aliakapoor
Reviews.Content: We initially thought of staying in and around ramblas but thank god we chose gran torre instead. its very close to the Sans train station and hence you can take the train from the airport to the hotel and into the ramblas area without taking any cabs... saving money. sans is a big station so to get to the gothic area & ramblas just get down at the liceu station. the hotel was amazing - for 10 euro extra per night we moved from a standard room to an executive room on level 16 which has the most amazing view, massive bedroom, massive bed, massive bathroom and shower with 2 sinks and lots of space... tea and coffee and a massive flat screen tv too... excellent buffet breakfast and very friendly staff - natalia/natalie at reception was very helpful and the restaurant staff even kept our big tub of ice cream in the freezer for us (as there isn't one in the room obviously). go to the gothic area and visit ramblas but try and eat in the tapas bars in the gothic area instead. go to the beach in barceloneta, its clean and really nice for a city beach, if you like night clubs - def go to CDLC just off the beach... trendy and good dance music (more house-pop-hip hop), make sure you dress well as no one there was dressed badly! ladies, you might want to wear a nice dress with heels! you can walk to la font magica at night from the hotel which is really a nice site (we could even see the fountains from our room). will def stay at gran torre again! oh and barcelona is great for shopping. decent gym in the hotel and internet access. the spa looked nice but didnt have time to use it....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, friendly staff, situated close to amenities”
Reviews.Author: Les86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 100 metres from Santes railway station and the metro. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the views from the 23rd floor restaurant superb. Our room was clean and had everything we required for a short stay. We chose to explore the city via the metro system ( a two day pass costs approx 11 Euro for unlimited bus and metro travel) which was a lot easier to use than we imagined. After checking out, the hotel held our bags securely for us until we returned at tea time and provided clean towels to have a shower in the spa at no extra cost. Overall the hotel was excellent value and a great base to explore the city, we would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Lazen
Reviews.Content: Visted this hotel years ago and returned in August 2010. Not to be missed the service and rooms are excellent. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location (from airport/train), amaizing view”
Reviews.Author: ritchy75
Reviews.Content: the hotel is just located in front of the train station (no problems with luggages) and is well connected to the airport or the city. The diner and/or the breakfast is possible at the top floor: the view is amaizing !

Reviews.Title: “everything i wanted and so much more”
Reviews.Author: ksahni
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was exemplary. There were 6 of us that stayed in 3 rooms. When we arrived we asked for rooms on high floors and next to each other. The staff were more than helpful with our request and put us on the 19th floor. The views from these rooms were nothing short of spectacular. You could see all around the city. The rooms were big and very clean. The bathrooms were spacious and also very clean.The hotel was located near the sants estacio which was handy to get around. the city. The staff went out of their way to explain anything we needed to know to get around. The 2 restaurants in the hotel were pricey but you could not at any time fault the service or the food. With the sants station across the road all the places we wanted to go to were within 15 mins ofthe hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone going to barcelona for a short break. My family and i would like to thank the staff at the hotel for making our stay unforgettable. I hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: roxdahl
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly especially this one man who worked evenings. He answered questions and gave great suggestons. The staff spoke English which was very helpful. The room was clean and had a modern feel. The bathroom was nice and the shower had great water pressure. The hotel is next to the Sants Train station which made it easy to get to transportation to sightsee and to the airport. I would recommend this hotel if you do mind public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views, Good location”
Reviews.Author: AndyL79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located almost adjacent to Sants train station (Estacio de Sants), which provides a regular and economic (€3) train service to Barcelona Airport - so much nicer than trawling your luggage through the streets after a long flight. Breakfast is a very comprehensive buffet, covering almost any taste, with the added bonus of being served on the 23rd floor, with windows at all sides, so each morning you can choose a different seat and take a different view of the beatiful city below. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff polite and accomodating. The location is very good. Within walking range from a variety of sites. In one direction, you can walk to MontJuif and see the magical fountain (a must for any visit). In a second direction, you can walk to the main Ramblas Street. And in a third direction you can walk to the Port. Or for those less wanting to walk, the Barcelona Bus Turistic stops at Estacio de Sants and has a very regular hop-on hop-off service that seems to produce a bus every 5 minutes. On the downside, the hotel is typical of large chains, with a number of extra charges. The WiFi is free, but only for the first 15 minutes, then you get charged. The Fitness Centre is free, but there is a daily charge per person for the Spa. Drinks are typically €8 - rather steep compared to the typicall €2-€3 price in local bars and restaurants. The menu of the restaurant, which boasts a 3 course meal for €35 is also a little steep, with local restaurants presenting much better choices at much lower costs. So as long as you are happy to explore and find your own eateries, and don't mind a little walking, this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Very clean. Great facilities. Underground car park a god send. Beside Sants for metro.”
Reviews.Author: DublinWelcomesAll
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Very clean. Great facilities. Underground car park a god send. Beside Sants for metro. Views out onto square (front of hotel) gives a very airy feel to your surroundings. Fab views from restaurant. Pity they don't have a roof top pool - guess you cannot have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best located hotel if you are going to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Brit-Andorra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to Barcelona's main railway station of Sants, and as such you can arrive by train or rental car, and have an evening out in Barcelona before taking the direct train to the airport next day, 3 Euros for a 20 minute ride to Terminal 2 and the buses are waiting for you to go to the new Terminal 1 (compare that with £16.50 each way on the Heathrow Express). Being the main station, it is better equipped than any metro station for people overloaded with luggage - escalators and lifts everywhere, no carrying heavy suitcases upstairs and no long walks through tunnels. The area around is quiet with a few decent restaurants and seems safe enough. And it is right on the main routes for the Metro, the tourist bus and the regular buses. The hotel itself is of a high standard, with helpful, English-speaking staff, and the upper rooms have amazing views across the city to the Sagrada Familia and other landmarks all the way around to the coast. I thought I had tried every option for Barcelona airport. The airport hotels are too far from the city and not actually that close to the airport, most of them are located in an industrial estate. The city hotels are too awkward for the airport, so you either have to haul luggage around or take an expensive taxi ride. This hotel seems like the ideal compromise, and I will definitely use it again for a one-night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Ole!!”
Reviews.Author: NickManchester
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel direct only the day before we arrived due the unwelcome cancellation of our previous arrangement with another hotel by the initial booking agent (1800 hotels) the day before we were due to fly.... Notwithstanding the mad panic that preceded the trip, the hotel - picked by reference to Trip Advisor - was tremendous. After negotiation with the helpful front desk people, we had a room on the 16th floor (high is good for the views and peace and quiet) which was a generous size with a well equipped bathroom. The restaurant on the top floor has spectacular 360 degree views over Barcelona. The excellent breakfast provided everything from a full fry up to a fruit salad on a serve yourself basis but beware of the coffee (which seems to be a problem in many Spanish hotels???). Dinner was a more formal affair - smart casual -and seriously expensive. However the food was good, service exemplary and the views to the Sagrada Familia breathtaking. Outside the hotel and within easy reach were several bars and restaurants and for self caterers there is a supermarket under the hotel (just don't expect speedy service or a smile there...). Transport was a doddle because the hotel is on the same square as Sants station which is a node for the underground and main rail lines so buy a rover ticket and you can go anywhere safely and easily. The rail systems are clean and safe. In a nutshell you'd be mad to go anywhere else! Nick

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience in our honeymoon Spain trip”
Reviews.Author: Pidner
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the trip advisor's reviews. The location is good but the service is horrible. First of all our room didn't have a hair drier and they took almost 1 hour to bring me one to the room when we were late for our dinner reservation. In our second day, brown water come out of the tap and the maintenance person couldn't explain the reason for that. In our third day we came late from a dinner to the hotel and we literally couldn't get into the room because the door lock suddenly stopped working and the door wouldn't open. They moved us to another room so that on the next day a person could break the door and let us in... The soap on the sink makes your skin completely dry, the shampoo is very bad and the towels are rough. The only good thing was the breakfast and the free night stay for the broken lock. Very frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: addictedtotravel80
Reviews.Content: great hotel, staff, and location 3 minute walk to train and metro station. breakfast is excellent. However one waiter his name is Juan he was very rude and unpolite to the kids and to us. One advise they need a separate desk for tourist to ask for location and site seeing as you have to stand with others waiting to check in which sometime can take up to 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - with a surprise birthday cake - recomended!!!”
Reviews.Author: IPAGE1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff - nothing was too much trouble. We upgraded to an exec room on 18th Floor for 12 euros a night for the room - well worth it for the view! And a great location for hopping on the metro to zoom around the city whilst being out of the main hustle and bustle. Room was big and bright wth huge windows to take in the view - and slept so well it was hard to get up!! The restaurant on the top floor is such a romantic place to share a meal after dark - with views for miles across the city and the huge expanse of starry sky - lovely. The hotel noticed it was my birthday and we came back to the room after a fab day out to find a lovely birthday cake and a card wishing me a happy birthday - what a fantatic touch and such a lovely end to a magical day. Definitely stay here again. RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back”
Reviews.Author: saptaker
Reviews.Content: We were at the Torre Catalunya for 2 days this past July prior to a cruise. We booked based on some of the reviews we had read on this and other internet sites and we were not disappointed. The hotel is outside of the old city, but transportation is easily accessible. It's across the street from both the main train station (Barcelona Sants) and a metro stop (Estacio Sants). The metro is clean, well lit, and will take you anywhere! We took a train directly from the airport to the hotel. The room was enormous by European standards with tile floors and large windows (lots of light). I should have so nice a bathroom--a stall shower and a bathtub big enough for 2 (if you're so inclined). If you stay, be sure to make a trip to the restaurant on the top floor. It is all windows with amazing views of city. Dinner is pricey, but you can always do breakfast or go up for dessert. There is a fitness room, spa, and small pool in the basement. The fitness room is free, but there is a small charge for the pool. We were too busy, but it was nice to know it was there. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful with directions, recommendations for dining, and even offered to make reservations for us. We got a great rate from entertainment.com that made it a terrific value. When we come back to Barcelona (and we will--it's an amazing city), we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What A Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Celine35
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel-super location in that it is so convenient to the Sants Railway station. Service was excellent. As it was our wedding anniversary, we upgraded to a suite and it was stunning. Reception even sent up a bottle of champagne to mark the occasion. Couldn't recemmond this hotel highly enough-ONly minus would be the pool and the lack of a rooftop area-looked jealously at the expo hotel next door with the pool and seating area

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: lsheeh1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel we stayed in across Europe. The room was very well air conditioned and was huge! The bathroom was very big with 2 sinks, a shower, bidet, and a very big bathtub. The hotel had a great view of the city and was right next to the train station, Barcelona Sants, and the metro. Just walk across the street to the metro and you can get anywhere in the city. The staff was very friendly and helped you find anything. There was a nice pool inside the hotel as well and you could get free internet for about 5 minutes. This hotel was the best hotel and it was actually cheaper than other hotels we stayed at in France and Italy. I will definitely stay in this hotel again. GREAT hotel and very nice staff!!! Stay here if you are visiting Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent choice for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: lukulius
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for two days and didn't get to spend too much time in the hotel. I've been spoilt by US hotels where you can get better service for less money, but this being Europe, it's not too bad. The hotel is fairly new and the staff is polite and pleasant, trying to be invisible most of the time. I stayed in an executive room which was worth the extra money. I would have appreciated a flat-screen TV instead of a CRT but the channel collection was pretty good. The room was clean and the highlight was the bathroom which was nicely designed with ample space. The beds are comfortable (although a bit firm for my taste), the view is quite pleasant and there is complimentary coffee and tea. Other than that, everything you would expect from a 4-star hotel. Tip: The breakfast buffer for 12E is well worth the money and a very nice surprise. It's not continental only, in fact it includes a full English breakfast section.

Reviews.Title: “Be a king in barca”
Reviews.Author: erankam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clear Pay for the upper flor it's worth it. The staff is very helpful. The hotel is near the sants train station so it's very good way to com and leave from the airport. There is supermarket benith the hotel. There is a metro few steps away so can get any were.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ikimaru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel not too long ago and I totally loved it!! The staff was nice, the rooms were nice and clean. The best thing about Spain is that they don't expect you to tip them, they just do their job and when you do, they give you a heart warming thanks. Outside of the hotel however customer service is not that great so be careful about that. Say you're Canadian!! Trust me it makes a BIG difference!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice, Especially For First-Time Visitors”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: When I told friends that I was going to Barcelona, a common refrain was: watch out for pickpockets. I am happy to say that nothing of that happened to me in the five days of work and touring in Barcelona. And it was a very enjoyable experience for my wife and I, with this Hotel being a contributing factor. The best location for touring Barcelona would probably be the Plaza Catalunya aka Placa Catalunya. That's where tour buses congregate and where two pedestrian walkways (one being La Ramblas) run parallel to each other. But because there are so many people, it can be very confusing for first-timers. The Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya is next to Barcelona-Sants station and this is a central interchange with the added benefit of being wide open once you step out of the station. This means that there are no dark alleyways to the Hotel where muggers may hide. I stayed a total of five days, broken up by a visit to Lisbon where I had another meeting. For the five days, I had two different suites and was pleasantly surprised. There was a large living area and a sizeable dining table with space for six. There was a Nespresso coffee machine with six coffee pods of varying strengths. There was also an extra WC in the living room, which proved specially convenient. The masterbedroom had two king beds. And being at the corner, there was a spectacular view of the city. I asked for and got two different corners so I had an even better view. The sea/city view is more colourful. The bathroom was sizeable, double sink as reviewers have noted and with a ledge so toiletries stay dry. Being at the corner, the bathroom was very bright. It's somehow very pleasant to walk into a naturally-lit bathroom when one wakes up. There was plenty of wardrobe space. Both times, the iron was supposed to be available only upon request but it was in the wardrobe. The slippers were hidden away in the bath robes and should be better located. Breakfast was expensive at 12 euros and for two, that works out to 24 so we skipped that and ate outside. There is a good local cafe (we were the only non-locals) up the street, about 1 o'clock position from the door. It's a bar and the breakfast of ham sandwiches and coffee came up to less than 6 euros. More than the amenities was the service recovery. I had two problems in the very first hour of checking in. First, I had a problem with the Nespresso machine. The milk foaming nozzle was not properly cleaned. I tried at least 10 times and the water that came out (I wanted tea) had gunk. To the credit of the hotel, my machine was changed. Then, the wifi failed to work. It was frustrating because my PDA had malfunctioned so I needed the wifi. That took a while with the service staff coming up needlessly as it was clear to me that the problem was in the network. I had told him, I was in Barcelona for an Internet conference so I knew the source of the problem. It took the next day to get that sorted out. The service seems spotty. Perhaps because it is a busy hotel. During my entire stay, apart from the very first day when I checked in late at 6.30, there was always one or two guests at the reception. On my second stay, I had chocolates; they were absent in the first suite. At departure, although the concierge had been helpful before, he could see that I was struggling with three bags. Instead, all he did was wave and say "goodbye". I suppose that is a minor quirk that can be forgiven.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123alivia
Reviews.Content: We lost out bag in the taxi and the staff in the hotel tried really hard to help us and they called each taxi company in barcelona . Finally they found our bag . The staff are very friendly and great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, really helpful staff , lovely large rooms and very clean and modern.”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaAlison
Reviews.Content: Its the second time we stayed here and standards still as high. Even the same staff as 2 years ago so must treat their employees well too. The receptionists and porters are really helpful ,maps on hand and loads of knowledge on barcelona. Its near the main railway station, Sants but you cannot hear the trains, its opposite the metro and so you can be in the centre of Barcelona in minutes. Sants is great station to be near if you want to explore up the coast too, Sitges only 40 mins away. Rooms are really big and bathrooms luxurious - double sinks, walk in shower rooms and big baths. Noticed this year Spa is pay as you go think its 6euros, 2 years ago was free - no children allowed in pool and spa though. We took our 12 mth old and they provided lovely big cot - we had taken some of favourite baby books for her and they even left a little Spanish book mark on the top of her book - thought that really nice touch. We were room only - roof top restaurant looked good though and breakfast is also served there. Plenty of little cafes nearby so we had breakfast out most days. No hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “WOOOW”
Reviews.Author: Mezajee
Reviews.Content: Great, quiete and clean hotel in a very full of life area. Station for in Spain trips and Metro are 1 minute walking distance. The hotel looks normal from outside but you will be impressed when you check-in and see it from inside.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny I spent”
Reviews.Author: Mochaaaa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their hotel website and few days before I arrived, I got an email from them and ask me what's the purpose, how many people will stay in room, what pillow I want and all sorts of info. My family and I travel quite a lot and stayed at a lot of 4 and 5 stars hotel and I can tell you this hotel is making feel like the best. Upon arrival, I got all kinds of tourist info they prepared for me. When we stepped into the room, there's a piece of cake and a bottle of water waiting and there's a card to my 4 years old girl which is a welcome gift from them. An extra bed is already set up for my little one. Room is spacious, clean and well decorated. I love this hotel. Location is good just next to the train station, close enough to go to the main area but not as busy and noisy as La Rambla. I would definitely recommend this hotel to you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel room with fabulous view of Barcelona and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nickalmom
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel for its location. It sits on the corner of the Sans Train Station and metro stop. Lovely quiet neigborhood with some nice restaurants within a few blocks. It was a nice walk to Plaza Espanya and the Museum of Art. We could see the fountains at night in front of the museum. The metro is easy to navigate and it was a short ride to Las Ramblas area.
