The room was very clean and large with huge shower and double sinks. There is a grocery store under the hotel and a refrigerator in the room and coffe pot so we had our breakfast in the room. I enjoyed soaking in the beautiful views if the city after exploring all day. The front desk staff were super helful and gave us maps on srrival.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sportnoi
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed there for only one night, we could tell it was a great hotel, and would definitely choose it for our next visit to Barcelona. Our room was comfortable and nicely designed. The entire hotel was very clean and inviting, and breakfast on the top floor was amazing. The view was absolutely breathtaking, we could see all of the city! The hotel is located right next to Barcelona Sants station, and only a 10 minute walk from Montjuic and the beautiful fountain (Font Màgica). The staff was very helpful and spoke English well. So overall, we enjoyed our stay at Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to come back to after a long day of sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Andrewuk83
Reviews.Content: I got the train from the airport (which cost 3euros) straight into Barclona Sants train station where the hotel is situated across the road. Although it isn't right in the centre you can walk or you can get the metro from Barcelona Sants across the road to Las Ramblas(Liceu station, green line) which is 5 stops away. Upon arriving at the hotel I was greeted by a bell boy who offered to take my bags. The lady on reception (sonai, I think thats how it was spelt) was very very helpful. She answered questions and made sure I had a good view from my room. Everyday when I saw her she would wave and say hello. very friendly. The room itself was wonderful, very clean and big and a wonderful bathroom with a bath and shower, a walk in shower, twin sinks and separate toilet. In room safe, mini bar, ironing board and a great hair dryer. Overall I would be happy to go back to this hotel. Its right next to transport links, its nice to walk to and from, friendly staff and nice room to come back to after sight seeing. Plus for a great view go up to the 24th floor where you have breakfast and look over the city!

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: Maciek1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent location, service and food quality. Excellent place in Barcelona. Thanks a lot A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury hotel...but far away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: fishbowl
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent three nights at the hotel. We got off the train...and walked right into the hotel. It is literally across the street from the Sants Train station, the main train station for the city. That means the view wasn't great, but it was pretty convenient to walk across the street to get the metro. The hotel had a beautiful room, and nice bathroom. There was a mini bar as well and a flat screen tv. The king sized bed was very nice. There were some rowdy soccer fans outside the hotel which was kind of annoying at 2 am, but overall it was pretty quiet. I can tell there must be alot of business conferences taking place there. There is a fitness center, spa, and pool for an additional fee. There is a restaurant on the top floor with 360 degree views of the city..very nice. Did not eat there. Upon checkout got a coupon for 10 euros off your next trip....if you are frequent traveler to Barcelona it may be handy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: angel1929
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very good. Being aware that hotel rooms in European countries can often be on the small side, I specifically researched hotels with spacious rooms and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a standard room (didn't feel the need to pay extra since most of our time would be spent outside of the hotel) which met our needs not to bump into other. The bed was comfortable, mini bar was expensive (of course) so we made purchases from stores in the area, and the bathroom was large. The bathroom provided dual sinks, a water closet with a frosted door, separate shower, and a tub with a showerhead. Housekeeping promptly brought an iron to our room when called for and replaced a missing tv remote. The hotel staff were very accomodating and spoke sufficient English to give us directions to the local attractions. The hotel is located across the street from the Sants Train station which we utilized to take us to the airport for 3 euros per person instead of paying for a taxi as well as get to the center of the city. The double decker tour bus stop is across from the train station which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: ireneflorida
Reviews.Content: just returned from a short visit to celebrate our anniversary, this is our third visit and i must say the hotel gets better each time, we upgraded to a room on the 21st floor,the views are spectacular, all the staff go out of their way to be helpfull, the breakfast on the 23rd floor is more than good, we can't wait until our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Sparklingwine72
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in May 2010. We arrived at the reception late in the evening, but yet we received very good service. Me and my husband got a room from the 17th floor and our friends got an upgraded room from the 20th floor "because all the executive rooms were full booked". Which was of course fine for them :) Our room was quite spacious with a large bed and a desk with a chair, and an armchair in the corner. The mini-stereo was a nice touch, and knowing that it would be there we brought our own cd's with us. Our bathroom had two sinks (nice!) and a bathtub. The room and the bathroom were both very clean and cosy. The only minus point in the room was the pillow; very big and extremely hard. The restaurant was the best part of the hotel with its breathtaking view over the city of Barcelona. The breakfast was definitely worth of paying for; delicious and enough variety to keep the hunger away until the afternoon. We also had one dinner in the restaurant, and we enjoyed it very much. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. The location of the hotel was very good; just by the central station of Barcelona (Sants); and there was also an underground station in the same building. We used mainly the sightseeing bus (Barcelona Bus touristic), since we bought the two-day-ticket. This was a good way to travel around the big city, because you can hop on and off where you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday, brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evansemily86
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. The staff were really really friendly, and couln't be more helpful. We really enjoyed our stay there, and it helped make our holiday in Barcelona really special. I would highly recommend booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gracias!”
Reviews.Author: cataVen
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for making our stay in Barcelona so nice. The Hotel is perfectly located by the train station to give easy access to all of Barcelona and much of Spain. Arriving at reception, Alex, greeted us warmly and quickly, cheerfully, and efficiently informed us about the hotel and assigned us to our room The room, 2110, was clean, comfortable, neatly prepared, with an excellent view. Cristina was very helpful getting me set up on the internet. Thank you for the special treat of giving us a bottle of white wine in celebration of our 45 th wedding anniversary. I wholeheartedly recommend Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and a bargain! (plus great views)”
Reviews.Author: Maddy1980
Reviews.Content: I visited the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for 4 nights with my boyfriend. We had a great time - the room was clean and comfortable, the staff were friendly, and the location was good. It isn't in the middle of the city, but is very close to Barcelona Sants station, the main station. It is easy to get to from the airport, and it's also easy to hop on the Metro to get into town. Another plus point about the hotel is the bar/restaurant, up on the 23rd floor with amazing views over Barcelona. If you stay here you have to check this out! Also, don't listen to people saying the area is dodgy... on two nights we wandered around the local area and found decent bars a 15 minute walk away. It's not in the middle of La Rambla, but we actually found that a good thing, it was nice to chill out away from the hustle and bustle. On our last day we could leave our luggage in the hotel all day as we had a late flight, and they even let us get showered and changed in the spa when we came to pick our bags up. All in all highly recommended, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel for a break in Barclona”
Reviews.Author: IESKY
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 5 night stay at the Torre Catalunya. The first night the hotel was pretty full and we arrived late, so we were given a room on a low floor with no view. The following day, we were moved (left our packed luggage in the room and it was moved for us) to a room on the 15th floor with better in-room facilities and a beautiful view of the city. Staff were very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Breakfasts on the 23rd floor were satisfactory. Would warmly recommend this hotel to visitors who do not feel a need to be right in the middle of the "action" and are happy to take a 10 minute subway ride to get to the main tourist spots. Must also commend Yeego for an excellent rate at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thma84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice with good service and kind staff. The view from the rooms facing the square is nice and the location of the hotel is good. I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Suite dreams across from Estacio Sants”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on the 17th floor. The suite was large, the furnishings were modern, the views of the city were pretty. The suite bathroom was fantastic -- plenty of room for Bunny and me. The bed which was advertised as a king was really two attached twins; the mattress was not overly comfortable, but it was adequate for sleeping. I did not care for the spartan bedsheets/blanket. Why hotels in the 21st century do not provide basic soft duvet/comforters is beyond me! Thank the lord for the weariness of a day's tourism to bring sleep on easier. We booked through the hotel's website and got the internet connection free for the whole stay. (By the way, it is not WiFi, just a direct cable connection.) The free gym in the basement was a small 15 x 12 room with some equipment and free weights; it was enough for light exercising. There's a supermarket right around the corner from the hotel which was useful for stocking up on drinks. Across the street is Estacio Sants and about a block further is the metro station -- the metro trip into city center (Placa Catalunya or Passeig de Gracia) took about 20-25 minutes. Any jaded New Yorker will be impressed by Barcelona's efficient and clean metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CottonCandy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, it is close to the metro & train stations. The restaurant on the top floor for breakfast has a great view of Barcelona. The front desk service is good, but the housekeeping service & waiters/waitresses is quite slow. We called for an iron on 2 separate occasions and both times I had to do a call back just to see why it is taking so long. Yes, no iron in the rooms, just an ironing board. Also, the first day we checked in, the room had a lot of hair on the floor. We had to call housekeeping to vacuum the floor. The business center charges for everything, printing, etc. etc. Not enough towels in the bathrooms either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: arlhal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights and were happy with the hotel. The room was large and the bathroom had both a shower and bath. The bath was hard to get into with the drain at a location difficult to reach. The bed was comfortable, some may consider the mattress a little hard but we didn't. The hotel was clean everywhere. Breakfast at 12 EURO is a good buy if you want a BIG meal, no egg station so if having eggs to order is important you may be unhappy. Just downstairs there is a supermarket which was important to us since we want to have snacks and juice in the evening. At the supermarket there is a place to have breakfast (eggs to order, coffee, juice etc.). Getting to the hotel from the airport was as easy as can be. At terminal 2 there is a train to Santos RR station in Barcelona. Upon leaving the station look up and there is the hotel on the Stations plaza. A subway station is located at the Plaza and using the subway can get you to anywhere in Barcelona in a in minutes. Buses are also available within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in luxury and breakfast "with a view" !!!”
Reviews.Author: koster1111
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, this was our 7th visit to this hotel and we won't go anywhere else ever ! Trendy, large and very clean rooms, every comfort included, friendly and helpful staff, great location ( not exactly downtown but next to the main train station Sants where all the metro lines come together so the centre is only 4 minutes away ! ), safe neighbourhood, swimming pool and spa. Breakfast is amazing !!! The restaurant is on the 23th !!! floor and it's surrounded by glass windows so you'll have a magnificent view over the city. Not a single negative remark to mention, absolutely recommendable to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Second time I have stayed here - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: EnergyBelfast
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, handy location to Sants station. Beautiful rooms and top floor bar / restaurant. First class staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the most centrally located, but the views from the 'panoramic' restaurant on the 23rd floor are worth going for by themselves. The room was very good and the staff were courteous, but from the outside the Gran Torre looks like a 1970's high-rise block, with no real character. Nonetheless, I had a pleasant stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel”
Reviews.Author: el415
Reviews.Content: Don't let the pictures fool you, things are pretty old. It's not bad, but it's not as great as it seems, from the pictures. Overall its okay. But I'd stay somewhere closer to La Rumba.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to rest after a long day in BCN”
Reviews.Author: COCory
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the staff -- I can't recall nicer staff at any other hotel where I've stayed. My husband and I arrived early, exhausted from the long plane ride from the U.S., and they gave us a room immediately. Great views from the room. Quiet, too. One block from the main train station, which also has a metro stop. You can get anywhere in BCN or Spain from here. The spa is a little outdated. This isn't a four- or a five-star hotel, but the room decor and bathrooms are modern and clean, and it's very comfortable and convenient. We paid just around $100 a night for our stay -- you can't beat that anywhere, especially in pricey Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is very well located and offers panoramic views across”
Reviews.Author: mihainr1
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very well located and offers panoramic views across, especially in the restaurant (located at 23 floor)! advantage is that you get here in max 30 minutes from the airport, using the train! train and metro stations are about 200 meters from the hotel. tourbus stops near the hotel. find a large supermarket at 50 meters from the hotel. Hotel staff is very welcoming and polite. breakfast is very good. Cleaning is very ok! but normally we had one problem: in one evening, our son was hungry, and going to the restaurant I ordered pasta for him and for us a drink! was 21:30! unfortunately for us the restaurant staff ruin our evening saying that our son can eat pasta only if we can eat something of the menu . That's because pasta is not listed in the menu! but is listed in room service menu, I said. lady replied: yes but your son eating pasta only if you eat anything on the menu! and we left! is a four star hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel! A++”
Reviews.Author: sakuralondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel very nice. - Great Location just in front of the Sants Barcelona - Large Bed Room with great view (we stayed in 12th floor) - Bathroom great with seperate toilet room as well as shower room. Water pressure so good - Extremely CLEAN :-) - Room Service quick and tastey but not so pricy. - Staff so friendly and nice. Speaks perfect English. OK: - Breakfast OK but nothing wow about it. - there was a bit of noise in the evening. Not sure if we were unlucky, but there was noise upstair sounded like someone was moving furniture around?? - No toothbrush/paste is provided so don't forget to bring one! I've booked through directly with the hotel web site and got a flight seperately as it was cheaper than other travel portal site. Over all, really enjoyed it. My daughter didn't want to go home!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for us!!”
Reviews.Author: canela62
Reviews.Content: I had read many hotel reviews, and chose this one accordingly. It was absolutely perfect in every way! We stayed in one of the top floors. The room was beautiful, clean, and we slept peacefully every night (we stayed 10 days). Having the train station (Estacion Sants) across the street was the best. We rented a car there for 3 days and drove around the Costa Brava and also drove south of Barcelona. Then we bought the 2 day Bus Turistic, which is also in the station. We visited Montserrat, (the train for this was 1 walking block from the hotel) and spent the entire day there (amazing!!), and then we took the subway the rest of the days - also at the station across the street. Adjoining the hotel is a wonderful supermarket, where we always stocked up for whenever we got the munchies. The staff at the hotel is the best...extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious with the spectacular views of Barcelona and the waiters extremely nice. Thank you so much. (Sorry I waited so long to write a review). Barcelona is a magnificent city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would return...”
Reviews.Author: Mookiechops
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and we booked this trip with Lastminute.com conicidentally we found out that other family members had stayed at this hotel and had a good experience last year. We had expressed a preference via Lastminute for a room on a high floor with a nice view when we arrived the Receptonist tried to sell us an upgrade to an executive room from our standard room which we declined and were allocated room 304 on the third floor it appeared to be the only room with a balcony but with a view of the next door hotel. After two nights of hearing what sounded like water each night outside our room window and wind I expressed my concern to Demian on night reception who immediately offered us an uograde to an executive room. We obviously took up his offer as we could not sleep properly and the next six nights at the hotel were excellent. It was suggested that the noise we heard was from the Hotel fountains. We flew into and out of Barcelona in between the BA airline strikes and when our return flight was delayed Demian on night reception and all the staff in the Business Centre went above and beyond the call of duty to help us resolve the unexpected cancellation and change to our return flight. The staff all spoke good english and were most helpful. Pros; The executive rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Lots of lifts so no hanging around or having to bundle in with other guests. Sants Estacio Metro is also a Renfe station which gives access to all the main tourist attractions and the Airport and is just across the road from the hotel. The station is large and also has three toilets, McDonalds and shops. There is a large supermarket/hypermarket literally 30 seconds as you turn left out of the hotel. You can stock up on water and food if you want to avoid eating out all the time as we found the price of food even fastfood a bit dear at times. There is also a local Spanish Fast Food Outlet called Pan and Co just across the road from the hotel. If you need to get some water or nibbles late up to 11pm there is a nice little shop in Berlin Road run by some asian guys which isn't a rip off shop and are friendly. Cons Not all the rooms give a comfortable nights sleep - avoid room 304 (maybe the whole of the third floor) unless you sleep like a log and want a balcony with a very limited view . There tends to be a lot of noise from wind not sure if it was the time we went or if it's peculiar to this hotel. Also you are given two different sized pillows which didn't help me sleep if both were used. Not near any major attraction but with access to the metro in Barcelona and the T10 ticket this was no problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great connections, and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FerijenUK
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a few days at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya, and its one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at. Following advice here, we paid the little extra for an Executive Room which gave a fantastic view of Montjuic, (Olympic area) the Placa Espanya, and lots of Barcelona. The room was spacious and comfortable - although the pillows were harder than I'd have liked. The pool/spa is tiny and probably not worth the six euros unless you have walked all day and have a couple of hours to kill, in which case it was brilliant for chilling out in. I didn't get breakfast - its 12 euros a day if you have it every day, but 16 euros if you have it one off, which is considerably more than the 'menu del dia' three course meal at a restuarant we ate at just up the road. There's a local bakers shop which does very nice pastries as well! The restaurant is pricey - about 50euros ahead for a blow out meal - but does gorgeous food and has a brilliant view over the city. The location isn't in a prime tourist area, but its yards from the metro line to get to all of Barcelona, and well placed for Montjuic and for trains out of the city, as well as the train to the airport (its really not worth getting a taxi as the train goes straight from the airport to Sants station, literally around the corner). If I went back to Barcelona (this was my second visit, but my first to this hotel) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with access to everything”
Reviews.Author: Im_Harsh_But_Fair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent - very clean, spacious, awesome bathroom and helpful staff. The hotel is opposite the Sants Estació tube station and this gives very easy access to most of Barcelona. I would recommend this hotel to everyone staying in Barcelona as I feel it gave excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: anonrf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for my fiance's 30th birthday and it was lovely and also very quiet. The bar was quite expensive so wouldn't recommend drinking too much but I think that is to be expected in most hotels. The room was very clean and tidy and the shower was fantastic. Breakfast was 12 euros each per day and it was lovely with a large variety of fresh fruit, pastries, coffee, cheese and ham etc. Use of the pool/gym/sauna etc was 6 euros each but again it was a nice treat after a day site seeing. It was a 2 minute walk to the train/tube station which was very handy but also taxis were not expensive to all the major attractions. If you were feeling up to it, you could walk to La Ramblas. I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, good service and great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMusicTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was nice with a very comfortable bed. I thought the bathroom was fine although the shower/tub filled up quickly. The service was great and the bellmen are helpful. I loved the breakfast buffet. It was the best I have seen . I am a vegetarian and there were many options for me as well as my fiance who eats meat.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a must for a city break to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PhilipCooper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately worthy of a high ranking on tripadvisor. It is located directly opposite a mainline station (Barcelona Sants) which has direct access to the airport and serves 2 lines on the metro system. This is a large hotel with 23 floors. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and the rooms were spotless. The bathroom had 2 showers and a bath and double sink with all the standard amenities. We ate at the top floor restaurant as we wanted to admire the Barcelona city views and we were not disappointed. The food was great but way too expensive for what we were served. My advice is to eat on the ground floor bar as the food is just as good and much cheaper. Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel and I would not hesitate to return on my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for an urban escapade”
Reviews.Author: Torremaules
Reviews.Content: Good points: * Restaurant at the top has views all around Barcelona and surroundings (the sea, Montjuic, airport, Tibidabo, Sagrada Familia). * Executive room has kettle and tea service, very good soundproofing, and may have nice views too. (Advice: ask for a room on a high floor (at least over the 15th floor), and facing south-east, that is, facing the sea and Montjuic. The views to north-west are the not so pleasing works in progress around the train station. And if you are facing south but below the 15th floor you'll have a nice view to the concrete wall of another lower hotel. * Buffet breakfast has excellent variety and quality. Choice of fresh fruits, iogurts (actimel), cheeses, Catalan cold meats, etc. * Location: easy connection to everywhere in the city, central train station and metro stop across the square (green line 3, blue line 5). And there is a big supermarket, named 'Esclat', next door to the hotel. Bad points: * Have to pay for internet: a bad point for a hotel of this level. * Have to pay for spa: considering it is so small it should be included as well. * There are works in progress in the hotel surroundings and neighbourhood around the train station does not seem much charming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: comrade98
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel, at a good price. Location is excellent, handy for two metro stations. Great rooms, with excellent views if you are above the 12th floor. Restaurant on top floor (23rd) is also excellent - restaurant is not cheap, but is of a really good standard. You can go up there for just a drink or a coffee. The Spa in the basement is very nice, although they charge a rather cheeky 6 euros to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: EditeH
Reviews.Content: This was a good place. They even shipped a box back to me to the US after left. I was on my way to Africa and decided to ship some things home instead of shlepping them. And they sent that to me via fed ex. Their restaurant on top has a spectacular view of the city, and the very expensive asian dinner was on them because my internet service had been interrupted for a couple of hours the night before. The manager went way out of his way to make me comfortable and also invited us for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not _that_ good.”
Reviews.Author: asoyland
Reviews.Content: Nice enough rooms with a fine view, as expected from other reviews since we upgraded to executive for this reason. However, the beds were too hard by our standards, and there was way too much noise during both evenings / nights of the weekend we stayed there. This from two quite young people who did not turn in early and don't expect or need total silence to sleep well. No need to elaborate on the location, which is one of the principal advantages of this hotel. Internet access did not work the one time we tried (and very much needed it asap). Also, there was only one large towel available when we arrived rather late at night, which of course is no big deal, but together with other minor issues does affect our overall perception of the hotel. Staff was by and large friendly and helpful, though there was an incident while checking out, where we had either been misinformed or had misunderstood the conditions of a breakfast special offer. It worked out in the end, but was a negative experience. The breakfast, though, was very good, and not a bad choice at least once. Make sure you don't come too late though, because the staff seemed to intentionally make noise and tidy all around you starting 10.45 with breakfast until 11. While we can understand their motivations, this is most certainly not good service. All in all this was an OK hotel for this price however, and while I wouldn't reccomend it and cannot quite understand its high rating on TA, I wouldn't mind staying here again either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect -- Nearly”
Reviews.Author: TinyAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Spacious room (by European standards), immaculate, staff extremely helpful, not too pushy, well-priced. Location adjacent to rail/metro station, which makes it easy to get to major locations around Barcelona. Only drawbacks: (1) our reservation was somehow canceled, although this did not impace us because the hotel had plenty of availability during the days of our stay and (2) the in-room wireless internet did not function.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, space and location”
Reviews.Author: madman101
Reviews.Content: The size of the room and the bathrooms surprised me, being used to the typical European city hotel. It was well-appointed, huge, well stocked. The service staff was very helpful, me being a first-timer in Barcelona and gave me all of the tips for going around the city. The Metro station is nearby and a hypermarket can be found downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Oasisgirl80
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for convenient location - right opposite Barcelona Sants station. Its very convenient as a base for getting around. I was on business - as a tourist I'd have probably chosen an area with a bit more atmosphere, such as Las Ramblas, or Barceloneta near the beach. The hotel is great. Super clean, plush, good food. The restaurant on the top floor has amazing panoramic views of Barcelona and is a great way to start the day at breakfast. The breakfast buffet was great and catered for everyone - whether you wanted spanish style (bread & tomato etc), pastries, healthy fruit or a fry up. My tip - fill up here if you want to save money on lunch during the day! The evening restaurant food isn't cheap but it is fantastic. I recommend treating yourself to at least one meal here during your stay. The bar on the ground floor does more basic but perfectly good food (but of course without the amazing view). Rooms were nice, cool with tiled floor and good air con, nice bathroom, good provisions. Staff are very polite and helpful. Special mention to the guy who kept the business centre open for me (it stays open quite late anyway) as I was frantically trying to download my flight booking confirmation for the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and... a great value”
Reviews.Author: LatinOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. Very clean, spacious, fantastic views, friendly staff. Location a plus if you have to take a cab, are willing to take the metro, bus or ride the high speed train (AVE) as you need to walk no more than 1 block to access all of these. The view from the restaurant on the top (23rd) floor is amazing, particularly sunrises and sunsets. I paid 75 Euros per night. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsjetsetter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week and were beyond impressed with the hotel and it's staff. The location is convienent when you are arriving from the airport. You can take the train to Sants Estacio and then cross the street to the hotel. The neighborhood isnt super lively, but again youre just accross the street from a major train station, and just one stop away from the city center. The rooms are pretty spacious for European standards, comfortable beds, very clean. When we did have a problem (broken remote, buzzing hairdryer) someone was up in a matter of minutes with a replacement. The bathroom was great, with an enormous bathtub, as well as a seperate shower. Check out 'Visual' on the 23rd floor for an elegant dinner with breathtaking views of the city. They also serve a fantastic brunch here with an assortment of cheeses, breads, fruit, cereal, meats, juices etc. We would have eaten here every morning if we werent poor Americans- its nearly 50 USD for two though well worth it. Luckily, there is a supermarket just around the corner. The gym was surprisingly small but sufficiant, with a steam room, sauna and pool available for a reasonable charge 6 EU. On top of all that, the staff is exceptional. Everyone from the bellman, concierge, housekeeper, wait staff helped to make our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Excellent Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ygpsydney
Reviews.Content: Great Location - Fantastic staff throughout the hotel - Excellent value for money Wish the hotel had free internet acess - come with 15minutes free. Excellent restaurant. Staff were very attentive and service was always good. ask for a room on the higher floors for the views. Hotel room was quiet and clean. Good bathroom. Highly recommended and great value for money

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tyandrey
Reviews.Content: this hotel is truly good one, we stay 10 days, changed two room, one on the 21 floor another on 11 floor betweem cruise ship, clean, friendly, near Sants station (2 min. walk) Staff very nice and helpful, room is large enough, bathtop's size you can not find over USA, the body cream much much nicer than ship, towl is big size. too. we catch the toure bus blue line, red line, also buy a T-10 ticket for under ground train & city bus, circle allover Barcelona, ( very interest city, lots to see and do, good sea food) we had breakfast on the top floor (23) $12.00 per person (promeion desayuno) super nice, best coffee in town. texi to airport about $35.00 one way, to the cruise $30.00 (they charge your luggage which included price) you may take green line bus to the train (RENFE) 3 stop to Sants station walk to the hotel only $3.00 from airport (BCN). if you have time. we did it when we out of airport. T-10 is metro ticket for zone #1, Sants is majur metro station won't miss. if you are first time on Barcelona this hotel is best one to chose. I'll suggest let the hotel staff order your texi is safe way, very happy with. we was there December 13th week earlier to catch Norwegian Jade to Mediterranen by the way this cruise line is very displeasure good luck. Bob & Su

Reviews.Title: “Slightly out of the way but good standard”
Reviews.Author: the_adj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, adjacent to Sants Estacio. Good value for money, large beds, double showers and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMiya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three girlfriends for a girly holiday. The hotel was AMAZING! Upon arrival we checked in, security checks were carried out and the staff were helpful and gave us a lot of information about where to go and to eat. Although we weren't right next to each other, we were still on the same floor, just a couple of doors down. The rooms were very spacious, large twin beds, a spacious bathroom with to sinks, a bath, separate shower and toilet and very clean! The views were amazing from the restaurant on the top floor and was located right by the main train station (walk out from the station and it is pretty much in front of you). The only disadvanatage was we were a bit out of the city (but easy access due to the close station) and the area smelt bad (a strong urine smell). There is a supermarket located round the corner which we only discovered on our last day unfortunately. All in all a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lktoday
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say what a fantastic time we had at the hotel at the weekend, I booked very late for my husbands birthday and was so pleasently surprised! Hotel was the most convenient I have ever stayed in, LITERALLY across the road from the train station. On the Sat we had a knock at the door and without me requesting they supplied a cake and birthday card for my husband which was a lovely touch and really made our hols. We did not eat in the beautiful restaurant as we are tapas lovers but the spa was lovely and we spent a nice relaxing time there. Finally they allowed us to stay in the room up till 3pm which was great for us to leave our luggage and look around Barcelona without worrying. Room was great and an extremely enjoyable holiday which I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitCouple
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was simply WONDERFUL! We arrived way before check-in time and they still gave us a room. We didn't like the view and asked to see another room which was an upgrade. We chose that room on the 19th floor which afforded us an outstanding view of the city. We ate in the restaurant which gave us a panoramic view of the city as well. The staff was very friendly, informative, and cheerfully assisted us with our every need. A few suggestions: If you book online, request an upgrade upon arrival (floors 19-23). The city view is more expressive when viewing from an even number room (exp. 1910, 2114). Food in the hotels restaurant and lounge are quite pricey. There are many eateries and a hypermarket (or grocery store) in walking distance. Lots of great places to eat within the train station (Barcelona Sants). If all else fails, ask Christina from the Business center, she'll welcome the company and go the extra mile to help meet your need. We recommend you book a day on the "Big Bus Tour" and a day on the "City Tour", together you'll get a great overview of the city and its history. If you're going to Spain for a short stay, a little history, and a central location; this is the place for your short stay. If you're honeymooning......you might want to reconsider and lean more toward a resort. Although the town may be known for pick pockets, there are still some good Samaritans. I left my wallet in the taxi when leaving the city and the driver returned it to the airport security. Kudos’ go out to Christina (who works in the hotels business center), for notifying me upon my return to Kuwait, that my wallet had been found and was secure.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, convenient location, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: beignet3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Torre Catalunya over a weekend and had a nice time. The front desk staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful. The hotel was not incredibly busy so we were able to get some extra attention from the staff. The hotel is next to a large train/metro station which made it convenient to get anywhere in Barcelona. The hotel is not within walking distance of any of the common tourist sites, you will need to ride the metro or take a cab. Our room was very clean, with everything in working order. The view was nice from the 15th floor. Although this hotel is a good value, next time I think I would pay extra to stay closer to the main action in Barcelona along the Ramblas. You will get a much better feel for the city that way.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan City Break”
Reviews.Author: DiWYorks
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a long weekend in Barcelona (Thurs-Monday) and I adored it! It really is the perfect city - it ticks all the boxes, it has great shopping, amazing places to eat and drink, wonderful sightseeing, fantastic entertainment and if that's not enough, it also has a lovely beach and a picturesque harbour! The Metro links are the best and easiest way to travel around the city, I wouldn't recommend driving! We stayed at the Torre Catalunya Hotel, which was near enough to the centre, without being too close. There is a Metro station and Barcelona Sants train station just across the road, so it's an easy hotel to get to. The staff were very attentive and friendly, the buffet breakfast on the 23rd floor was really nice and the views from here were spectacular. We upgraded our room to an executive room, for an extra 12 Euros per night per room, which I though was good value and worth doing, as these rooms were on higher floors, were bigger and had little things like robes, slippers and tea and coffee etc. There was also an ice maker right outside our room. The room had air-con and was spotlessly clean and the maid cleaned every day. I can't fault it! Things you must see in Barcelona - the magic fountains (Friday and Saturday evenings in winter. Wrap up warm as whilst during the day we were in jeans and t-shirts, by evening it got a bit chilly especially when sitting watching the fountains performing. We also enjoyed going up to the top of Christopher Columbus's column ( there's a lift inside the column). La Sagrada Familia church is breathtaking, the cable cars going up to Montjuic were fun. I wasn't overly impressed with Parc Guel but I know many people who say they've enjoyed going. Port Vell (harbour) is worth a visit, it's a great walk when it's sunny. Be at the cathedral at 12noon on a Sunday to watch the dancing in the square next to the catheral- take some small change for the dancers collection plates. We found lots of nice places to eat - the best were a small restaurant called Xandor which I think was near the Place of Angels Metro stop. Here we had the best paella and great service, in authentic surroundings - there were many small restaurants around this area so worth heading in this direction on an evening. We also enjoyed La Dolce Hirminia (not sure of spelling) which was near the Equinanaona Metro stop. Wine carafes were cheap and the food was very good and very well presented - it does get very busy though, so be prepared to queue a little. Dessert here is also very good and it's not overly expensive. I think that's about it - but really, if you want a wonderful, romantic, exciting break, then I can't recommend this city enough! You need at least 3-4 days though, don't try cram it all into a weekend, you will miss so much!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tchai
Reviews.Content: I'm really impressed with this Torre Catalunya. We booked this hotel through Expedia and stayed here after our cruise. We book a standard room and we were very pleased when we walked into our room. It's more like a suite on the 18th floor overlooking the city of Barcelona. Awsome view from our room. Everything in the room is just right. The bed, the linens, the furnitures are all artistically designed and put together. And the bathroom is huge. There's separate bathtub, shower booth and a sepate booth for the toilet. Lots of amenities. The staff is very helpful and allowed us to check in early at 11am. We had breakfast buffet and for the price you pay, there's plenty of selection from hot meals to cold cuts, fresh fruits and pastries... Location is not in the middle of the tourist area. It's conveniently located near the transit. Close to the train station and the metro. We walked 5 minutes to the train/metro and easily get around Barcelona. We took the train to go to the Airport for 5EU each. I can go on and on raving about this hotel. I just love it and definitely will stay here in our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great location for traveling by train... helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelLITE111
Reviews.Content: ...wanted to locate a hotel nearby train station and got exactly what I wanted. learn few spanish words/phrases before you go... even at the train station, it was hard to find someone who spoke english. There is a market underneath the hotel which was pretty convenient to get drinks, pastries,,,, even hot breakfast ready to go!! Short train ride to plaza catalunya for most activities/shops happening. Rooms were spacious but the marble floor was little too cold for winter weather. Like usual european hotels, the heater was so so,,, but no problem getting hot water in the tub and shower!! room service was great and late night snak room service was surprisingly tasty... Def. choose this hotel if you are looking to take advantage of public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST OPTION”
Reviews.Author: hollanda33
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. Besides the great, big, clean rooms with awsome vieuws. Breakfast and the Visual resturant (23 floor) are definatelly worth while. But the best of all is the staff, nice and helpfull. Dedicated to make your stay unforgettable!!!!! THANK YOU !!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Exceeded our Expectations...we are picky hotel travelers, too!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiianeyes
Reviews.Content: We came off our 7 day Mediterranean cruise and went directly to the hotel. The front desk was extremely accommodating & very warm & friendly. They allowed us an early check-in (approx. 5-6 hours before normal check-in) with no fuss. Our room was very large (we upgraded to a Superior room level as my hubby did not feel it was too much more) and had all the amenities we needed plus one of the best showers ever! The pressure of the shower head & the temperature of the water was like something from a professional Spa experience! The tub was extremely large lending itself to a great opportunity for bubble bath & soak. We did dine in the restaurant and the food was very good but quite pricey considering there are sooo many wonderful places to eat in Barcelona for less. We also utilized their spa area one day and found the jacuzzi/hydrotherapy pool lacking. The spa's various treatment rooms: Steam, Sauna, power-shower were more than adequate for a facility of its size but the jacuzzi pool needs much more powerful jets to be truly effective. Overall, this hotel was great even if not so close to La Ramblas. The metro station is right across the street where you can get to anywhere in the city in minutes or less. Also their is a great supermarket right out the door of the hotel where we got fruit, water, shampoo, wine...so convenient! Truly being off La Ramblas gives you opportunity to relax and enjoy Barcelona every savory moment at your own pace!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location if u don't mind using local transport, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mousekin
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from staying at the Gran Hotel Torre, it is a lovely clean hotel, modern and the rooms are large, i had an executive room. A bit too much wood in the room is my only comment, but on the whole it was a good clean room, with a lovely bathroom and massive bed (2 singles pushed together) a bit hard but still comfy after sightseeing all day. Satelite TV but only CNN and the German version of MTV but it played alot of English speaking American reality shows which were quite funny. The spa was nice but you have to pay 6 euros, it would have been nice if it was included. You can pay the 6 euros and use it as much as you like that day, come and go etc. I didn;'t eat breakfast, so can't comment on that, the main railway station is across the street, so easy to get breakfast there much cheaper. We did use the restaurant on the top of the hotel, food was nice but cost 100 euros all together for 3 course and a bottle of wine. Great views but lacking in atmosphere. The staff were great, no complaints there at all. We used the underground alot as it was over the road and is very cheap and easy to use. Either a blue line which goes across the city or a green line that goes up and down. The staff at the hotel explain alot on how to get around and give you all the maps you need. Personally, i had high expectations from Barcelona, but was not that impressed, a big city with lots of shopping and not much else to look at. The Guadi buildings are great and the Guell parc, other than that just shopping and walking about. we found it hard to find a decent restaurant, found one in Las Ramblas called the Attic, i recommend this for the value and food, really good, it is upstairs so you have to look up and is on the left hand side as you walk down Las Ramblas. Camp Nou is worth a visit too if you are into football. On the whole a great value hotel if you don't mind catching the local transport. i would recommend it but Barcelona for me was not so good, i have been to better cities. I do understand though it is horses for courses and just wasn't my cup of tea. Too big, not enough good restaurants that were easy to find and not enough historical sites, perhaps i missed something? a haven for shoppers though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location So-so”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel b/c it looked like a really nice place to stay in Barcelona. It was a very nice hotel, however, not as nice as we would have thought for the price. We got upgraded to a superior room when we got there, which was nice, although the best part was the view! We were on the 21st floor and had great views of the city and Tibidabo. The service at the hotel was good - everyone was very helpful. The first 15 minutes of internet is free, but you have to pay after that and it is pretty expensive, not to mention I had a horrible time even connecting. I couldn't connect at all in our room and the service was so-so in the lobby. The biggest con of the hotel was the location - let me clarify though b/c it depends on what you are looking for. The hotel is basically in the business district. It is right by the train station and one of the main Metro stations (Sants Estacio) which makes getting places easy, but if you are looking to walk everywhere without using some sort of public transit, then it is more difficult. We love to walk and would have preferred to have been in an area more centrally located, like closer to the water. Next time we definitely would stay in a different location. We had breakfast in the hotel - it was kind pricey, 12 Euro/person - but a very good breakfast. Both hot and cold items and quite a spread, plus it in served in the restaurant on the top floor with great 360 degree views of the city. I would definitely suggest breakfast, it is worth it. Although there are minibars in the rooms, there is a huge grocery store (more like a Walmart) underneath the hotel where we went and got drinks/snacks for our room - a much cheaper option. They were great about letting us check in early, and keeping our bags until we were ready to catch our flight out. Overall, it was a nice hotel, just not as great as we thought it would be. Again, I would suggest staying somewhere more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, easy to find, good service”
Reviews.Author: maltman77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice location for access to the metro. It is also right next to the train station, so if you are planning on taking the train in or out it is very convenient. There is not a lot around the hotel otherwise though, so you will find yourself going other places to eat and sightsee. The hotel is a landmark so it is fairly easy to find. Try to request a room on one of the higher floors for the view. The view from the restaurant at the top is awesome and should be checked out even if you don't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Views to die for, but for the rest: don't die here, it's horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Peewee68
Reviews.Content: Maybe they had a bad day or maybe I am overcritical, but is the hotel I stayed in the same hotel as the one with the marvelous reviews on Tripadvisor? The hotel I stayed in on 26 September 2009 was filled with very unhelpful and lying staff members and we were given a room that had seen much better days. Let alone the dirty underwear that a previous guest had left in the room and that housekeeping had over looked and the awful stench of some aerosol that was sprayed to cover the nicotine smell in this non-smoking room. Lets start with the unhelpfull staff. We came in around 3 PM. This is in my opinions a rather normal time, we indicated before hand we would be there at 3 PM and the hotel had not given us a warning that check in would be later. After identifying ourselves to the friendly but rather unprofessional check in guy (Jesús and he resembled Manuel of Fawlty Towers in more than one way) it took 10 minutes to sort out our reservation because (as they told me) I had swapped my first name and last name and this meant a total melt down of the reservation system. Finally he found my name and told us the room wasn’t ready, because it was being cleaned, but would be ready in 45 minutes (we were standing there already for almost 15 minutes). Being an experienced traveler I knew that 45 minutes could mean 1 hour. So I asked him with a sense of humor if those 45 minutes were US minutes or Spanish minutes. I know Spaniards are not well know for their sense of humor and of course my joke was taken very seriously. My mistake. Anyway, he invited us to “take a chair with arms rests around the corner”. We politely refused and waited in from of his desk. Just to make clear we wanted to go to our room. After 20 minutes the front office manager (called Montse) came to us and she invited us to go to the bar. I refused politely again, because the bar was a row of “chairs with armrests” and because walking away would mean a longer delay for certain. She informed us also that we were lucky because the room was ready 10 minutes early (in my language only 35 minutes late). After the 35 minutes nothing happened. After asking it would take another 15 minutes. After 15 minutes it would take another 10 minutes and so on. In the meanwhile I asked what was happening. It then became clear that they had sold their suites with a lazy late check out to 4 PM and that suites only were available after 4 PM. At check in we were told it was being cleaned and now we were told the room was still sold (sold double in fact). At 4 PM two guest came down to check out. Right next to me. In a very, very quiet hotel they were the only ones to check out within the past hour. The checked out of their suite. Our suite. So at 4PM the room still had to be cleaned. I mentioned this to the front office manager Montse and she told me I was wrong. That the room was still being cleaned (for an hour now) " because it is such a bif room". Obviously Montse was lying as Jesús was lying. She made it worse by informing me that she had called me that morning on my cell phone to tell me that the room would be ready late. Having my Blackberry phone with me this was a lie: I had no missed calls. I showed her my phone to prove it and she shrugged an insisted that she had called me. So that was lie number 3. Nevermind. As to the room: damaged furniture, peeled of walls and cubboards and nasty smells of nicotine in this non-smoking room. We received a small card with apologies and 1 (one) small piece of cake. Again an insult. The fact there was dirty underwear in the room made my irritation into humor. What a waste of space this hotel is and what a waste of people Montse en the poor Jesúr (being ordered to lie) are. We tried this hotel only on the basis of the very nice reviews on Tripadvisor and never go here again. We will go back to Arts or Meridien next time. For you readers: do yourself a favor and avoid this dump of a hotel with incompetent staff. Even if the price is low (I now know why) views are (indeed) to die for. I rather die somewhere else. Sorry Torre Cataluna: you are rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DaveC64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. It's directly outside Sants train station, and a short walk down Tarragona ave to Montjuic and the Magic Fountain. Coupled with a travel card for the trains, it's perfect for travelling on lines 3 and 5 for some of the major attractions, and the direct Renfe train to/from the airport (which only costs approx 3 euros as opposed to the 30 euro taxi...). It's also one of the easiest hotels to see in Barcelona - visible from a lot of the higher viewpoints in the city, even from your plane if you fly in from the North (it's the building with the big blue Sony light on a spire on top). It's in a fairly quiet part of the city, so we heard no noise in our 6th floor room, even with the Merce festival happening all over the city. The location gives it some great views - our room sadly didnt have one, but that didnt stop us sitting on the 22nd floor watching the firework display at the end of the Merce festival out of the window, which was awesome. Ice machines are a problem, with 4 out of the 5 we tried not working, but I'm not that big of an ice fan so I dont hold it against them. The staff are extremely good - friendly, multi-lingual and very helpful, and the bar is reasonably priced. We didnt eat at the top floor "Visual" restaurant, but we did explore it and it looks very nice. The rooms are immaculately clean, comfortable, large and well equipped, with the exception of the TV which only has local TV, plus 2 English news channels and the German MTV - again though, I didnt come to Barcelona to watch TV so that wasnt an issue. If you're not on too tight of a budget, definitely stay here - it's convenient, failry luxurious, friendly and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the main station.”
Reviews.Author: RobertSterling
Reviews.Content: Very good service - everything fine with the hotel. Free internet only 15 min - longer would be nice. The spa has to be paid extra - Euro 6. Located at the main station. Take the metro or taxi to the center or the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the views and the well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: vthokie91
Reviews.Content: I think people have given very accurate reviews of this hotel. The good: I loved the city views, the spacious well-appointed room, their spa/pool was a unique experience for me and the overall cleanliness. The bad: taking a pretty bad spill on the granite stairway leading up to the hotel. If it is raining or the fountains are blowing water on to the steps, take the ramp you won't be sorry. The ice machine on our floor and an adjacent floor did not work. When you took a shower our room the water poured out in to the toilet area. Some of the wooden furniture was chipped in our room. They had wifi (you pay for it) in the lobby, but I didn't know this until the last day, it would have been nice to know of this option in advance. The location is far out, but we knew that going in. Wonderful room and the views cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: davo123
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly and the rooms were large and clean (we had upgraded to a superior room). The view from the room was superb and we thoroughly enjoyed a meal at the Visual restaurant on our first night. The location is very good within a short walk of Estacio station (approx 15min to the centre of Barcelona and 20min to the airport by train). The only drawback is that you have to pay €6 per day for the use of the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Good, I suppose”
Reviews.Author: ddd007
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel adjacent to the central station. We were swayed by other reviewers here. With hindsight it probably would have been better to stay more centrally, to avoid using the city's over-hot metro with it's long pedestrian tunnels. The hotel is a little frayed around the edges, but offers large clean rooms. Would have been nicer to be on one of the higher floors looking towards the Palau Montjuic. Maybe I am being unfairly ambivilent towards a decent hotel. Truth is, Barcelona did not live up to our expectations. Madrid was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, would be very happy to return.”
Reviews.Author: ned1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Torre Catalunya for five nights with my husband and small baby. From the moment we arrived the staff could not have been more helpful. We had an early morning flight but the receptionist checked us in at eleven and ment through metro,buses, sights with us, nothing was too much effort for him. Room was on ninth floor and I would suggest getting a room on a higher floor if traffic noise etc. bother you. Room was bright and spacious with loads of room for the babies cot. We booked on b and b basis and would definitely recommend doing so, the buffet style breakfast is served on 23rd floor with views over entire city. Huge variety of food at buffet and again the staff are so helpful and accomodating, at night the Visual restaurant opens, we tried it once and it was lovely but not really the place to bring a small baby. There is a nice lounge just off the lobby area and this also serves nice lunches etc., again staff here were wonderful. All in all we had a great stay at Torre Catalunya, it is a stones throw from Sants station and is so easy to get around city from here. You feel at the centre of things but are not right in the hustle of la Rambla. I would highly recommend this hotel and would love the chance to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sionedWales
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many 4 star hotels we found that this is probably the best. The room (executive room) was spotless,and a good size, and the staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We did not use the spa as the weather was very hot, but we used the sun terrace and outdoor pool at the sister hotel next door which was free to guests. I would recommend this hotel and will be returning myself.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bushwkurr
Reviews.Content: easy to get to by train from El Prat, about 10 min.....exit train station & hotel is right there. check in was a breeze, hotel staff were very frendly & very helpfull .........make sure you get a room above 10 th floor....streets very busy at night. room was large & very clean & comfortable.....would stay there again if ever in BCN...................

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT! A MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: egoddess2
Reviews.Content: I cant describe how much my bf and I loved this hotel. We got a room on the 20th floor with a great view. The room was spacious and modern. The bathroom was also large. The breakfast was amazing, with a panaramic view of the city. It is located right by the major train station, grocery store, and withing a 10 minute walk from the Sq. de Espana where the fountains can be found (a must see). A cab to downtown will run about 8-10 euros. The staff was UNBELIEVABLY nice and helpful. I would only stay at this hotel! A rooftop pool is available in the EXPO hotel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars in four stars price”
Reviews.Author: nikomc2
Reviews.Content: We stayed on July 2009, the room was an executive double room on 16th floor and was great spacious, clean and the bed was very good also (we don't like soft beds). Due to the height all parts of hotel have great views. Must visit the last floors cafe and restaurant! The metro station is very close to the hotel and on of the advantages is that you can find always your way back because you can see the hotel from far away!! The only minus was that we had to ask for sleepers and bathrobes that included in the price but we never managed to get on the phone the housekeeping service, also the breakfast is expensive and its preferable to have it in a cafeteria. Barcelona is great and there are many bars where its allowed to smoke!!!! Young couple from Kastoria Greece

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: IadoreMadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early August. Got an upgraded room on the 10th floor. It had an amazing bathroom with a tub/shower, separate toilet and bidet, and a a stand alone shower big enough for 2. Be sure to inquire about using the pool at the Expo hotel right next door. They are sister properties and you can get a voucher to use the pool at the Expo. The hotel is close to public transportation and the supermarket next door is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MefoandMeho
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! The train station is right in front of the hotel and you also have a grocery store next door. The rooms were very spacious, upgraded nicely, and if you are on the higher floors then you will have amazing views. I would recommend to anyone to make sure they do not stay in one of the lower floors because you will get street noise and you may be next too this huge fan which makes this very annoying sound 24/7. Because of reading the reviews we payed a little extra to ensure we got a room on a higher floor, 16 or above and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money-well worth 4 stars+”
Reviews.Author: janhUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be missed-a huge 23 storey tower block next to Sans Station-ideal for travelling by rail or getting onto the Turistic bus to view the city. Taxis to Placa Catalunya, more central areas cost about 8Euros. Rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable and air-conditioned with large windows and excellent views of the city. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Parking cost 21 Euros per night-to be expected in the centre of a major city. Fabulous 23rd floor restaurant/breakfast room with stunning views on all sides. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for us”
Reviews.Author: roslynpines
Reviews.Content: Executive level room was clean, spacious and well equipped. Just right after overnight flight from the sates. Train from airport for only 2.20euro, to Sants main station, out the door, turn right and the hotel is 50 meters away. The hotel is not in the center of the city, but There is a Metro station. The Metro system is excellent. A T-10 (10 trips) pass for 7.70 euro can be shared by 2. We were meeting friends for a cruise. Our rooms was the perfect freshen up place. The breakfast buffet was delightful and be pre-reserved for 12 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: golfkrazy2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the main train station which had a convenient connection to the airport. The staff was pleasant and efficient. We had a room on the 5th floor, which was quite large and clean. An open air bus tour of the City was located nearby, which was reasonably priced and provided great information. We would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppystar
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I feel compelled to write a review after reading other helpful tripadvisor reviews which helped me to choose this hotel. Myself and a friend stayed two nights (8/9 August) and really enjoyed our stay. We were looking for a hotel which was good value for money and convenient for getting into the city; we found it on both counts. We had a twin room on the 9th floor which luckily for us was in the corner so we had windows on both sides. The room was huge and had a decent TV and stereo system. The bathroom was fantastic with doule sinks and both a walk-in power shower and a bath. We did not have any problems with noise in the hotel. As others have said, directly opposite the hotel is the main train station, Barcelona Sants which is on a number of different lines and has a direct connection to the airport. I recommend the T-10 (10 trip) ticket which lasted us all weekend for 8 EUR. We decided to also get the 2-day hop on/off, open-top tourist bus ticket which at 27EUR for 2 days was a little pricey but was a great way to really see the city and sights in a short space of time (the metro is great but you can't see everything from underground!) We didn't have dinner in the hotel but did have breakfast on the last day which is also served on the 23rd floor with great views of the city. I'd definitely recommend the breakfast which had a great choice of both continental and hot food (although as someone else said was not as hot as it could be!) The check-in staff were a little slow with the check-in/out procedure but were really helpful and happy to recommend places to go and show you on a map which you could take away. The supermarket just around the corner was really handy (& cheaper than the mini-bar). Our only regret was not getting time to use the spa. Overall, a really great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good facility/service ,close to all transportations, reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: NyJHLee
Reviews.Content: I normally do not leave review after staying at hotels but this one is really worth every recommendation here by fellow reviewers if you are to stay in Barcelona. I've stayed there for 4 nights with spouse from 7/26~7/30. Check in/out was very smooth & fast. I did request for an iron & an adapter for my laptop charger, at both incidences hotel staff responded quickly & came to assist right away. Management also left a small birthday cake/card in our room which was a nice & thoughful touch..... We ordered room service once from restaurant & also dined at top floor restaurant during last night of our stay, the food/service was decent at reasonable cost (70~ euro for two on full course dinner) & the spectacular night view of the Barceloan was added bonus...Did not try their breakfast as we just walk across the street to Sants Station food court to have quick self serve breakfast. There's a bank ATM and supermarket next to the hotel just in case you need some urgent $ or stuff. We went to Figueres(2 hrs) and Airport(20 min) by train from Sants station right across the street which is very convenient. Metro subway (line #3 & #5) are also there. We did not even bother to take the tourist bus trip as we can reach all places by the convenient public transportation. The only thing is that you have to pay extra 10 euro per day for internet access but overall we've had a wonderful experience staying there & would not hesitate to recommend it to my friends if they are to visit Barcelona! p.s. if you are to take subway and take train to/from airport, remeber to buy a T10(10 trip) ticket for 7 euro which can be shared with your companion.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, clean, good food.”
Reviews.Author: dualfuelireland
Reviews.Content: I dont normal leave reviews, but as i found this hotel on tripadviser i thought i would leave a quick message. THe hotel is first class. Stayed on the 18th floor, Views look over the city. Quiet rooms, Food was excellent in the lounge bar and very cheap for the quality. Staff was very helpful. The hotel is ten minutes out off the city but u jump on a train outside the hotel! Get the tour bus for two days and use it to jump on and off the bus! Seen must off the sites on the bus tour. Thiefs are in very city, but there is alot about barcelona. They appear to work in twos so be smart with bags and back pockets! Would come back in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “nice, convenient location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: yoonster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. We arrived at 1030am and we able to check in early, which was nice after a 15hr flight. The service was good generally; some staff made a real effort to make our stay enjoyable. The rooms were clean and the bathroom well appointed. The main problem with the hotel is the noise from both the corridor/other rooms and the street outside (which is opposite one of the main train stations in barcelona, sants. It was an additional 6 euro per visit to the spa and pool, which was a little disappointing considering the price of the room. We liked the location best; the noise the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice people, but mixed views on location”
Reviews.Author: EBDUB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend from 25-28 July. Our superior room was on the 21st floor, giving great views over Barcelona. Bed was huge and very comfortable. Bathroom also big (double sinks) and had a great power shower (very welcome when returning from the heat of the city streets and the metro). Location was great for getting from the airport by Renfe train to the busy Sants Station (where we nearly got pickpocketed by a smooth operator who “accidentally” dropped his sunglasses in front of me while boarding the metro, then began to scrabble on the floor at my feet: fortunately I did not trip over him as he clearly hoped, so that he could “help” me while robbing me. Keep an eye out for him and his friend!). But while the metro is handy for getting in to the Ramblas and all the central sites, the hotel’s location is not in a very interesting part of town – and even though we enjoy walking, and would have strolled into the centre, this became a no-no in the high summer heat. The reception desk, while far from glossy, is manned by a great, helpful staff. The restaurant on the top floor is worth at least one visit for dinner, slightly pricey but very atmospheric and with panoramic views. As regards the buffet breakfast, it can be hit or miss as the hot food often goes cold before new supplies arrive. And the “coffee” is execrable – just like the stuff they serve in the same company’s Mare Nostrum hotels in Tenerife. Strange, because otherwise this hotel was great value (oh, and we heard no noise from any other rooms, and the cleaning service was great – unlike that experienced by some New Zealanders’ who complained about both on TripAdvisor recently.) Room service too, came up trumps for us when we had to call on them following a disastrous visit to an Italian restaurant in the vicinity of the hotel. Yes, I’d return, but not in high summer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right next to the Central Train/metro station”
Reviews.Author: Superturtle
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Hugh bathroom. Overall a very good hotel to explore barcelona if you don't mind taking the metro, which is not a probelm really.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndriasMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the last night of our tour in Spain. We love it...It was very clean and very close to the airport. The staff gave great information and was very helpful. The room was large and room service was good also. We would stay there again if wie travel back to Barca

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but no spotless service”
Reviews.Author: prever
Reviews.Content: Check in was quickly and the staff was very friendly. I booked two superior rooms and had it upgraded to executive rooms short before my stay. The only difference between superior and executive is that the executive rooms are on the upper floors (I think 18 to 22). I had to pay € 12,00 per room per night for the upgrade and I found this acceptable because the higher your room is, the more spectacular the views are. They gave us two corner rooms on the 21st floor and I think we had the most magnificent view we have ever had in a hotel. We could even see the magic fountains on Plaza Espagna from our room and this was great. Breakfast is € 12,00 if you book it when checking in. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is very nice, with seperate toilet / bidet and a spacious shower. They also have a bath. I think the rooms have been refursbished not too long ago. Everything looked nice. However, soms small things need to be repaired (a broken lamp, a broken shelf in the shower and the airco in one of the rooms didn't work properly). Minor things that are not acceptable in a five star hotel, but in my opinion acceptable in a four star hotel. Although I think management could improve there service if they would check these things regularly. In one of the rooms we had a coffee tray with coffee, tea and a water cooker. In the other room there was no coffee tray and I had to ask for this two times and after that we only got a water cooker, soms coffee and one cup. Not a complete tray with tea, milk and two cups. Apperantly it was too difficult for the staff to understand that every room should have a complete tray. One room also had no slippers and no extra pillows. The other room had no floor towel. I think that, even in a four star hotel, these amenities should be present in every room. Housekeeping was also not perfect. The floors were not spotless clean and in the bath tub we found some hairs. After all, I think the hotel is nice, the staff is very polite (but not always professional) and the hotel and the rooms look nice. I think the most important reason to book this hotel is for its fabulous views. Therefor I would advise to book an executive room. The hotel is close to Sants Station so that's very comfortable traveling from and to the airport. Trains leave every half our and the journey takes about 25 minutes. Please beware of pickpockets. There are a lot of them and if we were not so keen on this, we would have been victims ourselves! So please be careful, keep your belongings close to your body and try to avoid too many people close to each other in the metro or touristic places.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful introduction to Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel and was very happy with the excellent service we received. The staff at reception was very polite, kind and helpful. Their service was superb; there was nothing to troublesome for them. Although it is rated 4 star, it should be at least 5 star as the level of service and quality of rooms etc is first class. The location is also excellent as it is 1 minute walk to the main train station Barcelona Sants and it is so convenient to catch a train to anywhere you want to go. We took the trains to Montserrat and Tarragona with no problems. I also went to the designer outlet on the local train and then bus to the village, also no problems. Just ask the front desk, they are always willing to help. The only disappoint is the use of sauna and swimming pool which is chargeable. Whilst I understand the charge for sauna, I feel the use of swimming pool in a 4 star hotel should not be chargeable. That would be my only complaint. Still we did not have time to use the pool or sauna as we were too busy out and about all day everyday. There is so much to see and do in Barcelona. At the end of the day, though, it would have been nice to be able to take a quick dip in the pool to cool off as it was very hot while we were there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, clean, good place to stay where you will be treated with the utmost respect and kindness and all at very reasonable prices. My husband and I can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay. Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Manoja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the business district of Barcelona and not really walking distance to main areas of interest. The front desk is modest and quite busy at all times. On arriving, we were offered the breakfast special which was 12 Euro per person for full cooked breakfast. We took this option- to our regret. The staff at the front desk are friendly and speak English well. The room was basic, but with good views over Barcelona and a good sized bathroom.
