This was supposed to be an 'Executive Floor" but the rooms were not to that level by any means. The bed was not of good standard either and was quite cheap compared to others on our trip. The walls were also very thin and noise easily travelled. The housekeeping was very ambivalent. One day we arrived to find our old towels on the floor and none replaced, other days there were cleaning products left behind and one day there was absolutely no toilet paper left in the bathroom. The concierge told up that he would make a booking at a particular restaurant for us, and would go home without doing so. The breakfasts were terrible. We often found the hot food, non existant or inedible as it was greasy or cold. We would arrive into the area to find no clear tables with dishes stacked up and the staff telling us to sit anywhere...The water for tea and coffee was often luke warm. We do not advise you to get the breakfast specials. They had a business centre with reasonable internet charges, no free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “5 star in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: lucylou28
Reviews.Content: I can not sing the praises of this hotel highly enough. I loved every minute of my stay. Staff were brilliant. Rooms were fantastic. Service was first class. Loved the breakfasts. Location is spot on in my opinion linked via the station opposite to pretty much every where. Spa was great. Pool was fun. Would absolutely stay there again and recommend this hotel to everyone just brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: BeezTraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Barcelona for the 1st leg of our 2 week vacation we checked into the Gran Torre and our suite on the 18th floor. Other reviews mentioned how great the view is from the higher floors, and they were correct. The view from our suite was great. We had a very large bathroom and the sleeping area was very nice. The bed was firm, as all beds in Spain. It was difficult to get the room really cool, but that wasn't that big of an issue. The staff at the Gran Torre were wonderful, we arrived without any luggage and they helped us find the closest supermarket and shopping area so we could purchase some essentials. They also helped us with the airport and communicating when trying to find our luggage. The location is literally right next to the Sants train station, which is convientient for trains and metro access, but it was quite far from any sight seeing and cafes. We will look for a hotel in a different location on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: g_do
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, and I'm glad to say I agree with everyone else. The hotel is clean and modern, with amazing views and an impressive breakfast. We booked an ultra-cheap rate that didn't include breakfast, but springing for the breakfast once was worth the 16 Euros. The room was HUGE for a European hotel room. Great location outside of the hubbub of the old city, but very much in the city, with lots of public transportation options right outside. Plus, I can't believe how quiet our room was. Plus getting to the airport in a half hour for less than a Euro (if you buy a 10-trip ticket) is a bonus. It's rare that you find something that really seems expensive when it was really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Highly Recommended. Book now!”
Reviews.Author: filthiestfish
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my girlfriend for her birthday and decided to treat her to a short holiday in Barcelona so I looked on Tripadvisor for a good but inexpensive hotel in the city. The Gran Torre Catalunya is just that and at around 90 Euros a night for the two of us, it proved to be excellent value. We booked 2 nights directly with the hotel via their website, on a room only basis. I emailed the hotel to find out if they could surprise my girlfriend and they were most happy to arrange for a small cake and a card to be given to her free of charge! When we arrived at the hotel we were given a choice of 2 rooms: one on the 5th floor and one on the 7th floor. We chose the 7th floor room as it was much bigger and offered a better view of the city. Although it was a smoking room, it did not smell of tobacco at all, so I think that they perfume it well when cleaning. I thoroughly recommend breakfast on the 19th floor as it has everything that you can imagine (hot items like bacon and sausage, cereals, cold meats, smoked salmon and even torta Espanyola) plus it offers a great opportunity to take spectacular camera shots of the city. You can get a cheaper rate if you book it via the reception staff. It may still seem expensive, but if you eat enough at breakfast time then you can skip lunch and have some tapas at dinner time. For tapas the best place to go is "Ciudad Condal"-2 mins walk from Plaza Catalunya Metro stop. It has amazing tapas and friendly staff and it is always busy! We made use of the sauna and swimming pool facilities at a cost of 6 euros each. These were fine although the swimming pool and gym are very small, so it makes for an intimate experience with other couples. If you feel like relaxing after a long day of sight-seeing then I recommend the experience as it is open until around 10pm. The hotel staff were all genuinely friendly and engaging and asked us about our stay, during the check-out process. They even took care of our bags whilst we went out to do sight-seeing on our last day. I noticed that the restaurant staff on the 19th floor were not wearing name badges and I think that these would be useful for them to be identifiable to guests. We would strongly recommend this hotel to all travellers as it is very affordable luxury, and it is only about 4 metro stops away from the centre. It has magnificent views of the city, and friendly, helpful staff. As others have said, It is also very easy to get to from the airport. Some advice about safety in Barcelona: It is better to keep all your Euros and bank cards in the room's safety box and only carry the money that you will be needing on the day, as pickpocketing is rife here. We did not carry a wallet or purse and kept our money in several pockets. Bags should be carried on your front and be aware of your surroundings at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: theF1glam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to "Barcelona Sants" train/metro station. When you exit the station, you will see the tall building on the right. It only takes literally 1 minute to walk there. You can get to all the tourist attractions by metro and the system is extremely easy to use. The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. I kept asking a lot of questions to the same front desk staff at different times of the 2 days that I stayed there, she was always smiley and helpful and answered all my questions! The walls are very thin though, as you can hear your next door neighbors going in and out of their room. Other than that, everything is pretty nice. The room is spacious, clean and the view is nice. Although the bed isn't very soft, it's still not bad. You get toothbrush/toothpaste, razar, etc. that you don't always get from other hotels. There is a free lounge area on the top floor which is a really nice place to hang out with fantastic views of the city. The hotel has a business center where you can use their computers to go online. The first 5 minutes is free then it's like 3.5 euro for 15 minutes. There is a pool but I think it's like 8 euro to use. Barcelona isn't my favorite city but if I ever go back, I'd stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Monkeytose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Gran Torre for 5 nights. We were very pleased with our stay there. The hotel staff is VERY friendly and helpful!! They took time to explain answers to every question we had, they mailed our postcards, told my husband where to get a haircut, etc. I am glad that we did not stay at a hotel right on La Rambla because it is a very busy area with lots of noise. The location of Gran Torre was perfect because it was far enough away from the hustle bustle of La Rambla, but right on the metro, Sants Estacio, which the train from the airport also comes through (train stop is a different name - Barna Sants - but same station) - so it was really easy to get to all of the major points of interest in Barcelona. We stayed in room 1618, it was a corner room, and a lot bigger than all the other ones. It was a very clean hotel, free to use the safe, and the breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor is fabulous... but it is very expensive. I recommend you eat there at least the first day though, to start your trip off right. We were very pleased with this hotel. The friendly and knowledgeable staff made it very nice!

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in returning to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ForceTranquille2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, clean comfortable rooms with super views, no noise from outside,buffet breakfast plenty of food, even had rice cakes great for me (Coeliac disease) The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the Visual restaurant had amazing views. Next to the metro and bus station. Turistic bus connection nearby. Efficiently run.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location and Buffet!”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: Away from more tourist part of town, this hotel is right next to the metro station! It was so easy getting everywhere we wanted too. There are local restaurants near by and little shops which are cute to check out. We stayed in a suite and loved it. Every day new shampoo and conditioner bottles. Tons of channels on the TV. I would definitely recommend the breakfast buffet! That was the bast part about the hotel. My husband and I to save money ate a huge breakfast and skip lunch The restaurant where we ate the buffet in the morning had the best views of the city! Full panoramic views and very romantic. Great service in the entire hotel. Rent a scooter, best way to see the entire city in one day!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to fall after a hard trip”
Reviews.Author: HGauthier
Reviews.Content: After my friend had a horrible horse back riding accident in the countryside, we continued onto Barcelona as planned since she couldn't fly yet. We had an enormous Executive Room with two LARGE twin beds, and an amazing view (two floor-to-ceiling windows) which offered a nice "nest" for her to get some much needed quiet rest. We had robes and slippers, a HUGE marble bathroom with double sinks, marble floors, etc. It was everything the website promised and more. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke beautiful English. It is conveniently located across from Sants Estacio, a major train and metro station. It doesn't matter that you're not in the middle of the city, because you can be there within 5 minutes on the metro. Our rooms were about $130 USD a night and worth at least double that in my opinion. I can't believe what a great deal we got! GREAT HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Grand torre a Grand experience”
Reviews.Author: Dannyboy65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Torre for three nights using the Romantic getaway package. The hotel could be easily located from the Sants rail station, ( no need to go all the way to Placa Catalunya). It is a humonguous structure and looks tired. But on entry the impression is totally different as the reception area is well equipped and the Staff speaks excellent English which is a big plus. The check in was swift with proper explanation about how to negotiate the city etc. The room was huge and clean with good TV channels including Sky, CNN and BBC. The breakfast at the roof top was excellent and the view amazing. The rooms are clean and shower area excellent. Only one draw back..the bathroom doors donot have a lock system, so anyone can walk through and catch you with your pants down..could be embarrasing if you are travelling in a group and with children. For the price that I paid I will return to the Gran Torre...it was blissful.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Suite, you won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: MagnumSauna
Reviews.Content: For the end of our Barcelona Sitges trip, I booked a Junior Suite for about 150 Euros at this hotel. What a deal: high up on the 18th floor, we could see all the mountain range including Tibidabo, the Sagrada Famila and the Cucumber. Great views during the day, great views at night.. And the staff is nice and helpful. The checkout girl even asked if we had enjoyed our stay - something I have not been asked for years. They also had a breakfast buffet deal (don't know if its only for the junior suite takers) for 12 euros per person in their restaurant on top with even better views. If you want to impress your mate, you won't go wrong here and compared to other prices I have seen for Barcelona four stars, this is a really good deal. As for the suite, it's very big: one sitting room with tv, siting corner and big table, one bedroom with tv, a water closet, a huge bathroom with two sinks, a shower and a separate bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, even if the location isn't ideal”
Reviews.Author: cbearden714
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip to Spain and spent the final 2 nights in Barcelona at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya. Let me begin with the only real drawback this hotel had: Location. Barcelona is a massive, sprawling city, and unfortunately for the hotel, while it is extremely convenient to Sants Station (which allows you to take a train from the airport to the hotel), it's quite a walk to the historical areas of the city and from most of the nice shops / restaurants. Yes, there is a metro stop very close by which makes traveling to those areas pretty convenient, but since we were only in Barcelona for a couple of days, we wish that we had been a little closer to the "action" -- maybe on a street like Gran Via. Also, the area around the hotel looks largely residential and primarily as if it were built in the 1960's-1970's, not as nice in aesthetic appeal as the streets in the more "touristy" parts of Barcelona. Also, I'm not positive, but I believe that the metro stops running around 2:00 AM on weeknights (which is still early in Spain), so if you wanted to enjoy Barcelona's nightlife in a spot that's distant from the hotel, you'd likely need to get a taxi back. That being said, our overall stay at this hotel was excellent. The room decor was basic, slightly modern I suppose. The bathroom was very nice, with two sinks, a fog/steam resistant mirror, and a shower that had great pressure. The room had an ironing board and you could request an iron, if needed. We didn't watch tv really, but I did see that there were 4-5 English speaking stations (which was the most of any hotel we stayed at during our trip). Also, there was a mini-fridge in the room (complete with Cava!). We were on the 11th floor with a nice view of the Montjuic area...we did see the room next to ours, which was a corner room with double the amount of windows and therefore a phenomenal view --- if available, request one of the corner rooms for a truly outstanding view. The breakfast service that the hotel provides on the 23rd floor restaurant was great (and is discounted to 12 Euros per person, rather than 16 Euros, at the hotel's front desk upon check in), offering good food and great, panoramic views of the city. Dinner at the restaurant (named Visual) in the evening was also very nice and enjoyable. Finally, the one thing I was most impressed with at this hotel was the level of service by the staff. Our check-in was flawless and extremely informative (given a map of the city and some basic directions to key sites / metro stations, details on the best deals on the metro, details of the hotel's services, etc.), and upon check out the receptionist even sold us postage for our postcards and said that she would take care of stamping & mailing them out. Also, I was able to use the business center free of charge to check my email and log in to our airline site to print our boarding passes for our flight out of Barcelona at the end of our trip -- again, great service. For the great value (booked on Expedia at $102 per night) and impeccable level of service, I'm not sure that you could find many better hotels in Barcelona (despite the slightly distanced location from the best sights).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and city break”
Reviews.Author: discopants73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay At Barca.Had a great time,room was clean ,spacious and walk in shower was the most powerful I have ever used.Room was on the 15th floor and the views were great.Restaurant meals are really good and being on the 23rd floor the views of the city at night were spectacular.Staff did all they could to make your stay pleasurable and were very helpful.We read the reviews on Barcelona before we travelled and felt a tad apprehensive about all the stories of pickpockets and the like but have to say we never once felt intimidated or encountered any problems.We made use of the metro sytsem buying a T10 ticket for 6-8 euros and you can reach any area in 10 to 15 minutes from the hotel.All in all we had a great time and fully recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel just one 5 minute train ride from central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: liamneary
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our week-long stay. The trains were very frequent and convenient with the train station 100 yards from the hotel.The views of the city are fabulous. We upgraded on arrival to the 16th out of 22 floors for an extra 12 Euro per night and were delighted! We got a deal with the breakfast included and we were very happy with the food providedThe executive rooms were very spacious. The view from the rooftop restaurant is stunning. Internet access is very expensive at 4.50 for an hour or 10 Euro for 24 hours. It is a hotel designed for the business person but it was a pleasure to stay there as a tourist. The rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Mcdude82
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Torre Catalunya Hotel. My wife and I spent three nights there and did not want to leave. The hotel is not in the central tourist area (like Las Ramblas), but you are within walking distance of the Metro and Main Sans Bart train station and have easy access to the entire city. Upgrade to a deluxe room, the views are worth it and the rooms are quieter. The breakfast was fantastic and would recommend it, was worth every euro. The staff was great and extremely friendly. Also, getting from the airport to the hotel was no problem with the train, it literally stops at the hotel door. We loved Barcelona and the Torre Catalunya!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: antartoo
Reviews.Content: We had an executive room on the 14th floor, clean and comfortable, the view was good. The breakfast was excellent although not included in the price (16 euros per person + tax). We checked-in early at 9am and they had a room for us already. The staff were very friendly and helpful providing us travel information. We chose this hotel for our last 2 days in Barcelona so that we could go to the airport easily from the Sants train station. And the metro is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good service considering it was Spain”
Reviews.Author: rivenmyst137
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say outright that the dismal service in Spain (both Madrid and Barcelona) drove me insane. I have low standards and the Spaniards did a remarkable job of not living up to them. That said, the Catalunya did try. We upgraded for an extra 10 euro a night to a higher corner room with windows on two sides. It was beautiful. The only problem was that the air conditioning was broken. We called, and they did their best to find us another similar room, which they did 4 floors down. That was also lovely, except the internet connection didn't work. When we told them this, they sent the bellhop to try to fix it. Yes, the bellhop. Once he finally believed me that it was not a problem with my computer, they collectively shrugged that there was nothing they could do since it was a weekend. So, I had to go without internet access. For the amount I was paying, the internet really should have worked. But, other than that, it was a perfectly lovely hotel. I just don't like Spain. :) Oh, and the restaurant (on the top floor) is highly recommended. Pricey for dinner but worth it, and the breakfast was arguably the best part of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobertnNYC
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of favorable reviews and location next to the Sants train station, since I was dropping a rental car there, and it was a convenient spot to catch the train to the airport. I made reservations on the hotel website, which offered the best rate. During my trip I found the need to arrive a day earlier, and the hotel graciously gave me the same preferred internet rate for the extra night. The proximity to the train station might be considered a negative to some, train stations often being located in marginal areas, but this is not at all the case. The hotel’s location is a bit removed from the action, for example a healthy 40 minute walk to the Gothic Quarter. Barcelona’s metro system is very good, and the metro station is across the street from the hotel; it was not an issue for us. The hotel is a large, luxury property in wonderful condition; the rooms are nothing short of excellent. At 92 euros per night, we got excellent value. Beautiful bathrooms: great shower, separate bath tub, double sinks, and a “private” toilet area. The rooms had a writing table, chairs, ample closets, a safe, refrigerator, excellent climate controls (the air conditioning was on and forceful) and a large, comfy bed. The TV had two English speaking channels. The times we had to get information from the front desk staff or in the business center, they were cheerful, efficient and took time with us. On the one full day we had to tour Barcelona we had heavy rain, forcing us to stay at the hotel for dinner rather than braving the elements. The top floor dining room was lovely, and the meal was terrific. Prices for the food were hotel prices, but the quality was excellent. Their breakfast brunch was sumptuous. My research showed Barcelona’s hotels and even their hostals to be somewhat pricey. Perhaps booking well in advance for the smaller places might land you a better rate, but it’s a big city and you pay the big city price penalty. That being said, this hotel offered excellent quality and value, and we were thrilled with it.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel with fanatastic staff , close to metro and train station”
Reviews.Author: patnken
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of fellow trip advisors and were not dissapointed. when we arrived at the Hotel after a brief train journey from the airport (3 stops) we were warmly welcomed,we were given advice on where to go , what to see and when to see it. Nothing seemed to be to much trouble for the staff .all of whom were very friendly. I would recommend the breakfast buffet (12eu )as an excellent start to the day. The dinner at night was a little on the expensive side but its worth it when you see the views from the restaurant the rooom was large and spotless,bathroom was a good size with 2 basins, bath, walkin shower,toilet and bidet we used the metro to travel around town (a t-10 ticket is great value at 7.70 eu for 10 journeys and you can use it for train, trams) after we had taken the tour bus to try and get our bearings and decide what we wanted to visit (tour bus 21 eu for 1 day 27eu for 2 days) The only drawback on this holiday was when someone tried to pick pocket when I was at the bus stop, but whether it was luck, awareness or the fact that this guy was so bad a pickpocket nothing untoward occured . I will definately go back to Barcelona and will not hesitate to book theTorre Catalunya Hotel when I do so

Reviews.Title: “Totally unexpected but Fantasitc!”
Reviews.Author: Phicus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Torre Catalunya for 4 days in Nov 2007 with collegues for business meetings. I arrived and saw that we were directly across the road from the central regional & Metro station...Transport..Easy...A porter welcomed me whisked my bags and, announced me to the receptionist. I wasn't expecting all 5 stars but I got them. The room is large enough and, well equipped. The beds were comfortable & the housekeeping service exceptional The Desk is set up against the window so you can lok out. Why do other 5 stars face you away from the view? The Bathroom had double sinks & Water temp & Pressure fine. Breakfast is a usual breakfast buffet but done on the top floor in what becomes their modern Spanish/Fine Dining Restaurant at night. Great way to have your first coffee of the day looking our over Barcelona to the Sagrada Familia. At Night the view is amazing too and so is the food expensive but worth it. There is also a bar/restaruant on the ground floor which has more reasonable options, only dined here for lunch in between meetings but found it good value. The Meeting space is downstairs so very quiet away from the street which is good, AV is fine but took a while to get internet working but once it was it was fast and uninterrupted. Overall it is a great hotel and, there are some great local neighbourhoods to explore around. There is a fantastic supermarket directly below the hotel if you like a little Jamon the fridge (or a spare bottle of water). You can also get the metro just outside the door to anywhere you may want to visit on your sightseeing trips. Loved it..

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MattVienna_VA
Reviews.Content: Convenient from airport (< 3 Euro / person) within 1/2 block of Estacio Sants. On two metro lines - one direct to Las Ramblas. Had a superior level room w/ coffee and B-robes on 15th floor. No noise, clean, nice neighborhood. Did not use hotel restaurant but view on 23rd floor is very nice. Metro tickets available via 10 trip cards which can be used by multiple travelers. Swipe in - depart at destination. All trips same price. Cost 7.7 Euro. Very convenient. Old Barcelona is walkable with lots of interesting streets and alleys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrskrska33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights prior to picking up a cruise ship. Received an excellent check-in service - staff very welcoming. Was offered a free room upgrade to a high floor so we could enjoy the magnificent view over the city. They discount the buffet breakfast (excellent buffet) for residents - and you eat breakfast looking out over the city from their rooftop restaurant. High level floor meant we could not hear the street noise. Do NOT be tempted to sample their 'Taster' selection from the dinner menu in the rooftop restaurant. Whilst the food was superb (cost was approx 36 euro) the amount of food served in each course of this 'taster' wouldn't satisfy a budgie! Main 'Sants' station is opposite the hotel - and the open-topped hop on - hop off tour buses for tourists stop at the back of this station. So great location too. Great hotel - would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ..but you have to pay to use the pool!”
Reviews.Author: pishadeperro
Reviews.Content: This hotelis fantastic but charging 6 euros to use the poll in a 4* hotel is cheap....I'll not stay again on priciple

Reviews.Title: “So Glad I Found This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bron-Yr-Aur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early April 2009 and couldn't have been more pleased. Booked through Expedia, got a good rate. The multilingual staff was extremely friendly and helpful, really made the stay a pleasure. The room was not especially large but was quite comfortable, clean, and presentable every day. The bathroom was amazing... double sinks, bidet, large shower and tub with excellent water pressure, always a much appreciated amenity. The spa area is small but pleasant, worth the 6 Euro price, and the business center has fast net access and free printing. The view from the 23rd floor restaurant cannot be missed, especially at night. The dinner menu is pricey; go up for a drink before your evening out if you prefer. I do recommend catching the morning buffet breakfast at least once, again, the view is great, food is worth it too. The supermarket next door has good selection, we grabbed a few items of late night drinks or snacks, and the refridgerator in room has space to keep your perishables. If you are concerned about the location being too far from Las Ramblas, don't be. The hotel is directly across from Estacio Sants, through which run the Green and Blue metro lines. Las Ramblas is 5 stops away, about a 5-6 minute ride. Estacio Sants also provides easy access to and from El Prat airport via the train, about a 30min ride for 2.50 Euros. Pick up a T-10 ticket for metro rides, good value and its transferable. Hotel is also about a 10 min walk from the Montjuic magic fountains, a show that should not be missed. Catch the last one of the day, it looks best when it's dark. As far as entertainment, the whole city is within your reach via the metro. Ramblas is the big draw at night, great fun to just stroll along, eat some tapas, stop for some wine or cava and people-watch at an outdoor cage. Placa Reall is especially fun for an afternoon bite. The Barri Gotic is a great maze of narrow streets and a myriad of shops, great fun to wander. We mainly stuck to small cafes for our meals, but did have a nice dinner at Attic, about halfway up Ramblas, which I would recommend. If you are trying to save money or just get tired of eating ham on crusty bread, try one of the kebab shops. Other don't-miss attractions include La Sagrada Familia, Parc Guell, the 1992 Olympic grounds, and Monserrat. The Torre Catalunya makes an excellent base for any Barcelona adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect...”
Reviews.Author: arinez02
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through trip advisor and we are thankful. I booked a double room via internet just the previous day of our travel. The hotel has many rooms and may also be a solution for last minute travelers. We flew with the excellent airline vueling and arrived at Barcelona at 5 in the morning. At our arrival at the hotel I just asked the reception to leave the luggage till 12, and they offered to give us a room immediately with no charge. Moreover, as there was not a room with a double bed at the moment, they told us that we would be able to change room at 12 midday, as we did! We stayed there for 7 days and the staff were very polite and helpful at all our requests. The room(s) were excellent, modern and very clean. One of the main attractions of the hotel is the 23rd floor restaurant, where we had magnificent breakfasts with breathtaking city view. The location of the hotel is excellent, just 100 meters from the metro and from the central train station (ideal for excursions). I don't recommend the hotels near Rambla and barrio Gotico, as we saw most of them are old and in very noisy environment. All the above, for 94 euro per night, gave us one of our best vacations. We strongly recommend Torre Catalunya. Aris and Alkisti, from Athens, Greece

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perfect Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Foodie26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while we were in Barcelona and couldn't have been happier. We arrived jet-lagged and exhausted at about 10:00 in the morning (BTW--the hotel is right across the street from the central train station Estacio Sants and if you take the Aerobus from the airport it is only 4.25 Euro and drops you off in front of the train station, so all you have to do is walk across the street to get to the hotel) and the extremely professional and courteous staff were able to get us into a room right away. The staff at this hotel are wonderful. We dealt a lot with Alessandro at the front desk, and I have never met a more professional, knowledgeable, and courteous front desk clerk. He gave us a very detailed map and pointed us in the direction of everything we could possibly want to see in the city, and let us know about the free events going on in the city as well. The clerk at the business center was very nice, too. If you're worried about speaking Spanish, don't worry. All the front desk clerks and business center personnel we dealt with spoke flawless English. Now, let me tell you about the room...we paid 80 Euro a night and were put on the 16th floor with AMAZING views of Barcelona. The room was humongous! It had to be 1000 square feet--everything was done in that very chic minimalist decor, which looked great and the room was spotless. The bathroom was huge, with two sinks, a separate shower, separate tub, separate toilet, and separate bidet. We never heard any of our neighbors and although it's by the train station, we never heard any noise at night. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but there is a grocery store right by the hotel and you can put your perishables in the small refrigerator in the room. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. You are right across from the Metro, and La Rambla and the central part of the city is about 4 metro stops away. The only thing I regret about this place is having to leave...

Reviews.Title: “Clea hotel/Easy access to metro system”
Reviews.Author: evslee1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for a short break over the easter period. Staff were friendly and helpful, and on arrival provide a map and detailed explanation on what to see and how to get there. Hotel is ideally located near the Barcelona Sants train station that takes you to the airport and also the metro system which is cheap and easy to use. A must for seeing the sites cheaply and quickly. The rooms were very clean, large and I recommend staying on as high a floor as possible in order to experience the fabulous views of the city. Some minor repair work was needed in the shower area but that was it, very pleased overall.Didn't go to the restaurant so can't comment on that. Would recommend this hotel, which although not central to the main sites, makes them accessible due to the train station located just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to visit the city Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lynx06
Reviews.Content: Because of all the positive reviews mentioned in Tripadvisor, we had booked this hotel for a long weekend (April 3rd-6th). We had booked a superior room, but we learned that due to the fact that no superior rooms were available in that weekend, they had booked for us a junior suite for the same price ! The room was on the 11th floor (we had asked in our reservation if we could have a room at the 11th floor or higher because less noise of other guests and the view over the city) The size of the junior suite, the bed, the bathroom: very much to our liking ! Staff of the hotel was very helpful, the subway is indeed very nearby the hotel and easy to get around Barcelona. We enjoyed every morning our breakfast at the hotel, and on our last evening we enjoyed our drinks at the loungebar. If we ever return to visit Barcelona, this hotel would again be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous Rooms, Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: tjb42
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel in the early evening and the front desk couldn't have been more helpful. Moments after entering our room, the front desk even called to make sure everything was acceptable. The room was enormous. It has a very modern feel to it, however it's the modern look of the late 90's. It's very clean, a lot of wood panelling, huge windows affording gorgeous views. Large TV (not flat screen) housed in wood panelling along with CD player/radio. The bathroom was all marble, with frosted glass doors on a stand alone shower and seperate room for toilet and bidet. The tub was larger than average, and there were his and hers sinks, always a nice touch. The beds were clean and comfortable, however it was two twin beds pushed together to make a King and there was no matress topper connector, so we sort of fell through the crack a bit a couple times during the night (not great for romance). The location is very convenient. It is immediately outside the entrance to the main train station in Barcelona (Sants Estacion) which is also a metro stop and the hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Plaza Espana at the bottom of Mount Jeuc and the fountain show each night. Overall, the hotel staff were excellent, the room spacious and clean, and the location was convenient. A terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and employees”
Reviews.Author: cliew
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Spain and I found the employees at the front lobby very helpful. I was only there for 4 days and had the best time. The place is modern and very clean - and you have a great view of the surrounding area. My room overlooked the front of the hotel on the 11th floor. The beds were okay - although I preferred a more comfortable bed...but I had found the service great all around. And it's only a block away from the Barcelona Sant's metro! The only negative thing was that I could hear people walking in the hallway - I think it needs to have more sound -proof walls.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the edge on things”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterSean
Reviews.Content: Rooms good size. Location excellent for metro and trains to the airport. Breakfast good value and with excellent views. Would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ball_Mom_4
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel a little tired. The quality of the rooms and bath rooms could do with a good re-furbishing. The staff could not have been more helpful. It would unfair to criticize the hotel too much as we had a pleasant stay aside from the noise coming from the hallways and the outside. They need to noise proof the rooms otherwise we had a nice stay for the last few days we had before we returned home. The walks to the La Rambles and surrounding areas was very pleasant and the hotel was very close to the bus/train station for those that choose to ride rather than walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and clean!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain65
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect. We took the Aerobus from and to the airport. Coming from the airport we were the second to last stop, but the trip couldn't have been 20 minutes. Going to the airport there was only one stop after us, then off to the airport. at 4.50 Euros I felt it was a good bargain. I chose this place because of it's location. Not far from the airport, with a subway station out front, which will take you anywhere in the city. We found the subway very easy to navigate. I would never try to drive a car in this city. Too many people with too few parking spots. For us, the subway was the way to go. The hotel was probably one of the cleanest I have ever been in. Very modern, but extremely comfortable. I found an early booking deal on their website for 110.00 euros which included breakfast. I thought that was reasonable. Upon arrival they threw in a few more goodies, because we booked online. The people in reception were wonderful. As were the rest of the employees we encountered. While checking in she pulled out a map, showed us the highlights of the city. We mentioned we would be using the subway. She advised us to get the T-10 and to watch for pick pocketers. She says everyday they hear stories of people getting there wallet stolen. People be careful. We received a corner room on the 10th floor, so we had views in 2 directions. The room was large. As was the bathroom. Biggest shower I have ever been in. FYI about the bathroom lights. After a day of touristing, we came back to the hotel and the bathroom lights wouldn't work. They were working earlier in the day. So we finally called reception and the promptly sent someone up. Turns out there is a seperate switch to the lights on the outside of the bathroom. Once that is on the light switch in the bathroom will work. The switch was hidden behind the door. Just wanted to mention that in case someone else has the same problem. The breakfast was wonderful. Plenty to choose from. It was cloudy and rainy the days we were there, but I'm sure the views are great on a sunny day. We also had dinner in the lounge both nights. By time we came back from running around town, we were too tired to go look for somewhere else to eat. They have a small menu, but the food was good and reasonable. If I ever go back to Barcelona, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay close to all the action!”
Reviews.Author: aet83
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel right off of the Tarragona Metro stop and is less than 10 Euro by taxi to the center of the city. The staff are very helpful and friendly; setting the tone for a comfortable stay. The rooms are spacious and clean with great panoramic views of the city, mountains, and sea. Staying on La Ramblas puts you right in the middle of the action but this is definitely a more relaxing, peaceful option.

Reviews.Title: “Higly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Katwomaaan
Reviews.Content: We spend last Christmas 5 nights in Gran Torre Hotel and we had a great time. The recepionists were very friendly and helpful! In the beginning we had decided not to have breakfast in the hotel, but there was a special offer for 10euros per person, so we changed our minds. The breakfast was perhaps the best experience in the hotel. Nice buffet with a perfect view in the last floor of the hotel. The rooms were quite big and very clean. As it was our honeymoon, the hotel manager was so kind to offer us a bottle of champaign and a chocolate cake! The location is ok. Within one minute walking you can get the metro and go to the city center. And also very close to the airport. Although the hotel was not very cheap for our budget, I believe that it is a good value for the city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: stdnbr
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, and central, with an excellent front desk staff. If you book online, you save considerably on the room rate.The rooms are large and very clean. Cava is available with the Sunday morning breakfast buffet. The front desk staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the city transportation system, (Metro, buses and trains). An excellent starting point for getting around Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location O.K.”
Reviews.Author: AuroraUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night recently before taking a cruise. Location is good, direct rail link from the airport to Sants Staion. The hotel is located directly outside the station and also convenient for the metro ti the Ramblas etc. We used the 10 ticket card but we also walked to place Catalunya and it took us about 40 mins. As others have said there is some road noise but it did not bother us. the hotel is in a mainly business district but would have no bother using this for a longer stay for sightseeing. The rooftop restaurant for breakfast gives some fantastic views over Barcelona depending on where you are seated. We found all the staff to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value- highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Dol123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money. The restaurant was great. Breakfast filled you for teh whole day. The rooms were cleaned daily and were spotless. There was some road noise ( we were on floor 9). However, this did not distract from our stay. I would stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it. It was not in the most central part of the city but the metro was easy to use and you could be on the ramblas in 10 to 15 minutes from hotel room to actually being on the Ramblas....easy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very practical and a great value”
Reviews.Author: tommco
Reviews.Content: Hotel Torre Catalunya is a very practical choice and a great value, especially if you want to be near the train station. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, although I found the style a little too cold and businesslike. The beds were comfortable and it was quiet at night. The staff was super-friendly and ready to help. The breakfast buffet, although not free, is great, with a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, No Staff concern for guest needs”
Reviews.Author: LondonEthan
Reviews.Content: We were recently on a short 3 day stay at the hotel at the back end of December. The hotel was comfortable, but as a leisure traveller, not in the most ideal of locations but being from London could still live with the easy commute. All was fine until the last day of our stay when we checked out and left our bags locked away near reception from some last minute sightseeing. During that day we had the very unfortunate pleasure of losing our travel wallets with all of ur passports, VIsa's etc. Getting to the airport, i call the Hotel and speak to the frontdesk who tell me that someone had called the hotel and told the staff that they had found it. At that time the hotel still had our bags but proceeded to tell this good samaritan that we had already left and that they should merely take it to their nearest police station. The person's contact details were not taken, the area in which he was making the call from was not noted, so I ran around Barcelona from one police station to the next trying to find this person. The hotel made no real effort to assist and after missing our flight back home, I was trying to make several calls back to the hotel to get some more information or assistance from any of the scarce managers. Needless to say that this assistance never materialised. If there is anyone on this website that has had a similar experience, it would be great to get some advice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twentysomething09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 4th - 8th February and had a great time. The hotel is in an ideal location - 15 minutes by train from the airport to Sants station (buy a T10 ticket which is 10 journeys for 7.70 euros). The hotel is right outside the station. The staff were very helpful - providing maps, directions and which platforms to use at the train station. We received a free upgrade from a standard room on the 8th floor to an executive room on the 11th floor. The bathroom was fantastic with a very powerful walk in shower. The room was ideal with a flat screen TV. The occasional ambulance / traffic could be heard during the night but nothing that would keep you awake all night. The hotel staff left a birthday cake and card in the room on the night of my birthday which was a nice gesture. I would recommend visiting the restaurant on the top floor - we didn't eat at the restaurant but the panoramic views of the city were fabulous. We have already recommended this hotel to family members who have booked a trip later this year.

Reviews.Title: “31 Jan - 4 Feb 09 Would recommend - little noisy, but thats Barcelona in general”
Reviews.Author: CJMLiverpool
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights. views are fantastic from the rooms and the restaurant (on the top floor) the breakfast is fantastic, choice of cooked breakfast, fruits, fish, cheese, cold meats, breads all sorts - definitely set you up for the day. room was very clean and bed made daily. only negative comment would be the noise outside but i have visited Barcelona 4 times and stayed in different hotels - you cant avoid the noise!!! recommended for the transport links - station is across the road - perfect. would recommend Divers shop on the station for supplies, sell everything! the hotel SPA is great too. 6 Euros for a whole days access (can visit more than once)...great facilities in the SPA. generally give the hotel a 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with the noise !”
Reviews.Author: AndreiFilipache
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights for the New Year's Eve. Overall the hotel is ok. It doesn't look exactly like a 4 star one, probably 3*, but it's clean and the stuff is very nice. The reception desk and the rooms furniture is a little bit old, but generally the rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are nice, very clean and modern. Good location-just in front of the Metro Station (Sants Estacio station - just 5 station-7 minutes to La Rambla). + The panaroma from the roof top restaurant is amazing. - The noise: we stayed at the 4th floor and I couln't sleep all night long because of the street noise. I heard all the buses and ambulance until the early morning. Good advice: if you choose this hotel, ask for those floors over 10. Don't accept the lower floors, even if you pay a little bit extra. It works. The view of the city is fantastic over 10 and the noise is lower.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: RHBCumbria
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights over Christmas. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Views from the Hotel are fantastic. The room was spacious with an excellent bathroom. Very handy for Sants Station, but the hotel is not in the Centre. I communicated with the Hotel by email and found the whole experience most enjoyable. The breakfast was of a high order and the views from the top floor magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: judith-fran
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and thought it was great. Here are some key points - It is so easy to get to from airport just get train directly to Barcelona Sants and its just opposite the station -Its 6 metro stops on the green line into Placa Catalunya the main area in Barcelona - Its very quiet at the hotel only noise as mentioned was the odd ambulance - We walked one day into La Ramblas which only took 30 mins and is a nice stroll. - Pay the extra for the executive suite the view is amazing we were on the 18th floor - Don't bother getting breakfast every morning ite expensive just go one morning to appreciate the view. -The room itself is big the bathroom is fab and the beds are very comfortable. If you stay here you'll enjoy it the price is so good for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: tesoroSpain
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 (two teenagers plus my niece and myself) rented 2 rooms on the 15th floor of this great hotel on December 28. Super-sized non-smoking rooms, wonderful bathroom, great sheets, towels, bathrobes and slippers. We had a view of the Tibidabo from our rooms.The 10 euro breakfast on the top floor with fantastic views of Barcelona was well worth the money. The rooms were 100 euros/night (plus taxes and extras) which I thought was reasonable. Helpful and polite staff. Offered maps and directions to my favorite tapas places (Cafeteria Cataluña and Ciudad Condal ) No noise at night except for the odd ambulance or police car. I was hesitant to book so far from the Ramblas/Gotico area, but then decided that if what I could afford was out of the Ramblas area, then it might as well be well-communicated via train or metro, hence the choice near the Sants station. We liked it so much that we went back to the hotel for their 13 euro, three course menu del dia in the lounge on the ground floor before leaving town. Great for travelers arriving by train, just a short walk across the plaza, but also good for those arriving by car from southern points as you just have to turn right off of Diagonal onto Numancia and go down a few blocks. No getting trapped in busy Barcelona traffic. The parking lot is under the hotel and there is a hefty daily fee, but that is normal in all hotels I called in Barcelona. This is a large, contemporary hotel, so if you are looking for quaint, typically Spanish style, you might try elsewhere. It was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here February 2008 for 4 nights. After arriving at the Airport we got a train to Sants station. This was very cheap and takes about 15 mins. On exiting the station we could see the hotel straight in front of us so this was very handy. You cannot miss it as there is a large neon Sony sign at the top. The hotel staff were very friendly and courteous and we were given a very large, comfortable and clean room. The best part about the hotel is getting breakfast on the top floor. The views of Barcelona were amazing and we got many good pictures. Food was great with lots of variety. Being right next to the train station meant that getting around was easy. We used the Metro as our main means of transport. There were also city tour buses that frequently stopped outside the hotel and I would highly recommend doing the city tour as soon as possible after you arrive. My wife and I had a wonderful stay here and I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4* value”
Reviews.Author: Edna27
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Barcelona before so were really taking 'pot luck' when choosing a hotel. My research indicated that Barcelona hotels tended to the higher price range and I would normally have restricted my choice to the 3* hotels which I have always found more than adequate for a short sight-seeing holiday (after all we only sleep and have breakfast in them). In this case my return flight from Reus airport was early morning which meant that we had to be on the 0615 train to arrive in time. As I wanted to avoid travelling across Barcelona this early in the morning and risk missing the train I restricted my choice to hotels close to the Sants train station. The Gran Torre Catalunya is right on the station's doorstep and after visiting their website I took the plunge and booked into this 4* hotel, especially as the room rates were noticeably lower than the other Barcelona 4* hotels we viewed. We were not disappointed - it was everything the website implies. The staff were wonderful, the views over the City breathtaking and our standard room was extremely spacious and quite luxurious. The breakfast was absolutely amazing - held in the top floor panaromic restaurant and providing the widest choice of self-service food (cereals / English & /European breakfast / savouries) than any other European hotel we have stayed at. After breakfast we didn't even think about another meal until early evening! Despite the disastrous £ / euro exchange rate, the hotel was worth every penny and we would definitely use it again when we return to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite in BCN”
Reviews.Author: SweTraveller27
Reviews.Content: A new favourite hotel in Barcelona. Got a pretty good deal through the hotel website, an executive room, breakfast included for a total of EUR 147. Was happily surprised when I was upgraded to a Junior Suite (unfortunately only one night's stay there). Room on the 19th floor was spacious, had a big bathroom with separate shower, bath and double sinks. Separate work area, and living room area with a couch (possible to convert into an extra bed), TV and music center. And of course a fabulous view of the Montjüic mountain and Plaza Espanya. Breakfast was served on the 23rd floor and the food could easily match the views. A rich breakfast buffe with lots of cold cuts, fruits, hot items as well as all the necessities in a breakfast buffet. Staff courteous, helpful, and polite. Only downside was that internet did not work in my room (cable). Was offered another room but declined, used the wireless service in the lobby and business center instead. Got some coupons (1 hr free internet, complimentary drink, discount on spa treatments and parking) due to the fact that I had booked on the hotel website. Airport bus leaves every 10 minutes and stops outside of the hotel, a good choice (depending on time of day as traffic can be a bore in Barcelona). Barcelona Sants station is served by both long-distance trains as well as buses and metro. Recommend the metro, on time, clean and cool (the walks in the tunnels to the metro platforms are considerably hotter and can be looong). All in all, a very nice hotel which I will surely use next time in BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Torre catalunya”
Reviews.Author: delaneyPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three days spent in Barcelona at the Hotel Torre Catalunya. We booked an executive room which included robes, slippers and teas made, safe mine bar. The room and bathroom was lovely if I had one small criticism is that the room was a bit on the small side but the view from our room was superb. Transport links to the hotel were good just three stops from the airport to Barcelona Sants and as you left the station the hotel was right in front of you. The hotel could not have been easier to find. Transport links into Barcelona were good and I did not find it a disadvantage staying outside Barcelona. The bus touristic stop is not far away from the hotel. We purchased a T10 ticket which enables you to go on 10 journeys. We did not sample breakfast at the hotel we ate at the supermarket downstairs. Although we did venture up to the top floor to look round one night and it was very nice up there a wonderful view. All in all I enjoyed my time at Barcelona and would love to come back again and would not hesitate to stay at this hotel. Just one word I would not recommend the Barcelona Stadium tour unless you are a real fan. I thought it was rather expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a city break”
Reviews.Author: kkerr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at very short notice for a weekend break in Barcelona. It was easy to reach from the airport as there is a direct rail link from the airport to the railway/metro station just across the road from the hotel costing 2Euro70. It is also ideally situated for easy access into the centre/main tourist areas (5 mins by metro day or night). No hire car needed! The check in was efficient and friendly. The reception team also had some invaluable recommendations about which sites to see and good places to dine. Our room was clean, had a separate shower and bath with twin sinks. It was airconditioned and offered the usual TV, minibar, safe (free), CD/radio and ironing board. Robes and slippers were availabe on request. The higher rooms have better views although only 3rd floor rooms had balconies. The swimming pool was more of a spa pool - small and a little disappointing although still a nice way to relax tired legs after a day exploring. Breakfast is a buffet on the top floor of the hotel - great views so try to do it once during your stay. It costs 16euros but if you book the night before at reception it will only cost 10. If you are on a budget then there is a cafe in the station or at the supermarket to the left of the hotel which serves coffee/pastries etc. We did not have dinner in the hotel prefering to eat out. Note the restaurant operates a no jeans policy in the evening. Overall we were impressed with this hotel and would recommend it. Clean, friendly, efficient and ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: FartFinder
Reviews.Content: Great hotel fantastic views if you book exec upgrade(well worth it) and the room size is fantastic only minus is the bed was very hard.The reception was the most helpful I have ever experienced in Spain.Very nice bathroom and breakfast was very good with superb views all over the city as on the top floor. Gettting about great as bus touristic stops close by and only 4 stops on the metro to the Ramblas ONE BIG TIP when you visit sagrade la familier(sorry my spelling s a bit off) dont Q for an hour at the first lift you come to, to go up high there is another lift at the back where there is never more than a 5 minute Q

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, wonderful views, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Melissajane8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights last weekend. Lovely hotel with very helpful staff. Were upgraded to superior room on 19th floor. Views were amazing. Turn down service included. Easy access to all local attractions from nearby station, metro efficient and seemed safe. Breakfast was lovely in fantastic resturaunt with 360o view of Barcelona. Menu del Dias in lower floor bar was good value, three courses at 13.50 euros including bread and wine. Used the airport bus which runs every 6 mins to and from airport, to right outside hotel which was 4 euros each, little more expensive than the train, but a great tour of Barcelona. Would also thouroughly recommend the open top Bus Touristica, 20 euros each for one day, 26 for two, hop on hop off. Great for seeing everything when you don't have much time. Saved someone from pickpockets in an outside bar near the port, felt that street crime rate was high, and very little police presence. Not targeted ourselves, but we were extremely careful at all times. People we spoke to had been robbed in the streets or bars during our stay. Beautiful city, super hotel, but policing needs to be sorted if Barcelona wants to continue having as many tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with misinformation”
Reviews.Author: disappointed96
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya in Barcelona. We chose this hotel based on information we read in Frommer's "Barcelona" 2nd edition. Frommer's stated that this hotel had added extras such as "turn-down service, chocolates on the pillows" and "free parking" and an "indoor pool". The reality is that the hotel offered none of these services (and claimed they never had offered these extras) except for the indoor pool which Frommer's neglected to say was in their sister hotel next door. The hotel does not have a concierge but the front desk or business office will try to help you if they are not too busy. We gave them info about hiking in a town about 30 miles outside Barcelona and asked if they could contact the organization to help us set up this side trip. We wanted to do this on a Sunday. We were told that it was closed on Sunday but we could arrange it for Monday. Later we were told it was NOT open on Monday and also there was no way to get to this town (previously we were told we could take the train). It is one thing to not offer help in arranging activities but it is another thing to give out false, and at best, misleading information. Needless to say we were not pleased with the service provided by this highly recommended Frommer's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were surprised at the quality”
Reviews.Author: Amanda041
Reviews.Content: We looked at a few 5 star hotels but took Trip Advisor comments as our guide and chose this hotel instead. Same price for 3 nights here as one in our original 5 star choice! We booked an executive room which had absolutely everything we needed and more. Room was spotless, as were the sheets. Staff were always extremely helpful. Only niggle would be that the bar food badly let them down. The top floor restaurant views were incredible and the food was lovely. I would say that their menu is a little over the top (the chef's imagination can be a little strange) and you never quite know whether you will get a plate with very little food on it, or quite a lot. There are also a lot of little extras which can be confusing, but you do feel like you are special guests. Location was very central which we needed and it was a safe area too (we were originally concerned as it was near the station). All in all I would highly recommend it and would definitely go back there. Best example of a 4 star hotel we have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oscarmauricio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed for 3 days. The hotel is close to the Sans metro station and you can get to Las Ramblas, Downtown, Sagrada Familia, Barcelona FC stadium, etc within 15 minutes. Plaza España/Olympic Stadiums are a 10-15 minute walk. Airport is about 20 minutes away and taxi will cost about 25-30EUR. The Executive room was excellent. The breakfast was included in the rate, good variety and quallity of food. (Room w/o breakfast was 13 EUR cheaper but for 2 people is well worth it to get the Room+Breakfast Plan). Access to the internet in the room for a fee but in the business center is free for 15 minutes. Spa services are additional. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that you need in a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perpetual_tourist
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4 night city break at very late notice. We had never been to Barcelona before and were a little nervous of trying to find the hotel, but it couldn't have been easier! We came out of Sants station (also called Barcelona Sants) and the hotel was on one side of the square in front of us. The station offers Metro and trains, so the hotel is really well located for getting out and about in the city. The staff in the hotel were polite and friendly from the start. They gave us some excellent recommendations for restaurants (including a tapas bar round the corner when we were feeling lazy one night) and also attractions in the city. We had booked an executive room and I think that it was worth the few extra euros per night. Our room was on the 18th floor (executive rooms are 6th floor or higher I think) with great views over the city. The room was spacious, clean and modern with a huge en-suite bathroom with bath and separate shower. During the week we had a turn-down service with a chocolate - a nice touch to come back to after a long day in the city. The room also had air con, a stereo system, TV and all the usual bits and pieces. The only thing to note is that breakfast is not included. You can buy a deal for your stay at 10 euros per day (rather than 16 in the restaurant) but we tended to grab something from the cafe in the station on our way out in the mornings. If your room is lower down in the hotel then it might be worth having breakfast up there at least once for the view (the restaurant is on the 23rd floor and has panoramic views). In the evening the restaurant is smart dress only (i.e. no jeans). Overall this hotel ticked all of our boxes and I would definitely stay there again if we go back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious,Wondeful Staff,Fab transport links,A Proper Supermarket-heaven!”
Reviews.Author: marie943
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute and was not getting left with many choices,I was really starting to panic. This isn't even the sort of hotel I would normally look at as we go for small.traditional hotels. I found this through Expedia,and as I booked only 3 days before,I had been watching the price drop. We also booked it through a well-known uk cashback site and got an additional 7 and a half percent off!! I think it worked out about £72 per night in the end,then,reading other reviews we decided to upgrade to an executive room,and paid a little more. Had a poor experience initially with Expedia who wanted to charge me £15 because I had changed my booking to an executive room!! I politely pointed out that i would upgrade when I arrived in that case,at which point they wisely dropped the charge!! I say "luxurious " in my title,obviously this is a 4 star hotel,so don't take that too literally,but there is a nice air of comfort to the room,for the money,I think the lovely light wood panels and matching wooden furniture units create this. If you get an executive room,you get tea and coffee making facilities,which you don't get with a Standard room,I think. I also think that you don't get a bath robe with a standard room,but it says in the hotel brochure that you can request one. Soundproofing was one of the best bits,as this is a very busy city,but apart fom the usual police sirens,nothing to complain about. Unlike some hotels,NO sound o f slamming doors or noisy guests-loved it!! There is an ice bucket in the room and an ice machine on each floor. BREAKFAST ON ROOM SERVICE-had this the first day and all I can say is,if you HAVE to,have the continental!! Even better go and get yourself some orange juice and ensaimadas from the supermarket and eat in your room (there is also a cafe at the supermarket). I have to make allowances for the fact that we ordered it too late (they still very kindly let us have it though! )and the scrambled egg was in a pool of water and the bacon and sausages bore NO resemblance to food usually supplied in a traditional english breakfast-bacon was very thin and greasy more like ham,and sausages oozed with red oil.(think tapas) ps i love tapas but this was a Spanish version of an english meal-didn't work. I know that makes me a whingeing pom-you are right. Sorry,but I had to warn you!! Also tried the hotel RESTAURANT-they have a japanese chef (first time i have tried this type of food) and it was very "nouvelle cuisine"-tiny,tiny portions,not for those who like a reasonably sized plate of food,and was quite expensive, (£110 euros for two), though lovely views at night. I think this hotel has a lot of rooms,so is able to offer them at a good price if they don't all get filled up.This was a very,very well priced stay,enjoy. Central points on the metro line univesitat to canyelles are placa catalunya (well known square with dept store with great cafe views).top of ramblas Pobel sec (station for poble espanya-the spanish village) Drassanes (bottom of ramblas) Liceue -stop for gothic quarter, and half way down ramblas, and market hall (very special)go to the left a bit futher down between macdonalds and kentucky for gothic quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: krawimi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Torre Catalunya is right next to Sants, the train station. It's not very close to Las Ramblas or Psg de Gracia. In other words, it's not really in a tourist area; the neighborhood does not have many restaurants or shops. But it is right next to the train station which was great for us. My family had 2 rooms and we got an amazing deal. We paid around 85 euros per room per night, and that rate included breakfast. The rooms were very large, comfortable, clean and nice. The bathrooms were also very large and comfortable. The shower was great. The TV didn't face the bed, only the sofa, and that was a bit odd, but not a big deal for us. The included breakfast was an impressive spread. The quality of the food wasn't gourmet, but it was good. The dining room had amazing views. The entire hotel was clean and we were happy with it. Maybe we were so happy because we got a great deal and maybe we would have been less happy if we paid 300 euros. This isn't luxurious like a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, but it was a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of Hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_Thunder
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Partner for a short break in May 2008. We booked through lastminute.com, which was about £100 cheaper per person than rival websites, with flights! When we arrived we jumped straight on the Train from Barcelona Airport, got a free train ticket to town, Jumped off at Sants walked out the door, debated about which way the hotel would be...but looked up and there it was...Couldnt have been simpler! When we arrived at the hotel the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. They upgraded our room free of charge, and so we were on the 12 floor. The porter took our bags up, and was very pleasant when explaining to us how things worked in the room, and also pointed out some of the views from our window, which was amazing (even if only of a busy city!) We wanted to watch the Champions League football whilst there (only on the TV) so we asked at the man at the front desk of any local bars that would show it. He searched the internet for us, and found a nice little Irish bar right next to 'La sagrada familia'. we had to get the metro there, but that wasnt too hard being on te door step of one! He also recommended a lovely little restaurant for a Tapas, and it was so reasonably priced too, although we didnt ake advantage of this till the following day. We walked absolutely everywhere, it was about a 30min walk into town, but the weather was amazing, and I never once felt unsafe. You get to see so much more when you're not crammed on a metro... We also took in the tour of the Camp Nou (Nou Camp!) Again we walked here from the hotel. It saved on the metro fair, and is good exercise! It took us 20mins. And was worth the walk for any football fan out there. We werent disappointed. The shop just near the hotel is also good for stocking up on refreshments, and over half the price of the hotel minibar it is worth it. Also, there are so many sights within easy distance of the Hotel, like the Olympic Village. Have a look at your travel book, and see whats around! Wherever you go, you will always see the hotel so you'll never get lost!! It towers above everything else, and at night you will see the neon sign on the roof! It was always fun to spot! All in all, the hotel was great. I regret not heading upto the hotel restaurant on the top floor, but we were just so busy with everything else that we just didnt have time. But I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good base to explore Barcelona, far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas to let you see that its not just a tourist destination. It has so much more to offer. On the way back to the Airport, ask a little man at the gate how to get to the Airport (act like a tourist)...they'll normal give you a free ticket again...saves 3 Euros!!! (every little helps!!) Extra Tip: (If you get the chance and you like books...The Shadow of the Wind, Carlos Ruiz Zafón, It is set in post- Spanish Civil War Barcelona, and mentions many of the places you may visit as a tourist...probably more of a chicks novel, but nevertheless an interesting read about a fascinating city...Barcelona!)

Reviews.Title: “It deserves 5 stars not 4!”
Reviews.Author: Kaiser_Amir
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Torre Catalunya from July 7th til July the 13th. Had a wonderful vacation. To sum things up: the hotel was great and Barcelona is a fantastic city! "Torre Catalunya" can easily be reached by train from the airport. Its just three stops away and takes 30 minutes to get there. Once you are on the train platform at the airport just ask the guide standing next to ticket machines how can you get to the "Sants Estacio" and he'll show you which train you should take. He will also buy a ticket from the ticket machines for you if you can't do it yourself, even though they work in different languages, including english. So, you get off at "Sants Estacio" and once you're there you can't really miss the hotel since its such giant tower that its visible from most places in Barcelona. When we checked in at the "Torre Catalunya" they wanted to give us a room on the 3rd floor (or 4th I can't remember exactly). I asked for a higher floor and they gave us a room on the 6th floor, explaining other "Standard rooms" are fully occupied and if we want something on higher floors we have to pay extra for "Executive suite". We didn't, so we stayed at the 6th floor. I can honestly say that this room was one of the best ones I've ever had in a hotel. It was clean, spacious, had nice modern furnitures, a safe-box, a great air conditioner, a big flat screen tv and a stereo with cd player. Another thing which impressed me was the bathroom which was simply GIANT! The only minor problem with our room was that since it was on the 6th floor and facing the main street where they were doing some construction work it would get a bit noisy. But, this didn't bother us too much since they would start working after 9 o'clock while we would get up at 8. So, it wasn't as if we couldn't get the sleep we needed. At night, when we would return to the room the workers had left and everything was just fine. Now, apart from the great room, the best thing about this hotel is, without a doubt, its BREAKFAST! I'm not a big eater and I don't go on vacation to eat, but the breakfast at this hotel really impressed me. It is served on the top floor (21st) and from there you have a panoramic view of the city which is simply AMAZING! Its such a delight to sit next to the window while eating breakfast and having the entire city at your feet. The breakfast's menu was fantastic as well. It had EVERYTHING from sausages, bacon, scrambled egg to smoked salmon, cereals, etc. And they kept bringing more even we the closing time (10:30am) was nearing. The staff were very nice and kind. I broke a glass frame with a picture in it in our room and offered to pay for it, but they said it was no problem and refused to take money. Now, before booking the hotel, I was a bit worried by reviewes about the hotel's location. I read that some people said it was not centrally located. True! It's not, but its not a problem either. You have the "Sants Estacio" metro station in front of the hotel. From there you have a DIRECT LINE to Las Ramblas or "Catalunya" (city center). Just the the metro (green line) in the direction of "Canyelles" and if you want to go to Las Ramblas, then get off at "Drassanes". If you want to go to city center, then get off at "Catalunya". Either way, its a 15-20 minutes ride. You can buy a ticket for 4 days which is 10 euros from what I remember and its valid for metro, bus, tram, etc. for 4 days! A single trip ticket costs 1,60 euros. I used the internet at the hotel, down in the "Business lounge" and paid 3 euros for 30 minutes, while in the city center it costs 1,10 euros. Now, a few tips about Barcelona: 1- Not many people speak english! I'm not talking about the hotel staff. They speak good english. I'm talking about the people on the street! This can cause problems. It did for us and a lot of other tourists when we wanted to go back to the airport at the end of our Barcelona visit. Here is what happened: All monitors clearly said that the train leaving from platform 9 will go to the airport. So, we went to platform 9 where loads of other tourists were waiting. Just to make sure, I asked a local women if the train goes to the airport and she barely understood what I asked and finally just nodded her head saying "Aeroporto, aeroporto". Except that the train leaving from platform 9 NEVER reached the airport! Luckily for us, after the 3rd stop, we realized that it was the wrong train (a local man on the train also confirmed it) and hopped out with some other tourists. However, many other tourists just went on and I really feel for them, because I imagine some of them might have lost their flights. We on the other hand took a cab to the airport which costs us 25 euros, but we split the cost with an english man who was in the same situation as us. 2- Definitely go and visit "Tibidabo mountain". I know that almost all guides rate "Sagrada Familia" as the top attraction in Barcelona, but I liked Tibidabo best. The views from up there are BREATHTAKING and the way up with "Funicular" and the "Blue tram" is also great. 3- Avoid going to the "Sagrada Familia" at mid-day. I had a friend who did this and he told me he spent 6 HOURS there for going up and coming down. I went there around 18:00 (the last elevator goes up at 19:00) and I stood in the line for just 15 minutes. It took me around one hour and a half to see the whole thing. 4- If you like sunday shopping, then go "Maremagnum" shopping mall. Its pretty much the only shopping center open on Sunday.
