Just take the metro, the green line, and get off at the "Drassanes" station. 5- Parc Guell and the Ciutadella Park MUST also be on your visit list. If you have questions about the hotel, just send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Torre Catalunya!”
Reviews.Author: charlotte0884
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a 5 night stay at this brilliant hotel. As previous reviews mentioned the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. As soon as we checked in they had a map out showing us where we were located and pointed out the things that we should see! When we checked in I was slightly disappointed that we were given a room on the 3rd floor (especially when the reviews had been marvelling about the spetacular views) When we requested a room higher up we where told it would be an extra 12 euros per night between us. So we decided to upgrade and got a lovely room on the 18th floor with an amazing view over barcelona. Apparently any room above the 11th floor encounters the extra 12 euro a night, so if you want a great view be prepared to pay the extra! The room itself was immaculate and very stylish. It had everything you could need including mini-bar, huge t.v, tea making facilities, hairdryer, loads of storage space, a safe and loads more! The bathroom was amazing with two sinks, a large bath and then a seperate walk in shower and a separate toilet! Plus all the toiletries you could think of! I cannot comment on the hotels othere facilities as we only really slept there as there is so much to see and do in barcelona.Don't be put of by the fact that there is not outdoor pool as for no extra cost you can use the hotels next door rooftop pool for no extra cost plus they provide you with towels. Although the hotel is situated slightly outside the city centre an excellant metro sevice gets you there in 10 mins! The metro station is located two mins walk from hotel. We used the metro for all our journeys as it was cheap and efficient. The T10 ticket provides you with 10 journeys for 7 euros and you can use the ticket between yourself and whoever your travelling with. And unlike the london underground the tubes are air conditioned and feel a lot safer! We were often on the tube at midnight and never encountered any problems. Also close to the hotel is barcelona's main train station where you can travel all over spain and the best bit is that you can travel to and from the airport. We booked the hotel and flight ourself so did not get tranfers included so we got the train to and from the hotel and it cost peanuts! You can actually use your t10 ticket for this journey so it cost not even two pound each for our return journey! These trains run every 30 mins and only takes half an hour to reach hotel from airport! Overall this was a fab hotel and if I go back to this wonderful city then I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “friendly people everywhere”
Reviews.Author: narnia61
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in June. It was my first stop of my five weeks in Spain and this hotel got me onto a great start. The people working here were all very sincere in wanting to help with anything I needed. Reception, business center, housekeeping and the restaurant were all efficient and easy to work with. I booked an executive room on the upper floors and was given a great room with a terrific view. It was worth the extra money! I also ate at the restaurant on the top floor one night and the food, service and view were quite good. I live in Manhattan so service and food is a big deal to me and they delivered at this restaurant. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmzAllan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and really enjoyed it. Great service, when arrived had friendly greeting, with staff making helpful suggestions of local attractions and offering a choice of rooms, our room wasn't all that high up but the views were still amazing and the room was lovely- marble floors and lovely large bathroom. If you stay at this hotel it is definately worth getting some t-10 tickets (10 journeys for 7.20 euros) for the metro system. There is a direct train from the airport to sants station which is right next to the hotel, and this journey is covered by your t-10 ticket. The station is on more than one metro line and although it is slightly out of the centre of town it is no trouble to use the air conditioned metro system to go a few stops to get to other areas. The bus turistic was also worthwhile although rather steep at 20 euros a day or 26 for 2 days but it is a very thorough hop on hop off system and it takes at least a day to go around all the 3 routes which the ticket covers. The bus stops right next to the hotel as well which again was really useful. Didn't find too many restaurants near the hotel, but there are shops and a couple of hypermarkets within a 2 min walk, and a big shopping centre a longer walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: KentTraveller1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. For a 3 night break I thought it was a great location. Coming from Barcelona airport we took the train to Sants station which was approx. 20 mins journey. Coming out of Sants station the hotel is directly opposite the station, about a 5 mins walk. Daniel at reception checked us in and he was very polite, informative and gave us a map and highlighted all the main attractions of the city. We were a bit disappointed when we found out that the pool was part of the spa therefore to use its facilities it came at a cost of 6 euros, which wasn't highlighted when the booking was made. The plus side to this was that the hotel around the corner Epox Hotel had an outdoor pool on the roof, free of charge to Torre Catalyuna guests. This was great as we could sunbathe and use the pool with the benefits of a spa in the hotel, even though we had to pay for it. We did use the spa which I would recommend as it was lovely and great to relax for a couple of hours after a days of city sightseeing. We took a Barcelona sightseeing bus which was behind the train station and we also spent a day at the beach which is about 25 mins by metro. Las Ramblas by metro is also about 15 mins away. For a short stay in Barcelona and if you looking to do a variety of things I thought the location was ideal. In general the area is relatively quiet, but there are quite a few major building works going on in the area. We were woken up one morning by some works, but on the whole it didn't affect our stay in the hotel. There are also a handful of restaurants in the area. Rooms were clean, spacious and modern. There wasn't a kettle in the room but we were offered the choice of upgrading our rooms to the 21st floor, with slippers, bathrobes and tea and cofffee facilties at the cost of 6 euros a night. I did think this was a bit outrageous as for a 4 star hotel I would have thought that these basic items came in each room.

Reviews.Title: “its ok -the reviiews in tripadviser give it way too much credit”
Reviews.Author: bonscottIreland
Reviews.Content: i booked this after reading loads of great reviews in tripadviser it aint that great.expect to pay over 25 euro if u get taxi to hotel from airport a bit expensive in my opinion.'u get to hotel and u have to give more ids than u do at the airport!!!room is small with a view of a carpark!the best thing in the room is the television a wide screen t v with skynews and bbc plus spanish channels.bathroom is average whatever u do dont taake anything from the minibar 5.5o euro for 1 can of cola !!its near the metro so you can get anywhere in barce-shops are across the road in sans train sstation.it is a nice area no dodgy characters around staff are pleasant-overall average

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great serive”
Reviews.Author: DazBucks
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Gran Torre Catalunya in Barcelona in early June. The location of the hotel is perfect for transport connections. Next to Barcelona-Sants station it's just 20 minutes on the train to the airport. You have train and metro connections and a good selection of buses just outside the hotel. It's also just a 10-15 minute walk to Placa Espagna, where there are again good transport connections. The room was clean and reasonably spacious. A large TV and separate sinks in the bathroom. The staff very really friendly and helpful. We asked for their help every day and were never disappointed. Breakfast was not included in the room price, which was a shame. At 16 euros, per person, it's a little expensive, though the view, from the 23rd floor is great. There was an alternative buffet breakfast for 6 euros on the ground floor, though we did not try this. There's plenty of cafe's and bakeries close by if you wanted to venture out

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Angela077
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this Hotel, very friendly and helpful English speaking staff, room ready when we arrived at 12md. Three of us staying in the room but still plenty of space. Safe in room very useful. Every thing kept very clean. Good shower and toilet facilities. Great breakfast with efficient staff, and serving hot coffee. View from restaurant 23 floor wonderful, also had good evening meal in restaurant although a little pricey. Great links to public transport, main line train station and metro within in yards of Hotel, easy to use. Would recomend this Hotel to anybody visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel away from the crowds of downtown”
Reviews.Author: MikeJM-NYC
Reviews.Content: We decided to return to Barcelona 6 years later, after having experienced a very rainy trip there in 2008. In addition, we figured that trying a different hotel might give us a new and improved look at Barcelona. We found the Hotel Gran Torre Catalunya on Expedia and reserved 8 days there, at a price of approx. $275/night. I read various reviews on TripAdvisor, and felt comfortable paying this amount of money in advance (as required by Expedia) given the very good reports. We left NYC and flew overnight, arriving on a Tuesday morning. The hotel staff was quite accomodating, quickly finding a superior room on the 18th floor (the top floor for this room type), even though we were at least 2 hours before check-in time. When we arrived at the room itself, it was clean and comfortable. The view was astounding from the 18th floor (see pictures); also, this was a corner room, giving a view toward the east and south. The bed was large (i.e., two twin beds together) and very comfortable. The television was the largest that we've ever had in Europe, measuring about 32" widescreen. Also, the bathroom was very spacious with 2 sinks, a tub, separate shower, and a separate room for the toilet/bidet. My only issue was that the floors were marble with minimal carpeting on each side of the bed. Subsequently, the floor was cool, making it uncomfortable to walk without shoes for much time. There is a safe in the closet and a refrigerator/mini bar in a cabinet. Also, the A/C is excellent with individual controls in the room. Overall, the room was really worth every penny paid. The rest of the hotel was also equally impressive. The lobby was nicely decorated with easy access to the various areas of importance. There are 5 fast-moving elevators, which means that there is never any significant wait to get up or down when you want. We checked out the restaurant which is on the penthouse floor; the view is great, but the prices are noteworthy as well. There is also a spa/gym in the basement. If you want to workout, the exercise room is free for guests; it is sparsely equipped with several nautilus type machines (3), a few aerobic machines (3), and some dumbbells. It could use some mirrors and better a/c. If you want the spa/pool, you need to pay 6 euros and then you have full access. There is also a locker room to change and clean up after a swim or workout. For a hotel gym, it was reasonable, although I've seen much better. Housekeeping was very good, coming whenever we left the room (either in the AM or afternoon). The staff was always courteous and spoke English to us proficiently and courteously, even though my Spanish is limited (and my Catalan is essentially zero). When one of the bathroom light bulbs went out, the staff responded appropriately and quickly (i.e., it was replaced within 30 minutes by maintenance). Some of the reviews commented on the distance from the main attractions (i.e., Sagrada Familia, la Rambla, etc.). Yes, this hotel is a good distance away, requiring the Metro to get to these various tourist attractions. However, the area is quite busy and safe with a railroad/Metro station about 1 block away. In addition, there are plenty of small restaurants and shops very close by, in several different directions from the hotel. We prefer to stay in areas away from the tourists and closer to the locals, since this gives us a chance to see how the residents of the city live and interact. Also, it is generally cheaper, since you don't get treated like a tourist with overpriced goods and services. Overall, the Hotel Gran Torre Catalunya was a great find and more than met our expectations. We'd definitely stay there again and highly recommend it when travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would want and more!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda032
Reviews.Content: First trip to Barcelona for a 3 night trip with my mum. Barcelona is a fantastic city and one I would certainly like to return to with husband and kids in tow. As stated in previous reviews the journey from the airport into Sants estacio is free, (they give you the ticket as you get to the train barrier and then again at Sants for your return) very quick (3 stops away)and easy. The hotel is right by the station but make sure you come out of the right exit! Very straightforward check-in with polite and informative staff. We had taken the advice from reviewers and booked an executive room and were on the 17th floor with the great views everyone talks about. Bathroom was great with bath, separate shower and double sinks - bath robes and slippers are provided too. My only slight critism (and really only when looking hard) was that the air con was not very powerful and the room could be very hot when you first come in despite it only being May. We made use of the free safe after reading and hearing from friends about the risk of pickpockets and this was good advice, though we felt entirely safe throughout our stay. The locals are friendly and helpful and the metro system is a joy - simple to use, cheap (buy the 10 tickets at the station machines and share), and gets you to anywhere you would want. However, we had booked the tourist bus additionally and this was probably easier to reach the admission free Gaudi park and generally get your bearings - again better to buy on line. There appear to be two separate companies and we had booked with the seemingly less well known, Barcelona tours,(orange buses rather than multi-coloured) after some initial difficulties finding the stop near the hotel (turn right as you leave the hotel), this seemed like a good company which takes you close to all the main sights and if you don't want to go into some of the Gaudi buildings you can at least see the outside from the bus which are amazing. However, we did go inside the cathedral, which is good value for money, I think. We also visited the Picasso museum and if you are an art lover it is a lovely place to go - the building is beautiful and there are many of his works. Nearby the museum is the area to find various tapas and also the Gothic church. Eating wise there is so much choice - I would recommend Los Caracoles but get there early (7.30) as it is as busy as the equally famous 5 Cats in Place Real. The snails are fab and then spit roast chicken to name only a couple of the choices but the atmosphere seems very authentic. If you are seated downstairs, make sure you go to the toilet as the place is much larger than you expect and has some very interesting decoration and twists and turns, so I nearly got lost! We also pre-booked a dinner and flamenco show, (just off la Ramblas) which was an excellent recommendation by the hotel staff, who also booked on our behalf,. 60 euros for both a wonderful and extensive buffet, including drinks, paella and various seafood and salad dishes. The falamenco took my breath away and as it is a fairly small venue it feels intimate and not too touristy - in fact there were many Spanish and few British except for us. We had the breakfast at the hotel on the final morning - which had a vast choices, fantastic views and service, and was very convenient for our midday departure. All in all, I would highly recommend a trip to Barcelona, any sort of group (shame even the hen weekends have got here , though not too overwhelming). I would also recommend the hotel, though we didn't use the spa, we may have for a longer stay and if the rest of the hotel is anything to go by, I am sure it is great.

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Cathie Jepson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room at this hotel and as all the other reviews say the view is fantastic. The room was spotless and well appointed with a kettle, ironing board, robes, aircon and a fantastic bathroom with a huge walk in shower plus twin washbasins. The staff are lovely (in all areas) and really helpful. The location we liked - the city centre was absolutely packed, so in a way it was nice to get away from it (even though we invariably headed back that way to a restaurant in the evening). There is a locals bar/restaurant just 5 mins walk from the hotel(either full menu or tapas, which we had) if you're too tired to head back into town. The food was nice but the place is brightly lit (so not the place for a romantic evening!). We didn't have dinner at the hotel but the breakfast was excellent. I thought at first it was expensive, but the selection was amazing and all really fresh. Transport links from the hotel are good with the train station so close, with the metro, which is frequent and clean. There is also a taxi rank outside the station - and they are not too expensive for heading into town at night (approx €7). Also one of the tourist hop on hop off bus routes stops outside the station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Cleggy
Reviews.Content: Really clean hotel with nice spacious air conditioned rooms. Large bathroom. Although there is nothing in the area near the hotel it is right beside the metro stop and main train station. We used metro on our stay in Barcelona and found it great to use at nights too. Really good value for the money

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ratul
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Why? 1. The view 2. The staff 3. The Location. The view is incredible. We had a 19th floor room overlooking all of Barcelona. I can assure you there is nothing better than waking up to an outstanding view of the city. It really makes the trip quite pleasurable. Upgrade for the extra 8 euros a night. It is definitely worth it. The staff is welcoming and incredibly helpful. This is comforting and useful as they know about the best restaurants and bars in the city, as well as places to avoid. Can't say anything better about them. The location is great. Close to the city centre by metro (which is so convenient) and away from the sketchy parts of the city. It's very nice to have this place as your base . The room is great, price is fantastic, and the staff will make you feel welcome. Any negatives? Not particularly no.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Serval
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with excellent service and large bathrooms. The front desk staff were always extremely helpful and friendly. The metro is close to the hotel as well as a train station. There are no restaurants near the hotel. The hotel's restaurant on the top floor is good with a great view of the city, but has a limited menu. I was in Barcelona for just 3 nights and would have preferred a hotel within walking distance to restaurants and sights.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jgatsby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at this great city hotel. Situated next to the main Sants station in Barcelona we think the Torre Catalunya must have a great recruitment programme for it's staff are a major strength. Nothing is too much trouble and everyone makes you feel like a valued guest from the Reception to the cleaning staff, from the Lounge Bar to the lovely top floor restaurant. Pay the extra 9 Euros per night for an executive room and you get a wonderful view of the city, a spacious room with all the frills - robes, slippers, large TV and CD player and a bathroom that is clean and fitted with every amenity you could wish for. Breakfast is one of those occasions that could last all morning which is probably why they finish at 10 on a weekday and 11 at the weekend. The top floor restaurant gives you the views and provides an imaginative menu. It is expensive and if you stay for several days it may be a last night treat. The bar provides a cheaper option with pizza, pasta and a really good burger on offer. Being a city centre hotel there is no outside space to relax in but there is a park next to the hotel. Also the structure features a lot of glass and the strong sun can make the room hot as the air con is not brilliant. Parking is underground but you do not need a car in Barcelona as the public transport is brilliant. A T10 card will give you ten journeys by Metro, bus, local train or tram for less than 1 Euro per journey. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mshel21
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel and had a great time, the reason I havent given it the full 5 is simply because of a few minor things, (door keys stopped working several times etc) but wouldnt hestitate to recommend it! Upgraded room to 18th floor when we got there, nice spacious room, with fantastic views over the city. It was 36 euros for the upgrade from the 9th, and you also get tea & coffee making facilities, bathrobes & slippers. The room also came with hairdryer, cd player, tv, bath and shower. I booked with roomsnet.com and got a good price, which included breakfast every morning which was delicious, especially the croissants. The reception desk and staff were very helpful recommending places to us, and travel advice. We used the metro alot to get about, since the hotel is right next to Barcelona Sants Station. It was 7,20 euros for a 10 journey ticket, and myself and my boyfriend used 2 in four days. The metro can take you to barcelona in either 3 or 5 stops (5-8 minutes) depending where you get off on las ramblas, as well as many other places. We also used the spa, which has a small pool and gym, with 2 saunas and a steam room was 6 euros each. And they have a business centre where they let you use the internet for free for 5 mins, before getting charged which was handy to check email etc. There was a lot of business travellers whilst we were there but also alot of tourists too. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel and would return, and recommend it, as well as a good pair of walking shoes as there is lots to see and do in barcelona. ------------------------------- Directions from airport - we arrived in terminal A using Monarch, to get to the station, you have to go out of the front doors and turn right towards the bridge and there is a free bus to take you to the station (3 minutes). Where we were given a free ticket for the train, (15 mins) to Sants Station. Same for return, free ticket, and its platform 9. Really easy and free.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkprincess50
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i have just come back from an excellent weekend break, friday until monday. we stayed in the Gran Torre Catalunya Barcelona. The hotel was fantastic, it was immaculate and spacious. The staff were so friendly and helpful, explaining where to go and what there was to see. We asked for more blankets and they were sent up at once. The hotel was in an excellent location, we were right across the road form the metro station, and from the open top bus tour, which is great value for money. I would highy recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDFE
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, next to Estatio Sants station, accessed via train or aircoach from the airport. You cannot miss the 23 storey new hotel building as you exit the station It has a massive SONY radio aerial on the roof. The hotel is very new so the owners may have built it to be ready for the extra visitors when the new high speed train from Madrid arrives. That is the reason for the building work at the station. We visited in Nov 07 and the work did not affect us at all. Terrific cheap buffet in the station restaurant which we used prior to departing on the way home. We booked flights via EasyJet and the hotel via ‘eXcape with us’ which gave us a good deal for four nights. However, I tried for hours on the internet to seek a phone number for the hotel so I could ring and make sure our booking was on their system (which I always do). Reading the other reviews I came across the fact that the old 6 storey Expo hotel next door was in the same group. Typed in expo hotels and voila! - a telephone number - which is [--]. The website is ‘expogrupo.com’ (and they own the fabulous Mare Nostrum resort in Tenerife). When we arrived all the reception staff spoke excellent English and very really helpful. We had booked a standard room because the eXcape site did not give the option of a superior room. Reception told us standard rooms are up to floor 9, and superior room floors 10-16. Floors 17-22 are more expensive and I think some are suites. We chose floor 16 with panoramic views and paid 8 euros each per night extra, which matched what others were offering on the web. Other reviews are accurate re the excellent facilities and restaurants so I will not repeat them here but instead give a little feedback on the city. Barcelona is very much bigger than we envisaged but if you like walking you can see so much. We walked in to the centre by different routes every day and in the evening came home by taxi for £5. There are three open topped bus tour routes, which if you did them all back to back would take a whole day. However they are worth it especially the two day ‘hop-on, hop-off’ ticket which we used. There is a lot to see so get a cheap guide book and plan your visit. Sagrada Familia is architecturally, simply stunning. The maritime museum shows how Spain was able to navigate the world centuries ago. There is a model of the Armada’s flagship - what must have been an awesome sight coming across the English Channel. Regarding security, If you are sensible Barcelona is no more dangerous than London, Manchester, Leeds etc. I wear Rohan or Meyer trousers both of which have zipped security pockets inside a front pocket, where I keep some money for the day. I have sewn an internal security pocket (£3 John Lewis) inside the waist band where I keep passports and remainder of euros for the holiday. My wife always wears her Eagle Creek secure handbag across her shoulder with zips closed. Any self respecting pickpocket will go for the back pocket wallets and the open handbags which are in abundance. Some people simply do not think - until it is too late and the wallet or purse has gone. The hotel was always a nice place to return to in the evening, for a drink or meal in the bar or a nice relaxing bath. For Barcelona, we recommend the Gran Hotel Torre Cataluna. Hope this is helpful. M&F Wakefield

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise B
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th - including taking him to the football. I wanted something quite special with a good base for getting around and also that was quite near to Nou Camp. I was not disappointed. The hotel was fabulous. We landed quite early in the day so went with regard to ask what time we would be able to check in - this wasn't a problem, they checked us in straight away. As the receptionist checked us in, she told us all about the facilities and then gave us a map of Barcelona, marking places to go and the easiest metro stops to use. We got to our room and it was of a very high standard. We had a twin room on the 10th floor. There was a double sink, bath, seperate walk in shower and toilet enclosed by another door. It's all modernly decorated and clean. We also ate in the hotel bar as we needed to eat quite late due to the 7pm football kick off. the food was excellent, quite expensive but worth it for ease and good food. Overall, this hotel is one of the best i have ever stayed in. the staff were fantastic and spoke excellent english. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: manutwo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Estacio Saints, so you get to the hotel from the airport in no time by train. I didn't explore the area surrounding the hotel and I didn't notice if there were enough restaurants, shops, etc, but the subway is very efficient and you get everywhere easily and safely. The check-in was smooth and the staff was very professional. The Italian and Spanish languages are very similar, but the clerk at the reception tried to explain everything in our language and I appreciated it very much. The atmosphere was maybe a little cold and I think the hotel is more popular with businessmen rather than tourists but that's all right for me, because you can appreciate the Catalunyan atmosphere everywhere else. It may also depend on the fact that February is not a very popular month with tourists! Our room was spacious and clean. The one flaw was with the window-door leading to the small terrace which would not open no matter what you did. Breakfast was included in our rate, it was good, the breakfast room wasn't crowded, spacious and with a wonderful light and it really set you up for the day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and I would definitely return. Barcelona is wonderful even in the winter and the nice experience in this good hotel just made our 4 day vacation unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JQ25
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and the staff really friendly and helpful. We got a good deal on our stay but we decided to upgrade to a superior room with a high floor (the lower rate rooms go up to the 9th floor only). It was well worth the upgrade - only 12 euros per night. We had amazing views over Barcelona from the higher floor. The reception gave us a comprehensive free guide book which has some great ideas for sight seeing and restaurants inside. Room was furnished to a high standard with robes and slippers too! Bathroom was very luxurious and the shower heaven after pounding the streets of Barcelona all day. The metro, bus and main train stations were right across the street. The very efficient and helpful bell boy gave us some great advice on how to get around and advised us to get a 10 trip pass. This was very cheap and it was enough to get us around for the full 3 days on bus, train or metro. We even used it to get the bus back to the airport on our last day. 1 card can be used by 2 people - 5 trips each, ingenious! Local knowledge is always best. There are some great bars on Port Olympic that are worth a vist and play music til the early hours. Some great restaurants there too. Give the hotel restaurant a go if you are feeling flush or if it is a special occasion. The food may be a bit fancy but it is delicious and the views at night are stunning. Alternatively try one of the 1000's of restaurants on Las Ramblas and take in the atmosphere with the street entertainers etc All in all a fantastic hotel in a great location in a fab city!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ram_murdock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. the view is wonder and the hotel is close to the city, the station is accross the road from the hotel - a 7 euro ticket provided me and my boyfriend with travel for two days and to the airport on the way home. taxi's are quite expensive- it cost us 30 euro to get to the hotel originally. Rooms are clean, large and cleaned daily. breakfast is gorgous and a continuous supply of food is available. this hotel is luxurious - i loved the way they brought the ice up to the room and delivered cocktails at no added cost. room service is additional is you want food. both restuarants are lovely although the 23rd floor one is rather expensive. the pool facilities are quite small but any time we were there - no one else was!! so plenty of room for two!! at the pool robes and slippers are provided. we also received chocolates on our bed and on arrival an english speaking receptionist showed us places to visit and how to get there which was extremely useful! i give this hotel 10/10 - i will definately be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: WhyFlyBy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days during Dec 2007. The hotel is located across the parking lot from the Estacio Sants, which is a major train station. Getting from the airport to the hotel was simple and inexpensive. Actually, it was free; the 20 minute train ride from the airport to the Sants station was free in both directions when we were there Christmas week. This hotel has about 20 floor and felt more like a business travelers hotel than one for vacationers. The checkin staff was very nice and always willing to help with suggestions or directions. All staffers we met spoke English sufficiently well. We were told we got a courtesy upgrade to a premium room. The room was large and had a desk, a couple of chairs and a spacious bathroom. We wanted a queen or king size bed. What we got was two, not particularly comfortable, single beds pushed together. Nobody like sleeping in the crack between the beds. We had just come from Madrid, where we stayed at the ME Madrid, which had a very comfortable mattress. By comparison, these beds felt like a big step down. The bathroom was clean and large, sporting terrazzo marble. It contained a deep tub, huge walk-in shower, toilet, and bidet. There was an in-room safe which supposedly cost 3 euros a day but we never got charged for using it. The hotel offers wired Internet in the room which can be rented by the hour or day. They also have a business center where they'll let you check email for 5 minute for free. The hotel location was decent. It's not in the center of town but its easy to get around by metro, and there's a stop within a block or so of the hotel. Given the trade offs between quality, price, and location, this felt like a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Great City”
Reviews.Author: Wendell B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends after a transatlantic voyage for a few days in Barcelona. Very sleek, stylish hotel located near the train station, north in the city. Very friendly and helpful staff chekced us in very efficiently before we were escorted to our rooms. Very modern rooms with flat screen TV with multi language cable stations, remote control stereo system, two single beds (can be pushed together), lots of storage and massive bathroom (shower and toilet separated). Excellent view of city from room and from the restaurant on the very top floor. Excellent food selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A small bar and brasserie off the lobby offers lighter meals from lunch until late in the evening. Very comfortable chairs, popular with some locals too. The metro station nearby gave quick access to all of Barcelona and there is a convienence store nearby (2 min walk) for anything you may need. Overall an excellent stay, to be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: cornwalls-hunny
Reviews.Content: only stayed for one night, very clean, staff very helpful and can speak english well! Hotel in Ideal situation literally across the road from main Train station- Sants Barcelona, also Aerobus stops right outside this! Mini bar in room just No hot drink making facilities availble in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent on all counts”
Reviews.Author: hildadajos
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel - super friendly and helpfull staff from the minute we arrived - did everything they could to make the stay nice. rooms great, breakfast fabulous, we eat kosher and managed great with juices , fresh fruit platters (loads of pineapple), smoked salmon galore, cereals yogurts everything - lots of ham etc if you want it. Position one minute walk from metro, with a four minute ride into the centre (or anywhere else!) HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scooterguy
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room, but being concerned about the ongoing construction at the Sants station directly across the street, we paid an extra 24Euros/night for a deluxe room on the 21st floor. We still could hear some noise but not enough to disturb our sleep. Our room was spacious, by European standards, clean and modern. We had a safe and a mini-bar. We did not use any of the dining facilities, The bathroom was very nice. Although not located near the tourist attractions, we found getting around to be relatively easy using the subway and also the Tuistic Bus one day. There is a supermarket located beneath the hotel (looking at the front of the hotel, it is on the right). We were very pleased with the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Well-Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveler48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently situated within short walking distance of the Barcelona Sants railway station offering direct service from the BCN Airport. The hotel is a modern high-rise, with large contemporary rooms, efficient, helpful staff; and the included breakfast in a beautiful 23rd floor setting was among the best we have experienced in extensive European travels. Highly recommended for reasonable cost lodging in an expensive, beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_TBristol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night break in Barcelona, staying at Torre Catalunya. Very difficult to fault the hotel at all - every member of staff we came into contact with was polite, helpful and very friendly; the hotel is very modern (without feeling cold) and spotlessly clean; the views from the windows are pretty incredible. Our only complaint would be concerning the restaurant on the 23rd floor - fantastic views over Barcelona (especially at night) but the meal we had there on our first night was very expensive for what it was - and dare I say rather pretentious? The steaks we asked for "well done" were all very underdone and full of gristle - practically inedible! The desserts were OK, but one was served on a badly cracked dish - when we complained, they readily offered not to charge for any of the three desserts. Maybe we were just unfortunate to experience this, but we did not eat in the restaurant again during out stay. However, that said, the Lounge Bar on the ground floor serves a very good choice of meals at lunch and in the evening, and each meal we had there was delicious (and much cheaper!). Breakfasts (on 23rd floor) are great - everything you could possible want, from beautiful fresh fruits to bacon; pastries to cereals. The hotel may be a little too far away from the centre and the Port area for some, but it makes for a pleasant walk during the day - or an interesting ride on the Tourist bus (good value).

Reviews.Title: “Nice features at the Gran Torre Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: blonder_ambitions
Reviews.Content: After some considerable time trying to locate a good hotel in Barcelona, I settled on the Gran Hotel. I was attracted by the spa and other facilities, location and, of course, the price! Whilst central (it's right by the main train station (Sants) in Barcelona) and about a 10 minute walk to Placa Espana and a few stops on the metro to Sagrada Familia or Las Ramblas, it is not within walking distance to the main touristy area. However, if you don't mind travelling a bit then this is a nice hotel. An added plus is that one of the "tourist tour" buses stops near the hotel (but get to the bus stop early as that gets busy - goodness knows what it's like at peak times in the summer months!) Back to the hotel. Upon arrival, we were greated by a friendly welcome and given some useful information about the area and where to get food etc. Note that if you're not booked in for breakfast but want to be, it's cheaper to sign up for breakfasts when you check in than turning up each morning at breakfast. We were disappointed to learn that to use the gym/spa etc we would have to pay locally. This was not mentioned on the website we booked with, nor on the hotel website. Had we known this, this could have influenced our decision to stay there. We had paid for an executive room and had a nice room on the 12th floor. We couldn't really fault the room at all - clean, well presented and modern. Tea and Coffee etc were provided (an added plus in Europe!) and the shower/bathroom was to die for. Perhaps a small grumble was the lack of a proper second pillow for each of us (there was a large cushion) but this may have been able to be resolved by a quick call to housekeeping (we were too lazy to bother!). We weren't too adventurous on our first night, and went to the top floor hotel restaurant for dinner. Whilst expensive, the food was good (although of the "no vegetables with main meals" variety) and the views spectacular. Service was excellent until we wanted to pay. We would recommend this for a special occasion. Breakfast in the morning was what others on this site have described - plenty of variety to suit all tastes, possibly expensive (but convenient) however as previously stated, the hot food was cold. However, service was good and everything was replaced quickly. The view from that floor in the daytime is also good. Even if you decide not to go for breakfast/dinner, definitely wander on up to admire the view from that floor. A good feature of the hotel is that you don't have to pay for internet access for the first 5 minutes of use. This means you can use the computers to check in for free. In the end, we didn't use the spa facilities (I objected to paying extra for them), but they seemed ok. The gym was quite small (as was the pool) but everything appeared to be in order. Generally we have no substantive complaints about this hotel. Service was good. The location was convenient (the metro is literally across the road from the hotel) and we could travel to everywhere we wanted too without any problems. As mentioned, we were disappointed to have to pay for the gym/spa but perhaps we should have expected this. We would probably return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY convient-completely recommed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: urbanelectron
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern, safe, pleasant hotel. It is located SO near the Sants (Saints?) train station you could throw a tennis ball over to it and hit it (RIGHT across the street). There is major construction right out front and across the street on the train station, but unless you are very near the bottom floors on the west end you'd never know it--i must admit we were there on a weekend tho, maybe is it loud on weekdays. We stayed on the 10th floor. The free breakfast was insanely good: a ginormous buffet with tons of everything: all kinds of juices, pastries, meats, coffee, cereal, yadda, yadda and vegetarian friendly. And the view from the restaurant is gorgeous, just make sure to get there early and grab a window seat and a free paper!). It is very clean and the bathrooms are really killer too: marble with frosted glass doors. You have to stick your key in the inside light switch to make it turn on (odd, esp since we arrived at night and had no clue), so get an extra key if you have to hang out alone with and wish to have lights on. There are a bunch of English channels, mostly news and sports. The hotel staff was exceptionally polite and very helpful too. And there are the subway stops right across the street making the trip to the Ramblas/Borne area about 10-15 minutes away total time. No free WIFI. Did not use spa or eat in restaurant in hotel. This is very, very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and lovely rooms- great for couples”
Reviews.Author: AndyShelleyHoliday
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our stay in the hotel for four nights at the end of September. We stayed in an executive double room, which whilst not particularly large, was well equipped and kept clean throughout our visit. Although not especially close to many of the main tourist attractions, a Metro stop opposite the hotel provided quick access to the rest of the city at a reasonable price. Our room was situated on the twelfth floor and afforded beautiful views of the city and surrounding mountains- a bonus over more centrally located accommodation. Whilst not detracting from our own experience, the building work outside (including some work at night!) would deter us from recommending this hotel to light sleepers. Also, whilst the hotel caters well for people on business and couples, the lack of hotel based activities may not make it an ideal choice for families with young children. That said, with so much to do in Barcelona itself, this shouldn’t be too much of a deterrent! We found the staff to be friendly, polite and hard working. All of the staff we encountered spoke good English, and whilst the hotel did seem fairly quiet at the time of our visit, credit should still be given the very efficient room service. For couples, we would highly recommend the restaurant at the top of the hotel, which affords panoramic views of the city and serves delicious food. A note of caution, however, as it does come at a cost! All in all, whilst this hotel wouldn’t suit all visitors and could be noisy from time-to-time, our personal experience was excellent, and we would have no qualms in staying at the hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Torre for 4 nights at the end of Sept 2007 and it was a mixed experience. The location was fine - we knew it was a little way out of the centre but with the proximity of Sants station and the metro it was fine. We also knew there was building work nearby so knew there might be some building noise. Barcelona was very busy, due to various conferences etc and The Police concert on 27 Sept which we went to (and fabulous it was too!). It meant the first night was expensive (260 Euros) but the following nights were about 160 euros per night. To add insult to injury the hotel charges 6 Euros per person per visit to the Spa, which might not be much but it’s the principle…. Our first problem was they didn’t have our reservation when we arrived, despite using a well known website and paying in full in advance, after about 20 mins at the reception desk this was resolved and they “found” our reservation. The next problem was with internet access as my husband wanted to make an internet conference call on the Friday. He was advised wireless connection would work in our room but when it didn’t he contacted Reception and was told wireless only worked on the first two floors of the hotel. They didn’t send anyone for about 45 mins by which time he’d missed the start of his call… Later on that day we couldn’t get access to the internet again and that time had to wait for over an hour for anyone to come to our room. On check out we had to argue our case to get them to wave their connection charge. On the Friday night we wanted a relatively early night following a day’s sight seeing and we were kept awake by noisy neighbours “partying” in the corridor from about 3am until 7am. We called reception and they sent someone to speak to the other guests. The noise was partly as the room doors don’t have a slow close mechanism and therefore are quite noisy when they close and also the floors are marble – both in the corridors and rooms, so you can hear everyone walking around as well as not having soft furnishings to absorb some of the noise. After such a disturbed night the hotel staff agreed to move us to a much higher floor and they did so the following morning and in fact we were also given a room upgrade, so they handled that complaint well. To be honest we were so tired we’d have checked out and gone elsewhere if it wasn’t for the fact our four nights were already paid for. Check out on the Sunday was also very slow. Perhaps we suffered from a particularly busy time for the hotel and they certainly didn’t have enough staff to deal with guests although they did try to resolve problems. We are back in Barcelona before Christmas but won’t be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel -You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: busywhizzy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break to celebrate our wedding anniversary at this lovely hotel. After reading other travellers reviews we were aware that there was some building work going on outside and the general advice was to ask for a room as high as possible, not only for the views but because of the noise! When we arrived we were told that we had only booked and paid for a standard room which would only get us a room as high as the 6th floor, however we were given the option to upgrade an extra 12 euro's a night upto 15 floor (I think), then extra 24 euro's upto 20 floor then even more to get higher and a suite. We opted for an extra 12 euro's to get a room on the 15 floor. We were a little early checking in so left our cases and hopped on a tourist bus, when we returned we were delighted to find that the kind receptionist had given us a double bed executive room on the 20th floor with the most amazing views! and we couldn't hear the building work. Just remember to be kind and considerate when asking and you might be as lucky as us! the room was always left clean with complimentary chocolates every day. The bed was huge and really comfortable and the room had the TV sound linked into the bathroom. Our package included breakfast and we'd certainly recommend you try and get breakfast included as it was an extra 20 euros each a day otherwise. The breakfast selection was huge and of good quality including a health section with a fresh smoothie every morning. You are able help yourself to as much as you like including smoked salmon, pastries, traditional english, continential. Even chilled bottles of bubbly are on ice. Recommend you treat yourself to a session in the spa for only 6 euro's each. the hydro massages in the pool are just what you need after a day walking in the city! All the staff that we came into contact with always had a smile. As the hotel is in the financial district we used the metro to visit all the other parts of the city. We recommend you buy a T10 ticket from the ticket machines in the stations, it's only 6.90 euro's, we brought ourselves a couple, great value for money as we could also use this to get to and from the airport. Be careful your not ripped off when visiting The Rambles, best to eat and drink just off one of the side street as you can pay as much as 7 euros for a pint of beer! steer clear of Mickys. However we recommend the salads in Moka just at the top of The Rambles. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and will hopefully return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Krissue
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three-night break at the Torre Catalunya and are full of praise for its ideal location, being adjacent to the mainline rail station 'Estacio Barcelona Sants' which links straight to the airport and sandwiched between the two Metro stations of 'Sants Estacio' and 'Tarragona' ,both of which are on green Line 3 giving direct access to Las Ramblas. I'd recommend you try to get a room at the front on a high floor (we were on the 10th) and go for a 'twin room' if possible rather than a 'double'. Our two teen sons (17 and 15) had a 'twin room' and were totally gobsmacked by the huge walk-in shower room, acres of space and panoramic views of the mountains. My wife and I had a 'double', which although beautifully equipped, was considerably smaller, with just an over bath type shower. Be warned that there is considerable construction work going on at the front of the hotel for extension work to the railway station, so there is some noise, even at night!! Hence the need for a high floor. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: RconTipperary
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Gran Torre after reading reviews. We were not disappointed. The staff were so helpful. I learned a lot about Barcelona after reading through forums. It made my trip much more enjoyable and knew where to go and what to see. Don't forget to go to Placa Espana [ just a ten minute walk from hotel] and enjoy the wonderful display of the water fountain with the vibrant colours and wonderful music. THe hotel is so well situated as it is a short journey on metro to centre and is a pleasure to return to a quiet restful room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: tina236
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel across the road from the main Sants station and just a couple of stops from the centre. Dont miss breakfast on the 23rd floor restaurant the view is fantastic. When going out to eat go through the station and cross over the road at the front and go a few hundred yards up the straight and you will come to very reasonable Spanish Restaurants which do not rip you off they are not the tourist filled places but full of locals. Use the metro to get in to Sants station from the Airport get a 10 trip ticket if you are staying for a few days and this also covers your trip to and from the Airport. A 10 minute walk takes you to the Barcelona Fountains dont miss this free brilliant fountain show. Nightly during summer and weekends rest of the year.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bam49
Reviews.Content: this excellent hotel had everything you could possibly need to enjoy your stay in Barcelona. It is ideally situated directly alongside the railway station, so you have great connections for the metro, the rail network the bus service and the bus touristic. the rooms are clean and fully equipped, the staff are helpful and efficient, and the breakfasts are to die for! eating on the 23rd floor restaurant was the best of starts to the day, and the meal kept us going until suppertime every day!!! what more can i say? When I go back to Barcelona, this will be my first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: grs
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, rooms not bad, but the views we had were of the bus station, we choose to have breakfast one day which was very nice and worth doing at least one day of your stay, in my opinion there was not much around the hotel so we ventured into Las Ramblas. The staff were ok, but the hotel did seem quite cold with no character, however the good points the bed was comfortable and enjoyed a nice sleep. Supermarket only next door so could get your bottles of bottle at reasonable price. We decided to come via Girona aiport which is about 1hr 10mins to barcelona city centre, "arc de tromph" the metro is not far from the bus station, the metro will take about 20mins. Be careful on the metro for pickpockets. When we come back to barcelona again we will try and get a flight direct to barcelona's main airport as there is more connections to get into barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for European Standards, but with Problems”
Reviews.Author: AnAmericanTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The room we received was very large even for American standards and two walls were windows so we had a great view. The bathroom was sizable as well. There was a bathroom with lots of amenities and separate shower. There were large closets, two tables, two chairs, large TV, and even a radio. The only problem was that when I had switched on a light, the circuit blew and we ended up sitting in the dark, along with our next door neighbors. The hotel staff came in and tried to fix the lights, but they could not. They gave us another room. That room was equally large. However, the bathroom wreaked of sewage. It was disgusting. The room also faced Sants Station, which was another negative. After going through the fiasco of packing up and moving late at night to the 2nd room, we found that the construction was still going on and would keep us up, if the smell of the bathroom did not. We went back down and asked for another room. This time, we got a smaller one, but at least the bathroom did not smell and we weren't facing the construction. However, by the time we went to bed, it was quite late. All in all, even though we had to go through this fiasco of changing rooms, the staff was accommodating. The location of the hotel was convenient. Sants Station was just around the corner and you could get anywhere form there. The train from the airport went straight here as well. There was a supermarket next door to obtain any necessities or food that was desired. It was convenient overall.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Hotel if you get it on a deal price”
Reviews.Author: weenzie
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel through laterooms.com. We payed £530.00 and stayed for 5 nights. We paid the extra amount for the room on the higher floor, which was well worth it for the brilliant night views of the city. It was a great hotel in a handy location. It is not in the centre of Barcelona but is right beside both the underground and the train station. The rooms were a lovely size with a nice big bathroom, clean and fully equiped. The staff were lovely and very helpful. There is internet access on the basement floor, free for the first half hour! You could have wi fi access for 24 hours for about €10. This is very handy if, like us , you travel with the lap top. The restaurant on the top floor is worth checking out. Its a bit pricey, but worth splashing out on for one night for the fab. views over the city. The food was good and some nice wines. There is a free bottle of cava with the voucher they give you on check in, but you have to be seated before a certain time. I didn't eat in the hotel for anything else. Breakfast for us was in the cafe which is in the supermarket under the hotel, again very handy. This is a great hotel in a handy location. I highly recommend both the hotel and Barcelona which is an amazing city with so much to see and do. We are planning to return with our toddler son soon and will be checking out the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for our next good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DublinTourist78
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 nights in Barcelona which has now become my most favourite city ever visited. What an amazing place! It had everything - culture, great food and wine, amazing shopping, friendly people, lovely weather, fantastic beaches(so close to city) and a brilliant transport system(so easy to get around). Stayed at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya after checking out reviews on Trip Advisor and other websites. Booked hotel through hotels.com. Paid €580 for an executive room for 5 nights. (I only booked a week in advance) It was right opposite Sants Station and only 5 stops on metro into the Ramblas (Drassanes station). As I mentioned, we were in an executive room. Standard room was obviously cheaper but having read the reviews which mentioned that there was building work going on at the station and that the executive rooms were higher up with less noise I booked the executive room. There was indeed building work going on at station and while you could kind of hear it early in the morning, it didn't disturb us or put us off. Our room was very large and as many reviews mention - the bathroom is amazing. I want the bathroom in my house to look like that! Marbled floors thoughout the room and the bathroom was marbled from floor to ceiling. There were his and her sinks, lovely bath with shower but then there was separate glass door in bathroom leading to toilet and bidet and then another seperate glass door leading to large shower room! Bathroom had phone and speakers in ceiling with whatever was on TV coming though to bathroom. Also great toiletries left in bathroom. Apart from the usual shampoo/conditioner/shower gel/ shower cap there was also a dental kit, shaving kit and comb!!!!! The bedroom had all you would need - including a CD player (so remember to bring CD's with you!), large TV, minibar and Tea and Coffee making facilites and internet access. The air-conditioning and black-out curtains were also greatly appreciated!! There is a safe in the room. I thought I read in some reviews that you had to pay a daily rate for the safe - you don't. The hotel itself is lovely. We were checked in promptly. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. On the first night we booked dinner in the restaurant on the 24th floor!!! What amazing views. Such an atmosphere. Free bottle of Cava if you eat between 8pm and 8-30pm. In Spain dinner is usually eaten a lot later than at home! The dinner was an experience in itself. Service fantastic. We both had 3 course dinner with one glass of the nicest red wine I have ever tasted and coffee too! The bill came to €130 which is steep but it was a lovely experience and atmosphere for our first night in Barcelona. Complimentary olives, aperatif and bread were served with the dinner. The menu might not be to everybodys liking. Found it difficult to choose a starter and in the end chose Rose Canneloni with turnip and mushroom consommé!!! It was actually rose petals inside canneloni style shavings of turnip in a clear mushroom soup!!!! The most bizarre thing I have ever eaten in my life. My mother had mushroom risotto with quail which was lovely. We both had the seabass for maincourse but don't expect any carbohydrates with that. It said served with green beans and mussles. I'd say there was one green bean on the plate sliced into the tiniest strips and 3 tiny mussles on the plate!!!!! I would say go up and check the restaurant and menu out and deside for yourself. Nice chilled out bar on the top floor too. Breakfast was not included in our room price. Couldn't find a deal on net for this hotel with breakfast included. Breakfast was I think €16 euro per person. As other reviewers said - you can grab breakfast in cafe across the road at cafe in station. We actually got cereal, milk, yoghurts and pastries at supermarket next door and had in our room!!! There is a spa in hotel as well as pool, sauna, steam room, gym and computers with internet access at €3.20 for half an hour (or 10 minutes is free!) downstairs in basement. There is a daily rate of €6 if you want to use the pool/sauna/steam room and obviously spa treatments are seperate. Would defintiely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay in this hotel if I visit Barcelona again (which hopefully will be again soon! Had such a great time in this city. I know people have mentioned pick pocketers and wallets being stolen but I have to say I felt totally safe in Barcelona and didn't see any eveidence of this. Everybody is so relaxed in this city. There seems to be no trafffic, no rushing for trains or the underground and people wait for the green man even when the road is clear as far as you can see!!!!!! Anyone interested in great shopping - here are some great places: There is a shopping centre down at the bottom of the Ramblas near Aquarium and Imax called Magnummare and the L'Illa shopping centre is great too and is located on Avinguda Diagonal - metro to Maria Cristina station and 10 min walk down to centre or get tram(check out all the food places on the lower level), Roca Outlet Village(www.larocavillage.com) is great too for some designer bargains - you can get return bus for €10 (hotel can organise it......it's around 50 minutes outside Barcelona), We got train and courtesy bus from station to the village, also check out Passeig de Gracia, Placa Catalunya and Av. Portal d'Angel for some great shops. Beach is great and there are some nice places to eat and Casino as well. Get off at Barceloneta or Ciutadella i Vila Olimpica stops on Metro. Some great restaurants serving Spanish food but also ate some great Japanese food at an all you can eat carousel buffet (€13.90 p.p at Japanese Restaurant on Gran Via De Les Corts (very close to hotel) and some amazing arabaic food at arabaic restaurant downstairs in L'Illa shopping centre. If you go to Barcelona in warm season make sure you go up to Tibadabo. It's high above city with a great church with statue of Jesus with arms outstretched looking down over whole city and Mediteranean. There is also a great theme park up there too with lots of rides that let you look down over the whole city. Amazing. To get there you need to get metro to Catalunya, then train to Av. Tibidabo and then tram and cable car up. The views are unbelievable! Great atmosphere up there too. As you can see, I absolutely loved Barcelona. I haven't mentioned the art museums etc as my mother who accompanied me is not interested in them whatso ever!!!! I will hopefully return again soon and check them out for myself. I have visited the Dali museum north of Barcelona which is a day trip you can do. Well worth a visit. I was there on school tour many years ago and it really got me interested in art. I would definitely recommend it if you have a day to spare. If you haven't been to Barcelona - you really don't know what you're missing. This city has everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - good location”
Reviews.Author: Carole17
Reviews.Content: We flew into Barcelona and wanted to spend some time there before picking up a hire car and driving up to France. Location was perfect for that - express airport bus stops outside the hotel and train station is two minutes. Booked through alpha rooms at a great rate. Standard room on 10th floor - but it was fine - had everything we wanted. Great air con which was needed! Breakfast was included and was good, view was fabulous from 23rd floor restaurant. Best bit was the concierge Hugo. He was so helpful, advised us what to do, where to pick up the transport etc. He's also an expert on Scottish football! Didn't even have to ask - they offered to store our luggage until we came to pick it up later. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Location might not suit on a city break as it's not in the hub - but suited us perfectly, and we really enjoyed the walk home from La Rambla. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: kingcone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of June 07. We were very impressed with the room, the spaciousness, the bathroom complete with seperate toilet/bidet and seperate shower cubicle and the large tv and cd system. The views from the twenty third floor restaurant over the city are stunning, the food is excellent for a continental breakfast, with plenty of different bread, fresh fruit, smoked salmon, and sparkling wine. The English breakfast is not so good by comparison. The main train and tube station is opposite the hotel which creates a little noise as there is building work continually at the station site. Buy a T10 ticket for 6.95 euro and you can have 10 trips on the tube network which is excellent for reliability and frequency. We caught the main train from the hotel station to the airport which run every 30 minutes and take 15 minutes for 5 euro each. The hotel has an indoor pool and spa but we used the sister hotel pool across the road which is on the roof and they provide the towels. To sum up,an excellent value hotel although a little way out but if you are willing to use the tube a very good base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: anthony77
Reviews.Content: Well I just returned from a stay at the "Torre Catalunya" for 3 nights with my girlfriend. On arrival into the Sans Station bus depot I knew the hotel was close by from reading previous posts. We caught the coach from Reus Airport which cost 19Euro for a return ticket with travel time of about 1.5hrs, nearly as long as the flight from UK. We headed away and immediately saw the large hotel which was a few minutes walk across a square just opposite the station. Upon checkin we were greeted by a friendly lady who spoke excellent English and checked us in promptly she was very welcoming as too were the other front desk assistants. And advised us on a few things to do and tours to take along with the complimentary city map. Our room was on the 10th floor facing the mountains outside the city quite a nice view. The room was large and modern as expected from the pictures. But the melamine coated wood fittings were starting to looks a little worn but not too bad. The bathroom was better than other 4 Star hotels I have stayed in, with it being tiled throught out with nice chrome accessories, it was good how the toilet and bidet were seperated from the bath area into another room with a frosted glass door. Also the TV/music was piped into the bathroom and you could ajust the volume as required. The location of the hotel was exccelent being near to the main station with ease of finding when coming from the airport. To get to the sights you had to catch the subway which was just opposite the hotel. There is a large supermarket just around the back of the hotel which was good for getting your water and having a quick coffee in the morning. Also a few cafes near too. We had a good stay, but needed at least 2 more days longer. The cycle tours are quite fun too which we booked through Expedia. We will definately return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wow hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! its interior is one of the most modern and beautiful I have been. The room was breathtaking, it was huge, comfortable, clean, beautiful and well decorated. The bathroom was amazing, we actually took pictures of it because its design lol. The room had huge windows from floor to celling all around, with a nice view. The location of Torre Catalunya isn't the best. Although it was a fine neighborhood, the hotel was kind of far from Las Ramblas and the main city attractions. Unfortunately we didn't spend much time in the hotel, so I can't say much about all its services. However our experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money! ”
Reviews.Author: azsummer
Reviews.Content: We are, in fact >STILL here. We cannot wait to check out! Here´s the scoop. The hotel itself is clean, modern and the rooms are spacious. That´s as good as it gets. I booked my reservations through a travel agent in Scottsdale, Arizona and well, I should have done it myself because it would have been about the tenth of the cost and maybe it wouldn´t suck so much.... Fisrt of all, if you speak English, they have people who speakit rather well. HOWEVER -- the people who work here do not like Brits, Americans, etc and will automatically give you the crappiest room available. Our room (along with any other English speaking patron) gets the WORST view amaginable. OVER THE CONSTRUCTION DUMP! We are on the tenth floor and haven´t slept a wink. The walls are paper thin, the windows might as well be open -- it´s THAT loud. There are teenage skaters all over the front of the hotel and they are dirty and they WILL steal your wallet! The person next to us had his taken out of his pocket! This hotel is SO far away from everything -- unless you have business to do right around here, you ar wasting your money staying here. You will spend the majority of your time on the train. Forget staying out late becuase the trains don´t run past midnight -- however, everything starts after midnight! The area the hotel is in is dirty, and very poor area of town. There is NOTHING to do hee and it wil take FOREVER to get to where you want to go. If I could give you one piece of advice -- either pay more for a hotel closer to where you will actually be doing things, or come back at another time. Staying in this part of town is an absolute complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sibh22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was less expensive than more central ones, but had fantastic access to public transport and was of a high quality, both of which made it very worthwhile. We travelled by train from the airport to the Sants railway station, which is literally right opposite the hotel - look up and you will see the name opf the hotel across the square. The same station also gave acess to the metro which brings you all over the city. A T10 ticket gives 10 journeys on metro/bus/tram and is very good value. Ask for a room on as high a floor as possible as you will get great views of the city and surrounding area. The bathroom in our bedroom was graet and the enormous bathtub was a godsend after walking around all day. The restaurant on the top floor does give fantastic views but is definately overpriced. I'd avise breakfast, on a morning that you're hungry andthere is a buffet. Otherwise just go up between meals and get a few snaps if you want them. I have recommeneded this hotel to friends who stayed there since and they equaly thought it was a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: mandi2doors
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last-minute and really didn't know much about it except that Hotels.com gave it 4 stars. We were blown away by how great the staff was! During our trip, our real estate agent was closing on the sale of our home back in the States and the front desk was able to coordinate us overnighting the paperwork back to them without any problems. They handed us maps (without us requesting them) and circled major attractions and told us about the 10 trip Metro card that we could buy (and share). Our room was gorgeous with a wonderful view (19th floor). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: donovanSY
Reviews.Content: We are a Singaporean family with a young one. Barcelona & this hotel was the first and last stop on our spain trip with Madrid sandwiched inbetween. 1st 3days were in a double room on the 3rd floor & there was nothing to shout about. But when we compared the rates with the madrid hotel which was centrally located, this hotel's rates are much higher. Located on 3rd floor and faced the constructrion work to the front of the hotel. Fears of noise from this did not materialise as there seems to be little activities from the site when we are "in". Upgraded the last 2 days to a superior room with a top up fee. The differences was apparent. Larger toilet, sofa area etc...view at 10th floor was towards another hotel. not scenic but ok. A must try is the resturant Visual on the top floor with a stunning view of that area of barcelona and great food and service. Location is not walking distance to the "centre" of barcelona, plaza catalunya but its accessible by metro after some 15-20min ride on the train. A plus point is the location of the train station(same location as metro)for day trips outside barcelona like to stiges or to the airport which is 3 stops away. Only down side we feel are the rates for a location not at the "centre". Should be more competitive. Don

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucawoolf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite modern, with a full panoply of ammenities. The rooms are quite large--our bathroom had both a shower and separate bathtub and was lovely. The decor is minimalist. The staff are quite friendly and willing to go to lengths to book you dinner and dance clubs as required. A concierge desk would be a nice feature. Be aware that there is a 6 euro charge to use the spa and pool. The fitness room was free and had decent equipment for a hotel gym. The hotel is located in quite business district, but is easily accessible to two metro stations. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: mulder1966
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel in the heart of Barcelona. A strategic choice for business trips, very close to the metro and a few stops from the ramblas. The room was very clean, with all the facilities and the staff has always been very kind. A spectacular view from the restaurant at the top of the tower complete this lovely hotel. I'll use it again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wizbud
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a long weekend ...I had stayed in the Sants area before so knew there was a convenient bus turistic stop nearby...we used it all weekend to get to the sights we wanted to see. Yes there are building works going on but they didn't affect us at all We arrived at 11 am and our room wasn't ready so very helpful receptionist said we could check in, leave our bags and return later for our room on the 14th floor. We walked into the centre of town Placa Catalunya and La Rambla..it took about 25 minutes and was good to stretch our legs after the flight. We returned at 5 and were immediately given our room. What an amazing view ..the room was well equipped and furnished although they could leave an iron with the ironing board (which is already in the room) so that you don't have to get housekeeping to bring one and the remove it next day !!!!!.The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was of a high standard. As it was our anniversary we decided to treat ourselves to dinnerat the hotel...what a great decision..the view from floor 23 was unbelievable , the setting sun and the food were fantastic. We ate dishes which were so inventive and delicious and the cheese trolley was second to none. The bill was pretty steep but it was one of the best meals we have ever had. The breakfast buffet was good but get there early as they don't seem to replace items when they have run out !! The downside of the hotel was the hallways..although they look very impressive ..all marble..the echoing of peoples' voices , their footsteps and slamming of doors was disturbing at times and one the final night at about 12.20 there was very loud music coming from the room above (we think) ..it lasted about 15 minutes and just as we were going to phone reception it stopped abruptly. We asked at reception next morning but the staff hadn't heard anything about it but were concerned that we had been disturbed. Overall a great place to stay with a good level of comfort and some really great touches.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but bothered by the worksite”
Reviews.Author: iulawr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located and is very near the Sants Station stop of the Blue Line of the Bus Turistic (i.e. the hop on and hop off tourist bus) which we spent most of the time in sightseeing in Barcelona. However, one will have to take the subway to Placa de Catalunya or a taxi to a nearby transfer point at Francesc Marcia-Diagonal in order to take the Red Line. The breakfast is a buffet style with lots of food; the smoke salmon is even better than what we have in the cruise ship which we have just left.
