The magnificent view of Barcelona one can enjoy during breakfast is beyond comparison. The staff is polite and friendly. The bellboy is particularly helpful. He explained the various switches of the room when he delivered our luggage to us. The hotel should have been a very good hotel but for the work site situated right in front of it. We arrived the hotel after leaving the cruise ship early in the morning and arrived at the hotel some time after 9 a.m.. Despite my request to have a room at a higher floor, the girl at the front desk said I could only check into a room on the 3rd floor immediately, or I would have to wait until 12 noon, the regular check in/out time. for another room on the 8th floor. There was also a condition that I would not be able to change my room once I had checked into the 3rd floor room. Since I have only 2 days in Barcelona, I wanted to settle down as soon as possible so that I could start my sightseeing earlier, I decided to accept the 3rd floor room and was fully prepared to take this as a room without a view. However, we had overlooked one thing or had we been alerted at all, i.e. it faced the worksite in front of the hotel. At 4 o’clock in the morning, workmen started talking loudly outside the worksite and heavy machines were clanking up and it was just impossible to continue with our sleep. We did not negotiate with the hotel for a change of room because we would have to get up at 3 a.m. to catch a flight home on the second morning. I wonder whether the hotel will allow us to change our room even if we asked. Another problem is the partition between the bathroom and the living area. Part of the partition is made of translucent glass. When I had to use the bathroom during the night, light came out through the glass partition and shone directly on the face of my wife and this woke her up. I cannot understand the rational of using the glass partition nor its location. If the designer wanted something translucent to create an ambient or what not, he should, say, use a translucent glass door, which faced the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Gupta7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for anniversary for 3 nights. Booked executive room. The staff were from the start very friendly and all spoke good english and always gave good advice on places to see. The hotel is right beside Sants station and so it is very easy to get to and from the airport. DO NOT TAKE TAXI TO or FROM airport as the train is much much cheaper. HOWEVER, THERE IS A LOT OF WORK GOING ON AT THIS STATION SO BE WARNED ...ALTHOUGH YOU CANNOT HEAR MUCH FROM THE BEDROOM. Get a T 10 card for the metro which gives you and your partner 5 trips each. It is very cheap. (The metro line required for the main tourist areas is a bit of a trek so wear trainers !!!) The hotel exec room that we booked was a good size, with a good view and a lovely bathroom. The staff were very helpful. The only downside is that there are not many restaurants near the hotel so make sure you eat before you get back to the hotel. Then you can relax in the spa which is quite good. Breakfast was the only area where they could have improved. Lots of breads and fruits. The scrambled egg did not look very nice and there is no veggie hot option. Barcelona itself is very, very beautiful with lots of places to see. When you go to places like this you do wander what an absolute mess London is !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: UKLondonLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of May. Had read good reviews and the hotel did live up to expectations. Very easy to get to the hotel on the train from the airport and equally easy to get to the La Rambla on the efficient metro. Open-top tour buses (which are a must but get very busy) stop just outside the hotel too. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms very good. Lovely marble bathrooms and amazing views from the hotel. Worth paying for an Executive room to get a room on the higher floors. Tried the buffet breakfast one day. My view is that it was OK but not amazing. Good choice but typical of a buffet style breakfast. Worth going up to the retaurant just to see the view. Internet access is €10 per day and they provide you with an ethernet cable. Helpful business center staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel Superb location”
Reviews.Author: VinSErith
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself just came back from 4 days trip to Barcelona. Booked the room thru Hotelsclick.com with good deal. We asked for an upgrade to Superior Double at 20th floor before arrival and the view is fantastic. Very clean condition throughout bedroom, bath/shower. Hotel staffs are v. pleasant and helpful with fluent English speaking. They are really proffesional in serving. Great location and easy access to city area within 10-15 mintues by metro. Breakfast is wonderful with nice view at 23rd flr. If you dont fancy a sea-view, then, this is the best inland hotel which overlook the entire Barcelona city. We are very please in general but unfortunately our camera got stolen at Parc Guell the next day. (Be aware of local middle age ladies-work in pair). Directed by hotel staff to Police station (English-OK) inside Sants station. Tips: Buy T-10 metro tickets and you can share with yr partner (Strange but it works). Tarragona metro is safer for night return. Plaza Espanya is just 12 mins walk down with lots of nice shops and visit the musical fountain nearby (at 8.45pm) and you wont be dissapointed. Put all vital things eg. passport in hotel safe-box and only bring minimum stuff. Buy 7 Musuem Entry ticket for 20 Euro at Picasso Musuem if you intend to see most of the Musuem at Barcelona. Try the Flemengo dance show for 35 euro/p (ask staff) but make sure you get a front seat to see the dancing steps. finally, If this is yr 1st visit, try Seafood Paella and Sangria but make sure you drink slowly wihout using a straw, otherwise you get so drunk before u even know it since it 's very taste drink. ha ha ha.. Have a nice trip in Barcelona. Vincent and Sumiko, UK

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR A BABY!!!”
Reviews.Author: nitadolly
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying in this hotel with our 11 month old baby. The staff were fantastic and baby cot really nice but you may want to bring your own fitted sheet. Has a mini bar for storing milk and baby food!! SANTS station is undergoing major renovations and it was a bit dusty outside but not really much noise. this hotel is not really in central Barcelona and if you are travelling with a baby, not all metro stations have lifts so alot of stairs to climb!!! Overall a great hotel but a bit way out from the centre and sights. Also no nice restaurants in the local area so you have to go on train for something nice to eat. the lounge bar in the hotel is great and so is the spa. GREAT HOTEL lovely rooms!!! Also a supermarket below so great for stocking UP!!!

Reviews.Title: “very close to metro but restaurant dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: AshbourneDublin
Reviews.Content: hi Just returned from bank holiday weekend in Barcelona , fabulous city, picked this hotel following reviews on trip advisor. hotel very clean, and rooms spacious, if yoiu like modern you will love it, very conveinent right beside metro/train station, now has tea coffee facilities in room and generally good only dissappointment was the visual restaurant very pricey and very small portions, I went for a take away following dinner ( not good for vegetarians, my portion of pasta was smaller than a starter portion in Ireland) Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterHasselt
Reviews.Content: Sorry for my bad englisch, I'm used to speak dutch, but I just had to write this: this hotel is really excellent!!!! Very big spotless rooms, very friendly personel, super breakfast on the 23° floor, train, metro and bus touristic just a few passes away... If you ever go to this beatifull city, be sure to sleep at hotel Torre Catalunya!!!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: thomassmith200
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, the location is excellent for transport being right opposite Sants Station which makes it great for thise traveling from the airport or by train. The service was good and the rooms were large with a high level of furnishing with an especially nice bathroom. The deal that we recieved also included breakfast which was served in the 23rd floor breakfast room which gave some of the best views over barcelona. Tom, London

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent - touch of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: jensta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend for a long weekend in Barcelona and was overjoyed with our choice of hotel. We arrived very early (before noon) as we had travelled on an early flight, and yet the receptionist let us check in straight away and go to our room several hours early. The room was fantastic - much better than a British five star hotel I had stayed in the previous week - and was clean and tidy to a fault. The breakfasts were excellent too, and proved a very good start to the day. The only thing which we felt was less than excellent was the meal we had in the hotel restaurant one evening, but maybe it just wasn't to our taste as we both prefer less 'posh' meals! The view from the hotel restaurant in the evening was fantastic though, looking out as it did over the 'magic fountains' as they put on their display. All in all I would heartily recommend this hotel, and am hoping to go back there in the autumn with my husband for another weekend of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sh29
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is very nice, great rooms, spacious, clean and maid service every day, towels and bed linen was changed daily. The staff are the most helpful that I have ever come across. We were really pleased with our room untill 4.30am on the first night of our stay when we realised there was going to be no let up in the amount of lorries and work that was being carried out right next to the hotel, after speaking to a member of staff we were quickly found another room to sleep in, Work is continous 24hrs so if you are unforunate enough to get a room next to the building ask to be moved. Frustrating times for the staff as well. ideal for getting around as right next to train and metro lines. Great restaurant around corner that does pizza and pasta, great prices too. If you do visit la Rambla dont eat on the main strip as its very pricey, good food and good prices at restaurants just off the side roads. All in all a good time, just a shame about the building work that can spoil the hotel if you get the wrong room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic room size”
Reviews.Author: raavani
Reviews.Content: Gran Torre Catalunya offered a great stay for our Barcelona trip over the Easter weekend. It is conveniently located just next to the Barcelona Sants station, so getting to and from the Airport is very easy. For getting into the city, the metro is close at hand - though i'd recommend catching the L 3 from the Tarragona station which is a 5 min walk from the hotel. ( Come out of the hotel, turn right and walk straight up past the hotel parking entrance. no need to cross any roads and the platform is just there when you go down the steps. Catching the L3 from the Barcelona Sants station involves a long walk to get to the platform) Some plus points of the hotels apart from a convenient location inlcude excellent room size , we were given an executive suite upon arrival , which was really large, plenty of space to move around. The bathroom it self was large with separate shower area and a bath . The views from the room were excellent . the hotel is 23 stories high so if you can get a room on a higher floor the views are good. The hotel was clean and service was responsive. There were a few irritants though - there wasn't a double bed in the room rather two single ones ( good size though), there was a slight seepage problem in the bathroom and water collected at a particular point on the floor. And although there was a coffee making tray available in the room, they do not replenish the items in the tray. So you got to use them economically to make them last the duration of the stay. The hotel also has a restaurant on the top floor but we did not use it since it required reservations and also formal dress code was indicated. For breakfast we went to the Art cafe in the station, its large and offered good variety for breakfast at economical price. So overall a good stay, i'd recommend it as a good hotel for couples looking for a comfortable stay. Not so sure if that good with young children - remember there is no way to lock the bathroom doors which are made of glass :)

Reviews.Title: “Torre Catalunya A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulRuk
Reviews.Content: Plus points. Nice bedroom great bathroom and very clean, helpful receptionist who checked us in early and explained the train system etc. Great view of the city from the restaurant. Good breakfast. Tube stations close. Minus points. Sants station building works, listening to jack hammers one morning at 2am nice. Would not recomend stopping here until the works is complete which looks like will take a long time. Not many nice places to eat in the vicinity. If you want good food go to the Attic near the top end of the Ramblers. If you're looking for a great meal out in a modern, chic setting, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “great value, good quality”
Reviews.Author: MajorVoid
Reviews.Content: Although it's in the Sants business district rather than bang in the centre of town, this hotel is one of the most efficient and comfortable places to stay I've ever been in Barcelona. It always seems to be busy but the staff are friendly and efficient. Rooms are spacious and comfortable - bathrooms in particular are great with big showers and separate bathing areas. For not much extra money you can upgrade to an 'executive' room which I think gives you a bit more space and some good amenities eg CD player, coffee maker etc. Has a smallish spa in the basement and good business facilities. Views from the restaurant at the top are totally stunning - you can see the city laid out - it must be one of the tallest buildings in Barcelona and breakfast, which is plentiful but not exceptional (terrible coffee!) sets you up for a great day out in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: arararar
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, really worth staying here. Stayed on 21st flood, had amazing views of the City. Staff very helpful. So handy for getting anywhere as so close to Sants station. Would recommend to anyway

Reviews.Title: “3 Days of Madness”
Reviews.Author: WANDERERUK37
Reviews.Content: Had a very good 3 day stay here for a recent england football match. Good location very close to estacio sants. Our room was on the 4th floor did'nt have a problem with traffic noise or the building work thats going on at the station. Restaurant is very good with superb views of the city would recommend it for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: funkycrumply
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! The receptionist was so helpful, and straight away advised us of the best places to go, by the best possible routes, etc. She actually marked it all out on a map for us too! The restaurant upstiars is a bit pricey, very al a carte, which we hadn't realised till we sat down, but again it was fantastic! We also tried the lounge restaurant, lovely pizza! The room was just gorgeous, marble floors and bathroom, topped up minibar, fab view! It really was a dream for us, we felt so posh! Would recommend definetely! Again as with other reviews, get a travel pass(barcelona card), as you don't have to keep paying to get around, it just gets u everywhere! If you do get this card when you book your holiday, and you have to collect it, you can only get it from the tourisme in barcelona town, or the airport. don't try and get it on a bank holiday day at 3 in the afternoon, it won't happen! get the card straight away at the airport, so you don't have to spend money getting to the tourist building! you also get a discount book for many things, so it may be better to wait till you get that before pre-booking! Also, went to flamenco dancing show at Flamenco's. also fantastic! In a lovely setting, courtyard not far from hotel. Barcelona stadium also a good day out! Not many places in town speak english, so be warned, its not that easy to eat out! No faults to hotel. oh, also the spa is nice aswell, small but not busy and nice and private!

Reviews.Title: “Genuine 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackout
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Gran Torre Catalunya in Barcelona. Had booked this hotel on the basis of many very strong reviews here on Tripadvisor. Location - hotel occupies the south side of Placa dela Paisos Catalana. The main train station Sants Estacion is on the west side of the square (the pick-up/drop-off for Ryanair's Reus coaches). The hotel is an Ideal base for exploring Barcelona, just a few minutes on the Metro from the hustle and bustle of Rambla. A number of the main Barcelona attractions are within easy walking distance of the hotel including the Placa d'Espana. Reception - Dario and Jennifer were professional and very welcoming while Miquel looked after the bags (if you arrive early or are departing late the hotel will hold your bags). Had booked a standard room with "American Breakfast" included. Reception advised standard room was on 6th floor but offered an upgrade to a superior room on 17th floor for Eur12 a night extra. A no brainer. The superior room was huge with a magnificent view southwards towards Palau Nacional and Montjuic. King bed, separate soft seating area, desk, two coffee tables and chairs. The bathroom was bigger than many hotel rooms I have been in. Complementary tea/coffee, large TV in-room safe and mini-bar (prices reasonable eg. Eur5 for quarter bottle of wine). The room was spotless, cleaned every day with a turn down service in the evening. Breakfast Room/Dining Room - Restaurant Visual on the 23rd floor with panoramic view of the city. A friendly greeting from Kelly every morning. Buffet breakfast was a feast, Cava included - and when in Spain :-). Can't comment on the hot food as did not partake but juices, cereals, fresh fruits, cold cheese/meats/smoked salmon platters and breads were in plentiful supply and the coffee was excellent. Food piers were patrolled and replenished frequently. Breakfast by 8:30am to avoid the rush and for window seating. We had A-La-Carte dinner in the restaurant on one night. Apparently very popular with couples at weekends so reservations are necessary particularly if you want a window table. There is a local food and wine tasting menu on offer for Eur40 a head which seemed to be drawing a lot of interest at other tables. We opted for local specialities. 4 courses, a bottle of wine and some Grappa for me, for Eur90, including tip. The food, presentation and service was excellent however hearty appetities may need a pre-dinner burger and fries in the nearby MacD's. Worth noting the range of wines on the list in the Eur12-20 bracket. Didn't use the spa or fitness room. Large supermarket in building below hotel. Overall, hotel worthy of 4* rating and excellent value-for-money. Would highly recommend. Downside - Placa dela Paisos Catalana is currently a building site. The square is the subject of major rejuvination works and Bob-the-Builder looks set to be on-site for some months yet. Many potential guests may be put off by the works, construction noise at 7am on weekdays etc. Personally, it did not interfere at all with our enjoyment of the hotel. If you exit the hotel and turn right onto Tarragona, the Metro station is 100 meters down the street so you can avoid the whole Sants Estacion area.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kickingkingNIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending six nights at The Gran Torre. Staff were excellent so helpful and friendly. Whatever i asked for at reception was delivered to our room promptly and then we recieved a call from reception to ensure the request had been honoured. We did not encounter any noise in the hotel at all. Very relaxing stay. The restaurant on 23rd floor is spectacular however the food is slightly overpriced but again the staff are so efficient and the whole experience memorable......for that special occassion. The lounge bar stood out for me,the staff were excellent, again very efficient but had time for a chat, the atmosphere was great. The metro is right beside the hotel and takes you to the centre very quickly, also the tourist bus passes the hotel and you can start your two or one day tour pass from the bus turistic stop beside the hotel, hopping on and off the bus whenever you wish and visitng whatever attractions you wish to see. We had a fantastic time and staying in the Gran Torrre made the whole stay 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Antonia1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Torre Catalunya for three days and had a terrific time. The hotel was amazing and had everything you could have wished for. It was totally spotless, everyone who worked there was extremely polite and it was in a good location. The hotel is situated literally a stones throw away from the station and metro that can take you into town and takes about 5 to 10 mins. We took a tour bus for two of the days and that was great and the stops were right outside the hotel. It's great that the station was so close as we didnt have to rush in the morning of our flight, we just walked a few seconds to the station, got on the train and the third stop was the airport and was so quick and easy to get to! This is a gorgeous hotel to stay in. You even have a computer suite with internet access, a lovely beauty parlour with swimming pool and beauty room and also an amazing restaurant on the top floor of the hotel with amazing panoramic views across the whole of Barcelona! Definately 10 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: grrrl_friday
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Lastminute and got a good deal. Having read a number of reviews on trip advisor we were concerned about the noise but this wasn't an issue as we were on the 10th floor. Hotel was excellent, staff were friendly and helpful, rooms very clean and the spa was an added bonus after a long day sightseeing. The only negative in our whole stay was when we went to the lounge bar for dinner one evening. Although buzzing with staff they were a little disorganised and a number of diners sent food back to the kitchen. Would highly recommend the hotel but suggest giving the bar a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dukesy
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a reasonable area. VERY clean room with all facilities one would expect. Nice big room with two singlwe beds on the 7th Floor. Nice views of city from room. Woke up for breakfast next morning, and went up to 23rd Floor to the panoramic resturant. OMG....What a view...

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: penny29
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but the work going on at the train station goes on right through the night.Staff very helpful and moved us to back of hotel but this did not help.

Reviews.Title: “classy & modern”
Reviews.Author: xtradel
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our honeymoon and we were very happy with our choice. we were greeted at reception by a very nice englishman who straight away started to tell us how to make the most of our stay. the rooms were very clean and modern even if they were a bit on the small side but from reading reviews about other hotels in barcelona this seems to be the norm. the bathroom was spotless, large and came supplied with plenty of toiletries and towels. the restaurant should be classed as an attraction because of the amazing views from the 23rd floor. breakfast was plentiful with a great variety. the main train station is just across the road and as long as you get used to the metro system, the centre of barcelona is just 10 mins away. my only gripe with the hotel would be the bar is very limited in its range of alcohol and seems to be unstaffed most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel & amazing views”
Reviews.Author: HampshireDiamond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip & what a hotel! my room was wonderful & the view out the large glass windows was amazing. If u are not frightened of heights go higher! & please take your camera. If you are reading my review dont waste anymore time book!! u will not be disappointed & I recommend that you have breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor over looking the city. Well situated with a train station very close by Breakfast - they cater for everyone & the food is hot & they have cooked breakfasts, fruits, everything & for those with sweet tooths there's lots of tasty pastries! & plenty of coffee.. My room was something else! I felt like royalty. Shame I was on a business trip... will deffiantly have to go back with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever Hotel Around, Loved It, The Min I Got There”
Reviews.Author: nicku
Reviews.Content: This hotel, is one the best hotel, I have ever stayed in, we with a group of 4 people, 2 couples, and the service was incredible, I would call it 5 star hotel, myself, rooms were clean, comfortable, breakfast, plenty to eat, more, your on the 23rd floor eating your breakfast in the morning, not to far from the las rambles, only a taxi ride away, cost about 7 euros, most of the staff in the hotel, spoke English, very helpful. The only downside to the hotel was the pool area, on the ground floor, where they charge 7 euros per person, to use the spa, pool, Jacuzzi, and steam rooms. If your into blonde, there is 2 gorgeous blonde, who work in the business area, I can not fault this hotel at all, plenty of bathroom supplies, walking distance to a shopping centre, only about 20 mins walk, I would 100% stay at this hotel again, if I ever went to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: bwfcManchester
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a long weekend during February and found it fantastic. ROOM - We opted for an executive room, as the site we booked it through offered this as only 10euro more than a standard. The room was beautiful, with modern furniture, electrical equipment (TV/cd player) to a high standard. It was exactly how the pictures described. The bathroom in particular was gorgeous, set out in marble with a double sink. The jet showers were fantastic, and all was remarkably clean. Of a weekend of 4 days, we spent many mornings resting in the room as it was of such high standard and so relaxing. I would advise to request a room as high up as possible, as the views are breathtaking. We were on the 16th floor of 23 and could see a great deal of Barcelona, including the Nou Camp stadium. However, if you dont get a great room, when you go up for breakfast/evening meal, you can get a 360 view of the whole city. HOTEL - We had the buffet breakfast every morning. Plenty of cold foods (cereal/fruit/ham etc) and toast, but not too much in the way of cooked foods. However, there was some sausage, egg, bacon. Didnt stay for evening meal as was quite expensive so cant comment. Mini bar v expensive as always, but room service relatively inexpensive. Hotel lobby, reception beautiful. You pay 6euros for the use of gym/sauna/steam room/pool so this is good value as it is all very beauftil, but be careful as opening hours are restricted. Particularly if you are only staying for a short weekend as we did, find out the opening hours as soon as possible, as we didnt get chance to go in because we left it last minute and it was closed. Masssages are offered at 32euro half hour and 57euro full hour. Not that much cheaper than England. All staff speak good english we found and were very friendly, allowing us to check out late for no extra fee. LOCATION - Takes about 40minutes to walk into the heart of town (Ramblas) but the metro is very accessible, as the hotel is 200m from Sants Station. There are buses aswell, but I would say that it is easier to get the metro. Around a 30 minute walk to the Nou Camp stadium, or again you can get a train. This was perfect for us as we visited Barcelona to go to both the Nou Camp and into town. However, could be a little out of the way if the football is not of great importance to you. Overall, although not quite a 5* hotel, this is definitely a sound 4* hotel. All was modern and clean and met all expectations. Barcelona is beautiful and this hotel contributed in large part to a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!! If I go back to Barcelona, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: yasmarie98
Reviews.Content: We stay at Gran Torre Catalunya for a week during christmas, it was great, everything we expect and more. Very clean and modern. The bath room was big, with tub, and a toilet a part. The staff was friendly and helpful.We ask for wakeup calls and they call us as asked. We have once dinner at the Visual restaurat in the top, I recomend you eat there once, and make a reservation for a table near a window, so you get the spectacular city view. The location its perfect with a train station in front, so you can go anywhere from there. Everything went as planned, we did not find any foults. Clean, modern, great location, confortable, friendly, great price. Will recomend and will stay here again. We did not use pool or spa so we can not comment about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ms247
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the hotel for a wedding present. The hotel is very nice and the service was incredible. The hotel is right next to the metro and train station we were able to get around very easy. The Restaurants was amazing as its right at the top of the hotel and the view is amazing. The room was clean and very modern :) Location great and there is a hypermarket right next door so you can stock up on food and drink ideal if you are travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gill247
Reviews.Content: If you are deciding whether to stay at this hotel or not then please book - you will not be dissapointed! Location - If arriving by air then take airport train to Sants station (approx 20 mins). The hotel is located directly across the road so is easy to find and you dont need to walk far with luggage. To get to the city centre the Metro station is 2 mins across the square and its only a few stops to the main sight seeing areas. The View - BREATHTAKING!! The restaurant is located on the top floor (23rd) and from here you have panoramic views from the mountains down to the sea. You can even see Sagrada Familia from here. Rooms - very well decorated, clean and modern. Marble bathroom with double sink and walk in shower which is huge. Very reasonable mini bar prices. Food - did not have dinner in the hotel but the breakfasts were lovely. Hot food on offer was poor but the selection of breads, cakes, cereals, fruits etc made up for this. Excellent coffee. Staff - very helpfull, on arrival the receptionist provided us with a map of the city and guided us to the best metro stop etc. Also gave us coupons for free cocktails in the hotel bar which was a nice touch. Restaurant staff were very friendly and allowed people to sit on after the 10am closing time. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in and I cannot fault it in any way. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm........ not Bad”
Reviews.Author: MSG-UK9
Reviews.Content: Very Clean smart Hotel. People and staff very nice and helpful. Pool needs some attention. Restaurant for dinner and breakfast is very expensive for what you get, apart from the view. My Advice is to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laboy75063
Reviews.Content: An absolutely beautiful hotel with breathtaking views. It's one of the tallest buildings in Barcelona so it overlooks the entire city. The restaurant is located on the top floor with 360 degree views of the city. When I return to Barcelona, this is definitely the hotel I will book again. The subway line is across the street. The tour buses pick you up there as well. It's several blocks from the sea but well worth the stay. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Brilliant Views of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravellersTune
Reviews.Content: We (my fiance and I) stayed at Hotel Torre Catalunya for three nights/four days and had a wonderful time from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. Every aspect of the hotel and service was 1st class and I wouldn not hesitate to stay here again. Checking in was efficient and straight forward, no problems in this area. We were apparantly allocated a room on the 5th floor (I suppose they say this to everyone lol) and were asked if we would like to upgrade to a higher floor for an extra 10 euros per night. We were offered a room on the 19th floor, we upgraded. The views we had over the city were worth every euro! The room was excellent, spacious, modern and very well kept as was the bathroom. The bathroom had a huge bath, seperate toilet area, twin marble sink and a brilliant power shower in a large marble enclosure. Loved the shower! The bed was kingsize whilst the room had the extra's you would associate with a 4* hotel. Mini bar (very reasonable prices), complimentary drinks, in room safe (six digit coded), tv, phone and so on. No complaints at all with the room or any aspect to do with the hotel. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. The foods available for breakfast were varied and well presented on the 23rd floor which provide super views over Barcelona. There is a lounge bar on the ground floor that provides you with the 1st drink of your stay free, a nice touch. Food is also available, which was of a good quality. On the lower floor there is a spa area with additional beauty treatments including massages if you desire. Obviously, these are for an additional fee. The hotel is a little way of La Rambla and other tourist attractions but believe me this is not a problem when you have a public travel set up as good as Barcelona. Sants station is right next door, metro stops are plentiful, buses are available, taxi's are cheap and last but not least the fantastic BUS TOURISTICO! We paid for a two day ticket that cost 22 euro's each. If you want to get around the sights, use the bus touristico it's great. If you fancy a stroll, you can be at La Rambla in 30 minutes. A final point about Barcelona, football lovers get yourself to the Camp Nou and do the stadium and museum tour and if you can get to a match. Fantastic. Tourists, do not miss the Sagrada Familia! Exceptional! Pay your eight or so euros to gain entry and help fund the building of this great Gaudi cathedral. There is so much to do in this multicultural city, it's great and we will be back and will have Hotel Torre Catalunya as our base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mssee
Reviews.Content: We ,meaning myself, husband, son & daughter-in-law ,had two rooms @ the hotel booked for after our cruise. We checked in early in the morning as we had private tours booked with Rabbies Tours of Barcelona, who were WONDERFUL!! But that's another review, if you want a tour book them!! I highly recommend them. Anyway back to the hotel. We were just going to leave our luggage there, but they were so nice, that they gave us one room, they said they would have the other room ready when we returned from our tour & transport the bags from our room to the other.Which they did. The front desk spoke English very well, & they were very friendly. The rooms were on the upper floors with beautiful views of the mountains & city. The rooms were spacious & clean. We had no problems with the bathrooms or showers, they even had a large soaking bathtub. Everyone makes a big deal about the lights, but it's really easy, just put your room key in the slot, no big deal. The restaurant on the top floor & was very good although pricey. We had dinner there & also the breakfast one morning. They have a breakfast buffet, but you can get a continental breakfast in the hotel lobby for much less. That was also very good. We had coffee & croissant. The hotel is a little out of the way. Although, it is right near the Sant station, that takes you anywhere you want to go. I know some other reviews complained of noise, I am a very light sleeper & heard nothing! For us this hotel was great ,as we had private tours booked with Rabbies for both days. We were picked up @ 9am & brought back after 6pm, so it didn't matter where we were. This hotel was great, & the staff was friendly. We requested a van cab to pick us up on our departure morning @ 9:30am & the front desk made sure the cab was waiting for us. They called in the mornings with a wake-up call & even asked if we wanted a call back in 10-15 minutes. WONDERFUL!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: itchybasil
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel fairly last minute so got a reasonable price, which is always good in my books!! The hotel is central, its minutes away from some bars and restaurants, and a cheap taxi ride to tourist spots like La Ramblas, Nou Camp and the Sagrada Familiar. Although, we found it quite fun just wandering around though!! The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with a nice bathroom and a balcony. The minibar was well stocked and reasonably priced (for a minibar!!) We took advantage of the hotels business facilities even though we werent there on business, but we just used the computers for a quick email check. I also took advantage of the spa and went for a nice anti stress massage, which i recommend, but they have a whole load of treatments on offer. The restaurant on the top floor is very nice with amazing views over the city. We didnt eat there but we had cocktails on the top floor (i recommend their 'sex on the beach' or the 'cosmopolitan') and admired the views. the lounge bar next to reception is also a nice place to go for a drink, as a resident your first drink is free for your stay! Yay! I recommend this hotel to everyone, and hope that you have just as enjoyable a stay as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - this hotel overbooks - you may not get your room!”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueen99
Reviews.Content: We made our booking for 2 rooms for 4 elderly pensioners (one 83 years old) arriving in the middle of the night through HotelTravel.com. It was CONFIRMED in May for 2 nights in September and FULLY PAID by credit card. Imagine our horror to arrive at 3.00am (having notified our late arrival at the time of booking) to find NO ROOMS available. The hotel staff didn't seem at all concerned saying they overbook all the time. They said as there was an exhibition on we would be lucky to get 2 rooms together but would try. At first they tried to seperate our party of 4 and put us in a hotel just for one night. Only after we made a fuss did we manage to get a hotel for the 2 nights together. To add insult to injury a Spanish customer arrived after us and checked in normally and given a room! We didn't get to our rooms at the other hotel until 6.00am and we were on the opposite side of Barcelona away from other members of our group. We spent most of the next day in bed recovering from the ordeal and the 2 day break was ruined. HotelTravel.com has told us the hotel refuses to take any action or responsibilty and they can only offer credit points of 40 euros off our next booking with them. We are disgusted with both HotelTravel.com & the Torre Catalunya Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevrod79
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Rooms very modern and well serviced. Restaurant is good but a little over priced. Easy to get to from the Airport, easy to get anywhere in Barcelona, two tube stations within 2 minutes walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kip1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. Staff was excellent, rooms were modern and clean. Engligh well spoken. Restaurant was nice although a little pricy for breakfast but the view was worth it. Don’t go for the 6Euro breakfast, as it’s a bunch of dry bread. Shell out the 14Euros or go to a café. One nice touch is that they call you personally for the wake up, and ask you if you would like a call back in 15 min. Also, once we left the phone off the hook and the front desk staff actually came to our room to wake us. Very nice. Highly recommended. Spa was ok.. Us the pool next door for free if you would like some sun. Also ask for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca333
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights last month and I really cannot fault anything at all. Our room was located on the 19th floor and boasted breathtaking views across the impressive city. The room was spacious, modern and impeccably clean, and the bed was huge and very comfortable. I have to say, the staff at this hotel are the best I've ever encountered and went out of their way to assisst in any way that they could (one porter actually walked off into the city and came back in a taxi for us to use). Also, the restaurant on the 23rd floor is magnificent, and again, the views are quite simply spectacular. Initially, I was a bit worried about the hotels location, and wondered whether it would be too far out from the main attractions. I needn't have been concerned. There is a Metro station located about 200 yards from the hotel entrance (Sants Estacio) and it's less than ten minutes to The Ramblas (about 4 or 5 short stops). The underground rail network is astonishingly efficient and so we waited no more than two minutes (literally) for a train to arrive. And, at just over one Euro per trip it is extremely good value for money. However, if you're wary about travelling on the underground (you needn't be) then there are thousands of taxi's around the city and you'll wait no more than a couple of minutes outside the hotel. The city is tremendous, with a vibrant atmosphere and there is almost too much to do. This hotel is located in a very quiet district and so you'lll be far away enough to avoid the hustle and bustle, but close enough to access it within minutes. If we ever go back to Barcelona I would have absolutely no reservations about staying in this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: redsox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel after returning from a cruise. It was about half an hour drive from the port near the railway station. It is a very nice hotel and would recommend it to others. The staff at the desk were very friendly and accommodating and when we found ourselves there before check-in time, they gave us an upgrade to a suite as they did not have a regular room available at the time! We stayed there for 2 nights and the rate was less than for lesser accommodation in Venice. The Turista bus was only a block away which was great. We did not have any meals at this hotel because the dinner required formal dress and during the day we were sightseeing. We found this to be a good stay and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great , Don't Miss It !!!”
Reviews.Author: Dvir_s
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Clean, Quiet, Superb Service. Big rooms, and shower. I think it's not a lie to say it is a 5 STARS hotel and not 4. Book it , You want regret. Me and my GF enjoyd every single moment inside this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Positive lodgings in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rmb48
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights, and it was a positive experience. The most pleasing aspect of the hotel was the quality of the room. It was extremely modern, comfortable and spotlessly clean. What was pehaps less promising was the external look of the hotel and the reception area (which was purely functional). However, the business centre on the lower floor was useful for internet connection, etc. The location of the hotel is good, depending on your priorities. It is close to Sants station, which makes it convenient for travelling by train to and from the airport. It's also easy to travel into the centre of Barcelona with the metro. The hotel, however, is not really in the centre of town, although it's well within the city limits. It's also quite a busy and noisy area, which might not be to everyone's taste. Overall, I would recommend the hotel, particularly for a comfortable business stay. It's a solid 4 star hotel, which represents an excellent Barcelona choice if you can get a room at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Do not accept to move to Expo Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: MARCOSTorres
Reviews.Content: Well...I should start by the booking process...Booked a night through a last minute website. Booking was confirmed at the hotel. Surprise arriving at the Hotel.. As many other messages , hotel claims that Torre Catalunya is overbooked and we should move to sister Hotel next door , EXPO HOTEL. Simply have a look on the review of Expo Hotel ( which I did before coming ) and see the difference. I said to the recepcionist that this was not negotiable , that I had a booking there , and would stay there. She went 3 times to see the manager , and at the end.. Magic.. A room appear to me and my 5 years old son. Not a room..a choice of smoking , no smoking , doubles , twins..etc.. I am a Hotel owner , and the strategy is simple. Sell the Hotel Torre with inviting promotions and last minute prices , and place guests at the next door hotel.Their ratings are bad , so people will be more tempted to try Torre. Once guests arrive at the reception , they try to put you next door. The Torre hotel is nice , modern and trendy. Although some lack of details on the room. The amenities choice are the poorest I have seen in a hotel 4*. On the bathroom , there is a telephone , which is chic and nice. But what is the point having a phone where the phone cable measures 25 feet... Yes , that amount of cable hanging beside the bowl and the bidet !!! And 2 wholes on the middle of the marble on the shower area.. We were on the 3rd floor...facing the station...noisy...very noisy.. So bad sound proofing there.. Views of breakfast are breathtaking , but the buffet choice is not from a 4*....Again , it is nice , but not for the hotel classification. I pai a promotional price of 150 euros for the night...Normal price would be 200 euros... To be honest...expensive.. Above all...DO NOT ACCEPT GOING NEXT DOOR.. FIRST : BAD RATINGS SECOND : NOT SAME QUALITY THIRD : SHOULD NOT BE THE SAME PRICE FOUR : IT IS AN ATTEMP TO FOOL PEOPLE

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Wekiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya in May 2006. This was the last hotel we stayed at on a 2 week cross Europe trip and it suited our needs perfectly. This was by no means a charming European hotel with lots of local charm, it was more like a clean, modern, business hotel in the middle of any large city. We had heard that traffic noise could be an issue so we asked for and were given rooms on the 15th floor where we could barely hear the sounds of car horns if we strained our ears. The staff were very professional and certainly a step above from the hotels I usually stay in, even here in the states. The room was very modern with lots of stone and wood surfaces. The outside wall of the room was completely glass which gave a really neat view of the city at night. The hotel is a ways from the typical touristy sites but with a metro stop and major bus hub a block away it is still minutes from everything. After the many hotels we stayed in during our trip this hotel was exactly what we needed as we got ready to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mentalmags
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week from 18th August. Great hotel excellent service staff very helpful and friendly. The views from the higher floor rooms are terrific as are the views from the restaurant. Breakfast wasn't included in our package but we did try it. We felt the cold buffet was good but don't expect fresh hot food as ours was cold and certainly tasted as if it had been cooked hours before! That said it was the only disappointment we found in the hotel. The hotel is so easily accessable from the station, metro and the bus! Although not central it was quite nice to get away from the buzz of the city and we did this very easily. Loved Barcelona and will be back one day. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pennypoptart
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. We arrived very late in the evening as our flight was delayed. The hotel had sold out of our requested room type, so upgraded us to a junior suite for no extra cost. The room had an amazing view of Barcelona. The bed was huge and comfy, and the bathroom clean, sleek and stylish. The breakfast was an extra cost, but well worth it. Super spread of meats, cheeses, cooked breakfast foods, croissants, and fruit! All fresh and a great way to set up the day! The location of this hotel is actually superb. Out of the noise and hecticness of Las Ramblas, and in a perfect position for getting on the metro. All tourist sites are within a very easy to use metro ride away. All in all, this hotel was great. The staff were very friendly, the room super, and the food top notch. A real gem. If you get the chance, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Jon.
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, I have stayed at this hotel twice now and it will not be long until I return again. The rooms are second to none with a massive bathroom and excellent views of the city. The staff are friendly and happy to recommend restaraunts and places to see.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, great service.”
Reviews.Author: sparkylee
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel...flew into Barcelona with my 5 year old daughter and stayed here our first 3 nights. After renting a car and heading out on a road trip of northern spain decided to book our last night here as well. My daughter was thrilled to be able to use the pool at the neighboring hotel - that she could see from our window. That hotel was much busier and we were thankful that although our hotel was geared more towards business folks that we felt very comfortable. Internet service is available on the bottom floor.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: skendizc
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in July. My kids stayed in superior room and me and my wife stayed in standard room. I would advice you to book superior room which is much spacer. Bear in mind that no rooms have balcony and if you want that I sugest you to book sister hotel next door Expo. Hotel is very clean, employess very helpfull and extremly polite. Dining room is at a top floor with a milion dollar view. Wellness center is not worth visitng as it very small but clean. I would recomend renting a bike from the reception and riding it through Barcelona. It is the best way to see all major atractions as well as other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Swanky Digs”
Reviews.Author: unionmaid
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel around noon, after dropping off a rental car at the Estacio Sants right next door. Told that our room wasn't ready yet, we dropped our bags with the front desk and set off to the Raval for lunch. Just as we were leaving, I asked the front desk clerk to get us a room on a higher floor, if possible. When we returned barely two hours later, we were taken to a beautiful room on the 22nd floor (right below the restaurant on the top floor!) with a panoramic view of the city out to Mount Tibidado ( I've probably spelled that wrong), even though we were on a super cheap Priceline rate, on a relatively busy-seeming Saturday night. After that, they could do no wrong. For us location wasn't a big deal, we were stopping back through Barcelona for just one night before flying back to the states, and if you don't mind a little walking, it's probably about a thirty or forty minute walk to the Ciutat Vella, not bad on a nice summer day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Danielle1700
Reviews.Content: The key to staying at this hotel is your room. The first room we were assigned was on a corner of the building on the 12th floor. The first thing I noticed was that a piece of the wall paneling had been pulled away and the room was tiny. I ignored that and went to take a shower and discovered the bathroom door was warped and did not close. Could live with that, but the bathtub drain was stuck down and the little piece that pulls it out was broken off. It had to pried up with a screwdriver. So I called down and they moved us to a much larger room on the same floor (a suite I think, as it had a third pull out bed). Spacewise it was a great improvement--huge bathroom with separate shower and much larger room. There were still a few little things broken in the bathroom, but nothing that mattered much to us. The service was good, although inconsistent. If you want to sleep past 7:30 am on a weekday, though--forget it. They are doing work on the train station next door and we were woken every morning by an extremely loud metal clanging construction noise. I think if you are high enough up, or even on the other side of the building, you may not hear it. Excellent business center with access to the Internet. The location was fine, although I found the train station itself and the metro system to be dirty and disorganized compared to other cities we visited. Getting the subway to the Ramblas area from that station was a maze of going up and down stairs--the likes of which I have never seen. The Bus Turistic is is an excellent way to get oriented and was actually a more pleasant, though slower, way to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good service but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Patte_p
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in july 2006. On our first night we stayed in a suite on the 21th floor. It consisted of one badroom, one livingroom with two soffas, one lavatory and one bathroom. The suite also had two minibars, two widescreen TVs and one espresso machine. Overall very nice. The view over the city were spectacular from our corner room, however the outside traffic is a bit noisy and so is the hotels airconditioning. On our second night we stayed in a executive room on the 22th floor. It consisted of one big room and a big bathroom. Over all very nice but a bit noisy, both from outside traffic and from the ac. In our opion this hotel is well spend money, just make sure you get a room high up in the building. However, it is a bit far off, both from all main tourist attractions and the Barcelona beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timden
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at this hotel, it is placed very well for the station and also for the underground, which is excellent. We had booked a room on the 3rd floor, this was changed to the 11th floor with no problem. The staff were brilliant and offered us more info on Barcelona than we could take in, our room was enormous with a gorgeous bathroom and breathtaking views over the city. It was clean and nobody objected to us emptying the mini bar and filling it with our own stuff. We used the spa once after a long day, this was excellant and the staff there could not have been nicer. We did not eat in the hotel, but a visit to the restaurant floor is a must to look at the view. One bit of advice, take the old travel kettle as there are no tea making facilities in the room. If you want to walk out of your door and find bars and restaurants then this is not for you, but the metro is superb and a T10 ticket is only 6.60 euros.(we went through 3) you are in the tourist areas in minutes speedily and in airconditioned comfort. If we return we will definately stay at this hotel and I have recommended it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hasmann
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Torre Catalunya Hotel in late May for a weekend break in Barcelona. The hotel is located very close to the Metro station which makes it easy to travel to any part of Barcelona (the metro system in the city is exceptional). The lobby is pleasant and the check-in proved a very simple and efficient process with plenty of information provided. We stayed in a standard room on the 17th floor (originally we were on the 5th floor but they changed our request without any problems). The room was spotless with delightful views of the City. The double bed was huge and the furniture and decor excellent. The service was generally very good, with one minor problem regarding the hot water which was fixed after a little persistence. The restaurant on the 23rd floor boasts magnificent views (although we only ate breakfast there). Breakfast was lovely with a variety of choice consisting of both hot and cold food with a selection of juices and fresh fruit. I cannot comment on the food as we ate out most of the time and ordered room service (which was excellent quality and portion sizes). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would highly recommend it as a cheaper alternative to the City hotels on Las Ramblas. The metro system is cheap and quick which, in my opinion, makes this a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Torre Catalunya before and after are cruise vacation. We took 2 rooms (we were a party of seven than included 3 children), that were nothing short of spectacular. The panomaric view from our room was breathtaking. The rooms are exceptionally clean, with modern decor, and all marble floors and bath. Our family room had both a bath and a separate enclosed shower, which works great when you have kids. The staff is exceptional. I have never felt so welcomed in any hotel or resort. They truly go out of their way to please the guests. Breakfast was included in our hotel rate and it was a terrific start to our day. Finally, this hotel is a five minute walk from the Sants train station which gives you easy access to the metro and the Spanish rail system, RENFE. I can't wait to return to this beautiful city, and I will defininately stay at the Hotel Torre Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MariaSF2006
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our Europe trip and happy to report that this hotel is excellent. We paid about $230 for one night and $150 for our 2nd night. Rooms are super spacious, modern and have everything you might need, including coffee maker (with coffee and tea provided free of charge), hair dryer, CD player, radio, mini bar, you even get a bathrobe and sleepers. Our room had huge and beautiful marble bathroom, with 2 sinks, separate shower and toilette rooms, plus a bathtub... The view from our room on the 18th floor was remarkable, overlooking the city! The bed was huge (King size) and super comfy! At the hotel you will find business center with access to internet (for small fee), fax machine, printers ect. There is also a spa with various services (not free of course). You can also use swimming pool at the Expo hotel next door (free of charge). The pool is located on the roof of the Expo hotel and overlooks the whole city (the view was to die for). Hotel staff are very helpful and accommodating. Hotel location: it is 2 minutes walk from one of the Barcelona's train stations (Sants), which was extremely helpful for us, given that we left for Madrid in a couple of days and could walk to our train easily. City center is 5-7 euro cab ride away, or nice 20 min walk. There is supermarket next door if you need to buy groceries, there is also plenty of good shops at the Saints train station. Be aware that most businesses/stores are closed on Sunday. Side note: there is a hop-on-hop-off bus stop right next to the hotel, but we found the tour to be ‘so so’ (19 Euro 1 day, 22 Euro for 2 days per person), there is no ‘tape-recorded’ city overview, it was hard to understand the guide and the information was not very interesting and considering everything a bit too pricey; that’s just our personal opinion. Another side note for those who travel by train: if you need to make train reservations for Madrid, you might want to do that way in advance. We were making ours 2 days in advance at local train station for Monday and a lot of seats were sold out, so we had to settle for 2nd class seats, change travel dates, and wait in line for 3 hours (not kidding) Overall we are very happy that we chose this hotel for our stay and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a beautiful weekend in Barcelona 18-22 of May stayed at the Torre Catalunia hotel. our superior room was at the 20th' floor, very nice,clean and speacios the view was fantastic. After reading the reviews at Tripadvisor we have decided to pay some more and have the 'superior' room, it was worth it. The hotel is near the Sants station but still it is a bit far from the center so we had to use the underground at list twice a day from, and to, the hotel . if you are looking for a beautiful view, very nice room and you don' t mind to use the Underground has mentioned above take the Torre Catalunia, otherwise choose one of the hotel's at the La Ramblas located in the hurt of the center.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Easter weekend and had 2 rooms for our party of 3 people, for which we paid approx £80 per night per room (without breakfast), which we thought was reasonable for a busy holiday weekend booked at short notice. On arrival we were warmly welcomed at the front desk, and on request were allocated two rooms on the 22nd floor. The views really were amazing from the large floor to ceiling windows. Rooms were spotlessly clean and well equipped with alll the usual 4-star amenities. WE used the restaurant upstairs every morning - although this was an extra with our rate, it was still reasonable value. The breakfast selection and quality was very impressibe, better than I have seen in other upscale Spanish hotels. I can recommend the made-to-order omelettes with the Spanish ham, they're delicious. The Torre Catalunya's location next to Sants Estacio suited us fine. Once on the nearby metro, you can be anywhere in the city centre in 20 minutes or so of leaving your room. Having been to Barcelona several times now (yes it is addictive!), we prefer not to stay in the Ramblas area which is just far too busy and noisy for a good night's sleep. We ate in the hotel's restaurant one evening, having discovered that other choices in town were fully booked. Although the hotel restaurant was also fully booked when we first arrived around 9:30 pm, the receptionist on the 23rd floor made every effort to accommodate us and a table was found within 15 minutes. First class service like this is hard to find, and we were very appreciative. We ordered fish and enjoyed this very much, although its not cheap. Strongly recommended property for those seeking a classy, professionally run hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..”
Reviews.Author: Aman2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and have to say that it was an excellent choice. Our executive room was not ready upon arrival, they therefore upgraded us to a superior room which was fantastic. Clean room, bright and airy, luxurious and fantastic service. Sants station across the road, touirst bus stop around the corner, what more do you want!!! I paid £70 per night- very good value indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Paula083
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for 5 nights at the beginning of May. My overall impression of the hotel was A*. We stayed in a standard room which we were very pleased with. It was very clean and spacious with a lovely bathroom. Everything was there that we needed for a break in Barcelona. Our room was situated on the 10th floor and although facing the Expo hotel we still had a nice view of the park which is situated close to the hotel. I didn't feel that the view was a problem at all as other people have stated and we never experienced any excess noise due to traffic or other people staying at the hotel. Although the hotel was further out of the center of Barcelona it is situated right next to Barcelona Sants station, which is the city's main train station. From here you can get the metro, train and buses into and around the city or further afield. We took advantage of the 2-day Bus Turistic pass which is the tourist bus that takes you all around the city on three different routes where you can hop on and off the bus. It is value for money at 22 euros for an unlimited two day use. One of the routes also picks up at the Barcelona Sants station and you can hop between the routes. Also if you are coming from Barcelona Airport there is a train or bus service that runs to Barcelona Sants at very good rates, although it isn't too far by taxi either. The only downfall on location is there aren't many bars and restaurants around the area where the hotel is. This wasn't a problem for us as we still ventured in to the center on an evening and also used the hotel amenities which were excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona, the staff were both helpful and accomodating throughout our stay, our room was clean and spacious, location is brilliant if you want to see both Barcelona and further and it is excellent value for money for the standard of hotel that you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay elsewhere....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Torre Catalunya for 3 nights in early May having read the reviews here in TripAdvisor. It's certainly nice to see your hotel right in front of you after arriving in Barcelona Sants station, especially after a long days travelling. And, as other posters already said, because of its location beside the station, it is ideal for getting around Barcelona or for day trips to regions around Barcelona. However, it is away from the main tourist areas around La Ramblas so we found ourselves making the trek in and out to our hotel to these areas at least twice a day which became cumbersome. If I was to go again, I think I would book somewhere closer to La Ramblas where you could stroll back late at night and wake up in the morning and be in the middle of all the action again. The hotel itself was clean and the staff were friendly. On checking in, I asked for a room high up but the only room available was on the 3rd floor. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was again clean with plenty of space. But our 'double bed' was two single beds pushed together..and I hate that. Our room had absolutely no view. In fact, our balcony had a wall around it with spikes on top that almost made us feel we were locked in! But I must emphasis that we were unlucky with our room. But if you get a room on the 3rd floor facing the Hotel Expo this is what you'll get. The restaurant on the 23rd floor is outstanding. Even if you decide not to stay here, I would recommend their restaurant. It's a little bit pricey but the panoramic views of Barcelona are simply outstanding. and the food wasn't bad either!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs to repair some features”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya, from 29th april to 1st may. We booked a room after reading some good reviews here at Tripadvisor. The hotel was nice, well located, with easy access to everywhere in Barcelona from there. Service was helpful. Room had an appropiate size, but also had some problems. First one, no good views from my room. In front of the Torre, on the east side, there's another Hotel called Expo, so make sure you book a room on a very high floor, or you won't have fantastic views (our room was on the 10th floor!!!). Second one, bathroom looked clean but we found black hairs on the bath and those weren't ours. Third one, the carpet on the room was a bit damaged, and looked a bit dirty. Fourth one, we booked a non smoker room, and found 2 holes of cigarettes on our top sheet!!! And finally, the table on our room was broken so the glass on the top could've been broken. We asked to be moved to another room, but the hotel was completely full. P.S.: the icecube machine from 10th floor was broken too, so we had to go to floor 11th everynight. Sorry about my english!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, less-than-ideal location”
Reviews.Author: tdog18
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending the Easter weekend at Hotel Torre Catalunya. The only real negative thing I can say about the hotel is that it can be very noisy ... not noise from the outside traffic, noise from the INSIDE. It's all marble floors, and you hear everything. We slept the worst we've ever slept in a hotel our first night. BUT other than that, it was a very nice hotel with big rooms and great views. If you are traveling often on the train to other regions, the location is ideal. If you feel you will primarily be in the Ramblas area, you may want to consider something more central. The metro is very convenient and cheap (we bought 2 T-10 passes + 4 single rides, so we used it to get everywhere) but it does mean you have to make long trips back. We like to make pit-stops to leave bags, use the bathroom, etc, and we really couldn't. Given that, I think we would try to stay at Hotel Banys Oriental if we go back. We had tried to get a room based on friends' recommendations, but they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: ssouthall6
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! More of a conference style hotel given that the rooms are geared up for businessmen, but even so the room I shared with my other half for a weekend getaway was ideal for us, with a fantastic view of Barcelona from the window even on the third floor. The hotel reminded me of the Metropolitan in London, very similar rooms and layout. On arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a chap with a goatee beard who works as a porter there who went to great lengths to ensure we got to see everything we wanted to in Barcelona, providing us with maps and discussing timeframes of certain locations. We didn't use the spa facilities but they seemed excellent and we were disappointed in the end we weren't staying a bit longer to give them a go. Breakfast was superb and the relatively expensive cost was offset by the sensational panoramic view of Barcelona you get while tucking into your morning pastry. The bathroom was great, the only complaint being the shower which although sunk into the floor did seem to be designed for people 5ft and under! The room was a little noisy too, although this is to be expected in such a large hotel. The people next to us seemed to enjoy dragging the chairs in the room backwards and forwards but I suppose the likelihood of this happening again is fairly slim. Otherwise the stay was great. The hotels location, a minute walk from Barcelona-Sants, is perfect for exploring the city. The metro station is two stops from the Nou Camp and around 5 stops from Las Ramblas, and Passeig de Gracia and Barceloneta are nearby as well. The metro and train systems are outstanding in Barcelona and are a great inexpensive way to get round the city. If I go back to Barcelona I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: couf
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 2 minute walk from the train station. The 2 major tour buses stop 5 minutes from the hotel. You can get to any major destination (city center / waterfront) in about 15 min on train. The room was beautiful. Large bed, large bath, seperate shower, 2 sinks, huge open windows for a view of the city (from 17th floor for us). After hours room service was limited, but the 23rd floor restaurant was very nice and posh. The breakfast wasn`t included in the price, but it was worth it with a nice morning selection. The hotel also had a spa area that cost 6 EUR a day. The hotel was also very clean, and the staff was polite and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not sure about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: belwill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area to access public transport. Literally, next door to Sans train station and the Metro. Reception staff where friendly and very helpful. The room was very modern and well designed. Apart from paint splashed windows and 'not so' good view of the expo hotel next door, the room was excellent. Fantastic views of Barcelona from the restaurant on the 23rd Floor. The restaurant we found very disappointing in terms of food and service. We felt hurried into ordering. A veal dish was returned as the underside was raw. It took over 20 minutes before they returned with the dish. By which time I had eaten my meal and my partner had cancelled her food as she was tired of waiting for her food. No apologises for the uncooked food or the fact that they had forgotten us!!!It spoilt an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed at in Europe...”
Reviews.Author: What2DoNext
Reviews.Content: The Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya is the best hotel I have been at in Europe. I am certain that there are probably other 4 to 5* hotels which are probably just as good but the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya is great value for money. I ordered an executive room but the hotel did not have any with a double bed so they upgraded me immediately. I had a room on the 21st floor and the views from my corner suite was to die for. No other hotel could have those views. The hotel is easily one of the highest points in the city. It is also at a great location near the Sants train and metro. The service at the hotel is to die for (I did not even have to push the button on the lift) and the staff are extremely helpful. I would definitely go there again. Since I was working there, I did not have time to visit the facilities like the pool and spa. The only thing I missed was Internet in my room but this was not a major problem. There is a Internet cafe in the hotel. Also the room service is really good as is the breakfast. The best place I had dinner was "Les Quinze Nits" on Placa Reial (off Las Ramblas) with English menus. This restaurant opens at 8.30pm and you don't make reservations so people generally go there and queue from 8.15pm. There is almost always a long line to get in but it is worth it. There is also a really good vegetarian place called the "Organic".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect,Fantastic,Look no further”
Reviews.Author: cherrypye
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the torre catalunya during the barcelona v chelsea match. From start to finish they looked after us. We had the most perfect corner suite with almost floor to ceiling windows, the biggest bed i have ever seen and panoramic views of the whole city. Slept with all the curtains open (19th floor) and the sunrise on our first morning is something that everybody should see before they shuffle off this mortal coil. Barcelona has the best underground ever! Even i could understand it and with a Barcelona card you can travel as much as you want for pennies. Only fault was that we were only there for 3 days and didn't get to see half of what we wanted... Oh,Dear! Going to have to go back! Mmmm. Wonder where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Could this be THE best view from a Hotel in Barcelona??”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Torre Catalunya stands tall and proud adjacent to Barcelona Sants Rail Station and cannot be missed. Exiting Sants Metro station it is the first building you see and from elevated positions around the City you will spot the building with it's Sony mast. Reception area is fairly compact but the staff were, for us, fully attentive, courteous and very helpful. Check in and out was a breeze and we found public areas as well as our room to be spotlessly clean. Initially we had a standard room (lower floors) but offered no view with the Expo Hotel adjacent. However 2nd night upgraded to Superior (for 20 Euros+tax) on 21st floor and as you can see from the pictures, well worth it. To be able to watch Barcelona's famous Font Magica fountain from your room is quite magical! The Standard room was spacious & modern with CD player, toiletries and generous bathroom with tub/stand in shower, writing desk, chairs and queen size bed. The Superior room was huge by Euro standards, with addition of bathrobes/slippers, monster sized bed and a magnificent bathroom which included separate toilet & shower rooms. Both rooms had 32" remote widescreen TVs, 24 hour room service and direct dial telephones. Breakfast is served in the 23rd floor Restaurant, and from here you have a 360 degree panorama of Barcelona that is second to none. Remember to take your camera for Breakfast then! No hotel comes without its flaws of course, namely poor quality of breakfast and miserable waiters/waitresses, no CD player in Superior rooms (only in standard??!!), a fairly mediocre Room service menu and slow service. Despite this, I still felt the hotel was excellent, good value for money, modern, spotlessly clean and is in an excellent location served by all public transportation (even the open top Bus Turistic, which stops the other side of Sants Rail station). Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but could have tried harder”
Reviews.Author: Emielou
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend booked this hotel based on other reviews and also the internet deal that we got (B&B for £200 for 3 nights). We flew to Reus airport which is an hour away from the city and got the bus provided for 18 euros return (I thought this was a bit pricey). If we went again I will book with Easyjet and fly to one of the nearer airports. The hotel is right next to the Sants station (where the bus drops you). It is ideal for getting the metro to anywhere in the city. If you get a T-10 it works out very cheap and you can hop on and off when you need. It took us 5-10 minutes to get to Las Rambles and anywhere else. The metro feels safe and is incredibly efficient (Britain could learn a thing or two) and it runs until at least midnight. We were allocated a non-smoking room on the 10th floor with a double bed. The room was lovely with a big marble bathroom and it even speakers in the bathroom. Don't use the mini bar, go next door to the 'hipermercat' and get wine, beer and snacks for a fraction of the price. The breakfast was good if not a bit disorganised and there didn't seem to be enough tables for the number of guests that they accomodate. We didn't use the restaurant at night as we were on a budget and wanted to venture out but when we asked the staff for recommendations they weren't too forthcoming. I would suggest using the timeout guide as they seemed to have it spot on. Make reservations at Octubre early!
