We ate in Tapa Tapa (english menu that was a god send as I was terrified of ordered rabbit or squid) and a few other little places we came across. The best by far was Les Quinze Nits on Placa Reial for quality and price, although the queue was huge when it opened at 8.30 we were seated in 5 mintues. It was 40 euros for both of us to have starers, mains and dessert, a litre of wine and mineral water. Also there is a place just round the corner called Crema Canela (or something like that) that is yummy! Try the superchocolate dessert it's amazing. There seemed to be some nice places down by the Fountains which are 10 minutes from the hotel but we didn't end up eating down there. The hotel looks further from the centre on a map than it actually is. For the price and convience of the metro and bus station it was a good choice. We didn't have time to use the spa so I can't comment on that. The staff were friendly enough and spoke English but I felt that you had to push for information or help and having worked in a 2/3* hotel for 4 years they certainly could have tried harder in view of their 4* rating. The one incident that did hugely annoy me was that on our final day we were due to leave at 6.45am, 15 minutes before the start of breakfast and although we had paid for it we were told by reception that they could not get us even a glass of juice or water let alone anything to eat and that we should buy breakfast from elsewhere. When we visit Barcelona again we would consider this hotel if we could get a 'barginous' deal but otherwise there are plenty of other hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Warning there is one thing wrong with this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at this hotel as a late valentines weekend. We booked direct through the hotels website and got a great deal and were lucky enough to be in a corner room on the 19th floor with amazing views, the room was massive and spotless. Breakfast on the 23rd is great and really is worth it, one of the best hotel breakfast I've ever had, the location to the train and metro make it perfect for exploring this fantastic city. The hotel staff are wonderful, we even had a massage in the health club as part of our trip which was very relaxing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and have even booked my parents in for later next month. So I guess you're asking what is wrong.... The problem is that this hotel is so good and the levels of service so great that you will come away wondering why all hotels can't be like this...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend 3 nights and cannot speak highly enough of the spotless rooms and marble bathroom. The view from the restaurant is superb and the breakfasts of a high standard. The reception, bar, room and restaurant staff are fantastic. We had lunch and a quick drink in the bar shortly after arrival and the bar manager brought us a map and explained where all the sights were and how much it would cost to get there. Sants Station is 2 minutes walk (you can't miss it!) and the metro is only 1.20 euro for a trip and the train is every 3 minutes. Get the RENFE train to Stiges which is 40 minutes away and costs 2.40 euro its fantastic. The magic fountain is less than 10 minutes walk and its a must!!!! We saw the 8.30pm show with the 1812 overture, Sting, Madonna and Beyonce! All round and excellent place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and places to visit”
Reviews.Author: cypriatvisitor
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. We chose this hotel based on other reviews on this website. We booked an executive room and stayed on the 16th floor. The hotel has 22 floors in all with the 23rd dedicated to the restaurant. The room was nice and clean with all the amenities like TV, kettle, mini bar, safe, bathroom with twin basin, power shower etc. etc. The hotel is also very conveniently located next to the Sants Estacio metro about 2 minutes walk from the hotel. There is a supermarket just outside the hotel also which is good for your daily supplies like bottled water, naranja, snacks etc. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, only because it was quite pricy for our budget but the view is lovely from the top floor. Also the spa in the hotel costs $6 euros per person and is well worth it after a long day site seeing. The hotel rooms either face inland with the mountain view or outwards with the sea view. We got the one facing inland with the mountain view which was nice but if you are to put in a request for a room then opt for the sea view as this is nicer. In terms of places to eat, we basically ate fast food during the day and had a decent meal in the evening. Good restaurants are, i) Pizza Marzano on Las Ramblas (equivalent to Pizza Express in UK both in terms of food and price), ii) Restaurante Chino Internacional on C. Fernando just off Las Ramblas (decor is run of the mill but the food and service are both very good), iii) La Fonda on Escudellers just off Placa Reial near Las Ramblas (good atmosphere, food was OK) iv) Baha Beach Club on the coast near the Olympic Port (we had lunch there and the food and view were good). The place to avoid is the Attic on Las Ramblas. From the outside the Attic looks very inviting and we were snarred by this complete tourist trap. They only offered the wine list and had no drinks menu (probably to hide the high prices) and offered us bread rolls which were rock hard and then put them on the bill at 1.45 Euros each. We did most of the sites in Barcelona in 3 days and decided to venture into Sitges and Monserrat. Sitges is a nice sleepy town on the coast. Has a carnival during the last week of February. Sitges can be reached by train from Sants Estacio train station in 45 minutes and the return ticket is 4.80 Euros. Monserrat is good for the view from the mountains. Make sure therefore to go there on a good sunny day. Trains go from Placa Espanyal every hour and take approx. 1hour. We did the return train and all the funiculars package for 18.40 Euros each. There is also another package including dinner at $30 Euros but we found a cafe there which did a decent lunch for approx. $6 Euros each. There is a desk at the Placa Espanyal train station dedicated for visitors to Monserrat, they will explain you the various prices and also help you with the tickets purchase and get you onto the right platform for the train so no need to worry about pre-planning this trip. All in all a good holiday and great hotel. Best to visit during the last week of February if you want to visit the carnival in Sitges also.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perfect Perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect. I chose this hotel because of all the other reviews and i was very happy. You will not be dissapointed. The only thing is the distance from the major sites which is really not a problem at all since the metro station is literally diagnol to the hotel, 2 minute walk. The rooms are a nice size for a European hotel. They are actually the same size as the American hotels. View is superb. I cant say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Torre - very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Torre for 3 nights in Aug 2005. I booked it over the internet and, as there was a special deal that week, I managed to get a double room for the price of a single room. I hadn't been to Spain before and I went on my own (single woman) so I wanted to make sure I stayed somewhere decent. And I wasn't disappointed. The room was beautiful; the bathroom was huge and, as I had a corner room I could see for literally miles around. (Make sure you request a room above the 11th floor for the best views.) Even though the hotel is across the road from Sants station, it wasn't noisy. The staff were very pleasant. The one thing that I didn't like was the pool but I wouldn't let that put me off staying here again. I bought a 10-journey metro pass and visited Barceloneta beach every day. Brill!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Boniedarling
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter in early Dec as a 21st birthday present we had just 4 nights but we had a wonderful time and the hotel was just great everything was lovely especially the breakfast which was included. the english porter was so friendly and so helpful and would not take a tip the only problem we had was when my daughter went for a massage they were doing alterations to the pool room and the drilling was defening.but it has to be done sometime, I do agree with everyone that the higher you go the better as the views are great also great for getting every where as the metro is opposite the hotel and is so cheap especially if you buy a multiticket and as it is a main station it goes everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and quality”
Reviews.Author: Paddy_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights 26th - 29th Jan and were very pleasantly surprised at the great quality of everything in this hotel. Everything is spotless and well maintained and the staff are very helpful. The thing that shocked us most was how reasonable the prices were for this standard of hotel. Dublin and the Costas in Spain could learn a thing or two about ripping people off. The room service menu and minibar charges are excellent. 3 euro for a beer/vodka and 8 euro for a deluxe burger with all the trimmings delivered to your room! I call that value! The room was very stylish and a good size with a very comfortable bed! Hi Fi and large screen TV, bathrobes and slippers all very nice quality. Great bathroom with twin sinks and a speaker from whichever device you have on in the bedroom. All in all the nicest hotel I have stayed in and at £65 B&B a steal. As Arnie says "I`ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite the rain, myself and my partner spent a super weekend in Barcelona. The hotel was second to none, the staff were most helpful upgrading us immediately to a double room as there were some available, and we only had a twin...didn't even need to ask. The views over the city from the restaurant were excellent, just unfortunate it was murky while we stayed. We took the opportunity to get a massage. Masseur was excellent. The hotel was a stones throw away from the Sants railway/metro station from which you can get anywhere in the city in 25 mins. Nou camp stadium which is well worth a visit, is just a 20 min walk away. Sagrada Familia, 10 mins on metro, is worth a look from outside, although 8.50 euros a piece to get inside to see scaffolding and not much else is worth thinking twice about. All in all, we will certainly be going back to Barcelona again, and will have no decision to make about where to stay. We will be straight back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special!”
Reviews.Author: TDWG
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a fantastic long romantic weekend in Barcelona in July 2005 during which we became engaged! This is an impressive, contemporary hotel in a handy location very close to one of the main train\metro stations from the airport, with breathtaking views across barcelona from most of the rooms. We had an executive room on one of the mid floors on a last minute deal which I would probably recommend over a standard room if you are going to stay in this type of hotel. The rooms are contemporary, clean, tranquil & classy with marble and wood and there are lots of nice little touches such as a hi-fi\CD player, twin sinks, robes, slippers and ice machines on every floor. Staff seem very able, efficient and friendly, in fact everything ran so smoothly you hardly noticed they were there. I very much recommend one (lazy) night having an evening meal at the hotel restaurant\bar located at the top of the building. We had a window seat and the views are even more amazing than the room. The service was efficient but unhurried and the food was of a very high standard indeed. I know from reading past reviews on the web some of the floors were due for a refit which was evident when we explored some of the lower floors. But it was clear that our floor and many others had been renovated to an excellent standard but do check with the hotel before you book. Overall, very very good if your looking for something a little special on your weekend away in Barcelona. We would recommend this and we will stay again if we visit Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a short break between Christmas and New Year as a birthday present for my boyfriend. We stayed in a suite on the 17th floor and the views were absolutely breathtaking. Watching the Barcelona sunrise was wonderful. The hotel was really nice, clean, and staff were friendly. The only disappointment was the restaurant. The food was sparce and very expensive and the waiter spilt a tray of drinks over us! Food in the lounge bar was much better. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Joe_78
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and a great value for money. We stayed for a week around New Year's; paid $123/night for an executive room but were upgraded to a suite. It had a great lineup of amenities (two flat TVs and minibars, bathtub and shower with a heated mirror in the bathroom, stylish interior with leather upholstery, night chocolates etc.) and manificent views. Service was laudable even if inconsistent at times. The hotel is not right in the center but is quite conveniently located anyway. In-room internet is not free (10 euros+tax per 24 hours) - it wasn't promised to be included in the price but in this hotel range it really should be. There's so much to see and do in Barcelona but be prepared to be treated to a noticeable lack of organization and service. Absolutely nothing was organized for the New Year's eve (there were like 10,000 people waiting in Placa Catalunya and we didn't even know when the midnight was) and even the decorative lights were turned off at 1AM (night illumination of buildings goes off even earlier, starting already at 10PM, which is irritating and just perfectly pointless). Some sights have erratic hours about which you will not be able to get to know at the 'tourist info' centers and at most sights you will be charged an easy 10-15 euros then handed a boring subjective audio guide lacking any actual information. Many restaurants were closed for a solid 2-3 weeks around Christmas. (Now how stupid is that?) We walked around Montjuic for over an hour looking for Poble Espanyol because there were no signs posted anywhere. And then we were conveniently ripped off on our way to the airport - the taxi driver turned on the higher fare (it was Monday mid-day) and declined to explain why. If you are willing to put up with this general mentality to explore and enjoy all that this great city has to offer, then I say seriously consider Torre Catalunya - if I go back, it will be my choice again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: lucyamartin
Reviews.Content: I guess I will say this was above average because it was pretty cheap, about $88 per night and the rooms were nice. I was irritated however, by the fact that they advertised a sauna and Turkish bath on their web site and it is currently under renovation. This was a big disappointment. I liked the little gym area though. I was also annoyed by the fact that they didn't have coffee or tea in the room-- although you could order it from room service for 6 euros!! Unlike some other reviewers, we had a pretty disgusting view of apartment buildings and the train station. This hotel may have nice views from some angles but it is not in a nice part of town. it is very convenient for buses, trains and metros but not in an attractive location. I would recommend staying in the old city for a more charming Barcelona experience although this place certainly is good value and on the metro it is not at all difficult to get to the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Barcelona for our Birthdays. We chose this hotel and were not disappointed!! It was really nice, very clean and luxurious! The best hotel I had ever stayed in! In the evening, we went to their restaurant on the 23rd floor (called Visual) and enjoyed a superb meal with stunning night views of Barcelona! I would advise you to book your meal as soon as you check in as we tried to go there the following night and it was fully booked! If you can't go there at night, the breakfast is served in the same restaurant, so you'll be able to see the nice views in daylight... We ordered room service and the meals were excellent and we had plenty of food on our plates! It was reasonably priced too... I would certainly recommend this hotel and we are hoping to revisit Barcelona this year... and I know that I will be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic break in the most romantic city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we think of romantic getaways, we immediately conjure up mental images of the Eiffel Tower in Paris, a gentle walk along a Caribbean beach at Sunset or even ice skating on the rink in Central Park. Never had I thought that Barcelona would be the place to give your heart - whether it is to the city or another person. Last weekend I gave mine to both. My boyfriend and I checked into the Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya on Friday 16th December for a weekend getaway. Despite lastminute not delivering their promise of upgarding us to an executive suite, the hotel ensured we still got our suite on the 18th floor, and even allowed us to check in two hours before the given time. Our room (1817) overlooked some of the most beautiful aspects of the city, and being 18 floors up we witnessed some of the most wonderful views as the sunlight hit different parts of buildings at different times of the day. At night we could see the Magic Fountain in the distance, along with the port, the Olympic Stadium and the Christopher Columbus statue. The room itself was luxurious, although not as big as I had perhaps expected. A CD player, mini-bar, robes and slippers, heated mirror in the bathroom which didn't steam up when the shower was on, chocolates on the pillows and a doorbell to the room were all little extras that led us to feeling that extra bit special and pampered. The restaurant in the hotel is situated on the 23rd floor, with amazing panoramic views of the city. The breakfast is wonderful and with the ability to eat as much as you like, it definitely sets you up for the day. However we were unable to eat there during the evening as there wasn't a vegetarian option. The lounge bar is also a lovely place to stop for a drink before you embark upon the city, and is by no means expensive. The city itself offers something different depending on what you want from it. It's the sort of city that is very sure of itself and doesn't need to try to win you over... it simply does. Must see sites include Camp Nou Stadium tour, the Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas (but watch out for over priced restaurants), the Harbour and the open top tour bus which is freezing in December but gives you a much wider perspective on the varying elements the city has to offer. But the most wondrous, magical, romantic surprise of the weekend was the Magic Fountatin which is situated next to the Espanol metro station. Buzzing with activity and noise, the avenue leading up to the magic fountain is decorated with tens of fountains lining the road. The fountain itself is a multitude of colours and is choreograophed to music. This to me was by far the most romantic experience of my life, the sheer force of the water and the occasion making it difficult to fight back the tears. All in all I would recommend Barcelona to everyone as there is something to satisfy all tastes and needs. There is certainly plenty for us to do when we return and I am sure we will visit some old favourites too.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: NorthWestUKDayo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via trip advisor. We where not dissappointed, it is simply a great hotel with very friendly staff and great facilities. Rooms are excellent and well appointed as you would expect from a 4 star hotel. We paid 65 Euro a night for a double room which was an absolute bargain. To relax, have a drink or meal from the 23rd floor restaurant - views are breathtaking over the whole of Barcelona, especially at sunset. My only very minor gripe, the pool area looks great but the water is not heated, so for us was too cold to use. The location is perfect for the excellent Barcelona metro system, with the Sants-Estacio trian station within 200 metres of the front door. (A useful tip to save you some walking, directly opposite the entrance of the hotel, next to the Panns restaurant is an Elevator to the metro. Once you have bought your 3/5/7 day all in metro & bus pass (12 Euro for the 3 day pass) from the tourist info at the station, just use this elevator. It will save your legs as they will certainly be used exploring the rest of Barcelona). As for sights around Barcelona, the Nou Camp is impressive, as is the Ramblas, the Port area and the great variety of restaurants and bars. We thought the Sagarda Familia was a waste of money, 8 Euros each to go in, and with all the building works - you may as well view it from the outside (it is an impressive building). You can also see it from the Hotel viewing deck. I had heard comments before about pick pockets etc in Barcelona, I would say don't be alarmed just be sensible with your property and keep your wits about you. I did not perceive it to be any worse than most major cities. (Don't let this stop you from visiting a great city). Enjoy Barcelona and specifically this hotel, I hope you find our comments useful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location”
Reviews.Author: G&HMLondon
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing I can say about the hotel was that the room service breakfast was cold by the time it got to our room. Other than that the hotel was excellent. A very comfortable bed, walk in shower and within spitting distance of Sants metro station for exploring the city. "Must see's" are the Sagrada Familia, Park Gueil and Casa Botjo - all Gaudi creations and all beautiful. The Mercat de St Josep was also incredible. To ensure you don't end up having an argument, make sure taxi drivers start the meter when you get in and keep your wits about you in tourist-centric areas to avoid becoming a victim of bag snatchers.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkGL2
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night but had an excellent corner room on 8th floor. The hotel was quiet, not too hot (makes a change), the room was large with 2 wardrobes and big bathroom with a shower big enough for 6, separate bath and double basins. The room also had a CD player and large flat screen TV with Sky News. Breakfast on 23rd floor was good too with the views a nice bonus in the morning. In my opinion, above average for Spain and good value through Octopus. Right across from the Sants station makes it easy to get to from the airport. The only downside is that there is a limited restaurant selection in the immediate vicinity but that is easily cured by taking the subway or a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to match the city.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 4 days in the amazing city of Barcelona using the Torree Catulunya hotel as a base tops it off the location is oposite the santos station which gives you accsess to every part of the city and tourist attractions, 12 euros for a 3 day unlimited metro and bus pass was excellent value. The magic fountain which is located just behind the hotel is well worth a visit on a Friday or Saturday night for a stunning display done to music. The hotel caters for your every need wewere lucky enough to have had a room on the 19th floor with stunning views over the city the decor was very simple and modern making great use of soft lighting and mirrors along with a huge bathroom with a walk in shower room and big bath the room was cleaned twice a day and was spotless. The panoramic resturant on the 23rd floor really does blow your mind with the view overlooking many of the citys landmarks. The evening menu will not be to everyones taste and probably won't fill you but well worth a try for a night. we found ourselves eating around the ramblas which is only a few stops along the metro line.The spa area in the hotel is small but offers everything from saunas and steam rooms to a dip pool with hydro massage but note that children are excluded from this area. If you are looking for a city break with excellent accomodation this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy”
Reviews.Author: CleverTrevor
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed having selected and booked the Hotel Torre Catalunya from reviews by Tripadvisor members about three weeks ago, to turn up and be told that they were transferring us due to a 'computer problem' causing overbooking. Discovered that we weren't the only ones shifted to accomdate a 150 person booking they received, and that this practice had occurred to other tripadvisor members also sent elsewhere previously from this hotel. Would strongly suggest confirming with them in advance that your internet booking will be honoured, or there's no point in travelling to them and being sent to an unsuitable hotel of their choosing...

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: sinoko896
Reviews.Content: no complaints. large rooms & bathrooms. best service. value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Torre Catalunya and had a great time. The views from the 23rd floor have to be seen to be believed. The service and friendliness, professionalism and helpfulness of staff was beyond expectations. We were on the 8th floor but were not disturbed by traffic noise at night, even though it was quite heavy. (We were also on the front where the traffic was!). The spa, pool etc was lovely (as someone said before, believe the photos). We would definitely go back to this hotel. It was first-class. Although the district was not too pretty and there were no restaurants around that we could find, it is so convenient for getting around by train, metro, bus or taxi. We ate in the restaurant one evening and enjoyed the meal, however, it was pricey - seems that you paid for presentation rather than quantity. You can eat in the bar though if you prefer. Very good choice at breakfast which was included in our deal. We have never stayed in such a good hotel before and were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jenna5
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for four nights in this hotel during the festival weekend in September 2005. The hotel is conveniently located near the train/metro station, though I wouldn't say the area is the safest at night. Keep to the well lit street and you should be fine. The hotel decor is beautiful with its modern look, clean, and we found our beds to be very comfy. Though we were on a low floor (4), we got a great rate at 154 Euros/night considering we were booking during the festival weekend. Yes, it's not near old town where all the action is. But the subway ride is less than 15 minutes away to old town and Plaza Espayna is about 15 minutes walking distance away. End of the day - would I recommend this hotel to my friends? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good modern hotel 2 minute walk from Sants railway station (3 stops from airport). Room was upgraded from std to a suite on the 22nd floor as there was a problem with our booked room. Fantastic views towards the olympic stadium and sea. bar was OK and Gym facilities were good. Tourist bus pickup point was close by. Staff service was good and they spoke good English. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: gabsterUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, large rooms, fantastic retsaurant, convenient location. Best hotel I've stayed in for years (I spend approx 50 nights/year in hotel) Highly reccomended. Ask for a room on higher floors to get away from traffic. All hotels in Barcelona suffer from traffic noise - this one was very good by comparison. Buffet breakfast 14 euros - average price for the city - usual food. Taxi about 5 euros to Ramblas. Hotel is yards from Sants railway station (direct bus & train link to airport). Managed to get an autumn deal of 78 GBP per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: + Points Excellent location - great for the tourist bus, trains to Porta Ventura theme park, the Nou Camp and the Olympic Park. Fantastic Rooms - the rooms are big and clean. The bathrooms are ernormous. Great Views - go to the top floor for panoramic views of Barcelona. Staff - very friendly and helpful. They also all spoke English. - Points. Noise - if your room is located lower than floor 10 of this hotel, it's going to be noisy, especially at the weekends. Don't let it put you off - just take ear plugs. La Ramblas - Not really to do with the hotel but never the less, avoid it, it's not nice and feels very unsafe!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Great views”
Reviews.Author: KevinBlackman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from and 4 night break in Barcelona staying at the Torre Catalunya. The hotel was very clean as you would expect from a 4 star hotel, the breakfast was good with a massive selection. (The cooked breakfasts are slightly cold!) We also asked for a room above the 14th floor and had one on the 20th - it avoided all the noise from the traffic and also gave you fantastic views over the city. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. It is slightly out of the main tourist area, but if you are prepared to walk or catch the tourist bus route which stops a stones throw away it will take you around all the major sights and you can get on and off as you wish. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. We had an excellent meal on our last night in the resturant on the top floor with fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “do not believe any bad reviews, this hotel is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: stroalki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend and will not stay anywhere else when we return to Barcelona. Close to the main Sants station (you can get tourist buses from outside this station to take you all around barcelona 17 euros for one day, 21 euros for 2 days - this is worth it because there are 3 buses (red,blue and green) that have a set route to stop at all of the main tourist and non-touristy attractions). We stayed on the 16th floor: breathtaking view of the city, one whole double bed (not 2 like some rooms), big bathroom, minifridge with drinks (you will have to pay for these of course), 32" tv with some english/american news channels and a music video channel, laptop access points, couple chairs and a table. Very lovely decor all around the hotel. Clean! which is one of our main priorities. The restaurant on the 23rd floor is supreme even if it may be a bit pricey (avg 20-30 euros a meal): loved the ambience, the light background music and even though the meal portions were small, they were delightful and actually filled me. However if you're someone who eats big meals, there are loads of wonderful spanish restaurants about (Avenida Diagonal, downtown or just ask the staff - they are very, very helpful). They run a buffet breakfast every morning which is varied and tasty. I was not let down. Taxis run right outside the hotel. The hotel is suitable for couples, families, large groups but above all business travellers. Internet access and a bar and spa/pool is available downstairs. For the price we paid (£220 each - flight, hotel - bed + breakfast) my husband and I found this hotel very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, money well spent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: if people can complain about this hotel they must be searching for something cause any complaints regarding this hotel have to be minor - what do people want for their money ??? the hotel is situated right next to the main train station making it simple to commute around. the hotel itself boasts great rooms, great bathrooms (huge) and a small but well equipped and very clean spa area. the staff are very friendly and cant seem to do enough. we asked for a room above the 10th floor as suggested by other visitors and got a room on the 18th (what great views) ok so the air con was alittle noisy, ok so there were 2 seperate beds (but there was room for 2 in the bath and the shower) for this money you would get a b+b break in a travel inn in the uk and maybe have a tenner spare in your pocket. dont be a fool and ignore this great hotel. barcelona is a great city there is so much to see and do, i will definatley go back and i wouldnt consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of the city and great loaction!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissLALondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Gran Torre Catalunya hotel for five days in August with my boyfriend and we chose this hotel on the basis of reading other reviews on tripadvisor. Good Points We had a fantastic time at the hotel, the room was clean, sleek and modern with a 'to die for' marble bathroom with a bath big enough for two and him and hers matching sinks!!! The bed was huge and comfy and the views from our 10th floor windows were brilliant!! We paid for our breakfast as part of our package and the choice was very impressive, fresh meats, cheese, pastries, yogurt, fruit juice and pancakes (served with a choice of sauces, my favourite was chocolate!!!) They also served the usual scambled eggs, bacon, baked beans, toast! The views from the hotel restuarant on the 23rd floor are fantastic and not to be missed, this is the major selling point of the hotel and many of the city's attractions such as Sagrada Familia, Montjuic and the Olympic Stadium can be viewed from here. The staff were friendly and helpful, even the maids would say good morning when we passed them in the hall. The hotel boasts a spa area but we were so busy we did not get the chance to use it! The other guest were really quite and there were no rowdy groups of people making a racket at night time.The hotel is a great base for exploring Barcelona, Monjuic is within walking distance and the metro is across the road and so easy to use it makes sense to see the sights using this method of transport. Bad points Air conditioning! It is a saviour in some respects but it is a nuisance at night time and made us feel really cold, you can control the temperature but you can't turn it off, it also made a bit of noise so if you're a light sleeper you may fine your sleep disturbed. Traffic! The hotel is in a busy area on a busy stretch of road so traffic noise is to be expected!!! Plus the windows are not double glazed so you may find it annoying at night time! Finally, some of the reviews stated they had robes and slippers in their hotel room, we did not have this so don't bank on it! Also some reviews have complained about having two single beds pushed together to make a double. My advice would be to request a double bed when you check in and also request a room higher than the tenth floor to great great views and reduced traffic noise - with that said I would definately stay at the Gran Torre again and will be recommending it to friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “whatever else coulld you want”
Reviews.Author: petepool
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky - but if you believe that then- we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge 5 nights. I would stay there again tonight if I could!We were on the 19th floor and with a corner suite overklooking magic fountain to the S West and the sangrda familia to the south(excuse spelling please). PS if you like a beer the hypermarket next door sells the same brand as the minibar at 50cents a can not 3 euros Top tip -ask for a high floor - dont settle for anything below 17 18?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it. We had a corner room on the 21st floor and had a wonderful panoramic view of the city. The room was very modern, clean and very comfortable. The hotel was located right next to the Sants station, so getting onto the metro was super easy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was amazing!!! marble floors large shower (room for two) I will be returning!
